IAST: tvāṁ hy agne sadam it samanyavo devāso devam aratiṁ nyerira iti kratvā nyerire
Griffith: THEE Agni, have the Gods, ever of one accord, sent hither down, a God, appointed messenger, yea, with their wisdom sent thee down.
Devanāgarī: त्वां ह्यग्ने सदमित्समन्यवो देवासो देवमरतिं न्येरिर इति क्रत्वा न्येरिरे
pada pāṭha: tvām | hi | agne | sadam | it | sa-manyavaḥ | devāsaḥ | devam | aratim | ni-erire | iti | kratvā | ni-erire || amartyam | yajata | martyeṣu | ā | devam | ā-devam | janata | pra-cetasam | viśvam | ā-devam | janata | pra-cetasam ||4.1.1||

IAST: amartyaṁ yajata martyeṣv ā devam ādevaṁ janata pracetasaṁ viśvam ādevaṁ janata pracetasam
Griffith: The Immortal, O thou Holy One, mid mortal men, the God-devoted God, the wise, have they brought forth, brought forth the omnipresent God-devoted Sage.
Devanāgarī: अमर्त्यं यजत मर्त्येष्वा देवमादेवं जनत प्रचेतसं विश्वमादेवं जनत प्रचेतसम्
pada pāṭha: tvām | hi | agne | sadam | it | sa-manyavaḥ | devāsaḥ | devam | aratim | ni-erire | iti | kratvā | ni-erire || amartyam | yajata | martyeṣu | ā | devam | ā-devam | janata | pra-cetasam | viśvam | ā-devam | janata | pra-cetasam ||4.1.1||

IAST: sa bhrātaraṁ varuṇam agna ā vavṛtsva devām̐ acchā sumatī yajñavanasaṁ jyeṣṭhaṁ yajñavanasam
Griffith: As such, O Agni, bring with favour to the Gods thy Brother Varuna who loveth sacrifice,
Devanāgarī: स भ्रातरं वरुणमग्न आ ववृत्स्व देवाँ अच्छा सुमती यज्ञवनसं ज्येष्ठं यज्ञवनसम्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | bhrātaram | varuṇam | agne | ā | vavr̥tsva | devān | accha | su-matī | yajña-vanasam | jyeṣṭham | yajña-vanasam || r̥ta-vānam | ādityam | carṣaṇi-dhr̥tam | rājānam | carṣaṇi-dhr̥tam ||4.1.2||

IAST: ṛtāvānam ādityaṁ carṣaṇīdhṛtaṁ rājānaṁ carṣaṇīdhṛtam
Griffith: True to the Law, the Aditya who supporteth men, the King, supporter of mankind.
Devanāgarī: ऋतावानमादित्यं चर्षणीधृतं राजानं चर्षणीधृतम्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | bhrātaram | varuṇam | agne | ā | vavr̥tsva | devān | accha | su-matī | yajña-vanasam | jyeṣṭham | yajña-vanasam || r̥ta-vānam | ādityam | carṣaṇi-dhr̥tam | rājānam | carṣaṇi-dhr̥tam ||4.1.2||

IAST: sakhe sakhāyam abhy ā vavṛtsvāśuṁ na cakraṁ rathyeva raṁhyāsmabhyaṁ dasma raṁhyā
Griffith: Do thou, O Friend, turn hither him who is our Friend, swift as a wheel, like two car-steeds in rapid course, Wondrous! to us in rapid course.
Devanāgarī: सखे सखायमभ्या ववृत्स्वाशुं न चक्रं रथ्येव रंह्यास्मभ्यं दस्म रंह्या
pada pāṭha: sakhe | sakhāyam | abhi | ā | vavr̥tsva | āśum | na | cakram | rathyā-iva | raṁhyā | asmabhyam | dasma | raṁhyā || agne | mr̥ḷīkam | varuṇe | sacā | vidaḥ | marut-su | viśva-bhānuṣu || tokāya | tuje | śuśucāna | śam | kr̥dhi | asmabhyam | dasma | śam | kr̥dhi ||4.1.3||

IAST: agne mṛḻīkaṁ varuṇe sacā vido marutsu viśvabhānuṣu
Griffith: O Agni, find thou grace for us with Varuna, with Maruts who illumine all.
Devanāgarī: अग्ने मृळीकं वरुणे सचा विदो मरुत्सु विश्वभानुषु
pada pāṭha: sakhe | sakhāyam | abhi | ā | vavr̥tsva | āśum | na | cakram | rathyā-iva | raṁhyā | asmabhyam | dasma | raṁhyā || agne | mr̥ḷīkam | varuṇe | sacā | vidaḥ | marut-su | viśva-bhānuṣu || tokāya | tuje | śuśucāna | śam | kr̥dhi | asmabhyam | dasma | śam | kr̥dhi ||4.1.3||

IAST: tokāya tuje śuśucāna śaṁ kṛdhy asmabhyaṁ dasma śaṁ kṛdhi
Griffith: Bless us, thou Radiant One, for seed and progeny, yea, bless us, O thou Wondrous God.
Devanāgarī: तोकाय तुजे शुशुचान शं कृध्यस्मभ्यं दस्म शं कृधि
pada pāṭha: sakhe | sakhāyam | abhi | ā | vavr̥tsva | āśum | na | cakram | rathyā-iva | raṁhyā | asmabhyam | dasma | raṁhyā || agne | mr̥ḷīkam | varuṇe | sacā | vidaḥ | marut-su | viśva-bhānuṣu || tokāya | tuje | śuśucāna | śam | kr̥dhi | asmabhyam | dasma | śam | kr̥dhi ||4.1.3||

IAST: tvaṁ no agne varuṇasya vidvān devasya heḻo 'va yāsisīṣṭhāḥ
Griffith: Do thou who knowest Varuna, O Agni, put far away from us the God's displeasure.
Devanāgarī: त्वं नो अग्ने वरुणस्य विद्वान्देवस्य हेळोऽव यासिसीष्ठाः
pada pāṭha: tvam | naḥ | agne | varuṇasya | vidvān | devasya | heḷaḥ | ava | yāsisīṣṭhāḥ || yajiṣṭhaḥ | vahni-tamaḥ | śośucānaḥ | viśvā | dveṣāṁsi | pra | mumugdhi | asmat ||4.1.4||

IAST: yajiṣṭho vahnitamaḥ śośucāno viśvā dveṣāṁsi pra mumugdhy asmat
Griffith: Best Sacrificer, brightest One, refulgent remove thou far from us all those who hate us.
Devanāgarī: यजिष्ठो वह्नितमः शोशुचानो विश्वा द्वेषांसि प्र मुमुग्ध्यस्मत्
pada pāṭha: tvam | naḥ | agne | varuṇasya | vidvān | devasya | heḷaḥ | ava | yāsisīṣṭhāḥ || yajiṣṭhaḥ | vahni-tamaḥ | śośucānaḥ | viśvā | dveṣāṁsi | pra | mumugdhi | asmat ||4.1.4||

IAST: sa tvaṁ no agne 'vamo bhavotī nediṣṭho asyā uṣaso vyuṣṭau
Griffith: Be thou, O Agni, nearest us with succour, our closest Friend while now this Morn is breaking.
Devanāgarī: स त्वं नो अग्नेऽवमो भवोती नेदिष्ठो अस्या उषसो व्युष्टौ
pada pāṭha: saḥ | tvam | naḥ | agne | avamaḥ | bhava | ūtī | nediṣṭhaḥ | asyāḥ | uṣasaḥ | vi-uṣṭau || ava | yakṣva | naḥ | varuṇam | rarāṇaḥ | vīhi | mr̥ḷīkam | su-havaḥ | naḥ | edhi ||4.1.5||

IAST: ava yakṣva no varuṇaṁ rarāṇo vīhi mṛḻīkaṁ suhavo na edhi
Griffith: Reconcile to us Varuna, be bounteous enjoy the gracious juice; be swift to hear us.
Devanāgarī: अव यक्ष्व नो वरुणं रराणो वीहि मृळीकं सुहवो न एधि
pada pāṭha: saḥ | tvam | naḥ | agne | avamaḥ | bhava | ūtī | nediṣṭhaḥ | asyāḥ | uṣasaḥ | vi-uṣṭau || ava | yakṣva | naḥ | varuṇam | rarāṇaḥ | vīhi | mr̥ḷīkam | su-havaḥ | naḥ | edhi ||4.1.5||

IAST: asya śreṣṭhā subhagasya saṁdṛg devasya citratamā martyeṣu
Griffith: Excellent is the glance, of brightest splendour, which the auspicious God bestows on mortals-
Devanāgarī: अस्य श्रेष्ठा सुभगस्य संदृग्देवस्य चित्रतमा मर्त्येषु
pada pāṭha: asya | śreṣṭhā | su-bhagasya | sam-dr̥k | devasya | citra-tamā | martyeṣu || śuci | ghr̥tam | na | taptam | aghnyāyāḥ | spārhā | devasya | maṁhanā-iva | dhenoḥ ||4.1.6||

IAST: śuci ghṛtaṁ na taptam aghnyāyāḥ spārhā devasya maṁhaneva dhenoḥ
Griffith: The God's glance, longed-for even as the butter, pure, heated, of the cow, the milch-cow's bounty.
Devanāgarī: शुचि घृतं न तप्तमघ्न्यायाः स्पार्हा देवस्य मंहनेव धेनोः
pada pāṭha: asya | śreṣṭhā | su-bhagasya | sam-dr̥k | devasya | citra-tamā | martyeṣu || śuci | ghr̥tam | na | taptam | aghnyāyāḥ | spārhā | devasya | maṁhanā-iva | dhenoḥ ||4.1.6||

IAST: trir asya tā paramā santi satyā spārhā devasya janimāny agneḥ
Griffith: Three are those births, the true, the most exalted, eagerly longed-for, of the God, of Agni.
Devanāgarī: त्रिरस्य ता परमा सन्ति सत्या स्पार्हा देवस्य जनिमान्यग्नेः
pada pāṭha: triḥ | asya | tā | paramā | santi | satyā | spārhā | devasya | janimāni | agneḥ || anante | antariti | pari-vītaḥ | ā | agāt | śuciḥ | śukraḥ | aryaḥ | rorucānaḥ ||4.1.7||

IAST: anante antaḥ parivīta āgāc chuciḥ śukro aryo rorucānaḥ
Griffith: He came invested in the boundless region, pure, radiant, friendly, mightily resplendent.
Devanāgarī: अनन्ते अन्तः परिवीत आगाच्छुचिः शुक्रो अर्यो रोरुचानः
pada pāṭha: triḥ | asya | tā | paramā | santi | satyā | spārhā | devasya | janimāni | agneḥ || anante | antariti | pari-vītaḥ | ā | agāt | śuciḥ | śukraḥ | aryaḥ | rorucānaḥ ||4.1.7||

IAST: sa dūto viśved abhi vaṣṭi sadmā hotā hiraṇyaratho raṁsujihvaḥ
Griffith: This envoy joyeth in all seats of worship, borne on his golden car, sweet-tongued Invoker:
Devanāgarī: स दूतो विश्वेदभि वष्टि सद्मा होता हिरण्यरथो रंसुजिह्वः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | dūtaḥ | viśvā | it | abhi | vaṣṭi | sadma | hotā | hiraṇya-rathaḥ | ram-sujihvaḥ || rohit-aśvaḥ | vapuṣyaḥ | vibhā-vā | sadā | raṇvaḥ | pitumatī-iva | sam-sat ||4.1.8||

IAST: rohidaśvo vapuṣyo vibhāvā sadā raṇvaḥ pitumatīva saṁsat
Griffith: Lovely to look on, with red steeds, effulgent, like a feast rich in food, joyous for ever.
Devanāgarī: रोहिदश्वो वपुष्यो विभावा सदा रण्वः पितुमतीव संसत्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | dūtaḥ | viśvā | it | abhi | vaṣṭi | sadma | hotā | hiraṇya-rathaḥ | ram-sujihvaḥ || rohit-aśvaḥ | vapuṣyaḥ | vibhā-vā | sadā | raṇvaḥ | pitumatī-iva | sam-sat ||4.1.8||

IAST: sa cetayan manuṣo yajñabandhuḥ pra tam mahyā raśanayā nayanti
Griffith: Allied by worship, let him give man knowledge: by an extended cord they lead him onward.
Devanāgarī: स चेतयन्मनुषो यज्ञबन्धुः प्र तं मह्या रशनया नयन्ति
pada pāṭha: saḥ | cetayat | manuṣaḥ | yajña-bandhuḥ | pra | tam | mahyā | raśanayā | nayanti || saḥ | kṣeti | asya | duryāsu | sādhan | devaḥ | martasya | sadhani-tvam | āpa ||4.1.9||

IAST: sa kṣety asya duryāsu sādhan devo martasya sadhanitvam āpa
Griffith: He stays, effectual in this mortal's dwelling, and the God wins a share in his possessions.
Devanāgarī: स क्षेत्यस्य दुर्यासु साधन्देवो मर्तस्य सधनित्वमाप
pada pāṭha: saḥ | cetayat | manuṣaḥ | yajña-bandhuḥ | pra | tam | mahyā | raśanayā | nayanti || saḥ | kṣeti | asya | duryāsu | sādhan | devaḥ | martasya | sadhani-tvam | āpa ||4.1.9||

IAST: sa tū no agnir nayatu prajānann acchā ratnaṁ devabhaktaṁ yad asya
Griffith: Let Agni -for he knows the way- conduct us to all that he enjoys of God-sent riches,
Devanāgarī: स तू नो अग्निर्नयतु प्रजानन्नच्छा रत्नं देवभक्तं यदस्य
pada pāṭha: saḥ | tu | naḥ | agniḥ | nayatu | pra-jānan | accha | ratnam | deva-bhaktam | yat | asya || dhiyā | yat | viśve | amr̥tāḥ | akr̥ṇvan | dyauḥ | pitā | janitā | satyam | ukṣan ||4.1.10||

IAST: dhiyā yad viśve amṛtā akṛṇvan dyauṣ pitā janitā satyam ukṣan
Griffith: What all the Immortals have prepared with wisdom, Dyaus, Sire, Begetter, raining down true blessings.
Devanāgarī: धिया यद्विश्वे अमृता अकृण्वन्द्यौष्पिता जनिता सत्यमुक्षन्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | tu | naḥ | agniḥ | nayatu | pra-jānan | accha | ratnam | deva-bhaktam | yat | asya || dhiyā | yat | viśve | amr̥tāḥ | akr̥ṇvan | dyauḥ | pitā | janitā | satyam | ukṣan ||4.1.10||

IAST: sa jāyata prathamaḥ pastyāsu maho budhne rajaso asya yonau
Griffith: In houses first he sprang into existence, at great heaven's base, and in this region's bosom;
Devanāgarī: स जायत प्रथमः पस्त्यासु महो बुध्ने रजसो अस्य योनौ
pada pāṭha: saḥ | jāyata | prathamaḥ | pastyāsu | mahaḥ | budhne | rajasaḥ | asya | yonau || apāt | aśīrṣā | guhamānaḥ | antā | ā-yoyuvānaḥ | vr̥ṣabhasya | nīḷe ||4.1.11||

IAST: apād aśīrṣā guhamāno antāyoyuvāno vṛṣabhasya nīḻe
Griffith: Footless and headless, both his ends concealing, in his Bull's lair drawing himself together.
Devanāgarī: अपादशीर्षा गुहमानो अन्तायोयुवानो वृषभस्य नीळे
pada pāṭha: saḥ | jāyata | prathamaḥ | pastyāsu | mahaḥ | budhne | rajasaḥ | asya | yonau || apāt | aśīrṣā | guhamānaḥ | antā | ā-yoyuvānaḥ | vr̥ṣabhasya | nīḷe ||4.1.11||

IAST: pra śardha ārta prathamaṁ vipanyām̐ ṛtasya yonā vṛṣabhasya nīḻe
Griffith: Wondrously first he rose aloft, defiant, in the Bull's lair, the homeof holy Order,
Devanāgarī: प्र शर्ध आर्त प्रथमं विपन्याँ ऋतस्य योना वृषभस्य नीळे
pada pāṭha: pra | śardhaḥ | ārta | prathamam | vipanyā | r̥tasya | yonā | vr̥ṣabhasya | nīḷe || spārhaḥ | yuvā | vapuṣyaḥ | vibhā-vā | sapta | priyāsaḥ | ajanayanta | vr̥ṣṇe ||4.1.12||

IAST: spārho yuvā vapuṣyo vibhāvā sapta priyāso 'janayanta vṛṣṇe
Griffith: Longed-for, young, beautiful, and far-resplendent: and sevendear frieuds sprang up unto the Mighty.
Devanāgarī: स्पार्हो युवा वपुष्यो विभावा सप्त प्रियासोऽजनयन्त वृष्णे
pada pāṭha: pra | śardhaḥ | ārta | prathamam | vipanyā | r̥tasya | yonā | vr̥ṣabhasya | nīḷe || spārhaḥ | yuvā | vapuṣyaḥ | vibhā-vā | sapta | priyāsaḥ | ajanayanta | vr̥ṣṇe ||4.1.12||

IAST: asmākam atra pitaro manuṣyā abhi pra sedur ṛtam āśuṣāṇāḥ
Griffith: Here did our human fathers take their places, fain to fulfil the sacred Law of worship.
Devanāgarī: अस्माकमत्र पितरो मनुष्या अभि प्र सेदुरृतमाशुषाणाः
pada pāṭha: asmākam | atra | pitaraḥ | manuṣyāḥ | abhi | pra | seduḥ | r̥tam | āśuṣāṇāḥ || aśma-vrajāḥ | su-dughāḥ | vavre | antaḥ | ut | usrāḥ | ājan | uṣasaḥ | huvānāḥ ||4.1.13||

IAST: aśmavrajāḥ sudughā vavre antar ud usrā ājann uṣaso huvānāḥ
Griffith: Forth drave they, with loud call, Dawn's teeming Milch-kine bid in the mountainstable, in the cavern.
Devanāgarī: अश्मव्रजाः सुदुघा वव्रे अन्तरुदुस्रा आजन्नुषसो हुवानाः
pada pāṭha: asmākam | atra | pitaraḥ | manuṣyāḥ | abhi | pra | seduḥ | r̥tam | āśuṣāṇāḥ || aśma-vrajāḥ | su-dughāḥ | vavre | antaḥ | ut | usrāḥ | ājan | uṣasaḥ | huvānāḥ ||4.1.13||

IAST: te marmṛjata dadṛvāṁso adriṁ tad eṣām anye abhito vi vocan
Griffith: Splendid were they when they had rent the mountain: others, around, shall tell forth this their exploit.
Devanāgarī: ते मर्मृजत ददृवांसो अद्रिं तदेषामन्ये अभितो वि वोचन्
pada pāṭha: te | marmr̥jata | dadr̥-vāṁsaḥ | adrim | tat | eṣām | anye | abhitaḥ | vi | vocan || paśva-yantrāsaḥ | abhi | kāram | arcan | vidanta | jyotiḥ | cakr̥panta | dhībhiḥ ||4.1.14||

IAST: paśvayantrāso abhi kāram arcan vidanta jyotiś cakṛpanta dhībhiḥ
Griffith: They sang their song, prepared to free the cattle: they found the light; with holy hymns they worshipped.
Devanāgarī: पश्वयन्त्रासो अभि कारमर्चन्विदन्त ज्योतिश्चकृपन्त धीभिः
pada pāṭha: te | marmr̥jata | dadr̥-vāṁsaḥ | adrim | tat | eṣām | anye | abhitaḥ | vi | vocan || paśva-yantrāsaḥ | abhi | kāram | arcan | vidanta | jyotiḥ | cakr̥panta | dhībhiḥ ||4.1.14||

IAST: te gavyatā manasā dṛdhram ubdhaṁ gā yemānam pari ṣantam adrim
Griffith: Eager, with thought intent upon the booty, the men with their celestial speech threw open,
Devanāgarī: ते गव्यता मनसा दृध्रमुब्धं गा येमानं परि षन्तमद्रिम्
pada pāṭha: te | gavyatā | manasā | dr̥dhram | ubdham | gāḥ | yemānam | pari | santam | adrim || dr̥ḷham | naraḥ | vacasā | daivyena | vrajam | go-mantam | uśijaḥ | vi | vavruriti vavruḥ ||4.1.15||

IAST: dṛḻhaṁ naro vacasā daivyena vrajaṁ gomantam uśijo vi vavruḥ
Griffith: The solid mountain firm, compact, enclosing, confining Cows, the stable full of cattle.
Devanāgarī: दृळ्हं नरो वचसा दैव्येन व्रजं गोमन्तमुशिजो वि वव्रुः
pada pāṭha: te | gavyatā | manasā | dr̥dhram | ubdham | gāḥ | yemānam | pari | santam | adrim || dr̥ḷham | naraḥ | vacasā | daivyena | vrajam | go-mantam | uśijaḥ | vi | vavruriti vavruḥ ||4.1.15||

IAST: te manvata prathamaṁ nāma dhenos triḥ sapta mātuḥ paramāṇi vindan
Griffith: The Milch-cow's earliest name they comprehended: they found the Mother's thrice-seven noblest titles.
Devanāgarī: ते मन्वत प्रथमं नाम धेनोस्त्रिः सप्त मातुः परमाणि विन्दन्
pada pāṭha: te | manvata | prathamam | nāma | dhenoḥ | triḥ | sapta | mātuḥ | paramāṇi | vindan || tat | jānatīḥ | abhi | anūṣata | vrāḥ | āviḥ | bhuvat | aruṇīḥ | yaśasā | goḥ ||4.1.16||

IAST: taj jānatīr abhy anūṣata vrā āvir bhuvad aruṇīr yaśasā goḥ
Griffith: This the bands knew, and sent forth acclamation:with the Bull's sheen the Red One was apparent.
Devanāgarī: तज्जानतीरभ्यनूषत व्रा आविर्भुवदरुणीर्यशसा गोः
pada pāṭha: te | manvata | prathamam | nāma | dhenoḥ | triḥ | sapta | mātuḥ | paramāṇi | vindan || tat | jānatīḥ | abhi | anūṣata | vrāḥ | āviḥ | bhuvat | aruṇīḥ | yaśasā | goḥ ||4.1.16||

IAST: neśat tamo dudhitaṁ rocata dyaur ud devyā uṣaso bhānur arta
Griffith: The turbid darkness fled, the heaven was sp, endid! up rose the bright beam of celestial Morning.
Devanāgarī: नेशत्तमो दुधितं रोचत द्यौरुद्देव्या उषसो भानुरर्त
pada pāṭha: neśat | tamaḥ | dudhitam | rocata | dyauḥ | ut | devyāḥ | uṣasaḥ | bhānuḥ | arta || ā | sūryaḥ | br̥hataḥ | tiṣṭhat | ajrān | r̥ju | marteṣu | vr̥jinā | ca | paśyan ||4.1.17||

IAST: ā sūryo bṛhatas tiṣṭhad ajrām̐ ṛju marteṣu vṛjinā ca paśyan
Griffith: Surya ascended to the wide expanses, beholding deeds of men both good and evil.
Devanāgarī: आ सूर्यो बृहतस्तिष्ठदज्राँ ऋजु मर्तेषु वृजिना च पश्यन्
pada pāṭha: neśat | tamaḥ | dudhitam | rocata | dyauḥ | ut | devyāḥ | uṣasaḥ | bhānuḥ | arta || ā | sūryaḥ | br̥hataḥ | tiṣṭhat | ajrān | r̥ju | marteṣu | vr̥jinā | ca | paśyan ||4.1.17||

IAST: ād it paścā bubudhānā vy akhyann ād id ratnaṁ dhārayanta dyubhaktam
Griffith: Then, afterwards they looked around, awakened, when first they held that Heaven allotted treasure.
Devanāgarī: आदित्पश्चा बुबुधाना व्यख्यन्नादिद्रत्नं धारयन्त द्युभक्तम्
pada pāṭha: āt | it | paścā | bubudhānāḥ | vi | akhyan | āt | it | ratnam | dhārayanta | dyu-bhaktam || viśve | viśvāsu | duryāsu | devāḥ | mitra | dhiye | varuṇa | satyam | astu ||4.1.18||

IAST: viśve viśvāsu duryāsu devā mitra dhiye varuṇa satyam astu
Griffith: Now all the Gods abide in all their dwellings. Varuna, Mitra, be the prayer effective.
Devanāgarī: विश्वे विश्वासु दुर्यासु देवा मित्र धिये वरुण सत्यमस्तु
pada pāṭha: āt | it | paścā | bubudhānāḥ | vi | akhyan | āt | it | ratnam | dhārayanta | dyu-bhaktam || viśve | viśvāsu | duryāsu | devāḥ | mitra | dhiye | varuṇa | satyam | astu ||4.1.18||

IAST: acchā voceya śuśucānam agniṁ hotāraṁ viśvabharasaṁ yajiṣṭham
Griffith: I will call hither brightly-beaming Agni, the Herald, all-supporting, best at worship.
Devanāgarī: अच्छा वोचेय शुशुचानमग्निं होतारं विश्वभरसं यजिष्ठम्
pada pāṭha: accha | voceya | śuśucānam | agnim | hotāram | viśva-bharasam | yajiṣṭham || śuci | ūdhaḥ | atr̥ṇat | na | gavām | andhaḥ | na | pūtam | pari-siktam | aṁśoḥ ||4.1.19||

IAST: śucy ūdho atṛṇan na gavām andho na pūtam pariṣiktam aṁśoḥ
Griffith: He hath disclosed, like the milch cows' pure udder, the Sorria's juice when cleansed and poured from beakers.
Devanāgarī: शुच्यूधो अतृणन्न गवामन्धो न पूतं परिषिक्तमंशोः
pada pāṭha: accha | voceya | śuśucānam | agnim | hotāram | viśva-bharasam | yajiṣṭham || śuci | ūdhaḥ | atr̥ṇat | na | gavām | andhaḥ | na | pūtam | pari-siktam | aṁśoḥ ||4.1.19||

IAST: viśveṣām aditir yajñiyānāṁ viśveṣām atithir mānuṣāṇām
Griffith: The freest God of all who should be worshipped, the guest who is received in all men's houses,
Devanāgarī: विश्वेषामदितिर्यज्ञियानां विश्वेषामतिथिर्मानुषाणाम्
pada pāṭha: viśveṣām | aditiḥ | yajñiyānām | viśveṣām | atithiḥ | mānuṣāṇām || agniḥ | devānām | avaḥ | ā-vr̥ṇānaḥ | su-mr̥ḷīkaḥ | bhavatu | jāta-vedāḥ ||4.1.20||

IAST: agnir devānām ava āvṛṇānaḥ sumṛḻīko bhavatu jātavedāḥ
Griffith: Agni who hath secured the Gods' high favour,-may he be gracious, to us Jatavedas.
Devanāgarī: अग्निर्देवानामव आवृणानः सुमृळीको भवतु जातवेदाः
pada pāṭha: viśveṣām | aditiḥ | yajñiyānām | viśveṣām | atithiḥ | mānuṣāṇām || agniḥ | devānām | avaḥ | ā-vr̥ṇānaḥ | su-mr̥ḷīkaḥ | bhavatu | jāta-vedāḥ ||4.1.20||

IAST: yo martyeṣv amṛta ṛtāvā devo deveṣv aratir nidhāyi
Griffith: THE, Faithful One, Immortal among mortals, a God among the Gods, appointed envoy,
Devanāgarī: यो मर्त्येष्वमृत ऋतावा देवो देवेष्वरतिर्निधायि
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | martyeṣu | amr̥taḥ | r̥ta-vā | devaḥ | deveṣu | aratiḥ | ni-dhāyi || hotā | yajiṣṭhaḥ | mahnā | śucadhyai | havyaiḥ | agniḥ | manuṣaḥ | īrayadhyai ||4.2.1||

IAST: hotā yajiṣṭho mahnā śucadhyai havyair agnir manuṣa īrayadhyai
Griffith: Priest, best at worship, must shine forth in glory . Agni shall be raised high with man's oblations.
Devanāgarī: होता यजिष्ठो मह्ना शुचध्यै हव्यैरग्निर्मनुष ईरयध्यै
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | martyeṣu | amr̥taḥ | r̥ta-vā | devaḥ | deveṣu | aratiḥ | ni-dhāyi || hotā | yajiṣṭhaḥ | mahnā | śucadhyai | havyaiḥ | agniḥ | manuṣaḥ | īrayadhyai ||4.2.1||

IAST: iha tvaṁ sūno sahaso no adya jāto jātām̐ ubhayām̐ antar agne
Griffith: Born for us here this day, O Son of Vigour, between both races of born beings, Agni,
Devanāgarī: इह त्वं सूनो सहसो नो अद्य जातो जाताँ उभयाँ अन्तरग्ने
pada pāṭha: iha | tvam | sūno iti | sahasaḥ | naḥ | adya | jātaḥ | jātān | ubhayān | antaḥ | agne || dūtaḥ | īyase | yuyujānaḥ | r̥ṣva | r̥ju-muṣkān | vr̥ṣaṇaḥ | śukrān | ca ||4.2.2||

IAST: dūta īyase yuyujāna ṛṣva ṛjumuṣkān vṛṣaṇaḥ śukrām̐ś ca
Griffith: Thou farest as an envoy, having harnessed, Sublime One! thy strong-muscled radiant stallions.
Devanāgarī: दूत ईयसे युयुजान ऋष्व ऋजुमुष्कान्वृषणः शुक्राँश्च
pada pāṭha: iha | tvam | sūno iti | sahasaḥ | naḥ | adya | jātaḥ | jātān | ubhayān | antaḥ | agne || dūtaḥ | īyase | yuyujānaḥ | r̥ṣva | r̥ju-muṣkān | vr̥ṣaṇaḥ | śukrān | ca ||4.2.2||

IAST: atyā vṛdhasnū rohitā ghṛtasnū ṛtasya manye manasā javiṣṭhā
Griffith: I laud the ruddy steeds who pour down blessing, dropping oil, flectest through the thoualit of Order.
Devanāgarī: अत्या वृधस्नू रोहिता घृतस्नू ऋतस्य मन्ये मनसा जविष्ठा
pada pāṭha: atyā | vr̥dhasnū iti vr̥dha-snū | rohitā | ghr̥tasnū iti ghr̥ta-snū | r̥tasya | manye | manasā | javiṣṭhā || antaḥ | īyase | aruṣā | yujānaḥ | yuṣmān | ca | devān | viśaḥ | ā | ca | martān ||4.2.3||

IAST: antar īyase aruṣā yujāno yuṣmām̐ś ca devān viśa ā ca martān
Griffith: Yoking red horses to and fro thou goest between you Deities and mortal races.
Devanāgarī: अन्तरीयसे अरुषा युजानो युष्माँश्च देवान्विश आ च मर्तान्
pada pāṭha: atyā | vr̥dhasnū iti vr̥dha-snū | rohitā | ghr̥tasnū iti ghr̥ta-snū | r̥tasya | manye | manasā | javiṣṭhā || antaḥ | īyase | aruṣā | yujānaḥ | yuṣmān | ca | devān | viśaḥ | ā | ca | martān ||4.2.3||

IAST: aryamaṇaṁ varuṇam mitram eṣām indrāviṣṇū maruto aśvinota
Griffith: Aryaman, Mitra, Varuna, and Indra with Visnu, of the Gods, Maruts and Asvins-
Devanāgarī: अर्यमणं वरुणं मित्रमेषामिन्द्राविष्णू मरुतो अश्विनोत
pada pāṭha: aryamaṇam | varuṇam | mitram | eṣām | indrāviṣṇū iti | marutaḥ | aśvinā | uta || su-aśvaḥ | agne | su-rathaḥ | su-rādhāḥ | ā | it | ūm̐ iti | vaha | su-haviṣe | janāya ||4.2.4||

IAST: svaśvo agne surathaḥ surādhā ed u vaha suhaviṣe janāya
Griffith: These, Agni, with good car and steeds, bring hither, most bountiful, to folk with fair oblations.
Devanāgarī: स्वश्वो अग्ने सुरथः सुराधा एदु वह सुहविषे जनाय
pada pāṭha: aryamaṇam | varuṇam | mitram | eṣām | indrāviṣṇū iti | marutaḥ | aśvinā | uta || su-aśvaḥ | agne | su-rathaḥ | su-rādhāḥ | ā | it | ūm̐ iti | vaha | su-haviṣe | janāya ||4.2.4||

IAST: gomām̐ agne 'vimām̐ aśvī yajño nṛvatsakhā sadam id apramṛṣyaḥ
Griffith: Agni, be this our sacrifice eternal, with brave friends, rich in kine and sheep and horses,
Devanāgarī: गोमाँ अग्नेऽविमाँ अश्वी यज्ञो नृवत्सखा सदमिदप्रमृष्यः
pada pāṭha: go-mān | agne | avi-mān | aśvī | yajñaḥ | nr̥vat-sakhā | sadam | it | apra-mr̥ṣyaḥ || iḷā-vān | eṣaḥ | asura | prajā-vān | dīrghaḥ | rayiḥ | pr̥thu-budhnaḥ | sabhā-vān ||4.2.5||

IAST: iḻāvām̐ eṣo asura prajāvān dīrgho rayiḥ pṛthubudhnaḥ sabhāvān
Griffith: Rich, Asura! in sacred food and children, in full assembly, wealth broad-based and during.
Devanāgarī: इळावाँ एषो असुर प्रजावान्दीर्घो रयिः पृथुबुध्नः सभावान्
pada pāṭha: go-mān | agne | avi-mān | aśvī | yajñaḥ | nr̥vat-sakhā | sadam | it | apra-mr̥ṣyaḥ || iḷā-vān | eṣaḥ | asura | prajā-vān | dīrghaḥ | rayiḥ | pr̥thu-budhnaḥ | sabhā-vān ||4.2.5||

IAST: yas ta idhmaṁ jabharat siṣvidāno mūrdhānaṁ vā tatapate tvāyā
Griffith: The man who, sweating, brings for thee the fuel, and makes his head to ache, thy faithful servant,-
Devanāgarī: यस्त इध्मं जभरत्सिष्विदानो मूर्धानं वा ततपते त्वाया
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | te | idhmam | jabharat | sisvidānaḥ | mūrdhānam | vā | tatapate | tvā-yā || bhuvaḥ | tasya | sva-tavān | pāyuḥ | agne | viśvasmāt | sīm | agha-yataḥ | uruṣya ||4.2.6||

IAST: bhuvas tasya svatavām̐ḥ pāyur agne viśvasmāt sīm aghāyata uruṣya
Griffith: Agni, to him be a self-strong Protector guard him from all who seek to do him mischief.
Devanāgarī: भुवस्तस्य स्वतवाँः पायुरग्ने विश्वस्मात्सीमघायत उरुष्य
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | te | idhmam | jabharat | sisvidānaḥ | mūrdhānam | vā | tatapate | tvā-yā || bhuvaḥ | tasya | sva-tavān | pāyuḥ | agne | viśvasmāt | sīm | agha-yataḥ | uruṣya ||4.2.6||

IAST: yas te bharād anniyate cid annaṁ niśiṣan mandram atithim udīrat
Griffith: Who brings thee food, though thou hast food in plenty, welcomes his cheerful guest and speeds him onward,
Devanāgarī: यस्ते भरादन्नियते चिदन्नं निशिषन्मन्द्रमतिथिमुदीरत्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | te | bharāt | anni-yate | cit | annam | ni-śiṣat | mandram | atithim | ut-īrat || ā | deva-yuḥ | inadhate | duroṇe | tasmin | rayiḥ | dhruvaḥ | astu | dāsvān ||4.2.7||

IAST: ā devayur inadhate duroṇe tasmin rayir dhruvo astu dāsvān
Griffith: Who kindles thee devoutly in his dwelling,to him be wealth secure and freely giving.
Devanāgarī: आ देवयुरिनधते दुरोणे तस्मिन्रयिर्ध्रुवो अस्तु दास्वान्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | te | bharāt | anni-yate | cit | annam | ni-śiṣat | mandram | atithim | ut-īrat || ā | deva-yuḥ | inadhate | duroṇe | tasmin | rayiḥ | dhruvaḥ | astu | dāsvān ||4.2.7||

IAST: yas tvā doṣā ya uṣasi praśaṁsāt priyaṁ vā tvā kṛṇavate haviṣmān
Griffith: Whoso sings praise to thee at eve or morning, and, with oblation, doth the thing thou lovest,-
Devanāgarī: यस्त्वा दोषा य उषसि प्रशंसात्प्रियं वा त्वा कृणवते हविष्मान्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | tvā | doṣā | yaḥ | uṣasi | pra-śaṁsāt | priyam | vā | tvā | kr̥ṇavate | haviṣmān || aśvaḥ | na | sve | dame | ā | hemyā-vān | tam | aṁhasaḥ | pīparaḥ | dāśvāṁsam ||4.2.8||

IAST: aśvo na sve dama ā hemyāvān tam aṁhasaḥ pīparo dāśvāṁsam
Griffith: In his own home, even as a goId-girt courser, rescue him from distress, the bounteous giver.
Devanāgarī: अश्वो न स्वे दम आ हेम्यावान्तमंहसः पीपरो दाश्वांसम्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | tvā | doṣā | yaḥ | uṣasi | pra-śaṁsāt | priyam | vā | tvā | kr̥ṇavate | haviṣmān || aśvaḥ | na | sve | dame | ā | hemyā-vān | tam | aṁhasaḥ | pīparaḥ | dāśvāṁsam ||4.2.8||

IAST: yas tubhyam agne amṛtāya dāśad duvas tve kṛṇavate yatasruk
Griffith: Whoso brings gifts to thee Immortal, Agni, and doth thee service with uplifted ladle,-
Devanāgarī: यस्तुभ्यमग्ने अमृताय दाशद्दुवस्त्वे कृणवते यतस्रुक्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | tubhyam | agne | amr̥tāya | dāśat | duvaḥ | tve iti | kr̥ṇavate | yata-sruk || na | saḥ | rāyā | śaśamānaḥ | vi | yoṣat | na | enam | aṁhaḥ | pari | varat | agha-yoḥ ||4.2.9||

IAST: na sa rāyā śaśamāno vi yoṣan nainam aṁhaḥ pari varad aghāyoḥ
Griffith: Let him not, sorely toiling, lose his riches; let not the sinner's wickedness enclose him.
Devanāgarī: न स राया शशमानो वि योषन्नैनमंहः परि वरदघायोः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | tubhyam | agne | amr̥tāya | dāśat | duvaḥ | tve iti | kr̥ṇavate | yata-sruk || na | saḥ | rāyā | śaśamānaḥ | vi | yoṣat | na | enam | aṁhaḥ | pari | varat | agha-yoḥ ||4.2.9||

IAST: yasya tvam agne adhvaraṁ jujoṣo devo martasya sudhitaṁ rarāṇaḥ
Griffith: Whose well-wrought worship thou acceptest, Agni, thou God a mortal's gift, thou liberal Giver,-
Devanāgarī: यस्य त्वमग्ने अध्वरं जुजोषो देवो मर्तस्य सुधितं रराणः
pada pāṭha: yasya | tvam | agne | adhvaram | jujoṣaḥ | devaḥ | martasya | su-dhitam | rarāṇaḥ || prītā | it | asat | hotrā | sā | yaviṣṭha | asāma | yasya | vidhataḥ | vr̥dhāsaḥ ||4.2.10||

IAST: prīted asad dhotrā sā yaviṣṭhāsāma yasya vidhato vṛdhāsaḥ
Griffith: Dear be his sacrifice to thee, Most Youthful! and may we strengthen him when he adores thee.
Devanāgarī: प्रीतेदसद्धोत्रा सा यविष्ठासाम यस्य विधतो वृधासः
pada pāṭha: yasya | tvam | agne | adhvaram | jujoṣaḥ | devaḥ | martasya | su-dhitam | rarāṇaḥ || prītā | it | asat | hotrā | sā | yaviṣṭha | asāma | yasya | vidhataḥ | vr̥dhāsaḥ ||4.2.10||

IAST: cittim acittiṁ cinavad vi vidvān pṛṣṭheva vītā vṛjinā ca martān
Griffith: May he who knows distinguish sense and folly of men, like straight and crooked backs of horses.
Devanāgarī: चित्तिमचित्तिं चिनवद्वि विद्वान्पृष्ठेव वीता वृजिना च मर्तान्
pada pāṭha: cittim | acittim | cinavat | vi | vidvān | pr̥ṣṭā-iva | vītā | vr̥jinā | ca | martān || rāye | ca | naḥ | su-apatyāya | deva | ditim | ca | rāsva | aditim | uruṣya ||4.2.11||

IAST: rāye ca naḥ svapatyāya deva ditiṁ ca rāsvāditim uruṣya
Griffith: Lead us, O God, to wealth and noble offspring: keep penury afar and grant us plenty.
Devanāgarī: राये च नः स्वपत्याय देव दितिं च रास्वादितिमुरुष्य
pada pāṭha: cittim | acittim | cinavat | vi | vidvān | pr̥ṣṭā-iva | vītā | vr̥jinā | ca | martān || rāye | ca | naḥ | su-apatyāya | deva | ditim | ca | rāsva | aditim | uruṣya ||4.2.11||

IAST: kaviṁ śaśāsuḥ kavayo 'dabdhā nidhārayanto duryāsv āyoḥ
Griffith: This Sage the Sages, ne'er deceived, commanded, setting him down in dwellings of the living.
Devanāgarī: कविं शशासुः कवयोऽदब्धा निधारयन्तो दुर्यास्वायोः
pada pāṭha: kavim | śaśāsuḥ | kavayaḥ | adabdhāḥ | ni-dhārayantaḥ | duryāsu | āyoḥ || ataḥ | tvam | dr̥śyān | agne | etān | paṭ-bhiḥ | paśyeḥ | adbhutān | aryaḥ | evaiḥ ||4.2.12||

IAST: atas tvaṁ dṛśyām̐ agna etān paḍbhiḥ paśyer adbhutām̐ arya evaiḥ
Griffith: Hence mayst thou, friendly God, with rapid footsteps behold the Gods, wonderful, fair to look on.
Devanāgarī: अतस्त्वं दृश्याँ अग्न एतान्पड्भिः पश्येरद्भुताँ अर्य एवैः
pada pāṭha: kavim | śaśāsuḥ | kavayaḥ | adabdhāḥ | ni-dhārayantaḥ | duryāsu | āyoḥ || ataḥ | tvam | dr̥śyān | agne | etān | paṭ-bhiḥ | paśyeḥ | adbhutān | aryaḥ | evaiḥ ||4.2.12||

IAST: tvam agne vāghate supraṇītiḥ sutasomāya vidhate yaviṣṭha
Griffith: Good guidance hast thou for the priest, O Agni, who, Youngest God! with outpoured Soma serves thee.
Devanāgarī: त्वमग्ने वाघते सुप्रणीतिः सुतसोमाय विधते यविष्ठ
pada pāṭha: tvam | agne | vāghate | su-pranītiḥ | suta-somāya | vidhate | yaviṣṭha || ratnam | bhara | śaśamānāya | ghr̥ṣve | pr̥thu | candram | avase | carṣaṇi-prāḥ ||4.2.13||

IAST: ratnam bhara śaśamānāya ghṛṣve pṛthu ścandram avase carṣaṇiprāḥ
Griffith: Ruler of men, thou joyous God, bring treasure splendid and plentiful to aid the toiler.
Devanāgarī: रत्नं भर शशमानाय घृष्वे पृथु श्चन्द्रमवसे चर्षणिप्राः
pada pāṭha: tvam | agne | vāghate | su-pranītiḥ | suta-somāya | vidhate | yaviṣṭha || ratnam | bhara | śaśamānāya | ghr̥ṣve | pr̥thu | candram | avase | carṣaṇi-prāḥ ||4.2.13||

IAST: adhā ha yad vayam agne tvāyā paḍbhir hastebhiś cakṛmā tanūbhiḥ
Griffith: Now all that we, thy faithful servants, Agni, have done with feet, with hands, and with our bodies,
Devanāgarī: अधा ह यद्वयमग्ने त्वाया पड्भिर्हस्तेभिश्चकृमा तनूभिः
pada pāṭha: adha | ha | yat | vayam | agne | tvā-yā | paṭ-bhiḥ | hastebhiḥ | cakr̥ma | tanūbhiḥ || ratham | na | krantaḥ | apasā | bhurijoḥ | r̥tam | yemuḥ | su-dhyaḥ | āśuṣāṇāḥ ||4.2.14||

IAST: rathaṁ na kranto apasā bhurijor ṛtaṁ yemuḥ sudhya āśuṣāṇāḥ
Griffith: The wise, with toil, the holy rite have guided, as those who frame a car with manual cunning.
Devanāgarī: रथं न क्रन्तो अपसा भुरिजोरृतं येमुः सुध्य आशुषाणाः
pada pāṭha: adha | ha | yat | vayam | agne | tvā-yā | paṭ-bhiḥ | hastebhiḥ | cakr̥ma | tanūbhiḥ || ratham | na | krantaḥ | apasā | bhurijoḥ | r̥tam | yemuḥ | su-dhyaḥ | āśuṣāṇāḥ ||4.2.14||

IAST: adhā mātur uṣasaḥ sapta viprā jāyemahi prathamā vedhaso nṝn
Griffith: May we, seven sages first in rank, engender, from Dawn the Mother, men to be ordainers.
Devanāgarī: अधा मातुरुषसः सप्त विप्रा जायेमहि प्रथमा वेधसो नॄन्
pada pāṭha: adha | mātuḥ | uṣasaḥ | sapta | viprāḥ | jāyemahi | prathamāḥ | vedhasaḥ | nr̥̄n || divaḥ | putrāḥ | aṅgirasaḥ | bhavema | adrim | rujema | dhaninam | śucantaḥ ||4.2.15||

IAST: divas putrā aṅgiraso bhavemādriṁ rujema dhaninaṁ śucantaḥ
Griffith: May we, Angirases, be sons of Heaven, and, radiant, burst the wealth-containing mountain.
Devanāgarī: दिवस्पुत्रा अङ्गिरसो भवेमाद्रिं रुजेम धनिनं शुचन्तः
pada pāṭha: adha | mātuḥ | uṣasaḥ | sapta | viprāḥ | jāyemahi | prathamāḥ | vedhasaḥ | nr̥̄n || divaḥ | putrāḥ | aṅgirasaḥ | bhavema | adrim | rujema | dhaninam | śucantaḥ ||4.2.15||

IAST: adhā yathā naḥ pitaraḥ parāsaḥ pratnāso agna ṛtam āśuṣāṇāḥ
Griffith: As in the days of old our ancient Fathers, speeding the work of holy worship, Agni,
Devanāgarī: अधा यथा नः पितरः परासः प्रत्नासो अग्न ऋतमाशुषाणाः
pada pāṭha: adha | yathā | naḥ | pitaraḥ | parāsaḥ | pratnāsaḥ | agne | r̥tam | āśuṣāṇāḥ || śuci | it | ayan | dīdhitim | uktha-śasaḥ | kṣāma | bhindantaḥ | aruṇīḥ | apa | vran ||4.2.16||

IAST: śucīd ayan dīdhitim ukthaśāsaḥ kṣāmā bhindanto aruṇīr apa vran
Griffith: Sought pure light and devotion, singing praises; they cleft the ground and made red Dawns apparent.
Devanāgarī: शुचीदयन्दीधितिमुक्थशासः क्षामा भिन्दन्तो अरुणीरप व्रन्
pada pāṭha: adha | yathā | naḥ | pitaraḥ | parāsaḥ | pratnāsaḥ | agne | r̥tam | āśuṣāṇāḥ || śuci | it | ayan | dīdhitim | uktha-śasaḥ | kṣāma | bhindantaḥ | aruṇīḥ | apa | vran ||4.2.16||

IAST: sukarmāṇaḥ suruco devayanto 'yo na devā janimā dhamantaḥ
Griffith: Gods, doing holy acts, devout, resplendent, smelting like ore their human generations.
Devanāgarī: सुकर्माणः सुरुचो देवयन्तोऽयो न देवा जनिमा धमन्तः
pada pāṭha: su-karmāṇaḥ | su-rucaḥ | deva-yantaḥ | ayaḥ | na | devāḥ | janima | dhamantaḥ || śucantaḥ | agnim | vavr̥dhantaḥ | indram | ūrvam | gavyam | pari-sadantaḥ | agman ||4.2.17||

IAST: śucanto agniṁ vavṛdhanta indram ūrvaṁ gavyam pariṣadanto agman
Griffith: Enkindling Agni and exalting Indra, they came encompassing the stall of cattle.
Devanāgarī: शुचन्तो अग्निं ववृधन्त इन्द्रमूर्वं गव्यं परिषदन्तो अग्मन्
pada pāṭha: su-karmāṇaḥ | su-rucaḥ | deva-yantaḥ | ayaḥ | na | devāḥ | janima | dhamantaḥ || śucantaḥ | agnim | vavr̥dhantaḥ | indram | ūrvam | gavyam | pari-sadantaḥ | agman ||4.2.17||

IAST: ā yūtheva kṣumati paśvo akhyad devānāṁ yaj janimānty ugra
Griffith: Strong One! he marked them-and the Gods before them-like herds of cattle in a foodful pasture.
Devanāgarī: आ यूथेव क्षुमति पश्वो अख्यद्देवानां यज्जनिमान्त्युग्र
pada pāṭha: ā | yūthā-iva | kṣu-mati | paśvaḥ | akhyat | devānām | yat | janima | anti | ugra || martānām | cit | urvaśīḥ | akr̥pran | vr̥dhe | cit | aryaḥ | uparasya | āyoḥ ||4.2.18||

IAST: martānāṁ cid urvaśīr akṛpran vṛdhe cid arya uparasyāyoḥ
Griffith: There they moaned forth their strong desire for mortals, to aid the True, the nearest One, the Living.
Devanāgarī: मर्तानां चिदुर्वशीरकृप्रन्वृधे चिदर्य उपरस्यायोः
pada pāṭha: ā | yūthā-iva | kṣu-mati | paśvaḥ | akhyat | devānām | yat | janima | anti | ugra || martānām | cit | urvaśīḥ | akr̥pran | vr̥dhe | cit | aryaḥ | uparasya | āyoḥ ||4.2.18||

IAST: akarma te svapaso abhūma ṛtam avasrann uṣaso vibhātīḥ
Griffith: We have worked for thee, we have laboured nobly-bright Dawns have shed their light upon our worship-
Devanāgarī: अकर्म ते स्वपसो अभूम ऋतमवस्रन्नुषसो विभातीः
pada pāṭha: akarma | te | su-apasaḥ | abhūma | r̥tam | avasran | uṣasaḥ | vibhātīḥ || anūnam | agnim | purudhā | su-candram | devasya | marmr̥jataḥ | cāru | cakṣuḥ ||4.2.19||

IAST: anūnam agnim purudhā suścandraṁ devasya marmṛjataś cāru cakṣuḥ
Griffith: Adding a beauty to the perfect Agni, and the God's beauteous eye that shines for ever.
Devanāgarī: अनूनमग्निं पुरुधा सुश्चन्द्रं देवस्य मर्मृजतश्चारु चक्षुः
pada pāṭha: akarma | te | su-apasaḥ | abhūma | r̥tam | avasran | uṣasaḥ | vibhātīḥ || anūnam | agnim | purudhā | su-candram | devasya | marmr̥jataḥ | cāru | cakṣuḥ ||4.2.19||

IAST: etā te agna ucathāni vedho 'vocāma kavaye tā juṣasva
Griffith: Agni, Disposer, we have sung these praises to thee the Wise: do thou accept them gladly.
Devanāgarī: एता ते अग्न उचथानि वेधोऽवोचाम कवये ता जुषस्व
pada pāṭha: etā | te | agne | ucathāni | vedhaḥ | avocāma | kavaye | tā | juṣasva || ut | śocasva | kr̥ṇuhi | vasyasaḥ | naḥ | mahaḥ | rāyaḥ | puru-vāra | pra | yandhi ||4.2.20||

IAST: uc chocasva kṛṇuhi vasyaso no maho rāyaḥ puruvāra pra yandhi
Griffith: Blaze up on high and ever make us richer. Give us great wealth, O thou whose boons are many.
Devanāgarī: उच्छोचस्व कृणुहि वस्यसो नो महो रायः पुरुवार प्र यन्धि
pada pāṭha: etā | te | agne | ucathāni | vedhaḥ | avocāma | kavaye | tā | juṣasva || ut | śocasva | kr̥ṇuhi | vasyasaḥ | naḥ | mahaḥ | rāyaḥ | puru-vāra | pra | yandhi ||4.2.20||

IAST: ā vo rājānam adhvarasya rudraṁ hotāraṁ satyayajaṁ rodasyoḥ
Griffith: WIN, to assist you, Rudra, Lord of worship, Priest of both worlds, effectual sacrificer,
Devanāgarī: आ वो राजानमध्वरस्य रुद्रं होतारं सत्ययजं रोदस्योः
pada pāṭha: ā | vaḥ | rājānam | adhvarasya | rudram | hotāram | satya-yajam | rodasyoḥ || agnim | purā | tanayitnoḥ | acittāt | hiraṇya-rūpam | avase | kr̥ṇudhvam ||4.3.1||

IAST: agnim purā tanayitnor acittād dhiraṇyarūpam avase kṛṇudhvam
Griffith: Agni, invested with his golden colours, before the thunder strike and lay you senseless.
Devanāgarī: अग्निं पुरा तनयित्नोरचित्ताद्धिरण्यरूपमवसे कृणुध्वम्
pada pāṭha: ā | vaḥ | rājānam | adhvarasya | rudram | hotāram | satya-yajam | rodasyoḥ || agnim | purā | tanayitnoḥ | acittāt | hiraṇya-rūpam | avase | kr̥ṇudhvam ||4.3.1||

IAST: ayaṁ yoniś cakṛmā yaṁ vayaṁ te jāyeva patya uśatī suvāsāḥ
Griffith: This shrine have we made ready for thy coming, as the fond dame attires her for her husband.
Devanāgarī: अयं योनिश्चकृमा यं वयं ते जायेव पत्य उशती सुवासाः
pada pāṭha: ayam | yoniḥ | cakr̥ma | yam | vayam | te | jāyā-iva | patye | uśatī | su-vāsāḥ || arvācīnaḥ | pari-vītaḥ | ni | sīda | imāḥ | ūm̐ iti | te | su-apāka | pratīcīḥ ||4.3.2||

IAST: arvācīnaḥ parivīto ni ṣīdemā u te svapāka pratīcīḥ
Griffith: Performer of good work, sit down before us, invested while these flames incline to meet thee.
Devanāgarī: अर्वाचीनः परिवीतो नि षीदेमा उ ते स्वपाक प्रतीचीः
pada pāṭha: ayam | yoniḥ | cakr̥ma | yam | vayam | te | jāyā-iva | patye | uśatī | su-vāsāḥ || arvācīnaḥ | pari-vītaḥ | ni | sīda | imāḥ | ūm̐ iti | te | su-apāka | pratīcīḥ ||4.3.2||

IAST: āśṛṇvate adṛpitāya manma nṛcakṣase sumṛḻīkāya vedhaḥ
Griffith: A hymn, O Priest, to him who hears, the gentle, to him who looks on men, exceeding gracious,
Devanāgarī: आशृण्वते अदृपिताय मन्म नृचक्षसे सुमृळीकाय वेधः
pada pāṭha: ā-śr̥ṇvate | adr̥pitāya | manma | nr̥-cakṣase | su-mr̥ḷīkāya | vedhaḥ || devāya | śastim | amr̥tāya | śaṁsa | grāvā-iva | sotā | madhu-sut | yam | īḷe ||4.3.3||

IAST: devāya śastim amṛtāya śaṁsa grāveva sotā madhuṣud yam īḻe
Griffith: A song of praise sing to the God Immortal, whom the stone, presser of the sweet juice, worships.
Devanāgarī: देवाय शस्तिममृताय शंस ग्रावेव सोता मधुषुद्यमीळे
pada pāṭha: ā-śr̥ṇvate | adr̥pitāya | manma | nr̥-cakṣase | su-mr̥ḷīkāya | vedhaḥ || devāya | śastim | amr̥tāya | śaṁsa | grāvā-iva | sotā | madhu-sut | yam | īḷe ||4.3.3||

IAST: tvaṁ cin naḥ śamyā agne asyā ṛtasya bodhy ṛtacit svādhīḥ
Griffith: Even as true knower of the Law, O Agni, to this our solemn rite he thou attentive.
Devanāgarī: त्वं चिन्नः शम्या अग्ने अस्या ऋतस्य बोध्यृतचित्स्वाधीः
pada pāṭha: tvam | cit | naḥ | śamyai | agne | asyāḥ | r̥tasya | bodhi | r̥ta-cit | su-ādhīḥ || kadā | te | ukthā | sadha-mādyāni | kadā | bhavanti | sakhyā | gr̥he | te ||4.3.4||

IAST: kadā ta ukthā sadhamādyāni kadā bhavanti sakhyā gṛhe te
Griffith: When shall thy songs of festival be sung thee? When is thy friendship shown within our dwelling?
Devanāgarī: कदा त उक्था सधमाद्यानि कदा भवन्ति सख्या गृहे ते
pada pāṭha: tvam | cit | naḥ | śamyai | agne | asyāḥ | r̥tasya | bodhi | r̥ta-cit | su-ādhīḥ || kadā | te | ukthā | sadha-mādyāni | kadā | bhavanti | sakhyā | gr̥he | te ||4.3.4||

IAST: kathā ha tad varuṇāya tvam agne kathā dive garhase kan na āgaḥ
Griffith: Why this complaint to Varuna, O Agni? And why to Heaven? for what is our transgression?
Devanāgarī: कथा ह तद्वरुणाय त्वमग्ने कथा दिवे गर्हसे कन्न आगः
pada pāṭha: kathā | ha | tat | varuṇāya | tvam | agne | kathā | dive | garhase | kat | naḥ | āgaḥ || kathā | mitrāya | mīḷhuṣe | pr̥thivyai | bravaḥ | kat | aryamṇe | kat | bhagāya ||4.3.5||

IAST: kathā mitrāya mīḻhuṣe pṛthivyai bravaḥ kad aryamṇe kad bhagāya
Griffith: How wilt thou speak to Earth and bounteous Mitra? What wilt thou say to Aryaman and Bhaga?
Devanāgarī: कथा मित्राय मीळ्हुषे पृथिव्यै ब्रवः कदर्यम्णे कद्भगाय
pada pāṭha: kathā | ha | tat | varuṇāya | tvam | agne | kathā | dive | garhase | kat | naḥ | āgaḥ || kathā | mitrāya | mīḷhuṣe | pr̥thivyai | bravaḥ | kat | aryamṇe | kat | bhagāya ||4.3.5||

IAST: kad dhiṣṇyāsu vṛdhasāno agne kad vātāya pratavase śubhaṁye
Griffith: What, when thou blazest on the lesser altars, what to the mighty Wind who comes tobless us,
Devanāgarī: कद्धिष्ण्यासु वृधसानो अग्ने कद्वाताय प्रतवसे शुभंये
pada pāṭha: kat | dhiṣṇyāsu | vr̥dhasānaḥ | agne | kat | vātāya | pra-tavase | śubham-ye || pari-jmane | nāsatyāya | kṣe | bravaḥ | kat | agne | rudrāya | nr̥-ghne ||4.3.6||

IAST: parijmane nāsatyāya kṣe bravaḥ kad agne rudrāya nṛghne
Griffith: True, circumambient? what to Earth, O Agni, what wilt thou say to man-destroying Rudra?
Devanāgarī: परिज्मने नासत्याय क्षे ब्रवः कदग्ने रुद्राय नृघ्ने
pada pāṭha: kat | dhiṣṇyāsu | vr̥dhasānaḥ | agne | kat | vātāya | pra-tavase | śubham-ye || pari-jmane | nāsatyāya | kṣe | bravaḥ | kat | agne | rudrāya | nr̥-ghne ||4.3.6||

IAST: kathā mahe puṣṭimbharāya pūṣṇe kad rudrāya sumakhāya havirde
Griffith: How to great Pusan who promotes our welfare,- to honoured Rudra what, who gives oblations?
Devanāgarī: कथा महे पुष्टिम्भराय पूष्णे कद्रुद्राय सुमखाय हविर्दे
pada pāṭha: kathā | mahe | puṣṭim-bharāya | pūṣṇe | kat | rudrāya | su-makhāya | haviḥ-de || kat | viṣṇave | uru-gāyāya | retaḥ | bravaḥ | kat | agne | śarave | br̥hatyai ||4.3.7||

IAST: kad viṣṇava urugāyāya reto bravaḥ kad agne śarave bṛhatyai
Griffith: What sin of ours to the far-striding Visnu, what, Agni, wilt thou tell the Lofty Arrow.
Devanāgarī: कद्विष्णव उरुगायाय रेतो ब्रवः कदग्ने शरवे बृहत्यै
pada pāṭha: kathā | mahe | puṣṭim-bharāya | pūṣṇe | kat | rudrāya | su-makhāya | haviḥ-de || kat | viṣṇave | uru-gāyāya | retaḥ | bravaḥ | kat | agne | śarave | br̥hatyai ||4.3.7||

IAST: kathā śardhāya marutām ṛtāya kathā sūre bṛhate pṛcchyamānaḥ
Griffith: What wilt thou tell the truthful band of Maruts, how answer the great Sun when thou art questioned?
Devanāgarī: कथा शर्धाय मरुतामृताय कथा सूरे बृहते पृच्छ्यमानः
pada pāṭha: kathā | śardhāya | marutām | r̥tāya | kathā | sūre | br̥hate | pr̥cchyamānaḥ || prati | bravaḥ | aditaye | turāya | sādha | divaḥ | jāta-vedaḥ | cikitvān ||4.3.8||

IAST: prati bravo 'ditaye turāya sādhā divo jātavedaś cikitvān
Griffith: Before the Free, before the Swift, defend us: fulfil heaven's work, all-knowing Jatavedas.
Devanāgarī: प्रति ब्रवोऽदितये तुराय साधा दिवो जातवेदश्चिकित्वान्
pada pāṭha: kathā | śardhāya | marutām | r̥tāya | kathā | sūre | br̥hate | pr̥cchyamānaḥ || prati | bravaḥ | aditaye | turāya | sādha | divaḥ | jāta-vedaḥ | cikitvān ||4.3.8||

IAST: ṛtena ṛtaṁ niyatam īḻa ā gor āmā sacā madhumat pakvam agne
Griffith: I crave the cow's true gift arranged by Order: though raw, she hath the sweet ripe juice, O Agni.
Devanāgarī: ऋतेन ऋतं नियतमीळ आ गोरामा सचा मधुमत्पक्वमग्ने
pada pāṭha: r̥tena | r̥tam | ni-yatam | īḷe | ā | goḥ | āmā | sacā | madhu-mat | pakvam | agne || kr̥ṣṇā | satī | ruśatā | dhāsinā | eṣā | jāmaryeṇa | payasā | pīpāya ||4.3.9||

IAST: kṛṣṇā satī ruśatā dhāsinaiṣā jāmaryeṇa payasā pīpāya
Griffith: Though she is black of hue with milk she teemeth, nutritious, brightly shining, all-sustaining.
Devanāgarī: कृष्णा सती रुशता धासिनैषा जामर्येण पयसा पीपाय
pada pāṭha: r̥tena | r̥tam | ni-yatam | īḷe | ā | goḥ | āmā | sacā | madhu-mat | pakvam | agne || kr̥ṣṇā | satī | ruśatā | dhāsinā | eṣā | jāmaryeṇa | payasā | pīpāya ||4.3.9||

IAST: ṛtena hi ṣmā vṛṣabhaś cid aktaḥ pumām̐ agniḥ payasā pṛṣṭhyena
Griffith: Agni the Bull, the manly, hath been sprinkled with oil upon his back, by Law eternal.
Devanāgarī: ऋतेन हि ष्मा वृषभश्चिदक्तः पुमाँ अग्निः पयसा पृष्ठ्येन
pada pāṭha: r̥tenaḥ | hi | sma | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | cit | aktaḥ | pumān | agniḥ | payasā | pr̥ṣṭhyena || aspandamānaḥ | acarat | vayaḥ-dhāḥ | vr̥ṣā | śukram | duduhe | pr̥śniḥ | ūdhaḥ ||4.3.10||

IAST: aspandamāno acarad vayodhā vṛṣā śukraṁ duduhe pṛśnir ūdhaḥ
Griffith: He who gives vital power goes on unswerving. Prsni the Bull hath milked the pure wiiite udder.
Devanāgarī: अस्पन्दमानो अचरद्वयोधा वृषा शुक्रं दुदुहे पृश्निरूधः
pada pāṭha: r̥tenaḥ | hi | sma | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | cit | aktaḥ | pumān | agniḥ | payasā | pr̥ṣṭhyena || aspandamānaḥ | acarat | vayaḥ-dhāḥ | vr̥ṣā | śukram | duduhe | pr̥śniḥ | ūdhaḥ ||4.3.10||

IAST: ṛtenādriṁ vy asan bhidantaḥ sam aṅgiraso navanta gobhiḥ
Griffith: By Law the Angirases cleft the rock asunder, and sang their hymns together with the cattle.
Devanāgarī: ऋतेनाद्रिं व्यसन्भिदन्तः समङ्गिरसो नवन्त गोभिः
pada pāṭha: r̥tena | adrim | vi | asan | bhidantaḥ | sam | aṅgirasaḥ | navanta | go-bhiḥ || śunam | naraḥ | pari | sadan | uṣasam | āviḥ | svaḥ | abhavat | jāte | agnau ||4.3.11||

IAST: śunaṁ naraḥ pari ṣadann uṣāsam āviḥ svar abhavaj jāte agnau
Griffith: Bringing great bliss the men encompassed Morning: light was apparent at the birth of Agni.
Devanāgarī: शुनं नरः परि षदन्नुषासमाविः स्वरभवज्जाते अग्नौ
pada pāṭha: r̥tena | adrim | vi | asan | bhidantaḥ | sam | aṅgirasaḥ | navanta | go-bhiḥ || śunam | naraḥ | pari | sadan | uṣasam | āviḥ | svaḥ | abhavat | jāte | agnau ||4.3.11||

IAST: ṛtena devīr amṛtā amṛktā arṇobhir āpo madhumadbhir agne
Griffith: By Law the Immortal Goddesses the Waters, with meath-rich waves, O Agni, and uninjured,
Devanāgarī: ऋतेन देवीरमृता अमृक्ता अर्णोभिरापो मधुमद्भिरग्ने
pada pāṭha: r̥tena | devīḥ | amr̥tāḥ | amr̥ktāḥ | arṇaḥ-bhiḥ | āpaḥ | madhumat-bhiḥ | agne || vājī | na | sargeṣu | pra-stubhānaḥ | pra | sadam | it | sravitave | dadhanyuḥ ||4.3.12||

IAST: vājī na sargeṣu prastubhānaḥ pra sadam it sravitave dadhanyuḥ
Griffith: Like a strong courser lauded in his running, sped to flow onward swiftly and for ever.
Devanāgarī: वाजी न सर्गेषु प्रस्तुभानः प्र सदमित्स्रवितवे दधन्युः
pada pāṭha: r̥tena | devīḥ | amr̥tāḥ | amr̥ktāḥ | arṇaḥ-bhiḥ | āpaḥ | madhumat-bhiḥ | agne || vājī | na | sargeṣu | pra-stubhānaḥ | pra | sadam | it | sravitave | dadhanyuḥ ||4.3.12||

IAST: mā kasya yakṣaṁ sadam id dhuro gā mā veśasya praminato māpeḥ
Griffith: Go never to the feast of one who harms us, the treacherous neighbour or. unworthy kinsman.
Devanāgarī: मा कस्य यक्षं सदमिद्धुरो गा मा वेशस्य प्रमिनतो मापेः
pada pāṭha: mā | kasya | yakṣam | sadam | it | huraḥ | gāḥ | mā | veśasya | pra-minataḥ | mā | āpeḥ || mā | bhrātuḥ | agne | anr̥joḥ | r̥ṇam | veḥ | mā | sakhyuḥ | dakṣam | ripoḥ | bhujema ||4.3.13||

IAST: mā bhrātur agne anṛjor ṛṇaṁ ver mā sakhyur dakṣaṁ ripor bhujema
Griffith: Punish us not for a false brother's trespass. Let us riot feel the might of friend or foeman.
Devanāgarī: मा भ्रातुरग्ने अनृजोरृणं वेर्मा सख्युर्दक्षं रिपोर्भुजेम
pada pāṭha: mā | kasya | yakṣam | sadam | it | huraḥ | gāḥ | mā | veśasya | pra-minataḥ | mā | āpeḥ || mā | bhrātuḥ | agne | anr̥joḥ | r̥ṇam | veḥ | mā | sakhyuḥ | dakṣam | ripoḥ | bhujema ||4.3.13||

IAST: rakṣā ṇo agne tava rakṣaṇebhī rārakṣāṇaḥ sumakha prīṇānaḥ
Griffith: O Agni, keep us safe with thy protection, loving us, honoured God! and ever guarding.
Devanāgarī: रक्षा णो अग्ने तव रक्षणेभी रारक्षाणः सुमख प्रीणानः
pada pāṭha: rakṣa | naḥ | agne | tava | rakṣaṇebhiḥ | rarakṣāṇaḥ | su-makha | prīṇānaḥ || prati | sphura | vi | ruja | vīḷu | aṁhaḥ | jahi | rakṣaḥ | mahi | cit | vavr̥dhānam ||4.3.14||

IAST: prati ṣphura vi ruja vīḍv aṁho jahi rakṣo mahi cid vāvṛdhānam
Griffith: Beat thou away, destory severe affliction slay e'en the demon when he waxes mighty.
Devanāgarī: प्रति ष्फुर वि रुज वीड्वंहो जहि रक्षो महि चिद्वावृधानम्
pada pāṭha: rakṣa | naḥ | agne | tava | rakṣaṇebhiḥ | rarakṣāṇaḥ | su-makha | prīṇānaḥ || prati | sphura | vi | ruja | vīḷu | aṁhaḥ | jahi | rakṣaḥ | mahi | cit | vavr̥dhānam ||4.3.14||

IAST: ebhir bhava sumanā agne arkair imān spṛśa manmabhiḥ śūra vājān
Griffith: Through these our songs of praise be gracious, Agni; moved by ourprayers, O Hero, touch our viands.
Devanāgarī: एभिर्भव सुमना अग्ने अर्कैरिमान्स्पृश मन्मभिः शूर वाजान्
pada pāṭha: ebhiḥ | bhava | su-manāḥ | agne | arkaiḥ | imān | spr̥śa | manma-bhiḥ | śūra | vājān || uta | brahmāṇi | aṅgiraḥ | juṣasva | sam | te | śastiḥ | deva-vātā | jareta ||4.3.15||

IAST: uta brahmāṇy aṅgiro juṣasva saṁ te śastir devavātā jareta
Griffith: Accept, O Angiras, these our devotions, and let the praise which Gods desire address thee.
Devanāgarī: उत ब्रह्माण्यङ्गिरो जुषस्व सं ते शस्तिर्देववाता जरेत
pada pāṭha: ebhiḥ | bhava | su-manāḥ | agne | arkaiḥ | imān | spr̥śa | manma-bhiḥ | śūra | vājān || uta | brahmāṇi | aṅgiraḥ | juṣasva | sam | te | śastiḥ | deva-vātā | jareta ||4.3.15||

IAST: etā viśvā viduṣe tubhyaṁ vedho nīthāny agne niṇyā vacāṁsi
Griffith: To thee who knowest, Agni, thou Disposer, all these wise secret speeches have I uttered,
Devanāgarī: एता विश्वा विदुषे तुभ्यं वेधो नीथान्यग्ने निण्या वचांसि
pada pāṭha: etā | viśvā | viduṣe | tubhyam | vedhaḥ | nīthāni | agne | niṇyā | vacāṁsi || ni-vacanā | kavaye | kāvyāni | aśaṁsiṣam | mati-bhiḥ | vipraḥ | ukthaiḥ ||4.3.16||

IAST: nivacanā kavaye kāvyāny aśaṁsiṣam matibhir vipra ukthaiḥ
Griffith: Sung to thee, Sage, the charming words of wisdom, to thee, O Singer, with. my thoughts and Praises.
Devanāgarī: निवचना कवये काव्यान्यशंसिषं मतिभिर्विप्र उक्थैः
pada pāṭha: etā | viśvā | viduṣe | tubhyam | vedhaḥ | nīthāni | agne | niṇyā | vacāṁsi || ni-vacanā | kavaye | kāvyāni | aśaṁsiṣam | mati-bhiḥ | vipraḥ | ukthaiḥ ||4.3.16||

IAST: kṛṇuṣva pājaḥ prasitiṁ na pṛthvīṁ yāhi rājevāmavām̐ ibhena
Griffith: PUT forth like a wide-spreading net thy vigour; go like a mighty King with his attendants.
Devanāgarī: कृणुष्व पाजः प्रसितिं न पृथ्वीं याहि राजेवामवाँ इभेन
pada pāṭha: kr̥ṇuṣva | pājaḥ | pra-sitim | na | pr̥thvīm | yāhi | rājā-iva | ama-vān | ibhena || tr̥ṣvīm | anu | pra-sitim | drūṇānaḥ | astā | asi | vidhya | rakṣasaḥ | tapiṣṭhaiḥ ||4.4.1||

IAST: tṛṣvīm anu prasitiṁ drūṇāno 'stāsi vidhya rakṣasas tapiṣṭhaiḥ
Griffith: Thou, following thy swift net, shootest arrows: transfix the fiends with darts that burn most fiercely.
Devanāgarī: तृष्वीमनु प्रसितिं द्रूणानोऽस्तासि विध्य रक्षसस्तपिष्ठैः
pada pāṭha: kr̥ṇuṣva | pājaḥ | pra-sitim | na | pr̥thvīm | yāhi | rājā-iva | ama-vān | ibhena || tr̥ṣvīm | anu | pra-sitim | drūṇānaḥ | astā | asi | vidhya | rakṣasaḥ | tapiṣṭhaiḥ ||4.4.1||

IAST: tava bhramāsa āśuyā patanty anu spṛśa dhṛṣatā śośucānaḥ
Griffith: Forth go in rapid flight thy whirling weapons: follow them closely, glowing in thy fury.
Devanāgarī: तव भ्रमास आशुया पतन्त्यनु स्पृश धृषता शोशुचानः
pada pāṭha: tava | bhramāsaḥ | āśu-yā | patanti | anu | spr̥śa | dhr̥ṣatā | śośucānaḥ || tapūṁṣi | agne | juhvā | pataṅgān | asam-ditaḥ | vi | sr̥ja | viṣvak | ulkāḥ ||4.4.2||

IAST: tapūṁṣy agne juhvā pataṁgān asaṁdito vi sṛja viṣvag ulkāḥ
Griffith: Spread with thy tongue the winged flames, O Agni; unfettered, cast thy firebrands all around thee.
Devanāgarī: तपूंष्यग्ने जुह्वा पतंगानसंदितो वि सृज विष्वगुल्काः
pada pāṭha: tava | bhramāsaḥ | āśu-yā | patanti | anu | spr̥śa | dhr̥ṣatā | śośucānaḥ || tapūṁṣi | agne | juhvā | pataṅgān | asam-ditaḥ | vi | sr̥ja | viṣvak | ulkāḥ ||4.4.2||

IAST: prati spaśo vi sṛja tūrṇitamo bhavā pāyur viśo asyā adabdhaḥ
Griffith: Send thy spies forward, flectest in thy motion; be, ne'er deceived, the guardian of this people
Devanāgarī: प्रति स्पशो वि सृज तूर्णितमो भवा पायुर्विशो अस्या अदब्धः
pada pāṭha: prati | spaśaḥ | vi | sr̥ja | tūrṇi-tamaḥ | bhava | pāyuḥ | viśaḥ | asyāḥ | adabdhaḥ || yaḥ | naḥ | dūre | agha-śaṁsaḥ | yaḥ | anti | agne | mākiḥ | te | vyathiḥ | ā | dadharṣīt ||4.4.3||

IAST: yo no dūre aghaśaṁso yo anty agne mākiṣ ṭe vyathir ā dadharṣīt
Griffith: From him who, near or far, is bent on evil, and let no trouble sent from thee o'ercome us.
Devanāgarī: यो नो दूरे अघशंसो यो अन्त्यग्ने माकिष्टे व्यथिरा दधर्षीत्
pada pāṭha: prati | spaśaḥ | vi | sr̥ja | tūrṇi-tamaḥ | bhava | pāyuḥ | viśaḥ | asyāḥ | adabdhaḥ || yaḥ | naḥ | dūre | agha-śaṁsaḥ | yaḥ | anti | agne | mākiḥ | te | vyathiḥ | ā | dadharṣīt ||4.4.3||

IAST: ud agne tiṣṭha praty ā tanuṣva ny amitrām̐ oṣatāt tigmahete
Griffith: Rise up, O Agni, spread thee out before us: burn down our foes, thou who hast sharpened arrows.
Devanāgarī: उदग्ने तिष्ठ प्रत्या तनुष्व न्यमित्राँ ओषतात्तिग्महेते
pada pāṭha: ut | agne | tiṣṭha | prati | ā | tanuṣva | ni | amitrān | oṣatāt | tigma-hete || yaḥ | naḥ | arātim | sam-idhāna | cakre | nīcā | tam | dhakṣi | atasam | na | śuṣkam ||4.4.4||

IAST: yo no arātiṁ samidhāna cakre nīcā taṁ dhakṣy atasaṁ na śuṣkam
Griffith: Him, blazing Agni! who hath worked us mischief, consume thou utterly like dried-up stubble.
Devanāgarī: यो नो अरातिं समिधान चक्रे नीचा तं धक्ष्यतसं न शुष्कम्
pada pāṭha: ut | agne | tiṣṭha | prati | ā | tanuṣva | ni | amitrān | oṣatāt | tigma-hete || yaḥ | naḥ | arātim | sam-idhāna | cakre | nīcā | tam | dhakṣi | atasam | na | śuṣkam ||4.4.4||

IAST: ūrdhvo bhava prati vidhyādhy asmad āviṣ kṛṇuṣva daivyāny agne
Griffith: Rise, Agni, drive off those who fight against us: make manifest thine own celestial vigour.
Devanāgarī: ऊर्ध्वो भव प्रति विध्याध्यस्मदाविष्कृणुष्व दैव्यान्यग्ने
pada pāṭha: ūrdhvaḥ | bhava | prati | vidhya | adhi | asmat | āviḥ | kr̥ṇuṣva | daivyāni | agne || ava | sthirā | tanuhi | yātu-jūnām | jāmim | ajāmim | pra | mr̥ṇīhi | śatrūn ||4.4.5||

IAST: ava sthirā tanuhi yātujūnāṁ jāmim ajāmim pra mṛṇīhi śatrūn
Griffith: Slacken the strong bows of the demondriven: destroy our foemen whether kin or stranger.
Devanāgarī: अव स्थिरा तनुहि यातुजूनां जामिमजामिं प्र मृणीहि शत्रून्
pada pāṭha: ūrdhvaḥ | bhava | prati | vidhya | adhi | asmat | āviḥ | kr̥ṇuṣva | daivyāni | agne || ava | sthirā | tanuhi | yātu-jūnām | jāmim | ajāmim | pra | mr̥ṇīhi | śatrūn ||4.4.5||

IAST: sa te jānāti sumatiṁ yaviṣṭha ya īvate brahmaṇe gātum airat
Griffith: Most Youthful God, he knoweth well thy favour who gave an impulse to this high devotion.
Devanāgarī: स ते जानाति सुमतिं यविष्ठ य ईवते ब्रह्मणे गातुमैरत्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | te | jānāti | su-matim | yaviṣṭha | yaḥ | īvate | brahmaṇe | gātum | airat || viśvāni | asmai | su-dināni | rāyaḥ | dyumnāni | aryaḥ | vi | duraḥ | abhi | dyaut ||4.4.6||

IAST: viśvāny asmai sudināni rāyo dyumnāny aryo vi duro abhi dyaut
Griffith: All fair days and magnificence of riches hast thou beamed forth upon the good man's portals.
Devanāgarī: विश्वान्यस्मै सुदिनानि रायो द्युम्नान्यर्यो वि दुरो अभि द्यौत्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | te | jānāti | su-matim | yaviṣṭha | yaḥ | īvate | brahmaṇe | gātum | airat || viśvāni | asmai | su-dināni | rāyaḥ | dyumnāni | aryaḥ | vi | duraḥ | abhi | dyaut ||4.4.6||

IAST: sed agne astu subhagaḥ sudānur yas tvā nityena haviṣā ya ukthaiḥ
Griffith: Blest, Agni, be the man, the liberal giver, who with his lauds and regular oblation
Devanāgarī: सेदग्ने अस्तु सुभगः सुदानुर्यस्त्वा नित्येन हविषा य उक्थैः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | it | agne | astu | su-bhagaḥ | su-dānuḥ | yaḥ | tvā | nityena | haviṣā | yaḥ | ukthaiḥ || piprīṣati | sve | āyuṣi | duroṇe | viśvā | it | asmai | su-dinā | sā | asat | iṣṭiḥ ||4.4.7||

IAST: piprīṣati sva āyuṣi duroṇe viśved asmai sudinā sāsad iṣṭiḥ
Griffith: Is fain to please thee for his life and dwelling. May all his days be bright: be this his longing.
Devanāgarī: पिप्रीषति स्व आयुषि दुरोणे विश्वेदस्मै सुदिना सासदिष्टिः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | it | agne | astu | su-bhagaḥ | su-dānuḥ | yaḥ | tvā | nityena | haviṣā | yaḥ | ukthaiḥ || piprīṣati | sve | āyuṣi | duroṇe | viśvā | it | asmai | su-dinā | sā | asat | iṣṭiḥ ||4.4.7||

IAST: arcāmi te sumatiṁ ghoṣy arvāk saṁ te vāvātā jaratām iyaṁ gīḥ
Griffith: I praise thy gracious favour: sing in answer. May this my song sing like a loved one with thee.
Devanāgarī: अर्चामि ते सुमतिं घोष्यर्वाक्सं ते वावाता जरतामियं गीः
pada pāṭha: arcāmi | te | su-matim | ghoṣi | arvāk | sam | te | vavātā | jaratām | iyam | gīḥ || su-aśvāḥ | tvā | su-rathāḥ | marjayema | asme iti | kṣatrāṇi | dhārayeḥ | anu | dyūn ||4.4.8||

IAST: svaśvās tvā surathā marjayemāsme kṣatrāṇi dhārayer anu dyūn
Griffith: Lords of good steeds and cars may we adorn thee, and day by day vouchsafe thou us dominion.
Devanāgarī: स्वश्वास्त्वा सुरथा मर्जयेमास्मे क्षत्राणि धारयेरनु द्यून्
pada pāṭha: arcāmi | te | su-matim | ghoṣi | arvāk | sam | te | vavātā | jaratām | iyam | gīḥ || su-aśvāḥ | tvā | su-rathāḥ | marjayema | asme iti | kṣatrāṇi | dhārayeḥ | anu | dyūn ||4.4.8||

IAST: iha tvā bhūry ā cared upa tman doṣāvastar dīdivāṁsam anu dyūn
Griffith: Here of free choice let each one serve thee richly, resplendent day by day at eve and morning.
Devanāgarī: इह त्वा भूर्या चरेदुप त्मन्दोषावस्तर्दीदिवांसमनु द्यून्
pada pāṭha: iha | tvā | bhūri | ā | caret | upa | tman | doṣā-vastaḥ | dīdi-vāṁsam | anu | dyūn || krīḷantaḥ | tvā | su-manasaḥ | sapema | abhi | dyumnā | tasthi-vāṁsaḥ | janānām ||4.4.9||

IAST: krīḻantas tvā sumanasaḥ sapemābhi dyumnā tasthivāṁso janānām
Griffith: So may we honour thee, content and joyous, passing beyond the glories of the people.
Devanāgarī: क्रीळन्तस्त्वा सुमनसः सपेमाभि द्युम्ना तस्थिवांसो जनानाम्
pada pāṭha: iha | tvā | bhūri | ā | caret | upa | tman | doṣā-vastaḥ | dīdi-vāṁsam | anu | dyūn || krīḷantaḥ | tvā | su-manasaḥ | sapema | abhi | dyumnā | tasthi-vāṁsaḥ | janānām ||4.4.9||

IAST: yas tvā svaśvaḥ suhiraṇyo agna upayāti vasumatā rathena
Griffith: Whoso with good steeds and fine gold, O Agni, comes nigh thee on a car laden with trcasure,
Devanāgarī: यस्त्वा स्वश्वः सुहिरण्यो अग्न उपयाति वसुमता रथेन
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | tvā | su-aśvaḥ | su-hiraṇyaḥ | agne | upa-yāti | vasu-matā | rathena || tasya | trātā | bhavasi | tasya | sakhā | yaḥ | te | ātithyam | ānuṣak | jujoṣat ||4.4.10||

IAST: tasya trātā bhavasi tasya sakhā yas ta ātithyam ānuṣag jujoṣat
Griffith: His Friend art thou, yea, thou art his Protector whose joy it is to entertain thee duly.
Devanāgarī: तस्य त्राता भवसि तस्य सखा यस्त आतिथ्यमानुषग्जुजोषत्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | tvā | su-aśvaḥ | su-hiraṇyaḥ | agne | upa-yāti | vasu-matā | rathena || tasya | trātā | bhavasi | tasya | sakhā | yaḥ | te | ātithyam | ānuṣak | jujoṣat ||4.4.10||

IAST: maho rujāmi bandhutā vacobhis tan mā pitur gotamād anv iyāya
Griffith: Through words and kinship I destroy the miglity: this power I have from Gotama my father.
Devanāgarī: महो रुजामि बन्धुता वचोभिस्तन्मा पितुर्गोतमादन्वियाय
pada pāṭha: mahaḥ | rujāmi | bandhutā | vacaḥ-bhiḥ | tat | mā | pituḥ | gotamāt | anu | iyāya || tvam | naḥ | asya | vacasaḥ | cikiddhi | hotaḥ | yaviṣṭha | sukrato iti su-krato | damūnāḥ ||4.4.11||

IAST: tvaṁ no asya vacasaś cikiddhi hotar yaviṣṭha sukrato damūnāḥ
Griffith: Mark thou this speech of ours, O thou Most Youthful, Friend of the House, exceeding wise, Invoker.
Devanāgarī: त्वं नो अस्य वचसश्चिकिद्धि होतर्यविष्ठ सुक्रतो दमूनाः
pada pāṭha: mahaḥ | rujāmi | bandhutā | vacaḥ-bhiḥ | tat | mā | pituḥ | gotamāt | anu | iyāya || tvam | naḥ | asya | vacasaḥ | cikiddhi | hotaḥ | yaviṣṭha | sukrato iti su-krato | damūnāḥ ||4.4.11||

IAST: asvapnajas taraṇayaḥ suśevā atandrāso 'vṛkā aśramiṣṭhāḥ
Griffith: Knowing no slumber, speedy and propitious, alert and ever friendly, most unwearied,
Devanāgarī: अस्वप्नजस्तरणयः सुशेवा अतन्द्रासोऽवृका अश्रमिष्ठाः
pada pāṭha: asvapna-jaḥ | taraṇayaḥ | su-śevāḥ | atandrāsaḥ | avr̥kāḥ | aśramiṣṭhāḥ || te | pāyavaḥ | sadhryañcaḥ | ni-sadya | agne | tava | naḥ | pāntu | amūra ||4.4.12||

IAST: te pāyavaḥ sadhryañco niṣadyāgne tava naḥ pāntv amūra
Griffith: May thy protecting powers, unerring Agni, taking their places here, combined, preserve us.
Devanāgarī: ते पायवः सध्र्यञ्चो निषद्याग्ने तव नः पान्त्वमूर
pada pāṭha: asvapna-jaḥ | taraṇayaḥ | su-śevāḥ | atandrāsaḥ | avr̥kāḥ | aśramiṣṭhāḥ || te | pāyavaḥ | sadhryañcaḥ | ni-sadya | agne | tava | naḥ | pāntu | amūra ||4.4.12||

IAST: ye pāyavo māmateyaṁ te agne paśyanto andhaṁ duritād arakṣan
Griffith: Thy guardian rays, O Agni, when they saw him, preserved blind Mamateya from affliction.
Devanāgarī: ये पायवो मामतेयं ते अग्ने पश्यन्तो अन्धं दुरितादरक्षन्
pada pāṭha: ye | pāyavaḥ | māmateyam | te | agne | paśyantaḥ | andham | duḥ-itāt | arakṣan || rarakṣa | tān | su-kr̥taḥ | viśva-vedāḥ | dipsantaḥ | it | ripavaḥ | na | aha | debhuḥ ||4.4.13||

IAST: rarakṣa tān sukṛto viśvavedā dipsanta id ripavo nāha debhuḥ
Griffith: Lord of all riches, he preserved the pious: the fees who fain would harm them did no mischief
Devanāgarī: ररक्ष तान्सुकृतो विश्ववेदा दिप्सन्त इद्रिपवो नाह देभुः
pada pāṭha: ye | pāyavaḥ | māmateyam | te | agne | paśyantaḥ | andham | duḥ-itāt | arakṣan || rarakṣa | tān | su-kr̥taḥ | viśva-vedāḥ | dipsantaḥ | it | ripavaḥ | na | aha | debhuḥ ||4.4.13||

IAST: tvayā vayaṁ sadhanyas tvotās tava praṇīty aśyāma vājān
Griffith: Aided by thee with thee may we be wealthy, may we gain strength with thee to guide us onward.
Devanāgarī: त्वया वयं सधन्यस्त्वोतास्तव प्रणीत्यश्याम वाजान्
pada pāṭha: tvayā | vayam | sa-dhanyaḥ | tvā-ūtāḥ | tava | pra-nītī | aśyāma | vājān || ubhā | śaṁsā | sūdaya | satya-tāte | anuṣṭhuyā | kr̥ṇuhi | ahrayāṇa ||4.4.14||

IAST: ubhā śaṁsā sūdaya satyatāte 'nuṣṭhuyā kṛṇuhy ahrayāṇa
Griffith: Fulfil the words of both, O Ever Truthful: straightway do this, thou God whom power emboldens.
Devanāgarī: उभा शंसा सूदय सत्यतातेऽनुष्ठुया कृणुह्यह्रयाण
pada pāṭha: tvayā | vayam | sa-dhanyaḥ | tvā-ūtāḥ | tava | pra-nītī | aśyāma | vājān || ubhā | śaṁsā | sūdaya | satya-tāte | anuṣṭhuyā | kr̥ṇuhi | ahrayāṇa ||4.4.14||

IAST: ayā te agne samidhā vidhema prati stomaṁ śasyamānaṁ gṛbhāya
Griffith: O Agni, with this fuel will we serve thee; accept the laud we sing to thee with favour
Devanāgarī: अया ते अग्ने समिधा विधेम प्रति स्तोमं शस्यमानं गृभाय
pada pāṭha: ayā | te | agne | sam-idhā | vidhema | prati | stomam | śasyamānam | gr̥bhāya || daha | aśasaḥ | rakṣasaḥ | pāhi | asmān | druhaḥ | nidaḥ | mitra-mahaḥ | avadyāt ||4.4.15||

IAST: dahāśaso rakṣasaḥ pāhy asmān druho nido mitramaho avadyāt
Griffith: Destroy the cursing Raksasas: preserve us, O rich in friends, from guile and scorn and slander.
Devanāgarī: दहाशसो रक्षसः पाह्यस्मान्द्रुहो निदो मित्रमहो अवद्यात्
pada pāṭha: ayā | te | agne | sam-idhā | vidhema | prati | stomam | śasyamānam | gr̥bhāya || daha | aśasaḥ | rakṣasaḥ | pāhi | asmān | druhaḥ | nidaḥ | mitra-mahaḥ | avadyāt ||4.4.15||

IAST: vaiśvānarāya mīḻhuṣe sajoṣāḥ kathā dāśemāgnaye bṛhad bhāḥ
Griffith: How shall we give with one accord oblation to Agni, to Vaisvanara the Bounteous?
Devanāgarī: वैश्वानराय मीळ्हुषे सजोषाः कथा दाशेमाग्नये बृहद्भाः
pada pāṭha: vaiśvānarāya | mīḷhuṣe | sa-joṣāḥ | kathā | dāśema | agnaye | br̥hat | bhāḥ || anūnena | br̥hatā | vakṣathena | upa | stabhāyat | upa-mit | na | rodhaḥ ||4.5.1||

IAST: anūnena bṛhatā vakṣathenopa stabhāyad upamin na rodhaḥ
Griffith: Great light, with full high growth hath he uplifted, and, as a pillar bears the roof, sustains it.
Devanāgarī: अनूनेन बृहता वक्षथेनोप स्तभायदुपमिन्न रोधः
pada pāṭha: vaiśvānarāya | mīḷhuṣe | sa-joṣāḥ | kathā | dāśema | agnaye | br̥hat | bhāḥ || anūnena | br̥hatā | vakṣathena | upa | stabhāyat | upa-mit | na | rodhaḥ ||4.5.1||

IAST: mā nindata ya imām mahyaṁ rātiṁ devo dadau martyāya svadhāvān
Griffith: Reproach not him who, God and selfreliant, vouchsafed this bounty unto me a mortal,-
Devanāgarī: मा निन्दत य इमां मह्यं रातिं देवो ददौ मर्त्याय स्वधावान्
pada pāṭha: mā | nindata | yaḥ | imām | mahyam | rātim | devaḥ | dadau | maryāya | svadhā-vān || pākāya | gr̥tsaḥ | amr̥taḥ | vi-cetāḥ | vaiśvānaraḥ | nr̥-tamaḥ | yahvaḥ | agniḥ ||4.5.2||

IAST: pākāya gṛtso amṛto vicetā vaiśvānaro nṛtamo yahvo agniḥ
Griffith: Deathless, discerner, wise, to me the simple, Vaisvanara most manly, youthful Aini.
Devanāgarī: पाकाय गृत्सो अमृतो विचेता वैश्वानरो नृतमो यह्वो अग्निः
pada pāṭha: mā | nindata | yaḥ | imām | mahyam | rātim | devaḥ | dadau | maryāya | svadhā-vān || pākāya | gr̥tsaḥ | amr̥taḥ | vi-cetāḥ | vaiśvānaraḥ | nr̥-tamaḥ | yahvaḥ | agniḥ ||4.5.2||

IAST: sāma dvibarhā mahi tigmabhṛṣṭiḥ sahasraretā vṛṣabhas tuviṣmān
Griffith: Sharp-pointed, powerful, strong, of boundless vigour, Agni who knows the lofty hymn, kept secret
Devanāgarī: साम द्विबर्हा महि तिग्मभृष्टिः सहस्ररेता वृषभस्तुविष्मान्
pada pāṭha: sāma | dvi-barhāḥ | mahi | tigma-bhr̥ṣṭiḥ | sahasra-retāḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | tuviṣmān || padam | na | goḥ | apa-gūḷham | vividvān | agniḥ | mahyam | pra | it | ūm̐ iti | vocat | manīṣām ||4.5.3||

IAST: padaṁ na gor apagūḻhaṁ vividvān agnir mahyam pred u vocan manīṣām
Griffith: As the lost milch-cow's track, the doubly Mighty,-he hath declared to me this hidden knowledge.
Devanāgarī: पदं न गोरपगूळ्हं विविद्वानग्निर्मह्यं प्रेदु वोचन्मनीषाम्
pada pāṭha: sāma | dvi-barhāḥ | mahi | tigma-bhr̥ṣṭiḥ | sahasra-retāḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | tuviṣmān || padam | na | goḥ | apa-gūḷham | vividvān | agniḥ | mahyam | pra | it | ūm̐ iti | vocat | manīṣām ||4.5.3||

IAST: pra tām̐ agnir babhasat tigmajambhas tapiṣṭhena śociṣā yaḥ surādhāḥ
Griffith: May he with sharpened teeth, the Bounteous Giver, Agni, consume with flame most fiercely glowing.
Devanāgarī: प्र ताँ अग्निर्बभसत्तिग्मजम्भस्तपिष्ठेन शोचिषा यः सुराधाः
pada pāṭha: pra | tān | agniḥ | babhasat | tigma-jambhaḥ | tapiṣṭhena | śociṣā | yaḥ | su-rādhāḥ || pra | ye | minanti | varuṇasya | dhāma | priyā | mitrasya | cetataḥ | dhruvāṇi ||4.5.4||

IAST: pra ye minanti varuṇasya dhāma priyā mitrasya cetato dhruvāṇi
Griffith: Those who regard not Varuna's commandments and the dear stedfast laws of sapient Mitra.
Devanāgarī: प्र ये मिनन्ति वरुणस्य धाम प्रिया मित्रस्य चेततो ध्रुवाणि
pada pāṭha: pra | tān | agniḥ | babhasat | tigma-jambhaḥ | tapiṣṭhena | śociṣā | yaḥ | su-rādhāḥ || pra | ye | minanti | varuṇasya | dhāma | priyā | mitrasya | cetataḥ | dhruvāṇi ||4.5.4||

IAST: abhrātaro na yoṣaṇo vyantaḥ patiripo na janayo durevāḥ
Griffith: Like youthful women without brothers, straying, like dames who hate their lords, of evil conduct,
Devanāgarī: अभ्रातरो न योषणो व्यन्तः पतिरिपो न जनयो दुरेवाः
pada pāṭha: abhrātaraḥ | na | yoṣaṇaḥ | vyantaḥ | pati-ripaḥ | na | janayaḥ | duḥ-evāḥ || pāpāsaḥ | santaḥ | anr̥tāḥ | asatyāḥ | idam | padam | ajanata | gabhīram ||4.5.5||

IAST: pāpāsaḥ santo anṛtā asatyā idam padam ajanatā gabhīram
Griffith: They who are full of sin, untrue, unfaithful, they have engendered this abysmal station.
Devanāgarī: पापासः सन्तो अनृता असत्या इदं पदमजनता गभीरम्
pada pāṭha: abhrātaraḥ | na | yoṣaṇaḥ | vyantaḥ | pati-ripaḥ | na | janayaḥ | duḥ-evāḥ || pāpāsaḥ | santaḥ | anr̥tāḥ | asatyāḥ | idam | padam | ajanata | gabhīram ||4.5.5||

IAST: idam me agne kiyate pāvakāminate gurum bhāraṁ na manma
Griffith: To me, weak, innocent, thou, luminous Agni, bast boldly given as 'twere a heavy burthen,
Devanāgarī: इदं मे अग्ने कियते पावकामिनते गुरुं भारं न मन्म
pada pāṭha: idam | me | agne | kiyate | pāvaka | aminate | gurum | bhāram | na | manma || br̥hat | dadhātha | dhr̥ṣatā | gabhīram | yahvam | pr̥ṣṭham | prayasā | sapta-dhātu ||4.5.6||

IAST: bṛhad dadhātha dhṛṣatā gabhīraṁ yahvam pṛṣṭham prayasā saptadhātu
Griffith: This Prstha hymn, profound and strong and mighty, of seven elements, and with offered dainties.
Devanāgarī: बृहद्दधाथ धृषता गभीरं यह्वं पृष्ठं प्रयसा सप्तधातु
pada pāṭha: idam | me | agne | kiyate | pāvaka | aminate | gurum | bhāram | na | manma || br̥hat | dadhātha | dhr̥ṣatā | gabhīram | yahvam | pr̥ṣṭham | prayasā | sapta-dhātu ||4.5.6||

IAST: tam in nv eva samanā samānam abhi kratvā punatī dhītir aśyāḥ
Griffith: So may our song that purifies, through wisdom reach in a moment him the Universal,
Devanāgarī: तमिन्न्वेव समना समानमभि क्रत्वा पुनती धीतिरश्याः
pada pāṭha: tam | it | nu | eva | samanā | samānam | abhi | kratvā | punatī | dhītiḥ | aśyāḥ || sasasya | carman | adhi | cāru | pr̥śneḥ | agne | rupaḥ | arupitam | jabāru ||4.5.7||

IAST: sasasya carmann adhi cāru pṛśner agre rupa ārupitaṁ jabāru
Griffith: Established on the height, on earth's best .station, above the beauteous grassy skin of Prsni.
Devanāgarī: ससस्य चर्मन्नधि चारु पृश्नेरग्रे रुप आरुपितं जबारु
pada pāṭha: tam | it | nu | eva | samanā | samānam | abhi | kratvā | punatī | dhītiḥ | aśyāḥ || sasasya | carman | adhi | cāru | pr̥śneḥ | agne | rupaḥ | arupitam | jabāru ||4.5.7||

IAST: pravācyaṁ vacasaḥ kim me asya guhā hitam upa niṇig vadanti
Griffith: Of this my speech what shall I utter further? They indicate the milk stored up in secret
Devanāgarī: प्रवाच्यं वचसः किं मे अस्य गुहा हितमुप निणिग्वदन्ति
pada pāṭha: pra-vācyam | vacasaḥ | kim | me | asya | guhā | hitam | upa | niṇik | vadanti || yat | usriyāṇām | apa | vāḥ-iva | vran | pāti | priyam | rupaḥ | agram | padam | veriti veḥ ||4.5.8||

IAST: yad usriyāṇām apa vār iva vran pāti priyaṁ rupo agram padaṁ veḥ
Griffith: When they have thrown as 'twere the cows' stalls open. The Bird protects earths' best and well-loved station.
Devanāgarī: यदुस्रियाणामप वारिव व्रन्पाति प्रियं रुपो अग्रं पदं वेः
pada pāṭha: pra-vācyam | vacasaḥ | kim | me | asya | guhā | hitam | upa | niṇik | vadanti || yat | usriyāṇām | apa | vāḥ-iva | vran | pāti | priyam | rupaḥ | agram | padam | veriti veḥ ||4.5.8||

IAST: idam u tyan mahi mahām anīkaṁ yad usriyā sacata pūrvyaṁ gauḥ
Griffith: This is the Great Ones' mighty apparition which from of old the radiant Cow hath followed.
Devanāgarī: इदमु त्यन्महि महामनीकं यदुस्रिया सचत पूर्व्यं गौः
pada pāṭha: idam | ūm̐ iti | tyat | mahi | mahām | anīkam | yat | usriyā | sacata | pūrvyam | gauḥ || r̥tasya | pade | adhi | dīdyānam | guhā | raghu-syat | raghu-yat | viveda ||4.5.9||

IAST: ṛtasya pade adhi dīdyānaṁ guhā raghuṣyad raghuyad viveda
Griffith: This, shining brightly in the place of Order, swift, hasting on in secret, she discovered.
Devanāgarī: ऋतस्य पदे अधि दीद्यानं गुहा रघुष्यद्रघुयद्विवेद
pada pāṭha: idam | ūm̐ iti | tyat | mahi | mahām | anīkam | yat | usriyā | sacata | pūrvyam | gauḥ || r̥tasya | pade | adhi | dīdyānam | guhā | raghu-syat | raghu-yat | viveda ||4.5.9||

IAST: adha dyutānaḥ pitroḥ sacāsāmanuta guhyaṁ cāru pṛśneḥ
Griffith: He then who shone together with his Parents remembered Prsni's fair and secret treasure,
Devanāgarī: अध द्युतानः पित्रोः सचासामनुत गुह्यं चारु पृश्नेः
pada pāṭha: adha | dyutānaḥ | pitroḥ | sacā | āsā | amanuta | guhyam | cāru | pr̥śneḥ || mātuḥ | pade | parame | anti | sat | goḥ | vr̥ṣṇaḥ | śociṣaḥ | pra-yatasya | jihvā ||4.5.10||

IAST: mātuṣ pade parame anti ṣad gor vṛṣṇaḥ śociṣaḥ prayatasya jihvā
Griffith: Which, in the Mother Cow's most lofty station, the Bull's tongue, of the flame bent forward, tasted.
Devanāgarī: मातुष्पदे परमे अन्ति षद्गोर्वृष्णः शोचिषः प्रयतस्य जिह्वा
pada pāṭha: adha | dyutānaḥ | pitroḥ | sacā | āsā | amanuta | guhyam | cāru | pr̥śneḥ || mātuḥ | pade | parame | anti | sat | goḥ | vr̥ṣṇaḥ | śociṣaḥ | pra-yatasya | jihvā ||4.5.10||

IAST: ṛtaṁ voce namasā pṛcchyamānas tavāśasā jātavedo yadīdam
Griffith: With reverence I declare the Law, O Agni; what is, comes by thine order, Jatavedas.
Devanāgarī: ऋतं वोचे नमसा पृच्छ्यमानस्तवाशसा जातवेदो यदीदम्
pada pāṭha: r̥tam | voce | namasā | pr̥cchyamānaḥ | tava | ā-śasā | jāta-vedaḥ | yadi | idam || tvam | asya | kṣayasi | yat | ha | viśvam | divi | Yat | ūm̐ iti | draviṇam | yat | pr̥thivyām ||4.5.11||

IAST: tvam asya kṣayasi yad dha viśvaṁ divi yad u draviṇaṁ yat pṛthivyām
Griffith: Of this, whate'er it be, thou art the Sovran, yea, all the wealth that is in earth or heaven.
Devanāgarī: त्वमस्य क्षयसि यद्ध विश्वं दिवि यदु द्रविणं यत्पृथिव्याम्
pada pāṭha: r̥tam | voce | namasā | pr̥cchyamānaḥ | tava | ā-śasā | jāta-vedaḥ | yadi | idam || tvam | asya | kṣayasi | yat | ha | viśvam | divi | Yat | ūm̐ iti | draviṇam | yat | pr̥thivyām ||4.5.11||

IAST: kiṁ no asya draviṇaṁ kad dha ratnaṁ vi no voco jātavedaś cikitvān
Griffith: What is our wealth therefrom, and what our treasure? Tell us O Jatavedas, for thou knowest,
Devanāgarī: किं नो अस्य द्रविणं कद्ध रत्नं वि नो वोचो जातवेदश्चिकित्वान्
pada pāṭha: kim | naḥ | asya | draviṇam | kat | ha | ratnam | vi | naḥ | vocaḥ | jāta-vedaḥ | cikitvān || guhā | adhvanaḥ | paramam | yat | naḥ | asya | reku | padam | na | nidānāḥ | aganma ||4.5.12||

IAST: guhādhvanaḥ paramaṁ yan no asya reku padaṁ na nidānā aganma
Griffith: What is our best course in this secret passage: we, unreproached, have reached a t)lace far distant.
Devanāgarī: गुहाध्वनः परमं यन्नो अस्य रेकु पदं न निदाना अगन्म
pada pāṭha: kim | naḥ | asya | draviṇam | kat | ha | ratnam | vi | naḥ | vocaḥ | jāta-vedaḥ | cikitvān || guhā | adhvanaḥ | paramam | yat | naḥ | asya | reku | padam | na | nidānāḥ | aganma ||4.5.12||

IAST: kā maryādā vayunā kad dha vāmam acchā gamema raghavo na vājam
Griffith: What is the limit, what the rules, the guerdon? Like fleet-foot coursers speed we to the contest.
Devanāgarī: का मर्यादा वयुना कद्ध वाममच्छा गमेम रघवो न वाजम्
pada pāṭha: kā | maryādā | vayunā | kat | ha | vāmam | accha | gamema | raghavaḥ | na | vājam || kadā | naḥ | devīḥ | amr̥tasya | patnīḥ | sūraḥ | varṇena | tatanan | uṣasaḥ ||4.5.13||

IAST: kadā no devīr amṛtasya patnīḥ sūro varṇena tatanann uṣāsaḥ
Griffith: When will the Goddesses, the Immortal's Spouses, the Dawns, spread over us the Sun-God's splendour?
Devanāgarī: कदा नो देवीरमृतस्य पत्नीः सूरो वर्णेन ततनन्नुषासः
pada pāṭha: kā | maryādā | vayunā | kat | ha | vāmam | accha | gamema | raghavaḥ | na | vājam || kadā | naḥ | devīḥ | amr̥tasya | patnīḥ | sūraḥ | varṇena | tatanan | uṣasaḥ ||4.5.13||

IAST: anireṇa vacasā phalgvena pratītyena kṛdhunātṛpāsaḥ
Griffith: Unsatisfied, with speech devoid of vigour, scanty and frivolous and inconclusive,
Devanāgarī: अनिरेण वचसा फल्ग्वेन प्रतीत्येन कृधुनातृपासः
pada pāṭha: anireṇa | vacasā | phalgvena | pratītyena | kr̥dhunā | atr̥pāsaḥ || adha | te | agne | kim | iha | vadanti | anāyudhāsaḥ | āsatā | sacantām ||4.5.14||

IAST: adhā te agne kim ihā vadanty anāyudhāsa āsatā sacantām
Griffith: Wherefore do they address thee here, O Agni? Let these who have no weapons suffer sorrow.
Devanāgarī: अधा ते अग्ने किमिहा वदन्त्यनायुधास आसता सचन्ताम्
pada pāṭha: anireṇa | vacasā | phalgvena | pratītyena | kr̥dhunā | atr̥pāsaḥ || adha | te | agne | kim | iha | vadanti | anāyudhāsaḥ | āsatā | sacantām ||4.5.14||

IAST: asya śriye samidhānasya vṛṣṇo vasor anīkaṁ dama ā ruroca
Griffith: The majesty of him the Good, the Mighty, aflame, hath shone for glory in the dwelling.
Devanāgarī: अस्य श्रिये समिधानस्य वृष्णो वसोरनीकं दम आ रुरोच
pada pāṭha: asya | śriye | sam-idhānasya | vr̥ṣṇaḥ | vasoḥ | anīkam | dame | ā | ruroca || ruśat | vasānaḥ | sudr̥śīka-rūpaḥ | kṣitiḥ | na | rāyā | puru-vāraḥ | adyaut ||4.5.15||

IAST: ruśad vasānaḥ sudṛśīkarūpaḥ kṣitir na rāyā puruvāro adyaut
Griffith: He, clothed in light, hath shone most fair to look on, wealthy in boons, as a home shines with riches.
Devanāgarī: रुशद्वसानः सुदृशीकरूपः क्षितिर्न राया पुरुवारो अद्यौत्
pada pāṭha: asya | śriye | sam-idhānasya | vr̥ṣṇaḥ | vasoḥ | anīkam | dame | ā | ruroca || ruśat | vasānaḥ | sudr̥śīka-rūpaḥ | kṣitiḥ | na | rāyā | puru-vāraḥ | adyaut ||4.5.15||

IAST: ūrdhva ū ṣu ṇo adhvarasya hotar agne tiṣṭha devatātā yajīyān
Griffith: PRIEST of our rite, stand up erect, O Agni, in the Gods' service best of sacrificers,
Devanāgarī: ऊर्ध्व ऊ षु णो अध्वरस्य होतरग्ने तिष्ठ देवताता यजीयान्
pada pāṭha: ūrdhvaḥ | ūm̐ iti | su | naḥ | adhvarasya | hotaḥ | agne | tiṣṭha | deva-tātā | yajīyān || tvam | hi | viśvam | abhi | asi | manma | pra | vedhasaḥ | cit | tirasi | manīṣām ||4.6.1||

IAST: tvaṁ hi viśvam abhy asi manma pra vedhasaś cit tirasi manīṣām
Griffith: For over evei y thought thou art the Ruler: thou furtherest e'en the wisdom of the pious.
Devanāgarī: त्वं हि विश्वमभ्यसि मन्म प्र वेधसश्चित्तिरसि मनीषाम्
pada pāṭha: ūrdhvaḥ | ūm̐ iti | su | naḥ | adhvarasya | hotaḥ | agne | tiṣṭha | deva-tātā | yajīyān || tvam | hi | viśvam | abhi | asi | manma | pra | vedhasaḥ | cit | tirasi | manīṣām ||4.6.1||

IAST: amūro hotā ny asādi vikṣv agnir mandro vidatheṣu pracetāḥ
Griffith: He was set down mid men as Priest unerring, Agni, wise, welcome in our holy synods.
Devanāgarī: अमूरो होता न्यसादि विक्ष्वग्निर्मन्द्रो विदथेषु प्रचेताः
pada pāṭha: amūraḥ | hotā | ni | asādi | vikṣu | agniḥ | mandraḥ | vidatheṣu | pra-cetāḥ || ūrdhvam | bhānum | savitā-iva | aśret | metā-iva | dhūmam | stabhāyat | upa | dyām ||4.6.2||

IAST: ūrdhvam bhānuṁ savitevāśren meteva dhūmaṁ stabhāyad upa dyām
Griffith: Like Savitar he hath lifted up his splendour, and like a builder raised his smoke to heaven.
Devanāgarī: ऊर्ध्वं भानुं सवितेवाश्रेन्मेतेव धूमं स्तभायदुप द्याम्
pada pāṭha: amūraḥ | hotā | ni | asādi | vikṣu | agniḥ | mandraḥ | vidatheṣu | pra-cetāḥ || ūrdhvam | bhānum | savitā-iva | aśret | metā-iva | dhūmam | stabhāyat | upa | dyām ||4.6.2||

IAST: yatā sujūrṇī rātinī ghṛtācī pradakṣiṇid devatātim urāṇaḥ
Griffith: The glowing ladle, filled with oil, is lifted; choosing Gods' service to the right he circles.
Devanāgarī: यता सुजूर्णी रातिनी घृताची प्रदक्षिणिद्देवतातिमुराणः
pada pāṭha: yatā | su-jūrṇiḥ | rātinī | ghr̥tācī | pra-dakṣiṇit | deva-tātim | urāṇaḥ || ut | ūm̐ iti | svaruḥ | nava-jāḥ | na | akraḥ | paśvaḥ | anakti | su-dhitaḥ | su-mekaḥ ||4.6.3||

IAST: ud u svarur navajā nākraḥ paśvo anakti sudhitaḥ sumekaḥ
Griffith: Eager he rises like the new-wrought pillar which, firmly set and fixed, anoints the victims.
Devanāgarī: उदु स्वरुर्नवजा नाक्रः पश्वो अनक्ति सुधितः सुमेकः
pada pāṭha: yatā | su-jūrṇiḥ | rātinī | ghr̥tācī | pra-dakṣiṇit | deva-tātim | urāṇaḥ || ut | ūm̐ iti | svaruḥ | nava-jāḥ | na | akraḥ | paśvaḥ | anakti | su-dhitaḥ | su-mekaḥ ||4.6.3||

IAST: stīrṇe barhiṣi samidhāne agnā ūrdhvo adhvaryur jujuṣāṇo asthāt
Griffith: When sacred grass is strewn and Agni kindled, the Adhvaryu rises to, his task rej o cing.
Devanāgarī: स्तीर्णे बर्हिषि समिधाने अग्ना ऊर्ध्वो अध्वर्युर्जुजुषाणो अस्थात्
pada pāṭha: stīrṇe | barhiṣi | sam-idhāne | agnau | ūrdhvaḥ | adhvaryuḥ | jujuṣāṇaḥ | asthāt || pari | agniḥ | paśu-pāḥ | na | hotā | tri-viṣṭi | eti | pra-divaḥ | urāṇaḥ ||4.6.4||

IAST: pary agniḥ paśupā na hotā triviṣṭy eti pradiva urāṇaḥ
Griffith: Agni the Priest, like one who tends the cattle, goes three times round, as from of old he wills it.
Devanāgarī: पर्यग्निः पशुपा न होता त्रिविष्ट्येति प्रदिव उराणः
pada pāṭha: stīrṇe | barhiṣi | sam-idhāne | agnau | ūrdhvaḥ | adhvaryuḥ | jujuṣāṇaḥ | asthāt || pari | agniḥ | paśu-pāḥ | na | hotā | tri-viṣṭi | eti | pra-divaḥ | urāṇaḥ ||4.6.4||

IAST: pari tmanā mitadrur eti hotāgnir mandro madhuvacā ṛtāvā
Griffith: Agni himself, the Priest, with measured motion, goes round, with sweet speech, cheerful, true to Order.
Devanāgarī: परि त्मना मितद्रुरेति होताग्निर्मन्द्रो मधुवचा ऋतावा
pada pāṭha: pari | tmanā | mita-druḥ | eti | hotā | agniḥ | mandraḥ | madhu-vacāḥ | r̥ta-vā || dravanti | asya | vājinaḥ | na | śokāḥ | bhayante | viśvā | bhuvanā | yat | abhrāṭ ||4.6.5||

IAST: dravanty asya vājino na śokā bhayante viśvā bhuvanā yad abhrāṭ
Griffith: His fulgent flames run forth like vigorous horses; all creatures are affrighted when he blazes.
Devanāgarī: द्रवन्त्यस्य वाजिनो न शोका भयन्ते विश्वा भुवना यदभ्राट्
pada pāṭha: pari | tmanā | mita-druḥ | eti | hotā | agniḥ | mandraḥ | madhu-vacāḥ | r̥ta-vā || dravanti | asya | vājinaḥ | na | śokāḥ | bhayante | viśvā | bhuvanā | yat | abhrāṭ ||4.6.5||

IAST: bhadrā te agne svanīka saṁdṛg ghorasya sato viṣuṇasya cāruḥ
Griffith: Beautiful and auspicious is thine aspect, O lovely Agni, terrible when spreading.
Devanāgarī: भद्रा ते अग्ने स्वनीक संदृग्घोरस्य सतो विषुणस्य चारुः
pada pāṭha: bhadrā | te | agne | su-anīka | sam-dr̥k | ghorasya | sataḥ | viṣuṇasya | cāruḥ || na | yat | te | śociḥ | tamasā | varanta | na | dhvasmānaḥ | tanvi | repaḥ | ā | dhuriti dhuḥ ||4.6.6||

IAST: na yat te śocis tamasā varanta na dhvasmānas tanvī repa ā dhuḥ
Griffith: Thy splendours are not covered by the darkness: detraction leaves no stain upon thy body.
Devanāgarī: न यत्ते शोचिस्तमसा वरन्त न ध्वस्मानस्तन्वी रेप आ धुः
pada pāṭha: bhadrā | te | agne | su-anīka | sam-dr̥k | ghorasya | sataḥ | viṣuṇasya | cāruḥ || na | yat | te | śociḥ | tamasā | varanta | na | dhvasmānaḥ | tanvi | repaḥ | ā | dhuriti dhuḥ ||4.6.6||

IAST: na yasya sātur janitor avāri na mātarāpitarā nū cid iṣṭau
Griffith: Naught hindered his production, Bounteous Giver: his Mother and his Sire were free to send him.
Devanāgarī: न यस्य सातुर्जनितोरवारि न मातरापितरा नू चिदिष्टौ
pada pāṭha: na | yasya | sātuḥ | janitoḥ | avāri | na | mātarāpitarā | nu | cit | iṣṭau || adha | mitraḥ | na | su-dhitaḥ | pāvakaḥ | agniḥ | dīdāya | mānuṣīṣu | vikṣu ||4.6.7||

IAST: adhā mitro na sudhitaḥ pāvako 'gnir dīdāya mānuṣīṣu vikṣu
Griffith: Then as Friend benevolent, refulgent, Agni shone forth in human habitations.
Devanāgarī: अधा मित्रो न सुधितः पावकोऽग्निर्दीदाय मानुषीषु विक्षु
pada pāṭha: na | yasya | sātuḥ | janitoḥ | avāri | na | mātarāpitarā | nu | cit | iṣṭau || adha | mitraḥ | na | su-dhitaḥ | pāvakaḥ | agniḥ | dīdāya | mānuṣīṣu | vikṣu ||4.6.7||

IAST: dvir yam pañca jījanan saṁvasānāḥ svasāro agnim mānuṣīṣu vikṣu
Griffith: He, Agni, whom the twice-five sisters, dwelling together, in the homes of men engendered,
Devanāgarī: द्विर्यं पञ्च जीजनन्संवसानाः स्वसारो अग्निं मानुषीषु विक्षु
pada pāṭha: dviḥ | yam | pañca | jījanan | sam-vasānāḥ | svasāraḥ | agnim | mānuṣīṣu | vikṣu || uṣaḥ-budham | atharyaḥ | na | dantam | śukram | su-āsam | paraśum | na | tigmam ||4.6.8||

IAST: uṣarbudham atharyo na dantaṁ śukraṁ svāsam paraśuṁ na tigmam
Griffith: Bright like a spear's tooth, wakened in the morning, with powerful mouth and like an axe well-sharpened.
Devanāgarī: उषर्बुधमथर्यो न दन्तं शुक्रं स्वासं परशुं न तिग्मम्
pada pāṭha: dviḥ | yam | pañca | jījanan | sam-vasānāḥ | svasāraḥ | agnim | mānuṣīṣu | vikṣu || uṣaḥ-budham | atharyaḥ | na | dantam | śukram | su-āsam | paraśum | na | tigmam ||4.6.8||

IAST: tava tye agne harito ghṛtasnā rohitāsa ṛjvañcaḥ svañcaḥ
