Griffith: These thy Bay Coursers, Agni, dropping fatness, ruddy vigorous, speeding straightly forward,
Devanāgarī: तव त्ये अग्ने हरितो घृतस्ना रोहितास ऋज्वञ्चः स्वञ्चः
pada pāṭha: tava | tye | agne | haritaḥ | ghr̥ta-snāḥ | rohitāsaḥ | r̥ju-añcaḥ | su-añcaḥ || aruṣāsaḥ | vr̥ṣaṇaḥ | r̥ju-muṣkāḥ | ā | deva-tātim | ahvanta | dasmāḥ ||4.6.9||

IAST: aruṣāso vṛṣaṇa ṛjumuṣkā ā devatātim ahvanta dasmāḥ
Griffith: And red steeds, wonderful, of mighty muscle, are to this service of the Gods invited:
Devanāgarī: अरुषासो वृषण ऋजुमुष्का आ देवतातिमह्वन्त दस्माः
pada pāṭha: tava | tye | agne | haritaḥ | ghr̥ta-snāḥ | rohitāsaḥ | r̥ju-añcaḥ | su-añcaḥ || aruṣāsaḥ | vr̥ṣaṇaḥ | r̥ju-muṣkāḥ | ā | deva-tātim | ahvanta | dasmāḥ ||4.6.9||

IAST: ye ha tye te sahamānā ayāsas tveṣāso agne arcayaś caranti
Griffith: These brightly-shining games of thine, O Agni, that move for ever restless, allsubduing,
Devanāgarī: ये ह त्ये ते सहमाना अयासस्त्वेषासो अग्ने अर्चयश्चरन्ति
pada pāṭha: ye | ha | tye | te | sahamānāḥ | ayāsaḥ | tveṣāsaḥ | agne | arcayaḥ | caranti || śyenāsaḥ | na | duvasanāsaḥ | artham | tuvi-svanasaḥ | mārutam | na | śardhaḥ ||4.6.10||

IAST: śyenāso na duvasanāso arthaṁ tuviṣvaṇaso mārutaṁ na śardhaḥ
Griffith: Like falcons hasting eagerly to the quarry, roar loudly like the army of the Maruts.
Devanāgarī: श्येनासो न दुवसनासो अर्थं तुविष्वणसो मारुतं न शर्धः
pada pāṭha: ye | ha | tye | te | sahamānāḥ | ayāsaḥ | tveṣāsaḥ | agne | arcayaḥ | caranti || śyenāsaḥ | na | duvasanāsaḥ | artham | tuvi-svanasaḥ | mārutam | na | śardhaḥ ||4.6.10||

IAST: akāri brahma samidhāna tubhyaṁ śaṁsāty ukthaṁ yajate vy ū dhāḥ
Griffith: To thee, O flaming God, hath prayer been offered. Let the priest laud thee: give to him who worships.
Devanāgarī: अकारि ब्रह्म समिधान तुभ्यं शंसात्युक्थं यजते व्यू धाः
pada pāṭha: akāri | brahma | sam-idhāna | tubhyam | śaṁsāti | uktham | yajate | vi | ūm̐ iti | dhāḥ || hotāram | agnim | manuṣaḥ | ni | seduḥ | namasyantaḥ | uśijaḥ | śaṁsam | āyoḥ ||4.6.11||

IAST: hotāram agnim manuṣo ni ṣedur namasyanta uśijaḥ śaṁsam āyoḥ
Griffith: Men have established Agni as Invoker, fain to adore the glory of the living.
Devanāgarī: होतारमग्निं मनुषो नि षेदुर्नमस्यन्त उशिजः शंसमायोः
pada pāṭha: akāri | brahma | sam-idhāna | tubhyam | śaṁsāti | uktham | yajate | vi | ūm̐ iti | dhāḥ || hotāram | agnim | manuṣaḥ | ni | seduḥ | namasyantaḥ | uśijaḥ | śaṁsam | āyoḥ ||4.6.11||

IAST: ayam iha prathamo dhāyi dhātṛbhir hotā yajiṣṭho adhvareṣv īḍyaḥ
Griffith: HERE by ordainers was this God appointed first Invoker, best at worship, to be praised at rites:
Devanāgarī: अयमिह प्रथमो धायि धातृभिर्होता यजिष्ठो अध्वरेष्वीड्यः
pada pāṭha: ayam | iha | prathamaḥ | dhāyi | dhātr̥-bhiḥ | hotā | yajiṣṭhaḥ | adhvareṣu | īḍyaḥ || yam | apnavānaḥ | bhr̥gavaḥ | vi-rurucuḥ | vaneṣu | citram | vi-bhvam | viśe-viśe ||4.7.1||

IAST: yam apnavāno bhṛgavo virurucur vaneṣu citraṁ vibhvaṁ viśe-viśe
Griffith: Whom Apnavana, and the Bhrgus caused to shine bright-coloured in the wood, spreading from home to home.
Devanāgarī: यमप्नवानो भृगवो विरुरुचुर्वनेषु चित्रं विभ्वं विशेविशे
pada pāṭha: ayam | iha | prathamaḥ | dhāyi | dhātr̥-bhiḥ | hotā | yajiṣṭhaḥ | adhvareṣu | īḍyaḥ || yam | apnavānaḥ | bhr̥gavaḥ | vi-rurucuḥ | vaneṣu | citram | vi-bhvam | viśe-viśe ||4.7.1||

IAST: agne kadā ta ānuṣag bhuvad devasya cetanam
Griffith: When shall thy glory as a God, Agni, be suddenly shown forth.
Devanāgarī: अग्ने कदा त आनुषग्भुवद्देवस्य चेतनम्
pada pāṭha: agne | kadā | te | ānuṣak | bhuvat | devasya | cetanam || adha | hi | tvā | jagr̥bhrire | martāsaḥ | vikṣu | īḍyam ||4.7.2||

IAST: adhā hi tvā jagṛbhrire martāso vikṣv īḍyam
Griffith: For mortal men have held thee fast, adorable in all their homes,
Devanāgarī: अधा हि त्वा जगृभ्रिरे मर्तासो विक्ष्वीड्यम्
pada pāṭha: agne | kadā | te | ānuṣak | bhuvat | devasya | cetanam || adha | hi | tvā | jagr̥bhrire | martāsaḥ | vikṣu | īḍyam ||4.7.2||

IAST: ṛtāvānaṁ vicetasam paśyanto dyām iva stṛbhiḥ
Griffith: Seeing thee faithful to the Law, most sapient, like the starry heaven,
Devanāgarī: ऋतावानं विचेतसं पश्यन्तो द्यामिव स्तृभिः
pada pāṭha: r̥ta-vānam | vi-cetasam | paśyantaḥ | dyām-iva | str̥-bhiḥ || viśveṣām | adhvarāṇām | haskartāram | dame-dame ||4.7.3||

IAST: viśveṣām adhvarāṇāṁ haskartāraṁ dame-dame
Griffith: Illumining with cheerful ray each solemn rite in every house.
Devanāgarī: विश्वेषामध्वराणां हस्कर्तारं दमेदमे
pada pāṭha: r̥ta-vānam | vi-cetasam | paśyantaḥ | dyām-iva | str̥-bhiḥ || viśveṣām | adhvarāṇām | haskartāram | dame-dame ||4.7.3||

IAST: āśuṁ dūtaṁ vivasvato viśvā yaś carṣaṇīr abhi
Griffith: Vivasvan's envoy living men have taken as their ensign, swift,
Devanāgarī: आशुं दूतं विवस्वतो विश्वा यश्चर्षणीरभि
pada pāṭha: āśum | dūtam | vivasvataḥ | viśvāḥ | yaḥ | carṣaṇīḥ | abhi || ā | jabhruḥ | ketum | āyavaḥ | bhr̥gavāṇam | viśe-viśe ||4.7.4||

IAST: ā jabhruḥ ketum āyavo bhṛgavāṇaṁ viśe-viśe
Griffith: The ruler over all mankind, moving like Bhrgu in each home.
Devanāgarī: आ जभ्रुः केतुमायवो भृगवाणं विशेविशे
pada pāṭha: āśum | dūtam | vivasvataḥ | viśvāḥ | yaḥ | carṣaṇīḥ | abhi || ā | jabhruḥ | ketum | āyavaḥ | bhr̥gavāṇam | viśe-viśe ||4.7.4||

IAST: tam īṁ hotāram ānuṣak cikitvāṁsaṁ ni ṣedire
Griffith: Him the intelligent have they placed duly as Invoking Priest,
Devanāgarī: तमीं होतारमानुषक्चिकित्वांसं नि षेदिरे
pada pāṭha: tam | īm | hotāram | ānuṣak | cikitvāṁsam | ni | sedire || raṇvam | pāvaka-śociṣam | yajiṣṭham | sapta | dhāma-bhiḥ ||4.7.5||

IAST: raṇvam pāvakaśociṣaṁ yajiṣṭhaṁ sapta dhāmabhiḥ
Griffith: Welcome, with sanctifying flame, best worshipper, with sevenfold might;
Devanāgarī: रण्वं पावकशोचिषं यजिष्ठं सप्त धामभिः
pada pāṭha: tam | īm | hotāram | ānuṣak | cikitvāṁsam | ni | sedire || raṇvam | pāvaka-śociṣam | yajiṣṭham | sapta | dhāma-bhiḥ ||4.7.5||

IAST: taṁ śaśvatīṣu mātṛṣu vana ā vītam aśritam
Griffith: In his Eternal Mothers, in the wood, concealed and unapproached,
Devanāgarī: तं शश्वतीषु मातृषु वन आ वीतमश्रितम्
pada pāṭha: tam | śaśvatīṣu | mātr̥ṣu | vane | ā | vītam | aśritam || citram | santam | guhā | hitam | su-vedam | kūcit-arthinam ||4.7.6||

IAST: citraṁ santaṁ guhā hitaṁ suvedaṁ kūcidarthinam
Griffith: Kept secret though his flames are bright seekingon all sides, quickly found.
Devanāgarī: चित्रं सन्तं गुहा हितं सुवेदं कूचिदर्थिनम्
pada pāṭha: tam | śaśvatīṣu | mātr̥ṣu | vane | ā | vītam | aśritam || citram | santam | guhā | hitam | su-vedam | kūcit-arthinam ||4.7.6||

IAST: sasasya yad viyutā sasminn ūdhann ṛtasya dhāman raṇayanta devāḥ
Griffith: That as food spreads forth in this earthly udder, Gods may rejoice them in the home of Order,
Devanāgarī: ससस्य यद्वियुता सस्मिन्नूधन्नृतस्य धामन्रणयन्त देवाः
pada pāṭha: sasasya | yat | vi-yutā | sasmin | ūdhan | r̥tasya | dhāman | raṇayanta | devāḥ || mahān | agniḥ | namasā | rāta-havyaḥ | veḥ | adhvarāya | sadam | it | r̥ta-vā ||4.7.7||

IAST: mahām̐ agnir namasā rātahavyo ver adhvarāya sadam id ṛtāvā
Griffith: Great Agni, served with reverence and oblation, flies ever to the sacrifice, the Faithful.
Devanāgarī: महाँ अग्निर्नमसा रातहव्यो वेरध्वराय सदमिदृतावा
pada pāṭha: sasasya | yat | vi-yutā | sasmin | ūdhan | r̥tasya | dhāman | raṇayanta | devāḥ || mahān | agniḥ | namasā | rāta-havyaḥ | veḥ | adhvarāya | sadam | it | r̥ta-vā ||4.7.7||

IAST: ver adhvarasya dūtyāni vidvān ubhe antā rodasī saṁcikitvān
Griffith: Bird of each rite, skilled in an envoy's duties, knowing both worlds and that which lies between them,
Devanāgarī: वेरध्वरस्य दूत्यानि विद्वानुभे अन्ता रोदसी संचिकित्वान्
pada pāṭha: veḥ | adhvarasya | dūtyāni | vidvān | ubhe iti | antariti | rodasī iti | sam-cikitvān || dūtaḥ | īyase | pra-divaḥ | urāṇaḥ | viduḥ-taraḥ | divaḥ | ā-rodhanāni ||4.7.8||

IAST: dūta īyase pradiva urāṇo viduṣṭaro diva ārodhanāni
Griffith: Thou goest from of old a willing Herald, knowing full well heaven's innermost recesses.
Devanāgarī: दूत ईयसे प्रदिव उराणो विदुष्टरो दिव आरोधनानि
pada pāṭha: veḥ | adhvarasya | dūtyāni | vidvān | ubhe iti | antariti | rodasī iti | sam-cikitvān || dūtaḥ | īyase | pra-divaḥ | urāṇaḥ | viduḥ-taraḥ | divaḥ | ā-rodhanāni ||4.7.8||

IAST: kṛṣṇaṁ ta ema ruśataḥ puro bhāś cariṣṇv arcir vapuṣām id ekam
Griffith: Bright God, thy path is black: light is before thee: thy moving splendour is the chief of wonders.
Devanāgarī: कृष्णं त एम रुशतः पुरो भाश्चरिष्ण्वर्चिर्वपुषामिदेकम्
pada pāṭha: kr̥ṣṇam | te | ema | ruśataḥ | puraḥ | bhāḥ | cariṣṇu | arciḥ | vapuṣām | it | ekam || yat | apra-vītā | dadhate | ha | garbham | sadyaḥ | cit | jātaḥ | bhavasi | it | ūm̐ iti | dūtaḥ ||4.7.9||

IAST: yad apravītā dadhate ha garbhaṁ sadyaś cij jāto bhavasīd u dūtaḥ
Griffith: When she, yet unimpregnate, hath conceived thee, even when newly born thou art an envoy.
Devanāgarī: यदप्रवीता दधते ह गर्भं सद्यश्चिज्जातो भवसीदु दूतः
pada pāṭha: kr̥ṣṇam | te | ema | ruśataḥ | puraḥ | bhāḥ | cariṣṇu | arciḥ | vapuṣām | it | ekam || yat | apra-vītā | dadhate | ha | garbham | sadyaḥ | cit | jātaḥ | bhavasi | it | ūm̐ iti | dūtaḥ ||4.7.9||

IAST: sadyo jātasya dadṛśānam ojo yad asya vāto anuvāti śociḥ
Griffith: Yet newly born, his vigour is apparent when the wind blows upon his fiery splendour,
Devanāgarī: सद्यो जातस्य ददृशानमोजो यदस्य वातो अनुवाति शोचिः
pada pāṭha: sadyaḥ | jātasya | dadr̥śānam | ojaḥ | yat | asya | vātaḥ | anu-vāti | śociḥ || vr̥ṇakti | tigmām | ataseṣu | jihvām | sthirā | cit | annā | dayate | vi | jambhaiḥ ||4.7.10||

IAST: vṛṇakti tigmām ataseṣu jihvāṁ sthirā cid annā dayate vi jambhaiḥ
Griffith: His sharpened tongue he layeth on the brushwood, and with his teeth e'en solid food consumeth.
Devanāgarī: वृणक्ति तिग्मामतसेषु जिह्वां स्थिरा चिदन्ना दयते वि जम्भैः
pada pāṭha: sadyaḥ | jātasya | dadr̥śānam | ojaḥ | yat | asya | vātaḥ | anu-vāti | śociḥ || vr̥ṇakti | tigmām | ataseṣu | jihvām | sthirā | cit | annā | dayate | vi | jambhaiḥ ||4.7.10||

IAST: tṛṣu yad annā tṛṣuṇā vavakṣa tṛṣuṁ dūtaṁ kṛṇute yahvo agniḥ
Griffith: When he hath borne off food with swift flame swiftly, strong Agni makes himself a speedy envoy,
Devanāgarī: तृषु यदन्ना तृषुणा ववक्ष तृषुं दूतं कृणुते यह्वो अग्निः
pada pāṭha: tr̥ṣu | yat | annā | tr̥ṣuṇā | vavakṣa | tr̥ṣum | dūtam | kr̥ṇute | yahvaḥ | agniḥ || vātasya | meḷim | sacate | ni-jūrvan | āśum | na | vājayate | hinve | arvā ||4.7.11||

IAST: vātasya meḻiṁ sacate nijūrvann āśuṁ na vājayate hinve arvā
Griffith: Follows the rustling of the wind, consuming, and courser-like, speeds, drives the swift horse onward.
Devanāgarī: वातस्य मेळिं सचते निजूर्वन्नाशुं न वाजयते हिन्वे अर्वा
pada pāṭha: tr̥ṣu | yat | annā | tr̥ṣuṇā | vavakṣa | tr̥ṣum | dūtam | kr̥ṇute | yahvaḥ | agniḥ || vātasya | meḷim | sacate | ni-jūrvan | āśum | na | vājayate | hinve | arvā ||4.7.11||

IAST: dūtaṁ vo viśvavedasaṁ havyavāham amartyam
Griffith: YOUR envoy who possesses all, Immortal, bearer of your gifts,
Devanāgarī: दूतं वो विश्ववेदसं हव्यवाहममर्त्यम्
pada pāṭha: dūtam | vaḥ | viśva-vedasam | havya-vāham | amartyam || yajiṣṭham | r̥ñjase | girā ||4.8.1||

IAST: yajiṣṭham ṛñjase girā
Griffith: Best worshipper, I woo with song.
Devanāgarī: यजिष्ठमृञ्जसे गिरा
pada pāṭha: dūtam | vaḥ | viśva-vedasam | havya-vāham | amartyam || yajiṣṭham | r̥ñjase | girā ||4.8.1||

IAST: sa hi vedā vasudhitim mahām̐ ārodhanaṁ divaḥ
Griffith: He, Mighty, knows the gift of wealth, he knows the deep recess of heaven:
Devanāgarī: स हि वेदा वसुधितिं महाँ आरोधनं दिवः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | hi | veda | vasu-dhitim | mahān | ā-rodhanam | divaḥ || saḥ | devān | ā | iha | vakṣati ||4.8.2||

IAST: sa devām̐ eha vakṣati
Griffith: He shall bring hitherward the Gods.
Devanāgarī: स देवाँ एह वक्षति
pada pāṭha: saḥ | hi | veda | vasu-dhitim | mahān | ā-rodhanam | divaḥ || saḥ | devān | ā | iha | vakṣati ||4.8.2||

IAST: sa veda deva ānamaṁ devām̐ ṛtāyate dame
Griffith: He knows, a God himself, to guide Gods to the righteous in his home:
Devanāgarī: स वेद देव आनमं देवाँ ऋतायते दमे
pada pāṭha: saḥ | veda | devaḥ | ā-namam | devān | r̥ta-yate | dame || dāti | priyāṇi | cit | vasu ||4.8.3||

IAST: dāti priyāṇi cid vasu
Griffith: He gives e'en treasures that we love.
Devanāgarī: दाति प्रियाणि चिद्वसु
pada pāṭha: saḥ | veda | devaḥ | ā-namam | devān | r̥ta-yate | dame || dāti | priyāṇi | cit | vasu ||4.8.3||

IAST: sa hotā sed u dūtyaṁ cikitvām̐ antar īyate
Griffith: He is the Herald: well-informed, he doth his errand to and fro,
Devanāgarī: स होता सेदु दूत्यं चिकित्वाँ अन्तरीयते
pada pāṭha: saḥ | hotā | saḥ | it | ūm̐ iti | dūtyam | cikitvān | antaḥ | īyate || vidvān | ā-rodhanam | divaḥ ||4.8.4||

IAST: vidvām̐ ārodhanaṁ divaḥ
Griffith: Knowing the deep recess of heaven.
Devanāgarī: विद्वाँ आरोधनं दिवः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | hotā | saḥ | it | ūm̐ iti | dūtyam | cikitvān | antaḥ | īyate || vidvān | ā-rodhanam | divaḥ ||4.8.4||

IAST: te syāma ye agnaye dadāśur havyadātibhiḥ
Griffith: May we be they who gratify Agni with sacrificial gifts,
Devanāgarī: ते स्याम ये अग्नये ददाशुर्हव्यदातिभिः
pada pāṭha: te | syāma | ye | agnaye | dadāśuḥ | havyadāti-bhiḥ || ye | īm | puṣyantaḥ | indhate ||4.8.5||

IAST: ya īm puṣyanta indhate
Griffith: Whocherish and enkindle him.
Devanāgarī: य ईं पुष्यन्त इन्धते
pada pāṭha: te | syāma | ye | agnaye | dadāśuḥ | havyadāti-bhiḥ || ye | īm | puṣyantaḥ | indhate ||4.8.5||

IAST: te rāyā te suvīryaiḥ sasavāṁso vi śṛṇvire
Griffith: Illustrious for wealth are they, and hero deeds, victorious,
Devanāgarī: ते राया ते सुवीर्यैः ससवांसो वि शृण्विरे
pada pāṭha: te | rāyā | te | su-vīryaiḥ | sasa-vāṁsaḥ | vi | śr̥ṇvire || ye | agnā | dadhire | duvaḥ ||4.8.6||

IAST: ye agnā dadhire duvaḥ
Griffith: Who have served Agni reverently.
Devanāgarī: ये अग्ना दधिरे दुवः
pada pāṭha: te | rāyā | te | su-vīryaiḥ | sasa-vāṁsaḥ | vi | śr̥ṇvire || ye | agnā | dadhire | duvaḥ ||4.8.6||

IAST: asme rāyo dive-dive saṁ carantu puruspṛhaḥ
Griffith: So unto us, day after day, may riches craved by many come,
Devanāgarī: अस्मे रायो दिवेदिवे सं चरन्तु पुरुस्पृहः
pada pāṭha: asme iti | rāyaḥ | dive-dive | sam | carantu | puru-spr̥haḥ || asme iti | vājāsaḥ | īratām ||4.8.7||

IAST: asme vājāsa īratām
Griffith: And power and might spring up for us.
Devanāgarī: अस्मे वाजास ईरताम्
pada pāṭha: asme iti | rāyaḥ | dive-dive | sam | carantu | puru-spr̥haḥ || asme iti | vājāsaḥ | īratām ||4.8.7||

IAST: sa vipraś carṣaṇīnāṁ śavasā mānuṣāṇām
Griffith: That holy Singer in his strength shoots forth his arrows swifter than
Devanāgarī: स विप्रश्चर्षणीनां शवसा मानुषाणाम्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | vipraḥ | carṣaṇīnām | śavasā | mānuṣāṇām || ati | kṣiprā-iva | vidhyati ||4.8.8||

IAST: ati kṣipreva vidhyati
Griffith: The swift shafts of the tribes of men.
Devanāgarī: अति क्षिप्रेव विध्यति
pada pāṭha: saḥ | vipraḥ | carṣaṇīnām | śavasā | mānuṣāṇām || ati | kṣiprā-iva | vidhyati ||4.8.8||

IAST: agne mṛḻa mahām̐ asi ya īm ā devayuṁ janam
Griffith: AGNI, show favour: great art thou who to this pious man art come,
Devanāgarī: अग्ने मृळ महाँ असि य ईमा देवयुं जनम्
pada pāṭha: agne | mr̥ḷa | mahān | asi | yaḥ | īm | ā | deva-yum | janam || iyetha | barhiḥ | ā-sadam ||4.9.1||

IAST: iyetha barhir āsadam
Griffith: To seat thee on the sacred grass.
Devanāgarī: इयेथ बर्हिरासदम्
pada pāṭha: agne | mr̥ḷa | mahān | asi | yaḥ | īm | ā | deva-yum | janam || iyetha | barhiḥ | ā-sadam ||4.9.1||

IAST: sa mānuṣīṣu dūḻabho vikṣu prāvīr amartyaḥ
Griffith: May he the Immortal, Helper, bard to be deceived among mankind,
Devanāgarī: स मानुषीषु दूळभो विक्षु प्रावीरमर्त्यः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | mānuṣīṣu | duḥ-dabhaḥ | vikṣu | pra-avīḥ | amartyaḥ || dūtaḥ | viśveṣām | bhuvat ||4.9.2||

IAST: dūto viśveṣām bhuvat
Griffith: Become the messenger of all.
Devanāgarī: दूतो विश्वेषां भुवत्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | mānuṣīṣu | duḥ-dabhaḥ | vikṣu | pra-avīḥ | amartyaḥ || dūtaḥ | viśveṣām | bhuvat ||4.9.2||

IAST: sa sadma pari ṇīyate hotā mandro diviṣṭiṣu
Griffith: Around the altar is he led, welcome Chief Priest at solemn rites,
Devanāgarī: स सद्म परि णीयते होता मन्द्रो दिविष्टिषु
pada pāṭha: saḥ | sadma | pari | nīyate | hotā | mandraḥ | diviṣṭiṣu || uta | potā | ni | sīdati ||4.9.3||

IAST: uta potā ni ṣīdati
Griffith: Or as the Potar sits him down.
Devanāgarī: उत पोता नि षीदति
pada pāṭha: saḥ | sadma | pari | nīyate | hotā | mandraḥ | diviṣṭiṣu || uta | potā | ni | sīdati ||4.9.3||

IAST: uta gnā agnir adhvara uto gṛhapatir dame
Griffith: Agni in fire at sacrifice, and in the house as Lord thereof,
Devanāgarī: उत ग्ना अग्निरध्वर उतो गृहपतिर्दमे
pada pāṭha: uta | gnāḥ | agniḥ | adhvare | uto iti | gr̥ha-patiḥ | dame || uta | brahmā | ni | sīdati ||4.9.4||

IAST: uta brahmā ni ṣīdati
Griffith: And as a Brahman takes his seat.
Devanāgarī: उत ब्रह्मा नि षीदति
pada pāṭha: uta | gnāḥ | agniḥ | adhvare | uto iti | gr̥ha-patiḥ | dame || uta | brahmā | ni | sīdati ||4.9.4||

IAST: veṣi hy adhvarīyatām upavaktā janānām
Griffith: Thou comest as the guide of folk who celebrate a sacrifice,
Devanāgarī: वेषि ह्यध्वरीयतामुपवक्ता जनानाम्
pada pāṭha: veṣi | hi | adhvari-yatām | upa-vaktā | janānām || havyā | ca | mānuṣāṇām ||4.9.5||

IAST: havyā ca mānuṣāṇām
Griffith: And to oblations brought by men.
Devanāgarī: हव्या च मानुषाणाम्
pada pāṭha: veṣi | hi | adhvari-yatām | upa-vaktā | janānām || havyā | ca | mānuṣāṇām ||4.9.5||

IAST: veṣīd v asya dūtyaṁ yasya jujoṣo adhvaram
Griffith: Thou servest as his messenger whose sacrifice thou lovest well,
Devanāgarī: वेषीद्वस्य दूत्यं यस्य जुजोषो अध्वरम्
pada pāṭha: veṣi | it | ūm̐ iti | asya | dūtyam | yasya | jujoṣaḥ | adhvaram || havyam | martasya | voḷhave ||4.9.6||

IAST: havyam martasya voḻhave
Griffith: To bear the mortal's gifts to heaven.
Devanāgarī: हव्यं मर्तस्य वोळ्हवे
pada pāṭha: veṣi | it | ūm̐ iti | asya | dūtyam | yasya | jujoṣaḥ | adhvaram || havyam | martasya | voḷhave ||4.9.6||

IAST: asmākaṁ joṣy adhvaram asmākaṁ yajñam aṅgiraḥ
Griffith: Accept our solemn rite; be pleased, Angiras, with our sacrifice:
Devanāgarī: अस्माकं जोष्यध्वरमस्माकं यज्ञमङ्गिरः
pada pāṭha: asmākam | joṣi | adhvaram | asmākam | yajñam | aṅgiraḥ || asmākam | śr̥ṇudhi | havam ||4.9.7||

IAST: asmākaṁ śṛṇudhī havam
Griffith: Give ear and listen to our call.
Devanāgarī: अस्माकं शृणुधी हवम्
pada pāṭha: asmākam | joṣi | adhvaram | asmākam | yajñam | aṅgiraḥ || asmākam | śr̥ṇudhi | havam ||4.9.7||

IAST: pari te dūḻabho ratho 'smām̐ aśnotu viśvataḥ
Griffith: May thine inviolable car, wherewith thou guardest those who give,
Devanāgarī: परि ते दूळभो रथोऽस्माँ अश्नोतु विश्वतः
pada pāṭha: pari | te | duḥ-dabhaḥ | rathaḥ | asmān | aśnotu | viśvataḥ || yena | rakṣasi | dāśuṣaḥ ||4.9.8||

IAST: yena rakṣasi dāśuṣaḥ
Griffith: Come near to us from every side.
Devanāgarī: येन रक्षसि दाशुषः
pada pāṭha: pari | te | duḥ-dabhaḥ | rathaḥ | asmān | aśnotu | viśvataḥ || yena | rakṣasi | dāśuṣaḥ ||4.9.8||

IAST: agne tam adyāśvaṁ na stomaiḥ kratuṁ na bhadraṁ hṛdispṛśam
Griffith: I. This day with praises, Agni, we bring thee that which thou lovest.
Devanāgarī: अग्ने तमद्याश्वं न स्तोमैः क्रतुं न भद्रं हृदिस्पृशम्
pada pāṭha: agne | tam | adya | aśvam | na | stomaiḥ | kratum | na | bhadram | hr̥di-spr̥śam || r̥dhyāma | te | ohaiḥ ||4.10.1||

IAST: ṛdhyāmā ta ohaiḥ
Griffith: Right judgment, like a horse, with our devotions.
Devanāgarī: ऋध्यामा त ओहैः
pada pāṭha: agne | tam | adya | aśvam | na | stomaiḥ | kratum | na | bhadram | hr̥di-spr̥śam || r̥dhyāma | te | ohaiḥ ||4.10.1||

IAST: adhā hy agne krator bhadrasya dakṣasya sādhoḥ
Griffith: For thou hast ever been the Car-driver, Agni, of noble
Devanāgarī: अधा ह्यग्ने क्रतोर्भद्रस्य दक्षस्य साधोः
pada pāṭha: adha | hi | agne | kratoḥ | bhadrasya | dakṣasya | sādhoḥ || rathīḥ | r̥tasya | br̥hataḥ | babhūtha ||4.10.2||

IAST: rathīr ṛtasya bṛhato babhūtha
Griffith: Strength, lofty sacrifice, and rightful judgment.
Devanāgarī: रथीरृतस्य बृहतो बभूथ
pada pāṭha: adha | hi | agne | kratoḥ | bhadrasya | dakṣasya | sādhoḥ || rathīḥ | r̥tasya | br̥hataḥ | babhūtha ||4.10.2||

IAST: ebhir no arkair bhavā no arvāṅ svar ṇa jyotiḥ
Griffith: Through these our praises come thou to meet us, bright as the sunlight,
Devanāgarī: एभिर्नो अर्कैर्भवा नो अर्वाङ्स्वर्ण ज्योतिः
pada pāṭha: ebhiḥ | naḥ | arkaiḥ | bhava | naḥ | arvāṅ | svaḥ | na | jyotiḥ || agne | viśvebhiḥ | su-manāḥ | anīkaiḥ ||4.10.3||

IAST: agne viśvebhiḥ sumanā anīkaiḥ
Griffith: O Agni, well disposed, with all thine aspects.
Devanāgarī: अग्ने विश्वेभिः सुमना अनीकैः
pada pāṭha: ebhiḥ | naḥ | arkaiḥ | bhava | naḥ | arvāṅ | svaḥ | na | jyotiḥ || agne | viśvebhiḥ | su-manāḥ | anīkaiḥ ||4.10.3||

IAST: ābhiṣ ṭe adya gīrbhir gṛṇanto 'gne dāśema
Griffith: Now may we serve thee singing these lauds this day to thee, Agni.
Devanāgarī: आभिष्टे अद्य गीर्भिर्गृणन्तोऽग्ने दाशेम
pada pāṭha: ābhiḥ | te | adya | gīḥ-bhiḥ | gr̥ṇantaḥ | agne | dāśema || pra | te | divaḥ | na | stanayanti | śuṣmāḥ ||4.10.4||

IAST: pra te divo na stanayanti śuṣmāḥ
Griffith: Loud as the voice of Heaven thy blasts are roaring.
Devanāgarī: प्र ते दिवो न स्तनयन्ति शुष्माः
pada pāṭha: ābhiḥ | te | adya | gīḥ-bhiḥ | gr̥ṇantaḥ | agne | dāśema || pra | te | divaḥ | na | stanayanti | śuṣmāḥ ||4.10.4||

IAST: tava svādiṣṭhāgne saṁdṛṣṭir idā cid ahna idā cid aktoḥ
Griffith: just at this time of the day and the night thy look is the sweetest .
Devanāgarī: तव स्वादिष्ठाग्ने संदृष्टिरिदा चिदह्न इदा चिदक्तोः
pada pāṭha: tava | svādiṣṭhā | agne | sam-dr̥ṣṭiḥ | idā | cit | ahnaḥ | idā | cit | aktoḥ || śriye | rukmaḥ | na | rocate | upāke ||4.10.5||

IAST: śriye rukmo na rocata upāke
Griffith: It shineth near us even as gold for glory.
Devanāgarī: श्रिये रुक्मो न रोचत उपाके
pada pāṭha: tava | svādiṣṭhā | agne | sam-dr̥ṣṭiḥ | idā | cit | ahnaḥ | idā | cit | aktoḥ || śriye | rukmaḥ | na | rocate | upāke ||4.10.5||

IAST: ghṛtaṁ na pūtaṁ tanūr arepāḥ śuci hiraṇyam
Griffith: Spotless thy body, brilliant as gold, like clarified butter:
Devanāgarī: घृतं न पूतं तनूररेपाः शुचि हिरण्यम्
pada pāṭha: ghr̥tam | na | pūtam | tanūḥ | arepāḥ | śuci | hiraṇyam || tat | te | rukmaḥ | na | rocata | svadhā-vaḥ ||4.10.6||

IAST: tat te rukmo na rocata svadhāvaḥ
Griffith: This gleams like gold on thee, O Self. dependent.
Devanāgarī: तत्ते रुक्मो न रोचत स्वधावः
pada pāṭha: ghr̥tam | na | pūtam | tanūḥ | arepāḥ | śuci | hiraṇyam || tat | te | rukmaḥ | na | rocata | svadhā-vaḥ ||4.10.6||

IAST: kṛtaṁ cid dhi ṣmā sanemi dveṣo 'gna inoṣi martāt
Griffith: All hate and mischief, yea, if committed, Agni, thou turnest,
Devanāgarī: कृतं चिद्धि ष्मा सनेमि द्वेषोऽग्न इनोषि मर्तात्
pada pāṭha: kr̥tam | cit | hi | sma | sanemi | dveṣaḥ | agne | inoṣi | martāt || itthā | yajamānāt | r̥ta-vaḥ ||4.10.7||

IAST: itthā yajamānād ṛtāvaḥ
Griffith: Holy One, from the man who rightly worships.
Devanāgarī: इत्था यजमानादृतावः
pada pāṭha: kr̥tam | cit | hi | sma | sanemi | dveṣaḥ | agne | inoṣi | martāt || itthā | yajamānāt | r̥ta-vaḥ ||4.10.7||

IAST: śivā naḥ sakhyā santu bhrātrāgne deveṣu yuṣme
Griffith: Agni, with you Gods, prosperous be our friendships and kinships.
Devanāgarī: शिवा नः सख्या सन्तु भ्रात्राग्ने देवेषु युष्मे
pada pāṭha: śivā | naḥ | sakhyā | santu | bhrātrā | agne | deveṣu | yuṣme iti || sā | naḥ | nābhiḥ | sadane | sasmin | ūdham ||4.10.8||

IAST: sā no nābhiḥ sadane sasminn ūdhan
Griffith: Be this our bond here by this place, thine al tar.
Devanāgarī: सा नो नाभिः सदने सस्मिन्नूधन्
pada pāṭha: śivā | naḥ | sakhyā | santu | bhrātrā | agne | deveṣu | yuṣme iti || sā | naḥ | nābhiḥ | sadane | sasmin | ūdham ||4.10.8||

IAST: bhadraṁ te agne sahasinn anīkam upāka ā rocate sūryasya
Griffith: THY blessed majesty, victorious Agni, shines brightly in the neighbourhood of Surya.
Devanāgarī: भद्रं ते अग्ने सहसिन्ननीकमुपाक आ रोचते सूर्यस्य
pada pāṭha: bhadram | te | agne | sahasin | anīkam | upāke | ā | rocate | sūryasya || ruśat | dr̥śe | dadr̥śe | nakta-yā | cit | arūkṣitam | dr̥śe | ā | rūpe | annam ||4.11.1||

IAST: ruśad dṛśe dadṛśe naktayā cid arūkṣitaṁ dṛśa ā rūpe annam
Griffith: Splendid to see, it shows even at nighttime, and food is fair to look on in thy beauty.
Devanāgarī: रुशद्दृशे ददृशे नक्तया चिदरूक्षितं दृश आ रूपे अन्नम्
pada pāṭha: bhadram | te | agne | sahasin | anīkam | upāke | ā | rocate | sūryasya || ruśat | dr̥śe | dadr̥śe | nakta-yā | cit | arūkṣitam | dr̥śe | ā | rūpe | annam ||4.11.1||

IAST: vi ṣāhy agne gṛṇate manīṣāṁ khaṁ vepasā tuvijāta stavānaḥ
Griffith: Agni, disclose his thought for him who singeth, the well, Strong God! while thou art praised with fervour.
Devanāgarī: वि षाह्यग्ने गृणते मनीषां खं वेपसा तुविजात स्तवानः
pada pāṭha: vi | sāhi | agne | gr̥ṇate | manīṣām | kham | vepasā | tuvi-jāta | stavānaḥ || viśvebhiḥ | yat | vavanaḥ | śukra | devaiḥ | tat | naḥ | rāsva | su-mahaḥ | bhūri | manma ||4.11.2||

IAST: viśvebhir yad vāvanaḥ śukra devais tan no rāsva sumaho bhūri manma
Griffith: Vouchsafe to us that powerful hymn, O Mighty, which, Radiant One! with all the Gods thou lovest.
Devanāgarī: विश्वेभिर्यद्वावनः शुक्र देवैस्तन्नो रास्व सुमहो भूरि मन्म
pada pāṭha: vi | sāhi | agne | gr̥ṇate | manīṣām | kham | vepasā | tuvi-jāta | stavānaḥ || viśvebhiḥ | yat | vavanaḥ | śukra | devaiḥ | tat | naḥ | rāsva | su-mahaḥ | bhūri | manma ||4.11.2||

IAST: tvad agne kāvyā tvan manīṣās tvad ukthā jāyante rādhyāni
Griffith: From thee, O Agni, springs poetic wisdom, from thee come thoughts and hymns of praise that prosper;
Devanāgarī: त्वदग्ने काव्या त्वन्मनीषास्त्वदुक्था जायन्ते राध्यानि
pada pāṭha: tvat | agne | kāvyā | tvat | manīṣāḥ | tvat | ukthā | jāyante | rādhyāni || tvat | eti | draviṇam | vīra-peśāḥ | itthā-dhiye | dāśuṣe | martyāya ||4.11.3||

IAST: tvad eti draviṇaṁ vīrapeśā itthādhiye dāśuṣe martyāya
Griffith: From thee flows wealth, with heroes to adorn it, to the true-hearted man who gives oblation.
Devanāgarī: त्वदेति द्रविणं वीरपेशा इत्थाधिये दाशुषे मर्त्याय
pada pāṭha: tvat | agne | kāvyā | tvat | manīṣāḥ | tvat | ukthā | jāyante | rādhyāni || tvat | eti | draviṇam | vīra-peśāḥ | itthā-dhiye | dāśuṣe | martyāya ||4.11.3||

IAST: tvad vājī vājambharo vihāyā abhiṣṭikṛj jāyate satyaśuṣmaḥ
Griffith: From thee the hero springs who wins the booty, bringer of help, mighty, of real courage.
Devanāgarī: त्वद्वाजी वाजम्भरो विहाया अभिष्टिकृज्जायते सत्यशुष्मः
pada pāṭha: tvat | vājī | vājam-bharaḥ | vi-hāyāḥ | abhiṣṭi-kr̥t | jāyate | satya-śuṣmaḥ || tvat | rayiḥ | deva-jūtaḥ | mayaḥ-bhuḥ | tvat | āśuḥ | jūju-vān | agne | arvā ||4.11.4||

IAST: tvad rayir devajūto mayobhus tvad āśur jūjuvām̐ agne arvā
Griffith: From thee comes wealth, sent by the Gods, bliss-giving; Agni, from thee the fleet impetuous charger.
Devanāgarī: त्वद्रयिर्देवजूतो मयोभुस्त्वदाशुर्जूजुवाँ अग्ने अर्वा
pada pāṭha: tvat | vājī | vājam-bharaḥ | vi-hāyāḥ | abhiṣṭi-kr̥t | jāyate | satya-śuṣmaḥ || tvat | rayiḥ | deva-jūtaḥ | mayaḥ-bhuḥ | tvat | āśuḥ | jūju-vān | agne | arvā ||4.11.4||

IAST: tvām agne prathamaṁ devayanto devam martā amṛta mandrajihvam
Griffith: Immortal Agni, thee whose voice is pleasant, as first in rank, as God, religious mortals
Devanāgarī: त्वामग्ने प्रथमं देवयन्तो देवं मर्ता अमृत मन्द्रजिह्वम्
pada pāṭha: tvām | agne | prathamam | deva-yantaḥ | devam | martāḥ | amr̥ta | mandra-jihvam || dveṣaḥ-yutam | ā | vivāsanti | dhībhiḥ | damūnasam | gr̥ha-patim | amūram ||4.11.5||

IAST: dveṣoyutam ā vivāsanti dhībhir damūnasaṁ gṛhapatim amūram
Griffith: Invite with hyrnns; thee who removest hatred, Friend of the Home, the household's Lord, unerring.
Devanāgarī: द्वेषोयुतमा विवासन्ति धीभिर्दमूनसं गृहपतिममूरम्
pada pāṭha: tvām | agne | prathamam | deva-yantaḥ | devam | martāḥ | amr̥ta | mandra-jihvam || dveṣaḥ-yutam | ā | vivāsanti | dhībhiḥ | damūnasam | gr̥ha-patim | amūram ||4.11.5||

IAST: āre asmad amatim āre aṁha āre viśvāṁ durmatiṁ yan nipāsi
Griffith: Far from us thou removest want and sorrow, far from us all ill-will when thou protectest.
Devanāgarī: आरे अस्मदमतिमारे अंह आरे विश्वां दुर्मतिं यन्निपासि
pada pāṭha: āre | asmat | amatim | āre | aṁhaḥ | āre | viśvām | duḥ-matim | yat | ni-pāsi || doṣā | śivaḥ | sahasaḥ | sūno iti | agne | yam | devaḥ | ā | cit | sacase | svasti ||4.11.6||

IAST: doṣā śivaḥ sahasaḥ sūno agne yaṁ deva ā cit sacase svasti
Griffith: Son of Strength, Agni, blest is he at evening, whom thou as God attendest for his welfare.
Devanāgarī: दोषा शिवः सहसः सूनो अग्ने यं देव आ चित्सचसे स्वस्ति
pada pāṭha: āre | asmat | amatim | āre | aṁhaḥ | āre | viśvām | duḥ-matim | yat | ni-pāsi || doṣā | śivaḥ | sahasaḥ | sūno iti | agne | yam | devaḥ | ā | cit | sacase | svasti ||4.11.6||

IAST: yas tvām agna inadhate yatasruk tris te annaṁ kṛṇavat sasminn ahan
Griffith: WHOSO enkindles thee, with lifted ladle, and thrice this day offiers thee food, O Agni,
Devanāgarī: यस्त्वामग्न इनधते यतस्रुक्त्रिस्ते अन्नं कृणवत्सस्मिन्नहन्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | tvām | agne | inadhate | yata-sruk | triḥ | te | annam | kr̥ṇavat | sasmin | ahan || saḥ | su | dyumnaiḥ | abhi | astu | pra-sakṣat | tava | kratvā | jāta-vedaḥ | cikitvān ||4.12.1||

IAST: sa su dyumnair abhy astu prasakṣat tava kratvā jātavedaś cikitvān
Griffith: May he excel, triumphant through thy splendours, wise through thy mental power, O Jatavedas.
Devanāgarī: स सु द्युम्नैरभ्यस्तु प्रसक्षत्तव क्रत्वा जातवेदश्चिकित्वान्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | tvām | agne | inadhate | yata-sruk | triḥ | te | annam | kr̥ṇavat | sasmin | ahan || saḥ | su | dyumnaiḥ | abhi | astu | pra-sakṣat | tava | kratvā | jāta-vedaḥ | cikitvān ||4.12.1||

IAST: idhmaṁ yas te jabharac chaśramāṇo maho agne anīkam ā saparyan
Griffith: Whoso with toil and trouble brings thee fuel, serving the majesty of mighty Agni,
Devanāgarī: इध्मं यस्ते जभरच्छश्रमाणो महो अग्ने अनीकमा सपर्यन्
pada pāṭha: idhmam | yaḥ | te | jabharat | śaśramāṇaḥ | mahaḥ | agne | anīkam | ā | saparyan || saḥ | idhānaḥ | prati | doṣām | uṣasam | puṣyan | rayim | sacate | ghnan | amitrān ||4.12.2||

IAST: sa idhānaḥ prati doṣām uṣāsam puṣyan rayiṁ sacate ghnann amitrān
Griffith: He, kindling thee at evening and at morning, prospers, and comes to wealth, and slays his foemen.
Devanāgarī: स इधानः प्रति दोषामुषासं पुष्यन्रयिं सचते घ्नन्नमित्रान्
pada pāṭha: idhmam | yaḥ | te | jabharat | śaśramāṇaḥ | mahaḥ | agne | anīkam | ā | saparyan || saḥ | idhānaḥ | prati | doṣām | uṣasam | puṣyan | rayim | sacate | ghnan | amitrān ||4.12.2||

IAST: agnir īśe bṛhataḥ kṣatriyasyāgnir vājasya paramasya rāyaḥ
Griffith: Agni is Master of sublime dominion, Agni is Lord of strength and lofty riches.
Devanāgarī: अग्निरीशे बृहतः क्षत्रियस्याग्निर्वाजस्य परमस्य रायः
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | īśe | br̥hataḥ | kṣatriyasya | agniḥ | vājasya | paramasya | rāyaḥ || dadhāti | ratnam | vidhate | yaviṣṭhaḥ | vi | ānuṣak | martyāya | svadhā-vān ||4.12.3||

IAST: dadhāti ratnaṁ vidhate yaviṣṭho vy ānuṣaṅ martyāya svadhāvān
Griffith: Straightway the self-reliant God, Most Youthful, gives treasures to the mortal who adores him.
Devanāgarī: दधाति रत्नं विधते यविष्ठो व्यानुषङ्मर्त्याय स्वधावान्
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | īśe | br̥hataḥ | kṣatriyasya | agniḥ | vājasya | paramasya | rāyaḥ || dadhāti | ratnam | vidhate | yaviṣṭhaḥ | vi | ānuṣak | martyāya | svadhā-vān ||4.12.3||

IAST: yac cid dhi te puruṣatrā yaviṣṭhācittibhiś cakṛmā kac cid āgaḥ
Griffith: Most Youthful God, whatever sin, through folly, we here, as human beings, have committed,
Devanāgarī: यच्चिद्धि ते पुरुषत्रा यविष्ठाचित्तिभिश्चकृमा कच्चिदागः
pada pāṭha: yat | cit | hi | te | puruṣa-trā | yaviṣṭha | acitti-bhiḥ | cakr̥ma | kat | cit | āgaḥ || kr̥dhi | su | asmān | aditeḥ | anāgān | vi | enāṁsi | śiśrathaḥ | viṣvak | agne ||4.12.4||

IAST: kṛdhī ṣv asmām̐ aditer anāgān vy enāṁsi śiśratho viṣvag agne
Griffith: In sight of Aditi make thou us sinless remit, entirely, Agni, our offences.
Devanāgarī: कृधी ष्वस्माँ अदितेरनागान्व्येनांसि शिश्रथो विष्वगग्ने
pada pāṭha: yat | cit | hi | te | puruṣa-trā | yaviṣṭha | acitti-bhiḥ | cakr̥ma | kat | cit | āgaḥ || kr̥dhi | su | asmān | aditeḥ | anāgān | vi | enāṁsi | śiśrathaḥ | viṣvak | agne ||4.12.4||

IAST: mahaś cid agna enaso abhīka ūrvād devānām uta martyānām
Griffith: Even in the presence of great sin, O Agni, free us from prison of the Gods or mortals.
Devanāgarī: महश्चिदग्न एनसो अभीक ऊर्वाद्देवानामुत मर्त्यानाम्
pada pāṭha: mahaḥ | cit | agne | enasaḥ | abhīke | ūrvāt | devānām | uta | martyānām || mā | te | sakhāyaḥ | sadam | it | riṣāma | yaccha | tokāya | tanayāya | śam | yoḥ ||4.12.5||

IAST: mā te sakhāyaḥ sadam id riṣāma yacchā tokāya tanayāya śaṁ yoḥ
Griffith: Never may we who are thy friends be injured: grant health and strength unto our seed and offspring.
Devanāgarī: मा ते सखायः सदमिद्रिषाम यच्छा तोकाय तनयाय शं योः
pada pāṭha: mahaḥ | cit | agne | enasaḥ | abhīke | ūrvāt | devānām | uta | martyānām || mā | te | sakhāyaḥ | sadam | it | riṣāma | yaccha | tokāya | tanayāya | śam | yoḥ ||4.12.5||

IAST: yathā ha tyad vasavo gauryaṁ cit padi ṣitām amuñcatā yajatrāḥ
Griffith: Even as ye here, Gods Excellent and Holy, have loosed the cow that by the foot was tethered,
Devanāgarī: यथा ह त्यद्वसवो गौर्यं चित्पदि षिताममुञ्चता यजत्राः
pada pāṭha: yathā | ha | tyat | vasavaḥ | gauryam | cit | padi | sitām | amuñcata | yajatrāḥ || evo iti | su | asmat | muñcata | vi | aṁhaḥ | pra | tāri | agne | pra-taram | naḥ | āyuḥ ||4.12.6||

IAST: evo ṣv asman muñcatā vy aṁhaḥ pra tāry agne prataraṁ na āyuḥ
Griffith: So also set us free from this affliction long let our life, O Agni, be extended.
Devanāgarī: एवो ष्वस्मन्मुञ्चता व्यंहः प्र तार्यग्ने प्रतरं न आयुः
pada pāṭha: yathā | ha | tyat | vasavaḥ | gauryam | cit | padi | sitām | amuñcata | yajatrāḥ || evo iti | su | asmat | muñcata | vi | aṁhaḥ | pra | tāri | agne | pra-taram | naḥ | āyuḥ ||4.12.6||

IAST: praty agnir uṣasām agram akhyad vibhātīnāṁ sumanā ratnadheyam
Griffith: AGNI hath looked, benevolently-minded, on the wealth-giving spring of radiant Mornings.
Devanāgarī: प्रत्यग्निरुषसामग्रमख्यद्विभातीनां सुमना रत्नधेयम्
pada pāṭha: prati | agniḥ | uṣasām | agram | akhyat | vi-bhātīnām | su-manāḥ | ratna-dheyam || yātam | aśvinā | su-kr̥taḥ | duroṇam | ut | sūryaḥ | jyotiṣā | devaḥ | eti ||4.13.1||

IAST: yātam aśvinā sukṛto duroṇam ut sūryo jyotiṣā deva eti
Griffith: Come, Asvins, to the dwelling of the pious: Surya the God is rising with his splendour.
Devanāgarī: यातमश्विना सुकृतो दुरोणमुत्सूर्यो ज्योतिषा देव एति
pada pāṭha: prati | agniḥ | uṣasām | agram | akhyat | vi-bhātīnām | su-manāḥ | ratna-dheyam || yātam | aśvinā | su-kr̥taḥ | duroṇam | ut | sūryaḥ | jyotiṣā | devaḥ | eti ||4.13.1||

IAST: ūrdhvam bhānuṁ savitā devo aśred drapsaṁ davidhvad gaviṣo na satvā
Griffith: Savitar, God, hath spread on high his lustre, waving his flag like a spoil-seeking hero.
Devanāgarī: ऊर्ध्वं भानुं सविता देवो अश्रेद्द्रप्सं दविध्वद्गविषो न सत्वा
pada pāṭha: ūrdhvam | bhānum | savitā | devaḥ | aśret | drapsam | davidhvat | go-iṣaḥ | na | satvā || anu | vratam | varuṇaḥ | yanti | mitraḥ | yat | sūryam | divi | ā-rohayanti ||4.13.2||

IAST: anu vrataṁ varuṇo yanti mitro yat sūryaṁ divy ārohayanti
Griffith: Their stablished way go Varuna and Mitra, what time they make the Sun ascend the heaven.
Devanāgarī: अनु व्रतं वरुणो यन्ति मित्रो यत्सूर्यं दिव्यारोहयन्ति
pada pāṭha: ūrdhvam | bhānum | savitā | devaḥ | aśret | drapsam | davidhvat | go-iṣaḥ | na | satvā || anu | vratam | varuṇaḥ | yanti | mitraḥ | yat | sūryam | divi | ā-rohayanti ||4.13.2||

IAST: yaṁ sīm akṛṇvan tamase vipṛce dhruvakṣemā anavasyanto artham
Griffith: Him whom they made to drive away the darkness, Lords of sure mansions, constant to their object,
Devanāgarī: यं सीमकृण्वन्तमसे विपृचे ध्रुवक्षेमा अनवस्यन्तो अर्थम्
pada pāṭha: yam | sīm | akr̥ṇvan | tamase | vi-pr̥ce | dhruva-kṣemāḥ | anava-syantaḥ | artham || tam | sūryam | haritaḥ | sapta | yahvīḥ | spaśam | viśvasya | jagataḥ | vahanti ||4.13.3||

IAST: taṁ sūryaṁ haritaḥ sapta yahvīḥ spaśaṁ viśvasya jagato vahanti
Griffith: Him who beholds the universe, the Sun-God, seven strong and youthful Coursers carry onward.
Devanāgarī: तं सूर्यं हरितः सप्त यह्वीः स्पशं विश्वस्य जगतो वहन्ति
pada pāṭha: yam | sīm | akr̥ṇvan | tamase | vi-pr̥ce | dhruva-kṣemāḥ | anava-syantaḥ | artham || tam | sūryam | haritaḥ | sapta | yahvīḥ | spaśam | viśvasya | jagataḥ | vahanti ||4.13.3||

IAST: vahiṣṭhebhir viharan yāsi tantum avavyayann asitaṁ deva vasma
Griffith: Spreading thy web with mightiest Steeds thou comest, rending apart, thou God, the black-hued mantle.
Devanāgarī: वहिष्ठेभिर्विहरन्यासि तन्तुमवव्ययन्नसितं देव वस्म
pada pāṭha: vahiṣṭhebhiḥ | vi-haran | yāsi | tantum | ava-vyayan | asitam | deva | vasma || davidhvataḥ | raśmayaḥ | sūryasya | carma-iva | ava | adhuḥ | tamaḥ | ap-su | antariti ||4.13.4||

IAST: davidhvato raśmayaḥ sūryasya carmevāvādhus tamo apsv antaḥ
Griffith: The rays of Surya tremulously shining sink, like a hide, the darkness in the waters.
Devanāgarī: दविध्वतो रश्मयः सूर्यस्य चर्मेवावाधुस्तमो अप्स्वन्तः
pada pāṭha: vahiṣṭhebhiḥ | vi-haran | yāsi | tantum | ava-vyayan | asitam | deva | vasma || davidhvataḥ | raśmayaḥ | sūryasya | carma-iva | ava | adhuḥ | tamaḥ | ap-su | antariti ||4.13.4||

IAST: anāyato anibaddhaḥ kathāyaṁ nyaṅṅ uttāno 'va padyate na
Griffith: How is it that, unbound and not supported, he falleth not although directed downward?
Devanāgarī: अनायतो अनिबद्धः कथायं न्यङ्ङुत्तानोऽव पद्यते न
pada pāṭha: anāyataḥ | ani-baddhaḥ | kathā | ayam | nyaṅ | uttānaḥ | ava | padyate | na || kayā | yāti | svadhayā | kaḥ | dadarśa | divaḥ | skambhaḥ | sam-r̥taḥ | pāti | nākam ||4.13.5||

IAST: kayā yāti svadhayā ko dadarśa divaḥ skambhaḥ samṛtaḥ pāti nākam
Griffith: By what self power moves he? Who liath seen it? He guards the vault of heaven, a close-set pillar.
Devanāgarī: कया याति स्वधया को ददर्श दिवः स्कम्भः समृतः पाति नाकम्
pada pāṭha: anāyataḥ | ani-baddhaḥ | kathā | ayam | nyaṅ | uttānaḥ | ava | padyate | na || kayā | yāti | svadhayā | kaḥ | dadarśa | divaḥ | skambhaḥ | sam-r̥taḥ | pāti | nākam ||4.13.5||

IAST: praty agnir uṣaso jātavedā akhyad devo rocamānā mahobhiḥ
Griffith: THE God hath looked, even Agni Jatavedas, to meet the Dawns refulgent in their glories.
Devanāgarī: प्रत्यग्निरुषसो जातवेदा अख्यद्देवो रोचमाना महोभिः
pada pāṭha: prati | agniḥ | uṣasaḥ | jāta-vedāḥ | akhyat | devaḥ | rocamānāḥ | mahaḥ-bhiḥ || ā | nāsatyā | uru-gāyā | rathena | imam | yajñam | upa | naḥ | yātam | accha ||4.14.1||

IAST: ā nāsatyorugāyā rathenemaṁ yajñam upa no yātam accha
Griffith: Come on your chariot, ye who travel widely, come to this sacrifice of ours, Nasatyas.
Devanāgarī: आ नासत्योरुगाया रथेनेमं यज्ञमुप नो यातमच्छ
pada pāṭha: prati | agniḥ | uṣasaḥ | jāta-vedāḥ | akhyat | devaḥ | rocamānāḥ | mahaḥ-bhiḥ || ā | nāsatyā | uru-gāyā | rathena | imam | yajñam | upa | naḥ | yātam | accha ||4.14.1||

IAST: ūrdhvaṁ ketuṁ savitā devo aśrej jyotir viśvasmai bhuvanāya kṛṇvan
Griffith: Producing light for all the world of creatures, God Savitar hath raised aloft his banner.
Devanāgarī: ऊर्ध्वं केतुं सविता देवो अश्रेज्ज्योतिर्विश्वस्मै भुवनाय कृण्वन्
pada pāṭha: ūrdhvam | ketum | savitā | devaḥ | aśret | jyotiḥ | viśvasmai | bhuvanāya | kr̥ṇvan || ā | aprāḥ | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | antarikṣam | vi | sūryaḥ | raśmi-bhiḥ | cekitānaḥ ||4.14.2||

IAST: āprā dyāvāpṛthivī antarikṣaṁ vi sūryo raśmibhiś cekitānaḥ
Griffith: Making his presence known by sunbeams, Surya hath filled the firmament and earth and heaven.
Devanāgarī: आप्रा द्यावापृथिवी अन्तरिक्षं वि सूर्यो रश्मिभिश्चेकितानः
pada pāṭha: ūrdhvam | ketum | savitā | devaḥ | aśret | jyotiḥ | viśvasmai | bhuvanāya | kr̥ṇvan || ā | aprāḥ | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | antarikṣam | vi | sūryaḥ | raśmi-bhiḥ | cekitānaḥ ||4.14.2||

IAST: āvahanty aruṇīr jyotiṣāgān mahī citrā raśmibhiś cekitānā
Griffith: Red Dawn.is come, riding with brightness onward, distinguished by her beams, gay-hued and mighty.
Devanāgarī: आवहन्त्यरुणीर्ज्योतिषागान्मही चित्रा रश्मिभिश्चेकिताना
pada pāṭha: ā-vahantī | aruṇīḥ | jyotiṣā | ā | agāt | mahī | citrā | raśmi-bhiḥ | cekitānā || pra-bodhayantī | suvitāya | devī | uṣāḥ | īyate | su-yujā | rathena ||4.14.3||

IAST: prabodhayantī suvitāya devy uṣā īyate suyujā rathena
Griffith: Dawn on her nobly-harnessed car, the Goddess, awaking men to happiness, approacheth.
Devanāgarī: प्रबोधयन्ती सुविताय देव्युषा ईयते सुयुजा रथेन
pada pāṭha: ā-vahantī | aruṇīḥ | jyotiṣā | ā | agāt | mahī | citrā | raśmi-bhiḥ | cekitānā || pra-bodhayantī | suvitāya | devī | uṣāḥ | īyate | su-yujā | rathena ||4.14.3||

IAST: ā vāṁ vahiṣṭhā iha te vahantu rathā aśvāsa uṣaso vyuṣṭau
Griffith: May those most powerful steeds and chariot bring you, O Asvins, hither at the break of morning.
Devanāgarī: आ वां वहिष्ठा इह ते वहन्तु रथा अश्वास उषसो व्युष्टौ
pada pāṭha: ā | vām | vahiṣṭhāḥ | iha | te | vahantu | rathāḥ | aśvāsaḥ | uṣasaḥ | vi-uṣṭau || ime | hi | vām | madhu-peyāya | somāḥ | asmin | yajñe | vr̥ṣaṇā | mādayethām ||4.14.4||

IAST: ime hi vām madhupeyāya somā asmin yajñe vṛṣaṇā mādayethām
Griffith: Here for your drauglit of meath are Soma juices: at this our sacrifice rejoice, ye Mighty.
Devanāgarī: इमे हि वां मधुपेयाय सोमा अस्मिन्यज्ञे वृषणा मादयेथाम्
pada pāṭha: ā | vām | vahiṣṭhāḥ | iha | te | vahantu | rathāḥ | aśvāsaḥ | uṣasaḥ | vi-uṣṭau || ime | hi | vām | madhu-peyāya | somāḥ | asmin | yajñe | vr̥ṣaṇā | mādayethām ||4.14.4||

IAST: anāyato anibaddhaḥ kathāyaṁ nyaṅṅ uttāno 'va padyate na
Griffith: How is it that, unbound and unsupported, he falleth not although directed downward?
Devanāgarī: अनायतो अनिबद्धः कथायं न्यङ्ङुत्तानोऽव पद्यते न
pada pāṭha: anāyataḥ | ani-baddhaḥ | kathā | ayam | nyaṅ | uttānaḥ | ava | padyate | na || kayā | yāti | svadhayā | kaḥ | dadarśa | divaḥ | skambhaḥ | sam-r̥taḥ | pāti | nākam ||4.14.5||

IAST: kayā yāti svadhayā ko dadarśa divaḥ skambhaḥ samṛtaḥ pāti nākam
Griffith: By what self-power moves he? Who hath seen it? He guards the vault of heaven, a close-set pillar?
Devanāgarī: कया याति स्वधया को ददर्श दिवः स्कम्भः समृतः पाति नाकम्
pada pāṭha: anāyataḥ | ani-baddhaḥ | kathā | ayam | nyaṅ | uttānaḥ | ava | padyate | na || kayā | yāti | svadhayā | kaḥ | dadarśa | divaḥ | skambhaḥ | sam-r̥taḥ | pāti | nākam ||4.14.5||

IAST: agnir hotā no adhvare vājī san pari ṇīyate
Griffith: AGNI the Herald, like a horse, is led forth at our solemn rite,
Devanāgarī: अग्निर्होता नो अध्वरे वाजी सन्परि णीयते
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | hotā | naḥ | adhvare | vājī | san | pari | nīyate || devaḥ | deveṣu | yajñiyaḥ ||4.15.1||

IAST: devo deveṣu yajñiyaḥ
Griffith: God among Gods adorable.
Devanāgarī: देवो देवेषु यज्ञियः
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | hotā | naḥ | adhvare | vājī | san | pari | nīyate || devaḥ | deveṣu | yajñiyaḥ ||4.15.1||

IAST: pari triviṣṭy adhvaraṁ yāty agnī rathīr iva
Griffith: Three times unto our solemn rite comes Agni like a charioteer,
Devanāgarī: परि त्रिविष्ट्यध्वरं यात्यग्नी रथीरिव
pada pāṭha: pari | tri-viṣṭi | adhvaram | yāti | agniḥ | rathīḥ-iva || ā | deveṣu | prayaḥ | dadhat ||4.15.2||

IAST: ā deveṣu prayo dadhat
Griffith: Bearing the viands to the Gods.
Devanāgarī: आ देवेषु प्रयो दधत्
pada pāṭha: pari | tri-viṣṭi | adhvaram | yāti | agniḥ | rathīḥ-iva || ā | deveṣu | prayaḥ | dadhat ||4.15.2||

IAST: pari vājapatiḥ kavir agnir havyāny akramīt
Griffith: Round the oblations hath he paced, Agni the Wise, the Lord of Strength,
Devanāgarī: परि वाजपतिः कविरग्निर्हव्यान्यक्रमीत्
pada pāṭha: pari | vāja-patiḥ | kaviḥ | agniḥ | havyāni | akramīt || dadhat | ratnāni | dāśuṣe ||4.15.3||

IAST: dadhad ratnāni dāśuṣe
Griffith: Giving the offerer precious boons.
Devanāgarī: दधद्रत्नानि दाशुषे
pada pāṭha: pari | vāja-patiḥ | kaviḥ | agniḥ | havyāni | akramīt || dadhat | ratnāni | dāśuṣe ||4.15.3||

IAST: ayaṁ yaḥ sṛñjaye puro daivavāte samidhyate
Griffith: He who is kindled eastward for Srnjaya, Devavata's son,
Devanāgarī: अयं यः सृञ्जये पुरो दैववाते समिध्यते
pada pāṭha: ayam | yaḥ | sr̥ñjaye | puraḥ | daiva-vāte | sam-idhyate || dyu-mān | amitra-dambhanaḥ ||4.15.4||

IAST: dyumām̐ amitradambhanaḥ
Griffith: Resplendent, tamer of the foe.
Devanāgarī: द्युमाँ अमित्रदम्भनः
pada pāṭha: ayam | yaḥ | sr̥ñjaye | puraḥ | daiva-vāte | sam-idhyate || dyu-mān | amitra-dambhanaḥ ||4.15.4||

IAST: asya ghā vīra īvato 'gner īśīta martyaḥ
Griffith: So mighty be the Agni whom the mortal hero shall command,
Devanāgarī: अस्य घा वीर ईवतोऽग्नेरीशीत मर्त्यः
pada pāṭha: asya | gha | vīraḥ | īvataḥ | agneḥ | īśīta | martyaḥ || tigma-jambhasya | mīḷhuṣaḥ ||4.15.5||

IAST: tigmajambhasya mīḻhuṣaḥ
Griffith: With sharpened teeth and bountiful.
Devanāgarī: तिग्मजम्भस्य मीळ्हुषः
pada pāṭha: asya | gha | vīraḥ | īvataḥ | agneḥ | īśīta | martyaḥ || tigma-jambhasya | mīḷhuṣaḥ ||4.15.5||

IAST: tam arvantaṁ na sānasim aruṣaṁ na divaḥ śiśum
Griffith: Day after day they dress him, as they clean a horse who wins the prize.
Devanāgarī: तमर्वन्तं न सानसिमरुषं न दिवः शिशुम्
pada pāṭha: tam | arvantam | na | sānasim | aruṣam | na | divaḥ | śiśum || marmr̥jyante | dive-dive ||4.15.6||

IAST: marmṛjyante dive-dive
Griffith: Dress the red Scion of the Sky.
Devanāgarī: मर्मृज्यन्ते दिवेदिवे
pada pāṭha: tam | arvantam | na | sānasim | aruṣam | na | divaḥ | śiśum || marmr̥jyante | dive-dive ||4.15.6||

IAST: bodhad yan mā haribhyāṁ kumāraḥ sāhadevyaḥ
Griffith: When Sahadeva's princely son with two bay horses thought of me,
Devanāgarī: बोधद्यन्मा हरिभ्यां कुमारः साहदेव्यः
pada pāṭha: bodhat | yat | mā | hari-bhyām | kumāraḥ | sāha-devyaḥ || accha | na | hūtaḥ | ut | aram ||4.15.7||

IAST: acchā na hūta ud aram
Griffith: Summoned by him I drew not back.
Devanāgarī: अच्छा न हूत उदरम्
pada pāṭha: bodhat | yat | mā | hari-bhyām | kumāraḥ | sāha-devyaḥ || accha | na | hūtaḥ | ut | aram ||4.15.7||

IAST: uta tyā yajatā harī kumārāt sāhadevyāt
Griffith: And truly those two noble bays I straightway took when offered me,
Devanāgarī: उत त्या यजता हरी कुमारात्साहदेव्यात्
pada pāṭha: uta | tyā | yajatā | harī iti | kumārāt | sāha-devyāt || pra-yatā | sadyaḥ | ā | dade ||4.15.8||

IAST: prayatā sadya ā dade
Griffith: From Sahadeva's princely son.
Devanāgarī: प्रयता सद्य आ ददे
pada pāṭha: uta | tyā | yajatā | harī iti | kumārāt | sāha-devyāt || pra-yatā | sadyaḥ | ā | dade ||4.15.8||

IAST: eṣa vāṁ devāv aśvinā kumāraḥ sāhadevyaḥ
Griffith: Long, O ye Asvins, may he live, your care, ye Gods, the princely son.
Devanāgarī: एष वां देवावश्विना कुमारः साहदेव्यः
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | vām | devau | aśvinā | kumāraḥ | sāha-devyaḥ || dīrgha-āyuḥ | astu | somakaḥ ||4.15.9||

IAST: dīrghāyur astu somakaḥ
Griffith: Of Sahadeva, Somaka.
Devanāgarī: दीर्घायुरस्तु सोमकः
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | vām | devau | aśvinā | kumāraḥ | sāha-devyaḥ || dīrgha-āyuḥ | astu | somakaḥ ||4.15.9||

IAST: taṁ yuvaṁ devāv aśvinā kumāraṁ sāhadevyam
Griffith: Cause him the youthful prince, the son of Sahadeva, to enjoy
Devanāgarī: तं युवं देवावश्विना कुमारं साहदेव्यम्
pada pāṭha: tam | yuvam | devau | aśvinā | kumāram | sāha-devyam || dīrgha-āyuṣam | kr̥ṇotana ||4.15.10||

IAST: dīrghāyuṣaṁ kṛṇotana
Griffith: Long life, O Asvins, O ye Gods.
Devanāgarī: दीर्घायुषं कृणोतन
pada pāṭha: tam | yuvam | devau | aśvinā | kumāram | sāha-devyam || dīrgha-āyuṣam | kr̥ṇotana ||4.15.10||

IAST: ā satyo yātu maghavām̐ ṛjīṣī dravantv asya haraya upa naḥ
Griffith: IMPETUOUS, true, let Maghavan come hither, and let his Tawny Coursers speed to reach us.
Devanāgarī: आ सत्यो यातु मघवाँ ऋजीषी द्रवन्त्वस्य हरय उप नः
pada pāṭha: ā | satyaḥ | yātu | magha-vān | r̥jīṣī | dravantu | asya | harayaḥ | upa | naḥ || tasmai | it | andhaḥ | susuma | su-dakṣam | iha | abhi-pitvam | karate | gr̥ṇānaḥ ||4.16.1||

IAST: tasmā id andhaḥ suṣumā sudakṣam ihābhipitvaṁ karate gṛṇānaḥ
Griffith: For him have we pressed juice exceeding potent: here, praised with song, let him effect his visit.
Devanāgarī: तस्मा इदन्धः सुषुमा सुदक्षमिहाभिपित्वं करते गृणानः
pada pāṭha: ā | satyaḥ | yātu | magha-vān | r̥jīṣī | dravantu | asya | harayaḥ | upa | naḥ || tasmai | it | andhaḥ | susuma | su-dakṣam | iha | abhi-pitvam | karate | gr̥ṇānaḥ ||4.16.1||

IAST: ava sya śūrādhvano nānte 'smin no adya savane mandadhyai
Griffith: Unyoke, as at thy journey's end, O Hero, to gladden thee today at this libation.
Devanāgarī: अव स्य शूराध्वनो नान्तेऽस्मिन्नो अद्य सवने मन्दध्यै
pada pāṭha: ava | sya | śūra | adhvanaḥ | na | ante | asmin | naḥ | adya | savane | mandadhyai || śaṁsāti | uktham | uśanā-iva | vedhāḥ | cikituṣe | asuryāya | manma ||4.16.2||

IAST: śaṁsāty uktham uśaneva vedhāś cikituṣe asuryāya manma
Griffith: Like Usana, the priest a laud shall utter, a hymn to thee, the Lord Divine, who markest.
Devanāgarī: शंसात्युक्थमुशनेव वेधाश्चिकितुषे असुर्याय मन्म
pada pāṭha: ava | sya | śūra | adhvanaḥ | na | ante | asmin | naḥ | adya | savane | mandadhyai || śaṁsāti | uktham | uśanā-iva | vedhāḥ | cikituṣe | asuryāya | manma ||4.16.2||

IAST: kavir na niṇyaṁ vidathāni sādhan vṛṣā yat sekaṁ vipipāno arcāt
Griffith: When the Bull, quaffing, praises our Iibation, as a sage paying holy rites in secret,
Devanāgarī: कविर्न निण्यं विदथानि साधन्वृषा यत्सेकं विपिपानो अर्चात्
pada pāṭha: kaviḥ | na | niṇyam | vidathāni | sādhan | vr̥ṣā | yat | sekam | vi-pipānaḥ | arcāt || divaḥ | itthā | jījanat | sapta | kārūn | ahnā | cit | cakruḥ | vayunā | gr̥ṇantaḥ ||4.16.3||

IAST: diva itthā jījanat sapta kārūn ahnā cic cakrur vayunā gṛṇantaḥ
Griffith: Seven singers here from heaven hath he begotten, who e'en by day have wrought their works while singing.
Devanāgarī: दिव इत्था जीजनत्सप्त कारूनह्ना चिच्चक्रुर्वयुना गृणन्तः
pada pāṭha: kaviḥ | na | niṇyam | vidathāni | sādhan | vr̥ṣā | yat | sekam | vi-pipānaḥ | arcāt || divaḥ | itthā | jījanat | sapta | kārūn | ahnā | cit | cakruḥ | vayunā | gr̥ṇantaḥ ||4.16.3||

IAST: svar yad vedi sudṛśīkam arkair mahi jyotī rurucur yad dha vastoḥ
Griffith: When heaven's fair light by hymns was made apparent (they made great splendour shine at break of morning),
Devanāgarī: स्वर्यद्वेदि सुदृशीकमर्कैर्महि ज्योती रुरुचुर्यद्ध वस्तोः
pada pāṭha: svaḥ | yat | vedi | su-dr̥śīkam | arkaiḥ | mahi | jyotiḥ | rurucuḥ | yat | ha | vastoḥ || andhā | tamāṁsi | dudhitā | vi-cakṣe | nr̥-bhyaḥ | cakāra | nr̥-tamaḥ | abhiṣṭau ||4.16.4||

IAST: andhā tamāṁsi dudhitā vicakṣe nṛbhyaś cakāra nṛtamo abhiṣṭau
Griffith: He with his succour, best of Heroes, scattered the blinding darkness so that men saw clearly.
Devanāgarī: अन्धा तमांसि दुधिता विचक्षे नृभ्यश्चकार नृतमो अभिष्टौ
pada pāṭha: svaḥ | yat | vedi | su-dr̥śīkam | arkaiḥ | mahi | jyotiḥ | rurucuḥ | yat | ha | vastoḥ || andhā | tamāṁsi | dudhitā | vi-cakṣe | nr̥-bhyaḥ | cakāra | nr̥-tamaḥ | abhiṣṭau ||4.16.4||

IAST: vavakṣa indro amitam ṛjīṣy ubhe ā paprau rodasī mahitvā
Griffith: Indra, Impetuous One, hath waxed immensely: he with his vastness hath filled earth and heaven.
Devanāgarī: ववक्ष इन्द्रो अमितमृजीष्युभे आ पप्रौ रोदसी महित्वा
pada pāṭha: vavakṣe | indraḥ | amitam | r̥jīṣī | ubhe iti | ā | paprau | rodasī iti | mahi-tvā || ataḥ | cit | asya | mahimā | vi | reci | abhi | yaḥ | viśvā | bhuvanā | babhūva ||4.16.5||

IAST: ataś cid asya mahimā vi recy abhi yo viśvā bhuvanā babhūva
Griffith: E'en beyond this his majesty extendeth who hath exceeded all the worlds in greatness.
Devanāgarī: अतश्चिदस्य महिमा वि रेच्यभि यो विश्वा भुवना बभूव
pada pāṭha: vavakṣe | indraḥ | amitam | r̥jīṣī | ubhe iti | ā | paprau | rodasī iti | mahi-tvā || ataḥ | cit | asya | mahimā | vi | reci | abhi | yaḥ | viśvā | bhuvanā | babhūva ||4.16.5||

IAST: viśvāni śakro naryāṇi vidvān apo rireca sakhibhir nikāmaiḥ
Griffith: Sakra who knoweth well all human actions hath with his eager Friends let loose the waters.
Devanāgarī: विश्वानि शक्रो नर्याणि विद्वानपो रिरेच सखिभिर्निकामैः
pada pāṭha: viśvāni | śakraḥ | naryāṇi | vidvān | apaḥ | rireca | sakhi-bhiḥ | ni-kāmaiḥ || aśmānam | cit | ye | bibhiduḥ | vacaḥ-bhiḥ | vrajam | go-mantam | uśijaḥ | vi | vavruriti vavruḥ ||4.16.6||

IAST: aśmānaṁ cid ye bibhidur vacobhir vrajaṁ gomantam uśijo vi vavruḥ
Griffith: They with their songs cleft e'en the mountain open and willingly disclosed the stall of cattle.
Devanāgarī: अश्मानं चिद्ये बिभिदुर्वचोभिर्व्रजं गोमन्तमुशिजो वि वव्रुः
pada pāṭha: viśvāni | śakraḥ | naryāṇi | vidvān | apaḥ | rireca | sakhi-bhiḥ | ni-kāmaiḥ || aśmānam | cit | ye | bibhiduḥ | vacaḥ-bhiḥ | vrajam | go-mantam | uśijaḥ | vi | vavruriti vavruḥ ||4.16.6||

IAST: apo vṛtraṁ vavrivāṁsam parāhan prāvat te vajram pṛthivī sacetāḥ
Griffith: He smote away the floods' obstructer, Vrtra; Earth, conscious, lent her aid to speed thy thunder.
Devanāgarī: अपो वृत्रं वव्रिवांसं पराहन्प्रावत्ते वज्रं पृथिवी सचेताः
pada pāṭha: apaḥ | vr̥tram | vavri-vāṁsam | parā | ahan | pra | āvat | te | vajram | pr̥thivī | sa-cetāḥ || pra | arṇāṁsi | samudriyāṇi | ainoḥ | patiḥ | bhavan | śavasā | śūra | dhr̥ṣṇo iti ||4.16.7||

IAST: prārṇāṁsi samudriyāṇy ainoḥ patir bhavañ chavasā śūra dhṛṣṇo
Griffith: Thou sentest forth the waters of the ocean, as Lord through power and might, O daring Hero.
Devanāgarī: प्रार्णांसि समुद्रियाण्यैनोः पतिर्भवञ्छवसा शूर धृष्णो
pada pāṭha: apaḥ | vr̥tram | vavri-vāṁsam | parā | ahan | pra | āvat | te | vajram | pr̥thivī | sa-cetāḥ || pra | arṇāṁsi | samudriyāṇi | ainoḥ | patiḥ | bhavan | śavasā | śūra | dhr̥ṣṇo iti ||4.16.7||

IAST: apo yad adrim puruhūta dardar āvir bhuvat saramā pūrvyaṁ te
Griffith: When, Much-invoked! the water's rock thou cleftest, Sarama showed herself and went before thee.
Devanāgarī: अपो यदद्रिं पुरुहूत दर्दराविर्भुवत्सरमा पूर्व्यं ते
pada pāṭha: apaḥ | yat | adrim | puru-hūta | dardaḥ | āviḥ | bhuvat | saramā | pūrvyam | te || saḥ | naḥ | netā | vājam | ā | darṣi | bhūrim | gotrā | rujan | aṅgiraḥ-bhiḥ | gr̥ṇānaḥ ||4.16.8||

IAST: sa no netā vājam ā darṣi bhūriṁ gotrā rujann aṅgirobhir gṛṇānaḥ
Griffith: Hymned by Angirases, bursting the cowstalls, much strength thou foundest for us as our leader.
Devanāgarī: स नो नेता वाजमा दर्षि भूरिं गोत्रा रुजन्नङ्गिरोभिर्गृणानः
pada pāṭha: apaḥ | yat | adrim | puru-hūta | dardaḥ | āviḥ | bhuvat | saramā | pūrvyam | te || saḥ | naḥ | netā | vājam | ā | darṣi | bhūrim | gotrā | rujan | aṅgiraḥ-bhiḥ | gr̥ṇānaḥ ||4.16.8||

IAST: acchā kaviṁ nṛmaṇo gā abhiṣṭau svarṣātā maghavan nādhamānam
Griffith: Come, Maghavan, Friend of Man, to aid the singer imploring thee in battle for the sunlight.
Devanāgarī: अच्छा कविं नृमणो गा अभिष्टौ स्वर्षाता मघवन्नाधमानम्
pada pāṭha: accha | kavim | nr̥-manaḥ | gāḥ | abhiṣṭau | svaḥ-sātā | magha-van | nādhamānam || ūti-bhiḥ | tam | iṣaṇaḥ | dyumna-hūtau | ni | māyā-vān | abrahmā | dasyuḥ | arta ||4.16.9||

IAST: ūtibhis tam iṣaṇo dyumnahūtau ni māyāvān abrahmā dasyur arta
Griffith: Speed him with help in his irypired invokings: down sink the sorcerer, the prayerless Dasyu.
Devanāgarī: ऊतिभिस्तमिषणो द्युम्नहूतौ नि मायावानब्रह्मा दस्युरर्त
pada pāṭha: accha | kavim | nr̥-manaḥ | gāḥ | abhiṣṭau | svaḥ-sātā | magha-van | nādhamānam || ūti-bhiḥ | tam | iṣaṇaḥ | dyumna-hūtau | ni | māyā-vān | abrahmā | dasyuḥ | arta ||4.16.9||

IAST: ā dasyughnā manasā yāhy astam bhuvat te kutsaḥ sakhye nikāmaḥ
Griffith: Come to our home resolved to slay the Dasyu: Kutsa longed eagerly to win thy friendship.
Devanāgarī: आ दस्युघ्ना मनसा याह्यस्तं भुवत्ते कुत्सः सख्ये निकामः
pada pāṭha: ā | dasyu-ghnā | manasā | yāhi | astam | bhuvat | te | kutsaḥ | sakhye | ni-kāmaḥ || sve | yonau | ni | sadatam | sa-rūpā | vi | vām | cikitsat | r̥ta-cit | ha | nārī ||4.16.10||

IAST: sve yonau ni ṣadataṁ sarūpā vi vāṁ cikitsad ṛtacid dha nārī
Griffith: Alike in form ye both sate in his dwelling the faithful Lady was in doubt between you.
Devanāgarī: स्वे योनौ नि षदतं सरूपा वि वां चिकित्सदृतचिद्ध नारी
pada pāṭha: ā | dasyu-ghnā | manasā | yāhi | astam | bhuvat | te | kutsaḥ | sakhye | ni-kāmaḥ || sve | yonau | ni | sadatam | sa-rūpā | vi | vām | cikitsat | r̥ta-cit | ha | nārī ||4.16.10||

IAST: yāsi kutsena saratham avasyus todo vātasya haryor īśānaḥ
Griffith: Thou comest, fain to succour him, with Kutsa,-a goad that masters both the Wind-God's horses,
Devanāgarī: यासि कुत्सेन सरथमवस्युस्तोदो वातस्य हर्योरीशानः
pada pāṭha: yāsi | kutsena | sa-ratham | avasyuḥ | todaḥ | vātasya | haryoḥ | īśānaḥ || r̥jrā | vājam | na | gadhyam | yuyūṣan | kaviḥ | yat | ahan | pāryāya | bhūṣāt ||4.16.11||

IAST: ṛjrā vājaṁ na gadhyaṁ yuyūṣan kavir yad ahan pāryāya bhūṣāt
Griffith: That, holding the brown steeds like spoil for capture, the sage may on the final day be present.
Devanāgarī: ऋज्रा वाजं न गध्यं युयूषन्कविर्यदहन्पार्याय भूषात्
pada pāṭha: yāsi | kutsena | sa-ratham | avasyuḥ | todaḥ | vātasya | haryoḥ | īśānaḥ || r̥jrā | vājam | na | gadhyam | yuyūṣan | kaviḥ | yat | ahan | pāryāya | bhūṣāt ||4.16.11||

IAST: kutsāya śuṣṇam aśuṣaṁ ni barhīḥ prapitve ahnaḥ kuyavaṁ sahasrā
Griffith: For Kutsa, with thy thousand, thou at day-break didst hurl down greedy Susna, foe of harvest.
Devanāgarī: कुत्साय शुष्णमशुषं नि बर्हीः प्रपित्वे अह्नः कुयवं सहस्रा
pada pāṭha: kutsāya | śuṣṇam | aśuṣam | ni | barhīḥ | pra-pitve | ahnaḥ | kuyavam | sahasrā || sadyaḥ | dasyūn | pra | mr̥ṇa | kutsyena | pra | sūraḥ | cakram | vr̥hatāt | abhīke ||4.16.12||

IAST: sadyo dasyūn pra mṛṇa kutsyena pra sūraś cakraṁ vṛhatād abhīke
Griffith: Quickly with Kutsa's friend destroy the Dasyus, and roll the chariot-wheel of Sarya near us.
Devanāgarī: सद्यो दस्यून्प्र मृण कुत्स्येन प्र सूरश्चक्रं वृहतादभीके
pada pāṭha: kutsāya | śuṣṇam | aśuṣam | ni | barhīḥ | pra-pitve | ahnaḥ | kuyavam | sahasrā || sadyaḥ | dasyūn | pra | mr̥ṇa | kutsyena | pra | sūraḥ | cakram | vr̥hatāt | abhīke ||4.16.12||

IAST: tvam piprum mṛgayaṁ śūśuvāṁsam ṛjiśvane vaidathināya randhīḥ
Griffith: Thou to the son of Vidathin, Rjisvan, gavest up mighty Mrgaya and Pipru.
Devanāgarī: त्वं पिप्रुं मृगयं शूशुवांसमृजिश्वने वैदथिनाय रन्धीः
pada pāṭha: tvam | piprum | mr̥gayam | śūśu-vāṁsam | r̥jiśvane | vaidathināya | randhīḥ || pañcāśat | kr̥ṣṇā | ni | vapaḥ | sahasrā | atkam | na | puraḥ | jarimā | vi | dardariti dardaḥ ||4.16.13||

IAST: pañcāśat kṛṣṇā ni vapaḥ sahasrātkaṁ na puro jarimā vi dardaḥ
Griffith: Thou smotest down the swarthy fifty thousand, and rentest forts as age consumes a garment.
Devanāgarī: पञ्चाशत्कृष्णा नि वपः सहस्रात्कं न पुरो जरिमा वि दर्दः
pada pāṭha: tvam | piprum | mr̥gayam | śūśu-vāṁsam | r̥jiśvane | vaidathināya | randhīḥ || pañcāśat | kr̥ṣṇā | ni | vapaḥ | sahasrā | atkam | na | puraḥ | jarimā | vi | dardariti dardaḥ ||4.16.13||

IAST: sūra upāke tanvaṁ dadhāno vi yat te cety amṛtasya varpaḥ
Griffith: What time thou settest near the Sun thy body, thy form, Immortal One, is seen expanding:
Devanāgarī: सूर उपाके तन्वं दधानो वि यत्ते चेत्यमृतस्य वर्पः
pada pāṭha: sūraḥ | upāke | tanvam | dadhānaḥ | vi | yat | te | ceti | amr̥tasya | varpaḥ || mr̥gaḥ | na | hastī | taviṣīm | uṣāṇaḥ | siṁhaḥ | na | bhīmaḥ | āyudhāni | bibhrat ||4.16.14||

IAST: mṛgo na hastī taviṣīm uṣāṇaḥ siṁho na bhīma āyudhāni bibhrat
Griffith: Thou a wild elephant with might invested. like a dread lion as thou wieldest weapons.
Devanāgarī: मृगो न हस्ती तविषीमुषाणः सिंहो न भीम आयुधानि बिभ्रत्
pada pāṭha: sūraḥ | upāke | tanvam | dadhānaḥ | vi | yat | te | ceti | amr̥tasya | varpaḥ || mr̥gaḥ | na | hastī | taviṣīm | uṣāṇaḥ | siṁhaḥ | na | bhīmaḥ | āyudhāni | bibhrat ||4.16.14||

IAST: indraṁ kāmā vasūyanto agman svarmīḻhe na savane cakānāḥ
Griffith: Wishes for wealth have gone to Indra, longing for him in war for light and at libation,
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रं कामा वसूयन्तो अग्मन्स्वर्मीळ्हे न सवने चकानाः
pada pāṭha: indram | kāmāḥ | vasu-yantaḥ | agman | svaḥ-mīḷhe | na | savane | cakānāḥ || śravasyavaḥ | śaśamānāsaḥ | ukthaiḥ | okaḥ | na | raṇvā | sudr̥śī-iva | puṣṭiḥ ||4.16.15||

IAST: śravasyavaḥ śaśamānāsa ukthair oko na raṇvā sudṛśīva puṣṭiḥ
Griffith: Eager for glory, labouring with praisesongs: he is like home, like sweet and fair nutrition.
Devanāgarī: श्रवस्यवः शशमानास उक्थैरोको न रण्वा सुदृशीव पुष्टिः
pada pāṭha: indram | kāmāḥ | vasu-yantaḥ | agman | svaḥ-mīḷhe | na | savane | cakānāḥ || śravasyavaḥ | śaśamānāsaḥ | ukthaiḥ | okaḥ | na | raṇvā | sudr̥śī-iva | puṣṭiḥ ||4.16.15||

IAST: tam id va indraṁ suhavaṁ huvema yas tā cakāra naryā purūṇi
Griffith: Call we for you that Indra, prompt to listen, him who hath done so much for men's advantage;
Devanāgarī: तमिद्व इन्द्रं सुहवं हुवेम यस्ता चकार नर्या पुरूणि
pada pāṭha: tam | it | vaḥ | indram | su-havam | huvema | yaḥ | tā | cakāra | naryā | purūṇi || yaḥ | mā-vate | jaritre | gadhyam | cit | makṣu | vājam | bharati | spārha-rādhāḥ ||4.16.16||

IAST: yo māvate jaritre gadhyaṁ cin makṣū vājam bharati spārharādhāḥ
Griffith: Who, Lord of envied bounty, to a singer like me brings quickly booty worth the capture.
Devanāgarī: यो मावते जरित्रे गध्यं चिन्मक्षू वाजं भरति स्पार्हराधाः
pada pāṭha: tam | it | vaḥ | indram | su-havam | huvema | yaḥ | tā | cakāra | naryā | purūṇi || yaḥ | mā-vate | jaritre | gadhyam | cit | makṣu | vājam | bharati | spārha-rādhāḥ ||4.16.16||

IAST: tigmā yad antar aśaniḥ patāti kasmiñ cic chūra muhuke janānām
Griffith: When the sharp-pointed arrow, O thou Hero, flieth mid any conflict of the people,
Devanāgarī: तिग्मा यदन्तरशनिः पताति कस्मिञ्चिच्छूर मुहुके जनानाम्
pada pāṭha: tigmā | yat | antaḥ | aśaniḥ | patāti | kasmin | cit | śūra | muhuke | janānām || ghorā | yat | arya | sam-r̥tiḥ | bhavāti | adha | sma | naḥ | tanvaḥ | bodhi | gopāḥ ||4.16.17||

IAST: ghorā yad arya samṛtir bhavāty adha smā nas tanvo bodhi gopāḥ
Griffith: When, Faithful One, the dread encounter cometh, then be thou the Protector of our body.
Devanāgarī: घोरा यदर्य समृतिर्भवात्यध स्मा नस्तन्वो बोधि गोपाः
pada pāṭha: tigmā | yat | antaḥ | aśaniḥ | patāti | kasmin | cit | śūra | muhuke | janānām || ghorā | yat | arya | sam-r̥tiḥ | bhavāti | adha | sma | naḥ | tanvaḥ | bodhi | gopāḥ ||4.16.17||

IAST: bhuvo 'vitā vāmadevasya dhīnām bhuvaḥ sakhāvṛko vājasātau
Griffith: Further the holy thoughts of Vamadeva be thou a guileless Friend in fight for booty.
Devanāgarī: भुवोऽविता वामदेवस्य धीनां भुवः सखावृको वाजसातौ
pada pāṭha: bhuvaḥ | avitā | vāma-devasya | dhīnām | bhuvaḥ | sakhā | avr̥kaḥ | vāja-sātau || tvām | anu | pra-matim | ā | jaganma | uru-śaṁsaḥ | jaritre | viśvadha | syāḥ ||4.16.18||

IAST: tvām anu pramatim ā jaganmoruśaṁso jaritre viśvadha syāḥ
Griffith: We come to thee whose providence protects us: wide be thy sway for ever for thy singer.
Devanāgarī: त्वामनु प्रमतिमा जगन्मोरुशंसो जरित्रे विश्वध स्याः
pada pāṭha: bhuvaḥ | avitā | vāma-devasya | dhīnām | bhuvaḥ | sakhā | avr̥kaḥ | vāja-sātau || tvām | anu | pra-matim | ā | jaganma | uru-śaṁsaḥ | jaritre | viśvadha | syāḥ ||4.16.18||

IAST: ebhir nṛbhir indra tvāyubhiṣ ṭvā maghavadbhir maghavan viśva ājau
Griffith: O Indra, with these men who love thee truly, free givers, Maghavan, in every battle,
Devanāgarī: एभिर्नृभिरिन्द्र त्वायुभिष्ट्वा मघवद्भिर्मघवन्विश्व आजौ
pada pāṭha: ebhiḥ | nr̥-bhiḥ | indra | tvāyu-bhiḥ | tvā | maghavat-bhiḥ | magha-van | viśve | ājau || dyāvaḥ | na | dyumnaiḥ | abhi | santaḥ | aryaḥ | kṣapaḥ | madema | śaradaḥ | ca | pūrvīḥ ||4.16.19||

IAST: dyāvo na dyumnair abhi santo aryaḥ kṣapo madema śaradaś ca pūrvīḥ
Griffith: May we rejoice through many autumns, quelling our foes, as days subdue the nights with splendour.
Devanāgarī: द्यावो न द्युम्नैरभि सन्तो अर्यः क्षपो मदेम शरदश्च पूर्वीः
pada pāṭha: ebhiḥ | nr̥-bhiḥ | indra | tvāyu-bhiḥ | tvā | maghavat-bhiḥ | magha-van | viśve | ājau || dyāvaḥ | na | dyumnaiḥ | abhi | santaḥ | aryaḥ | kṣapaḥ | madema | śaradaḥ | ca | pūrvīḥ ||4.16.19||

IAST: eved indrāya vṛṣabhāya vṛṣṇe brahmākarma bhṛgavo na ratham
Griffith: Now, as the Bhrgus wrought a car, for Indra the Strong, the Mighty, we our prayer have fashioned,
Devanāgarī: एवेदिन्द्राय वृषभाय वृष्णे ब्रह्माकर्म भृगवो न रथम्
pada pāṭha: eva | it | indrāya | vr̥ṣabhāya | vr̥ṣṇe | brahma | akarma | bhr̥gavaḥ | na | ratham || nu | cit | yathā | naḥ | sakhyā | vi-yoṣat | asat | naḥ | ugraḥ | avitā | tanū-pāḥ ||4.16.20||

IAST: nū cid yathā naḥ sakhyā viyoṣad asan na ugro 'vitā tanūpāḥ
Griffith: That he may, ne'er withdraw from us his friendship, but be our bodies' guard and strong defender.
Devanāgarī: नू चिद्यथा नः सख्या वियोषदसन्न उग्रोऽविता तनूपाः
pada pāṭha: eva | it | indrāya | vr̥ṣabhāya | vr̥ṣṇe | brahma | akarma | bhr̥gavaḥ | na | ratham || nu | cit | yathā | naḥ | sakhyā | vi-yoṣat | asat | naḥ | ugraḥ | avitā | tanū-pāḥ ||4.16.20||

IAST: nū ṣṭuta indra nū gṛṇāna iṣaṁ jaritre nadyo na pīpeḥ
Griffith: Now, Indra! lauded, glorified with praises, let power swell. high like rivers for the singer.
Devanāgarī: नू ष्टुत इन्द्र नू गृणान इषं जरित्रे नद्यो न पीपेः
pada pāṭha: nu | stutaḥ | indra | nu | gr̥ṇānaḥ | iṣam | jaritre | nadyaḥ | na | pīperiti pīpeḥ || akāri | te | hari-vaḥ | brahma | navyam | dhiyā | syāma | rathyaḥ | sadā-sāḥ ||4.16.21||

IAST: akāri te harivo brahma navyaṁ dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ
Griffith: For thee a new hymn, Lord of Bays, is fashioned. May we, car-borne, through song be victors ever.
Devanāgarī: अकारि ते हरिवो ब्रह्म नव्यं धिया स्याम रथ्यः सदासाः
pada pāṭha: nu | stutaḥ | indra | nu | gr̥ṇānaḥ | iṣam | jaritre | nadyaḥ | na | pīperiti pīpeḥ || akāri | te | hari-vaḥ | brahma | navyam | dhiyā | syāma | rathyaḥ | sadā-sāḥ ||4.16.21||

IAST: tvam mahām̐ indra tubhyaṁ ha kṣā anu kṣatram maṁhanā manyata dyauḥ
Griffith: GREAT art thou, Indra; yea, the earth, with gladness, and heaven confess to thee thine high dominion.
Devanāgarī: त्वं महाँ इन्द्र तुभ्यं ह क्षा अनु क्षत्रं मंहना मन्यत द्यौः
pada pāṭha: tvam | mahān | indra | tubhyam | ha | kṣāḥ | anu | kṣatram | maṁhanā | manyata | dyauḥ || tvam | vr̥tram | śavasā | jaghanvān | sr̥jaḥ | sindhūn | ahinā | jagrasānān ||4.17.1||

IAST: tvaṁ vṛtraṁ śavasā jaghanvān sṛjaḥ sindhūm̐r ahinā jagrasānān
Griffith: Thou in thy vigour having slaughtered Vrtra didst free the floods arrested by the Dragon.
Devanāgarī: त्वं वृत्रं शवसा जघन्वान्सृजः सिन्धूँरहिना जग्रसानान्
pada pāṭha: tvam | mahān | indra | tubhyam | ha | kṣāḥ | anu | kṣatram | maṁhanā | manyata | dyauḥ || tvam | vr̥tram | śavasā | jaghanvān | sr̥jaḥ | sindhūn | ahinā | jagrasānān ||4.17.1||

IAST: tava tviṣo janiman rejata dyau rejad bhūmir bhiyasā svasya manyoḥ
Griffith: Heaven trembled at the birth of thine effulgence; Earth trembled at the fear of thy displeasure.
Devanāgarī: तव त्विषो जनिमन्रेजत द्यौ रेजद्भूमिर्भियसा स्वस्य मन्योः
pada pāṭha: tava | tviṣaḥ | janiman | rejata | dyauḥ | rejat | bhūmiḥ | bhiyasā | svasya | manyoḥ || r̥ghāyanta | su-bhvaḥ | parvatāsaḥ | ārdan | dhanvāni | sarayante | āpaḥ ||4.17.2||

IAST: ṛghāyanta subhvaḥ parvatāsa ārdan dhanvāni sarayanta āpaḥ
Griffith: The stedfast mountains shook in agitation . the waters flowed, and desert spots were flooded.
Devanāgarī: ऋघायन्त सुभ्वः पर्वतास आर्दन्धन्वानि सरयन्त आपः
pada pāṭha: tava | tviṣaḥ | janiman | rejata | dyauḥ | rejat | bhūmiḥ | bhiyasā | svasya | manyoḥ || r̥ghāyanta | su-bhvaḥ | parvatāsaḥ | ārdan | dhanvāni | sarayante | āpaḥ ||4.17.2||

IAST: bhinad giriṁ śavasā vajram iṣṇann āviṣkṛṇvānaḥ sahasāna ojaḥ
Griffith: Hurling his bolt with might he cleft the mountain, while, putting forth his strength, he showed his vigour.
Devanāgarī: भिनद्गिरिं शवसा वज्रमिष्णन्नाविष्कृण्वानः सहसान ओजः
pada pāṭha: bhinat | girim | śavasā | vajram | iṣṇan | āviḥ-kr̥ṇvānaḥ | sahasānaḥ | ojaḥ || vadhīt | vr̥tram | vajreṇa | mandasānaḥ | saran | āpaḥ | javasā | hata-vr̥ṣṇīḥ ||4.17.3||

IAST: vadhīd vṛtraṁ vajreṇa mandasānaḥ sarann āpo javasā hatavṛṣṇīḥ
Griffith: He slaughtered Vrtra with his bolt, exulting, and, their lord slain, forth flowed the waters swiftly.
Devanāgarī: वधीद्वृत्रं वज्रेण मन्दसानः सरन्नापो जवसा हतवृष्णीः
pada pāṭha: bhinat | girim | śavasā | vajram | iṣṇan | āviḥ-kr̥ṇvānaḥ | sahasānaḥ | ojaḥ || vadhīt | vr̥tram | vajreṇa | mandasānaḥ | saran | āpaḥ | javasā | hata-vr̥ṣṇīḥ ||4.17.3||

IAST: suvīras te janitā manyata dyaur indrasya kartā svapastamo bhūt
Griffith: Thy Father Dyaus esteemed himself a hero: most noble was the work of Indra's Maker,
Devanāgarī: सुवीरस्ते जनिता मन्यत द्यौरिन्द्रस्य कर्ता स्वपस्तमो भूत्
pada pāṭha: su-vīraḥ | te | janitā | manyata | dyauḥ | indrasya | kartā | svapaḥ-tamaḥ | bhūt || yaḥ | īm | jajāna | svaryam | su-vajram | anapa-cyutam | sadasaḥ | na | bhūma ||4.17.4||

IAST: ya īṁ jajāna svaryaṁ suvajram anapacyutaṁ sadaso na bhūma
Griffith: His who begat the strong bolt's Lord who roareth, immovable like earth from her foundation.
Devanāgarī: य ईं जजान स्वर्यं सुवज्रमनपच्युतं सदसो न भूम
pada pāṭha: su-vīraḥ | te | janitā | manyata | dyauḥ | indrasya | kartā | svapaḥ-tamaḥ | bhūt || yaḥ | īm | jajāna | svaryam | su-vajram | anapa-cyutam | sadasaḥ | na | bhūma ||4.17.4||

IAST: ya eka ic cyāvayati pra bhūmā rājā kṛṣṭīnām puruhūta indraḥ
Griffith: He who alone o'erthrows the world of creatures, Indra the peoples' King, invoked of many-
Devanāgarī: य एक इच्च्यावयति प्र भूमा राजा कृष्टीनां पुरुहूत इन्द्रः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | ekaḥ | it | cyavayati | pra | bhūma | rājā | kr̥ṣṭīnām | puru-hūtaḥ | indraḥ || satyam | enam | anu | viśve | madanti | rātim | devasya | gr̥ṇataḥ | maghonaḥ ||4.17.5||

IAST: satyam enam anu viśve madanti rātiṁ devasya gṛṇato maghonaḥ
Griffith: Verily all rejoice in him, extolling the boons which Maghavan the God hath sent them.
Devanāgarī: सत्यमेनमनु विश्वे मदन्ति रातिं देवस्य गृणतो मघोनः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | ekaḥ | it | cyavayati | pra | bhūma | rājā | kr̥ṣṭīnām | puru-hūtaḥ | indraḥ || satyam | enam | anu | viśve | madanti | rātim | devasya | gr̥ṇataḥ | maghonaḥ ||4.17.5||

IAST: satrā somā abhavann asya viśve satrā madāso bṛhato madiṣṭhāḥ
Griffith: All Soma juices are his own for ever, most gladdening draughts are ever his, the Mighty,
Devanāgarī: सत्रा सोमा अभवन्नस्य विश्वे सत्रा मदासो बृहतो मदिष्ठाः
pada pāṭha: satrā | somāḥ | abhavan | asya | viśve | satrā | madāsaḥ | br̥hataḥ | madiṣṭhāḥ || satrā | abhavaḥ | vasu-patiḥ | vasūnām | datre | viśvāḥ | adhithāḥ | indra | kr̥ṣṭīḥ ||4.17.6||

IAST: satrābhavo vasupatir vasūnāṁ datre viśvā adhithā indra kṛṣṭīḥ
Griffith: Thou ever wast the Treasure-Lord of treasures: Indra, thou lettest all folk share thy bounty.
Devanāgarī: सत्राभवो वसुपतिर्वसूनां दत्रे विश्वा अधिथा इन्द्र कृष्टीः
pada pāṭha: satrā | somāḥ | abhavan | asya | viśve | satrā | madāsaḥ | br̥hataḥ | madiṣṭhāḥ || satrā | abhavaḥ | vasu-patiḥ | vasūnām | datre | viśvāḥ | adhithāḥ | indra | kr̥ṣṭīḥ ||4.17.6||

IAST: tvam adha prathamaṁ jāyamāno 'me viśvā adhithā indra kṛṣṭīḥ
Griffith: Moreover, when thou first wast born, O Indra, thou struckest terror into all the people.
Devanāgarī: त्वमध प्रथमं जायमानोऽमे विश्वा अधिथा इन्द्र कृष्टीः
pada pāṭha: tvam | adha | prathamam | jāyamānaḥ | ame | viśvāḥ | adhithāḥ | indra | kr̥ṣṭīḥ || tvam | prati | pra-vataḥ | ā-śayānam | ahim | vajreṇa | magha-van | vi | vr̥ścaḥ ||4.17.7||

IAST: tvam prati pravata āśayānam ahiṁ vajreṇa maghavan vi vṛścaḥ
Griffith: Thou, Maghavan, rentest with thy bolt the Dragon who lay against the waterfloods of heaven.
Devanāgarī: त्वं प्रति प्रवत आशयानमहिं वज्रेण मघवन्वि वृश्चः
pada pāṭha: tvam | adha | prathamam | jāyamānaḥ | ame | viśvāḥ | adhithāḥ | indra | kr̥ṣṭīḥ || tvam | prati | pra-vataḥ | ā-śayānam | ahim | vajreṇa | magha-van | vi | vr̥ścaḥ ||4.17.7||

IAST: satrāhaṇaṁ dādhṛṣiṁ tumram indram mahām apāraṁ vṛṣabhaṁ suvajram
Griffith: The ever-slaying, bold and furious Indra, the bright bolt's Lord, infinite, strong and mighty,
Devanāgarī: सत्राहणं दाधृषिं तुम्रमिन्द्रं महामपारं वृषभं सुवज्रम्
pada pāṭha: satrā-hanan | dadhr̥ṣim | tumram | indram | mahām | apāram | vr̥ṣabham | su-vajram || hantā | yaḥ | vr̥tram | sanitā | uta | vājam | dātā | maghāni | magha-vā | su-rādhāḥ ||4.17.8||

IAST: hantā yo vṛtraṁ sanitota vājaṁ dātā maghāni maghavā surādhāḥ
Griffith: Who slayeth Vrtra and acquireth booty, giver of blessings, Maghavan the bounteous:
Devanāgarī: हन्ता यो वृत्रं सनितोत वाजं दाता मघानि मघवा सुराधाः
pada pāṭha: satrā-hanan | dadhr̥ṣim | tumram | indram | mahām | apāram | vr̥ṣabham | su-vajram || hantā | yaḥ | vr̥tram | sanitā | uta | vājam | dātā | maghāni | magha-vā | su-rādhāḥ ||4.17.8||

IAST: ayaṁ vṛtaś cātayate samīcīr ya ājiṣu maghavā śṛṇva ekaḥ
Griffith: Alone renowned as Maghavan in battles, he frighteneth away assembled armies.
Devanāgarī: अयं वृतश्चातयते समीचीर्य आजिषु मघवा शृण्व एकः
pada pāṭha: ayam | vr̥taḥ | cātayate | sam-īcīḥ | yaḥ | ājiṣu | magha-vā | śr̥ṇve | ekaḥ || ayam | vājam | bharati | yam | sanoti | asya | priyāsaḥ | sakhye | syāma ||4.17.9||

IAST: ayaṁ vājam bharati yaṁ sanoty asya priyāsaḥ sakhye syāma
Griffith: He bringeth us the booty that he winneth may we, well-loved, continue in his friendship.
Devanāgarī: अयं वाजं भरति यं सनोत्यस्य प्रियासः सख्ये स्याम
pada pāṭha: ayam | vr̥taḥ | cātayate | sam-īcīḥ | yaḥ | ājiṣu | magha-vā | śr̥ṇve | ekaḥ || ayam | vājam | bharati | yam | sanoti | asya | priyāsaḥ | sakhye | syāma ||4.17.9||

IAST: ayaṁ śṛṇve adha jayann uta ghnann ayam uta pra kṛṇute yudhā gāḥ
Griffith: Renowned is he when conquering and when slaying: 'fis he who winneth cattle in the combat.
Devanāgarī: अयं शृण्वे अध जयन्नुत घ्नन्नयमुत प्र कृणुते युधा गाः
pada pāṭha: ayam | śr̥ṇve | adha | jayan | uta | ghnan | ayam | uta | pra | kr̥ṇute | yudhā | gāḥ || yadā | satyam | kr̥ṇute | manyum | indraḥ | viśvam | dr̥ḷham | bhayate | ejat | asmāt ||4.17.10||

IAST: yadā satyaṁ kṛṇute manyum indro viśvaṁ dṛḻham bhayata ejad asmāt
Griffith: When Indra hardeneth his indignation all that is fixed and all that moveth fear him.
Devanāgarī: यदा सत्यं कृणुते मन्युमिन्द्रो विश्वं दृळ्हं भयत एजदस्मात्
pada pāṭha: ayam | śr̥ṇve | adha | jayan | uta | ghnan | ayam | uta | pra | kr̥ṇute | yudhā | gāḥ || yadā | satyam | kr̥ṇute | manyum | indraḥ | viśvam | dr̥ḷham | bhayate | ejat | asmāt ||4.17.10||

IAST: sam indro gā ajayat saṁ hiraṇyā sam aśviyā maghavā yo ha pūrvīḥ
Griffith: Indra hath won all kine, all gold, all horses,-Maghavan, he who breaketh forts in pieces;
Devanāgarī: समिन्द्रो गा अजयत्सं हिरण्या समश्विया मघवा यो ह पूर्वीः
pada pāṭha: sam | indraḥ | gāḥ | ajayat | sam | hiraṇyā | sam | aśviyā | magha-vā | yaḥ | ha | pūrvīḥ || ebhiḥ | nr̥-bhiḥ | nr̥-tamaḥ | asya | śākaiḥ | rāyaḥ | vi-bhaktā | sam-bharaḥ | ca | vasvaḥ ||4.17.11||

IAST: ebhir nṛbhir nṛtamo asya śākai rāyo vibhaktā sambharaś ca vasvaḥ
Griffith: Most manly with these men of his who help him, dealing out wealth and gathering the treasure.
Devanāgarī: एभिर्नृभिर्नृतमो अस्य शाकै रायो विभक्ता सम्भरश्च वस्वः
pada pāṭha: sam | indraḥ | gāḥ | ajayat | sam | hiraṇyā | sam | aśviyā | magha-vā | yaḥ | ha | pūrvīḥ || ebhiḥ | nr̥-bhiḥ | nr̥-tamaḥ | asya | śākaiḥ | rāyaḥ | vi-bhaktā | sam-bharaḥ | ca | vasvaḥ ||4.17.11||

IAST: kiyat svid indro adhy eti mātuḥ kiyat pitur janitur yo jajāna
Griffith: What is the care of Indra for his Mother, what cares he for the Father who begat him?
Devanāgarī: कियत्स्विदिन्द्रो अध्येति मातुः कियत्पितुर्जनितुर्यो जजान
pada pāṭha: kiyat | svit | indraḥ | adhi | eti | mātuḥ | kiyat | pituḥ | janituḥ | yaḥ | jajāna || yaḥ | asya | śuṣmam | muhukaiḥ | iyarti | vātaḥ | na | jūtaḥ | stanayat-bhiḥ | abhraiḥ ||4.17.12||

IAST: yo asya śuṣmam muhukair iyarti vāto na jūtaḥ stanayadbhir abhraiḥ
Griffith: His care is that which speeds his might in conflicts, like wind borne onward by the clouds that thunder.
Devanāgarī: यो अस्य शुष्मं मुहुकैरियर्ति वातो न जूतः स्तनयद्भिरभ्रैः
pada pāṭha: kiyat | svit | indraḥ | adhi | eti | mātuḥ | kiyat | pituḥ | janituḥ | yaḥ | jajāna || yaḥ | asya | śuṣmam | muhukaiḥ | iyarti | vātaḥ | na | jūtaḥ | stanayat-bhiḥ | abhraiḥ ||4.17.12||

IAST: kṣiyantaṁ tvam akṣiyantaṁ kṛṇotīyarti reṇum maghavā samoham
Griffith: Maghavan makes the settled man unsettled: he scatters dust that he hath swept together,
Devanāgarī: क्षियन्तं त्वमक्षियन्तं कृणोतीयर्ति रेणुं मघवा समोहम्
pada pāṭha: kṣiyantam | tvam | akṣiyantam | kr̥ṇoti | iyarti | reṇum | magha-vā | sam-oham || vi-bhañjanuḥ | aśanimān-iva | dyauḥ | uta | stotāram | magha-vā | vasau | dhāt ||4.17.13||

IAST: vibhañjanur aśanimām̐ iva dyaur uta stotāram maghavā vasau dhāt
Griffith: Breaking in pieces like Heaven armed with lightning: Maghavan shall enrich the man who lauds h;m.
Devanāgarī: विभञ्जनुरशनिमाँ इव द्यौरुत स्तोतारं मघवा वसौ धात्
pada pāṭha: kṣiyantam | tvam | akṣiyantam | kr̥ṇoti | iyarti | reṇum | magha-vā | sam-oham || vi-bhañjanuḥ | aśanimān-iva | dyauḥ | uta | stotāram | magha-vā | vasau | dhāt ||4.17.13||

IAST: ayaṁ cakram iṣaṇat sūryasya ny etaśaṁ rīramat sasṛmāṇam
Griffith: He urged the chariot-wheel of Surya forward: Etasa, speeding on his way, he rested.
Devanāgarī: अयं चक्रमिषणत्सूर्यस्य न्येतशं रीरमत्ससृमाणम्
pada pāṭha: ayam | cakram | iṣaṇat | sūryasya | ni | etaśam | rīramat | sasr̥māṇam || ā | kr̥ṣṇaḥ | īm | juhurāṇaḥ | jigharti | tvacaḥ | budhne | rajasaḥ | asya | yonau ||4.17.14||

IAST: ā kṛṣṇa īṁ juhurāṇo jigharti tvaco budhne rajaso asya yonau
Griffith: Him the black undulating cloud bedeweth, in this mid-air's depth, at the base of darkness,
Devanāgarī: आ कृष्ण ईं जुहुराणो जिघर्ति त्वचो बुध्ने रजसो अस्य योनौ
pada pāṭha: ayam | cakram | iṣaṇat | sūryasya | ni | etaśam | rīramat | sasr̥māṇam || ā | kr̥ṣṇaḥ | īm | juhurāṇaḥ | jigharti | tvacaḥ | budhne | rajasaḥ | asya | yonau ||4.17.14||

IAST: asiknyāṁ yajamāno na hotā
Griffith: As in the night the sacrificing priest.
Devanāgarī: असिक्न्यां यजमानो न होता॥ ४.०१७.१
pada pāṭha: asiknyām | yajamānaḥ | na | hotā ||4.17.15||

IAST: gavyanta indraṁ sakhyāya viprā aśvāyanto vṛṣaṇaṁ vājayantaḥ
Griffith: Eager for booty, craving strength and horses, we-singers stir Indra, the strong, for friendship,
Devanāgarī: गव्यन्त इन्द्रं सख्याय विप्रा अश्वायन्तो वृषणं वाजयन्तः
pada pāṭha: gavyantaḥ | indram | sakhyāya | viprāḥ | aśva-yantaḥ | vr̥ṣaṇam | vājayantaḥ || jani-yantaḥ | jani-dām | akṣita-ūtim | ā | cyavayāmaḥ | avate | na | kośam ||4.17.16||

IAST: janīyanto janidām akṣitotim ā cyāvayāmo 'vate na kośam
Griffith: Who gives the wives we seek, whose succour fails not, to hasten, like a pitcher to the fountain.
Devanāgarī: जनीयन्तो जनिदामक्षितोतिमा च्यावयामोऽवते न कोशम्
pada pāṭha: gavyantaḥ | indram | sakhyāya | viprāḥ | aśva-yantaḥ | vr̥ṣaṇam | vājayantaḥ || jani-yantaḥ | jani-dām | akṣita-ūtim | ā | cyavayāmaḥ | avate | na | kośam ||4.17.16||

IAST: trātā no bodhi dadṛśāna āpir abhikhyātā marḍitā somyānām
Griffith: Be thou our guardian, show thyself our kinsman, watching and blessing those who pour the Soma;
Devanāgarī: त्राता नो बोधि ददृशान आपिरभिख्याता मर्डिता सोम्यानाम्
pada pāṭha: trātā | naḥ | bodhi | dadr̥śānaḥ | āpiḥ | abhi-khyātā | marḍitā | somyānām || sakhā | pitā | pitr̥-tamaḥ | pitr̥̄ṇām | kartā | īm | ūm̐ iti | lokam | uśate | vayaḥ-dhāḥ ||4.17.17||

IAST: sakhā pitā pitṛtamaḥ pitṝṇāṁ kartem u lokam uśate vayodhāḥ
Griffith: As Friend, as Sire, most fatherly of fathers giving the suppliant vital strength and freedom.
Devanāgarī: सखा पिता पितृतमः पितॄणां कर्तेमु लोकमुशते वयोधाः
pada pāṭha: trātā | naḥ | bodhi | dadr̥śānaḥ | āpiḥ | abhi-khyātā | marḍitā | somyānām || sakhā | pitā | pitr̥-tamaḥ | pitr̥̄ṇām | kartā | īm | ūm̐ iti | lokam | uśate | vayaḥ-dhāḥ ||4.17.17||

IAST: sakhīyatām avitā bodhi sakhā gṛṇāna indra stuvate vayo dhāḥ
Griffith: Be helping Friend of those who seek thy friendship . give life, when lauded, Indra, to the singer.
Devanāgarī: सखीयतामविता बोधि सखा गृणान इन्द्र स्तुवते वयो धाः
pada pāṭha: sakhi-yatām | avitā | bodhi | sakhā | gr̥ṇānaḥ | indra | stuvate | vayaḥ | dhāḥ || vayam | hi | ā | te | cakr̥ma | sa-bādhaḥ | ābhiḥ | śamībhiḥ | mahayantaḥ | indra ||4.17.18||

IAST: vayaṁ hy ā te cakṛmā sabādha ābhiḥ śamībhir mahayanta indra
Griffith: For, Indra, we the priests have paid thee worship, exalting thee with these our sacrifices.
Devanāgarī: वयं ह्या ते चकृमा सबाध आभिः शमीभिर्महयन्त इन्द्र
pada pāṭha: sakhi-yatām | avitā | bodhi | sakhā | gr̥ṇānaḥ | indra | stuvate | vayaḥ | dhāḥ || vayam | hi | ā | te | cakr̥ma | sa-bādhaḥ | ābhiḥ | śamībhiḥ | mahayantaḥ | indra ||4.17.18||

IAST: stuta indro maghavā yad dha vṛtrā bhūrīṇy eko apratīni hanti
Griffith: Alone, when Indra Maghavan is lauded, he slayeth many ne'er-resisted Vrtras.
Devanāgarī: स्तुत इन्द्रो मघवा यद्ध वृत्रा भूरीण्येको अप्रतीनि हन्ति
pada pāṭha: stutaḥ | indraḥ | magha-vā | yat | ha | vr̥trā | bhūrīṇi | ekaḥ | apratīni | hanti || asya | priyaḥ | jaritā | yasya | śarman | nakiḥ | devāḥ | vārayante | na | martāḥ ||4.17.19||

IAST: asya priyo jaritā yasya śarman nakir devā vārayante na martāḥ
Griffith: Him in whose keeping is the well-loved singer never do Gods or mortals stay or hinder.
Devanāgarī: अस्य प्रियो जरिता यस्य शर्मन्नकिर्देवा वारयन्ते न मर्ताः
pada pāṭha: stutaḥ | indraḥ | magha-vā | yat | ha | vr̥trā | bhūrīṇi | ekaḥ | apratīni | hanti || asya | priyaḥ | jaritā | yasya | śarman | nakiḥ | devāḥ | vārayante | na | martāḥ ||4.17.19||

IAST: evā na indro maghavā virapśī karat satyā carṣaṇīdhṛd anarvā
