Griffith: E en so let Maghavan, the loud-voiced Indra, give us true blessings, foeless, men's upholder.
Devanāgarī: एवा न इन्द्रो मघवा विरप्शी करत्सत्या चर्षणीधृदनर्वा
pada pāṭha: eva | naḥ | indraḥ | magha-vā | vi-rapśī | karat | satyā | carṣaṇi-dhr̥t | anarvā || tvam | rājā | januṣām | dhehi | asme iti | adhi | śravaḥ | māhinam | yat | jaritre ||4.17.20||

IAST: tvaṁ rājā januṣāṁ dhehy asme adhi śravo māhinaṁ yaj jaritre
Griffith: King of all creatures, give us glory amply, exalted glory due to him who lauds thee.
Devanāgarī: त्वं राजा जनुषां धेह्यस्मे अधि श्रवो माहिनं यज्जरित्रे
pada pāṭha: eva | naḥ | indraḥ | magha-vā | vi-rapśī | karat | satyā | carṣaṇi-dhr̥t | anarvā || tvam | rājā | januṣām | dhehi | asme iti | adhi | śravaḥ | māhinam | yat | jaritre ||4.17.20||

IAST: nū ṣṭuta indra nū gṛṇāna iṣaṁ jaritre nadyo na pīpeḥ
Griffith: Now, Indra! lauded, glorified with praises, let power swell high like rivers for the singer.
Devanāgarī: नू ष्टुत इन्द्र नू गृणान इषं जरित्रे नद्यो न पीपेः
pada pāṭha: nu | stutaḥ | indra | nu | gr̥ṇānaḥ | iṣam | jaritre | nadyaḥ | na | pīperiti pīpeḥ || akāri | te | hari-vaḥ | brahma | navyam | dhiyā | syāma | rathyaḥ | sadā-sāḥ ||4.17.21||

IAST: akāri te harivo brahma navyaṁ dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ
Griffith: For thee a new hymn, Lord of Bays! is fashioned. May we, car-borne, through song be victors ever.
Devanāgarī: अकारि ते हरिवो ब्रह्म नव्यं धिया स्याम रथ्यः सदासाः
pada pāṭha: nu | stutaḥ | indra | nu | gr̥ṇānaḥ | iṣam | jaritre | nadyaḥ | na | pīperiti pīpeḥ || akāri | te | hari-vaḥ | brahma | navyam | dhiyā | syāma | rathyaḥ | sadā-sāḥ ||4.17.21||

IAST: ayam panthā anuvittaḥ purāṇo yato devā udajāyanta viśve
Griffith: THIS is the ancient and accepted pathway by which all Gods have come into existence.
Devanāgarī: अयं पन्था अनुवित्तः पुराणो यतो देवा उदजायन्त विश्वे
pada pāṭha: ayam | panthāḥ | anu-vittaḥ | purāṇaḥ | yataḥ | devāḥ | ut-ajāyanta | viśve || ataḥ | cit | ā | janiṣīṣṭa | pra-vr̥ddhaḥ | mā | mātaram | amuyā | pattave | kariti kaḥ ||4.18.1||

IAST: ataś cid ā janiṣīṣṭa pravṛddho mā mātaram amuyā pattave kaḥ
Griffith: Hereby could one be born though waxen mighty. Let him not, otherwise, destroy his Mother.
Devanāgarī: अतश्चिदा जनिषीष्ट प्रवृद्धो मा मातरममुया पत्तवे कः
pada pāṭha: ayam | panthāḥ | anu-vittaḥ | purāṇaḥ | yataḥ | devāḥ | ut-ajāyanta | viśve || ataḥ | cit | ā | janiṣīṣṭa | pra-vr̥ddhaḥ | mā | mātaram | amuyā | pattave | kariti kaḥ ||4.18.1||

IAST: nāham ato nir ayā durgahaitat tiraścatā pārśvān nir gamāṇi
Griffith: Not this way go I forth: hard is the passage. Forth from the side obliquely will I issue.
Devanāgarī: नाहमतो निरया दुर्गहैतत्तिरश्चता पार्श्वान्निर्गमाणि
pada pāṭha: na | aham | ataḥ | niḥ | aya | duḥ-gahā | etat | tiraścatā | pārśvāt | niḥ | gamāni || bahūni | me | akr̥tā | kartvāni | yudhyai | tvena | sam | tvena | pr̥cchai ||4.18.2||

IAST: bahūni me akṛtā kartvāni yudhyai tvena saṁ tvena pṛcchai
Griffith: Much that is yet undone must I accomplish; one must I combat and the other question.
Devanāgarī: बहूनि मे अकृता कर्त्वानि युध्यै त्वेन सं त्वेन पृच्छै
pada pāṭha: na | aham | ataḥ | niḥ | aya | duḥ-gahā | etat | tiraścatā | pārśvāt | niḥ | gamāni || bahūni | me | akr̥tā | kartvāni | yudhyai | tvena | sam | tvena | pr̥cchai ||4.18.2||

IAST: parāyatīm mātaram anv acaṣṭa na nānu gāny anu nū gamāni
Griffith: He bent his eye upon the dying Mother: My word I now withdraw. That way I follow.
Devanāgarī: परायतीं मातरमन्वचष्ट न नानु गान्यनु नू गमानि
pada pāṭha: parā-yatīm | mātaram | anu | acaṣṭa | na | na | anu | gāni | anu | nu | gamāni || tvaṣṭuḥ | gr̥he | apibat | somam | indraḥ | śata-dhanyam | camvoḥ | sutasya ||4.18.3||

IAST: tvaṣṭur gṛhe apibat somam indraḥ śatadhanyaṁ camvoḥ sutasya
Griffith: In Tvastar's dwelling India drank the Soma, a hundredworth of juice pressed from the mortar.
Devanāgarī: त्वष्टुर्गृहे अपिबत्सोममिन्द्रः शतधन्यं चम्वोः सुतस्य
pada pāṭha: parā-yatīm | mātaram | anu | acaṣṭa | na | na | anu | gāni | anu | nu | gamāni || tvaṣṭuḥ | gr̥he | apibat | somam | indraḥ | śata-dhanyam | camvoḥ | sutasya ||4.18.3||

IAST: kiṁ sa ṛdhak kṛṇavad yaṁ sahasram māso jabhāra śaradaś ca pūrvīḥ
Griffith: What strange act shall he do, he whom his Mother bore for a thousand months and many autumns?
Devanāgarī: किं स ऋधक्कृणवद्यं सहस्रं मासो जभार शरदश्च पूर्वीः
pada pāṭha: kim | saḥ | r̥dhak | kr̥ṇavat | yam | sahasram | māsaḥ | jabhāra | śaradaḥ | ca | pūrvīḥ || nahi | nu | āsya | prati-mānam | asti | antaḥ | jateṣu | uta | ye | jani-tvāḥ ||4.18.4||

IAST: nahī nv asya pratimānam asty antar jāteṣūta ye janitvāḥ
Griffith: No peer hath he among those born already, nor among those who shall be born hereafter.
Devanāgarī: नही न्वस्य प्रतिमानमस्त्यन्तर्जातेषूत ये जनित्वाः
pada pāṭha: kim | saḥ | r̥dhak | kr̥ṇavat | yam | sahasram | māsaḥ | jabhāra | śaradaḥ | ca | pūrvīḥ || nahi | nu | āsya | prati-mānam | asti | antaḥ | jateṣu | uta | ye | jani-tvāḥ ||4.18.4||

IAST: avadyam iva manyamānā guhākar indram mātā vīryeṇā nyṛṣṭam
Griffith: Deeming him a reproach, his mother hid him, Indra, endowed with all heroic valour.
Devanāgarī: अवद्यमिव मन्यमाना गुहाकरिन्द्रं माता वीर्येणा न्यृष्टम्
pada pāṭha: avadyam-iva | manyamānā | guhā | akaḥ | indram | mātā | vīryeṇa | ni-r̥ṣṭam || atha | ut | asthāt | svayam | atkam | vasānaḥ | ā | rodasī iti | apr̥ṇāt | jāyamānaḥ ||4.18.5||

IAST: athod asthāt svayam atkaṁ vasāna ā rodasī apṛṇāj jāyamānaḥ
Griffith: Then up he sprang himself, assumed his vesture, and filled, as soon as born, the earth and heaven.
Devanāgarī: अथोदस्थात्स्वयमत्कं वसान आ रोदसी अपृणाज्जायमानः
pada pāṭha: avadyam-iva | manyamānā | guhā | akaḥ | indram | mātā | vīryeṇa | ni-r̥ṣṭam || atha | ut | asthāt | svayam | atkam | vasānaḥ | ā | rodasī iti | apr̥ṇāt | jāyamānaḥ ||4.18.5||

IAST: etā arṣanty alalābhavantīr ṛtāvarīr iva saṁkrośamānāḥ
Griffith: With lively motion onward flow these waters, the Holy Ones, shouting, as 'twere, together.
Devanāgarī: एता अर्षन्त्यललाभवन्तीरृतावरीरिव संक्रोशमानाः
pada pāṭha: etāḥ | arṣanti | alalā-bhavantīḥ | r̥tavarīḥ-iva | sam-krośamānāḥ || etāḥ | vi | pr̥ccha | kim | idam | bhananti | kam | āpaḥ | adrim | pari-dhim | rujanti ||4.18.6||

IAST: etā vi pṛccha kim idam bhananti kam āpo adrim paridhiṁ rujanti
Griffith: Ask them to. tell thee what the floods are saying, what girdling rock the waters burst asunder.
Devanāgarī: एता वि पृच्छ किमिदं भनन्ति कमापो अद्रिं परिधिं रुजन्ति
pada pāṭha: etāḥ | arṣanti | alalā-bhavantīḥ | r̥tavarīḥ-iva | sam-krośamānāḥ || etāḥ | vi | pr̥ccha | kim | idam | bhananti | kam | āpaḥ | adrim | pari-dhim | rujanti ||4.18.6||

IAST: kim u ṣvid asmai nivido bhanantendrasyāvadyaṁ didhiṣanta āpaḥ
Griffith: Are they addressing him with words of welcome? Will the floods take on them the shame of Indra?
Devanāgarī: किमु ष्विदस्मै निविदो भनन्तेन्द्रस्यावद्यं दिधिषन्त आपः
pada pāṭha: kim | ūm̐ iti | svit | asmai | ni-vidaḥ | bhananta | indrasya | avadyam | didhiṣante | āpaḥ || mama | etān | putraḥ | mahatā | vadhena | vr̥tram | jaghanvān | asr̥jat | vi | sindhūn ||4.18.7||

IAST: mamaitān putro mahatā vadhena vṛtraṁ jaghanvām̐ asṛjad vi sindhūn
Griffith: With his great thunderbolt my Son hath slaughtered Vrtra, and set these rivers free to wander.
Devanāgarī: ममैतान्पुत्रो महता वधेन वृत्रं जघन्वाँ असृजद्वि सिन्धून्
pada pāṭha: kim | ūm̐ iti | svit | asmai | ni-vidaḥ | bhananta | indrasya | avadyam | didhiṣante | āpaḥ || mama | etān | putraḥ | mahatā | vadhena | vr̥tram | jaghanvān | asr̥jat | vi | sindhūn ||4.18.7||

IAST: mamac cana tvā yuvatiḥ parāsa mamac cana tvā kuṣavā jagāra
Griffith: I cast thee from me, mine,-thy youthful mother: thee, mine own offspring, Kusava hath swallowed.
Devanāgarī: ममच्चन त्वा युवतिः परास ममच्चन त्वा कुषवा जगार
pada pāṭha: mamat | cana | tvā | yuvatiḥ | parā-āsa | mamat | cana | tvā | kuṣavā | jagāra || mamat | cit | āpaḥ | śiśave | mamr̥ḍyuḥ | mamat | cit | indraḥ | sahasā | ut | atiṣṭhat ||4.18.8||

IAST: mamac cid āpaḥ śiśave mamṛḍyur mamac cid indraḥ sahasod atiṣṭhat
Griffith: To him, mine infant, were the waters gracious. Indra, my Son, rose up in conquering vigour.
Devanāgarī: ममच्चिदापः शिशवे ममृड्युर्ममच्चिदिन्द्रः सहसोदतिष्ठत्
pada pāṭha: mamat | cana | tvā | yuvatiḥ | parā-āsa | mamat | cana | tvā | kuṣavā | jagāra || mamat | cit | āpaḥ | śiśave | mamr̥ḍyuḥ | mamat | cit | indraḥ | sahasā | ut | atiṣṭhat ||4.18.8||

IAST: mamac cana te maghavan vyaṁso nivividhvām̐ apa hanū jaghāna
Griffith: Thou art mine own, O Maghavan, whom Vyamsa struck to the ground and smote thy jaws in pieces.
Devanāgarī: ममच्चन ते मघवन्व्यंसो निविविध्वाँ अप हनू जघान
pada pāṭha: mamat | cana | te | magha-van | vi-aṁsaḥ | ni-vividhvān | apa | hanū iti | jaghāna || adha | ni-viddhaḥ | ut-taraḥ | babhūvān | śiraḥ | dāsasya | sam | piṇak | vadhena ||4.18.9||

IAST: adhā nividdha uttaro babhūvāñ chiro dāsasya sam piṇag vadhena
Griffith: But, smitten through, the mastery thou wonnest, and with thy bolt the Dasa's head thou crushedst.
Devanāgarī: अधा निविद्ध उत्तरो बभूवाञ्छिरो दासस्य सं पिणग्वधेन
pada pāṭha: mamat | cana | te | magha-van | vi-aṁsaḥ | ni-vividhvān | apa | hanū iti | jaghāna || adha | ni-viddhaḥ | ut-taraḥ | babhūvān | śiraḥ | dāsasya | sam | piṇak | vadhena ||4.18.9||

IAST: gṛṣṭiḥ sasūva sthaviraṁ tavāgām anādhṛṣyaṁ vṛṣabhaṁ tumram indram
Griffith: The Heifer hath brought forth the Strong, the Mighty, the unconquerable Bull, the furious Indra.
Devanāgarī: गृष्टिः ससूव स्थविरं तवागामनाधृष्यं वृषभं तुम्रमिन्द्रम्
pada pāṭha: gr̥ṣṭiḥ | sasūva | sthaviram | tavāgām | anādhr̥ṣyam | vr̥ṣabham | tumram | indram || arīḷham | vatsam | carathāya | mātā | svayam | gātum | tanve | icchamānam ||4.18.10||

IAST: arīḻhaṁ vatsaṁ carathāya mātā svayaṁ gātuṁ tanva icchamānam
Griffith: The Mother left her unlicked Calf to wander, seeking himself, the path that he would follow.
Devanāgarī: अरीळ्हं वत्सं चरथाय माता स्वयं गातुं तन्व इच्छमानम्
pada pāṭha: gr̥ṣṭiḥ | sasūva | sthaviram | tavāgām | anādhr̥ṣyam | vr̥ṣabham | tumram | indram || arīḷham | vatsam | carathāya | mātā | svayam | gātum | tanve | icchamānam ||4.18.10||

IAST: uta mātā mahiṣam anv avenad amī tvā jahati putra devāḥ
Griffith: Then to her mighty Child the Mother turned her, saying, My son, these Deities forsake thee.
Devanāgarī: उत माता महिषमन्ववेनदमी त्वा जहति पुत्र देवाः
pada pāṭha: uta | mātā | mahiṣam | anu | avenat | amī iti | tvā | jahati | putra | devāḥ || atha | abravīt | vr̥tram | indraḥ | haniṣyan | sakhe | viṣṇo iti | vi-taram | vi | kramasva ||4.18.11||

IAST: athābravīd vṛtram indro haniṣyan sakhe viṣṇo vitaraṁ vi kramasva
Griffith: Then Indra said, about to slaughter Vrtra, O my friend Vrtra, stride full boldly forward.
Devanāgarī: अथाब्रवीद्वृत्रमिन्द्रो हनिष्यन्सखे विष्णो वितरं वि क्रमस्व
pada pāṭha: uta | mātā | mahiṣam | anu | avenat | amī iti | tvā | jahati | putra | devāḥ || atha | abravīt | vr̥tram | indraḥ | haniṣyan | sakhe | viṣṇo iti | vi-taram | vi | kramasva ||4.18.11||

IAST: kas te mātaraṁ vidhavām acakrac chayuṁ kas tvām ajighāṁsac carantam
Griffith: Who was he then who made thy Mother widow? Who sought to stay thee lying still or moving?
Devanāgarī: कस्ते मातरं विधवामचक्रच्छयुं कस्त्वामजिघांसच्चरन्तम्
pada pāṭha: kaḥ | te | mātaram | vidhavām | acakrat | śayum | kaḥ | tvām | ajighāṁsat | carantam || kaḥ | te | devaḥ | adhi | mārḍīke | āsīt | yat | pra | akṣiṇāḥ | pitaram | pāda-gr̥hya ||4.18.12||

IAST: kas te devo adhi mārḍīka āsīd yat prākṣiṇāḥ pitaram pādagṛhya
Griffith: What God, when by the foot thy Sire thou tookest and slewest, was at hand to give thee comfort?
Devanāgarī: कस्ते देवो अधि मार्डीक आसीद्यत्प्राक्षिणाः पितरं पादगृह्य
pada pāṭha: kaḥ | te | mātaram | vidhavām | acakrat | śayum | kaḥ | tvām | ajighāṁsat | carantam || kaḥ | te | devaḥ | adhi | mārḍīke | āsīt | yat | pra | akṣiṇāḥ | pitaram | pāda-gr̥hya ||4.18.12||

IAST: avartyā śuna āntrāṇi pece na deveṣu vivide marḍitāram
Griffith: In deep distress I cooked a dog's intestines. Among the Gods I found not one to comfort.
Devanāgarī: अवर्त्या शुन आन्त्राणि पेचे न देवेषु विविदे मर्डितारम्
pada pāṭha: avartyā | śunaḥ | āntrāṇi | pece | na | deveṣu | vivide | marḍitāram || apaśyam | jāyām | amahīyamānām | adha | me | śyenaḥ | madhu | ā | jabhāra ||4.18.13||

IAST: apaśyaṁ jāyām amahīyamānām adhā me śyeno madhv ā jabhāra
Griffith: My consort I beheld in degradation. The Falcon then brought me the pleasant Soma.
Devanāgarī: अपश्यं जायाममहीयमानामधा मे श्येनो मध्वा जभार
pada pāṭha: avartyā | śunaḥ | āntrāṇi | pece | na | deveṣu | vivide | marḍitāram || apaśyam | jāyām | amahīyamānām | adha | me | śyenaḥ | madhu | ā | jabhāra ||4.18.13||

IAST: evā tvām indra vajrinn atra viśve devāsaḥ suhavāsa ūmāḥ
Griffith: THEE, verily, O Thunder-wielding Indra, all the Gods here, the Helpers swift to listen,
Devanāgarī: एवा त्वामिन्द्र वज्रिन्नत्र विश्वे देवासः सुहवास ऊमाः
pada pāṭha: eva | tvām | indra | vajrin | atra | viśve | devāsaḥ | su-havāsaḥ | ūmāḥ || mahām | ubhe iti | rodasī iti | vr̥ddham | r̥ṣvam | niḥ | ekam | it | vr̥ṇate | vr̥tra-hatye ||4.19.1||

IAST: mahām ubhe rodasī vṛddham ṛṣvaṁ nir ekam id vṛṇate vṛtrahatye
Griffith: And both the worlds elected, thee the Mighty, High, waxen strong, alone to slaughter Vrtra.
Devanāgarī: महामुभे रोदसी वृद्धमृष्वं निरेकमिद्वृणते वृत्रहत्ये
pada pāṭha: eva | tvām | indra | vajrin | atra | viśve | devāsaḥ | su-havāsaḥ | ūmāḥ || mahām | ubhe iti | rodasī iti | vr̥ddham | r̥ṣvam | niḥ | ekam | it | vr̥ṇate | vr̥tra-hatye ||4.19.1||

IAST: avāsṛjanta jivrayo na devā bhuvaḥ samrāḻ indra satyayoniḥ
Griffith: The Gods, as worn witheld, relaxed their efforts: thou, Indra, born of truth, wast Sovran Ruler.
Devanāgarī: अवासृजन्त जिव्रयो न देवा भुवः सम्राळिन्द्र सत्ययोनिः
pada pāṭha: ava | asr̥janta | jivrayaḥ | na | devāḥ | bhuvaḥ | sam-rāṭ | indra | satya-yoniḥ || ahan | ahim | pari-śayānam | arṇaḥ | pra | vartanīḥ | aradaḥ | viśva-dhenāḥ ||4.19.2||

IAST: ahann ahim pariśayānam arṇaḥ pra vartanīr arado viśvadhenāḥ
Griffith: Thou slewest Ahi who besieged the waters, and duggest out their all-supporting channels.
Devanāgarī: अहन्नहिं परिशयानमर्णः प्र वर्तनीररदो विश्वधेनाः
pada pāṭha: ava | asr̥janta | jivrayaḥ | na | devāḥ | bhuvaḥ | sam-rāṭ | indra | satya-yoniḥ || ahan | ahim | pari-śayānam | arṇaḥ | pra | vartanīḥ | aradaḥ | viśva-dhenāḥ ||4.19.2||

IAST: atṛpṇuvantaṁ viyatam abudhyam abudhyamānaṁ suṣupāṇam indra
Griffith: The insatiate one, extended, hard to waken, who slumbered in perpetual sleep, O Indra,-
Devanāgarī: अतृप्णुवन्तं वियतमबुध्यमबुध्यमानं सुषुपाणमिन्द्र
pada pāṭha: atr̥pṇuvantam | vi-yatam | abudhyam | abudhyamānam | susupānam | indra || sapta | prati | pra-vataḥ | ā-śayānam | ahim | vajreṇa | vi | riṇāḥ | aparvan ||4.19.3||

IAST: sapta prati pravata āśayānam ahiṁ vajreṇa vi riṇā aparvan
Griffith: The Dragon stretched against the seven prone rivers, where no joint was, thou rentest with thy thunder.
Devanāgarī: सप्त प्रति प्रवत आशयानमहिं वज्रेण वि रिणा अपर्वन्
pada pāṭha: atr̥pṇuvantam | vi-yatam | abudhyam | abudhyamānam | susupānam | indra || sapta | prati | pra-vataḥ | ā-śayānam | ahim | vajreṇa | vi | riṇāḥ | aparvan ||4.19.3||

IAST: akṣodayac chavasā kṣāma budhnaṁ vār ṇa vātas taviṣībhir indraḥ
Griffith: Indra with might shook earth and her foundation as the wind stirs the water with its fury.
Devanāgarī: अक्षोदयच्छवसा क्षाम बुध्नं वार्ण वातस्तविषीभिरिन्द्रः
pada pāṭha: akṣodayat | śavasā | kṣāma | budhnam | vāḥ | na | vātaḥ | taviṣībhiḥ | indraḥ || dr̥ḷhāni | aubhnāt | uśamānaḥ | ojaḥ | ava | abhinat | kakubhaḥ | parvatānām ||4.19.4||

IAST: dṛḻhāny aubhnād uśamāna ojo 'vābhinat kakubhaḥ parvatānām
Griffith: Striving, with strength he burst the firm asunder, and tore away the summits of the mountains.
Devanāgarī: दृळ्हान्यौभ्नादुशमान ओजोऽवाभिनत्ककुभः पर्वतानाम्
pada pāṭha: akṣodayat | śavasā | kṣāma | budhnam | vāḥ | na | vātaḥ | taviṣībhiḥ | indraḥ || dr̥ḷhāni | aubhnāt | uśamānaḥ | ojaḥ | ava | abhinat | kakubhaḥ | parvatānām ||4.19.4||

IAST: abhi pra dadrur janayo na garbhaṁ rathā iva pra yayuḥ sākam adrayaḥ
Griffith: They ran to thee as mothers to their offspring: the clouds, like chariots, hastened forth together.
Devanāgarī: अभि प्र दद्रुर्जनयो न गर्भं रथा इव प्र ययुः साकमद्रयः
pada pāṭha: abhi | pra | dadruḥ | janayaḥ | na | garbham | rathāḥ-iva | pra | yayuḥ | sākam | adrayaḥ || atarpayaḥ | vi-sr̥taḥ | ubjaḥ | ūrmīn | tvam | vr̥tān | ariṇāḥ | indra | sindhūn ||4.19.5||

IAST: atarpayo visṛta ubja ūrmīn tvaṁ vṛtām̐ ariṇā indra sindhūn
Griffith: Thou didst refresh the streams and force the billows: thou, Indra, settest free obstructed rivers.
Devanāgarī: अतर्पयो विसृत उब्ज ऊर्मीन्त्वं वृताँ अरिणा इन्द्र सिन्धून्
pada pāṭha: abhi | pra | dadruḥ | janayaḥ | na | garbham | rathāḥ-iva | pra | yayuḥ | sākam | adrayaḥ || atarpayaḥ | vi-sr̥taḥ | ubjaḥ | ūrmīn | tvam | vr̥tān | ariṇāḥ | indra | sindhūn ||4.19.5||

IAST: tvam mahīm avaniṁ viśvadhenāṁ turvītaye vayyāya kṣarantīm
Griffith: Thou for the sake of Vayya and Turviti didst stay the great stream, flowing, allsustaining:
Devanāgarī: त्वं महीमवनिं विश्वधेनां तुर्वीतये वय्याय क्षरन्तीम्
pada pāṭha: tvam | mahīm | avanim | viśva-dhenām | turvītaye | vayyāya | kṣarantīm || aramayaḥ | namasā | ejat | arṇaḥ | su-taraṇān | akr̥ṇoḥ | indra | sindhūn ||4.19.6||

IAST: aramayo namasaijad arṇaḥ sutaraṇām̐ akṛṇor indra sindhūn
Griffith: Yea, at their prayer didst check the rushing river and make the floods easy to cross, O Indra.
Devanāgarī: अरमयो नमसैजदर्णः सुतरणाँ अकृणोरिन्द्र सिन्धून्
pada pāṭha: tvam | mahīm | avanim | viśva-dhenām | turvītaye | vayyāya | kṣarantīm || aramayaḥ | namasā | ejat | arṇaḥ | su-taraṇān | akr̥ṇoḥ | indra | sindhūn ||4.19.6||

IAST: prāgruvo nabhanvo na vakvā dhvasrā apinvad yuvatīr ṛtajñāḥ
Griffith: He let the young Maids skilled in Law, unwedded, like fountains, bubbling, flow forth streaming onward.
Devanāgarī: प्राग्रुवो नभन्वो न वक्वा ध्वस्रा अपिन्वद्युवतीरृतज्ञाः
pada pāṭha: pra | agruvaḥ | nabhanvaḥ | na | vakvāḥ | dhvasrāḥ | apinvat | yuvatīḥ | r̥ta-jñāḥ || dhanvāni | ajrān | apr̥ṇak | tr̥ṣāṇān | adhok | indraḥ | staryaḥ | dam-supatnīḥ ||4.19.7||

IAST: dhanvāny ajrām̐ apṛṇak tṛṣāṇām̐ adhog indraḥ staryo daṁsupatnīḥ
Griffith: He inundated thirsty plains and deserts, and milked the dry Cows of the mighty master.
Devanāgarī: धन्वान्यज्राँ अपृणक्तृषाणाँ अधोगिन्द्रः स्तर्यो दंसुपत्नीः
pada pāṭha: pra | agruvaḥ | nabhanvaḥ | na | vakvāḥ | dhvasrāḥ | apinvat | yuvatīḥ | r̥ta-jñāḥ || dhanvāni | ajrān | apr̥ṇak | tr̥ṣāṇān | adhok | indraḥ | staryaḥ | dam-supatnīḥ ||4.19.7||

IAST: pūrvīr uṣasaḥ śaradaś ca gūrtā vṛtraṁ jaghanvām̐ asṛjad vi sindhūn
Griffith: Through many a morn and many a lovely autumn, having slain Vrtra, lie set free the rivers.
Devanāgarī: पूर्वीरुषसः शरदश्च गूर्ता वृत्रं जघन्वाँ असृजद्वि सिन्धून्
pada pāṭha: pūrvīḥ | uṣasaḥ | śaradaḥ | ca | gūrtāḥ | vr̥tram | jaghanvān | asr̥jat | vi | sindhūn || pari-sthitāḥ | atr̥ṇat | badbadhānāḥ | sīrāḥ | indraḥ | sravitave | pr̥thivyā ||4.19.8||

IAST: pariṣṭhitā atṛṇad badbadhānāḥ sīrā indraḥ sravitave pṛthivyā
Griffith: Indra hath set at liberty to wander on earth the streams encompassed pressed together.
Devanāgarī: परिष्ठिता अतृणद्बद्बधानाः सीरा इन्द्रः स्रवितवे पृथिव्या
pada pāṭha: pūrvīḥ | uṣasaḥ | śaradaḥ | ca | gūrtāḥ | vr̥tram | jaghanvān | asr̥jat | vi | sindhūn || pari-sthitāḥ | atr̥ṇat | badbadhānāḥ | sīrāḥ | indraḥ | sravitave | pr̥thivyā ||4.19.8||

IAST: vamrībhiḥ putram agruvo adānaṁ niveśanād dhariva ā jabhartha
Griffith: Lord of Bay Steeds, thou broughtest from the ant-hill the unwedded damsel's son whom ants were eating.
Devanāgarī: वम्रीभिः पुत्रमग्रुवो अदानं निवेशनाद्धरिव आ जभर्थ
pada pāṭha: vamrībhiḥ | putram | agruvaḥ | adānam | ni-veśanāt | hari-vaḥ | ā | jabhartha || vi | andhaḥ | akhyat | ahim | ā-dadānaḥ | niḥ | bhūt | ukha-chit | sam | aranta | parva ||4.19.9||

IAST: vy andho akhyad ahim ādadāno nir bhūd ukhacchit sam aranta parva
Griffith: The blind saw clearly, as he grasped the serpent, rose, brake the jar: hisjoints again united.
Devanāgarī: व्यन्धो अख्यदहिमाददानो निर्भूदुखच्छित्समरन्त पर्व
pada pāṭha: vamrībhiḥ | putram | agruvaḥ | adānam | ni-veśanāt | hari-vaḥ | ā | jabhartha || vi | andhaḥ | akhyat | ahim | ā-dadānaḥ | niḥ | bhūt | ukha-chit | sam | aranta | parva ||4.19.9||

IAST: pra te pūrvāṇi karaṇāni viprāvidvām̐ āha viduṣe karāṁsi
Griffith: To the wise man, O Sage and Sovran Ruler, the man who knoweth all thine ancient exploits.
Devanāgarī: प्र ते पूर्वाणि करणानि विप्राविद्वाँ आह विदुषे करांसि
pada pāṭha: pra | te | pūrvāṇi | karaṇāni | vipra | ā-vidvān | āha | viduṣe | karāṁsi || yathā-yathā | vr̥ṣṇyāni | sva-gūrtā | apāṁsi | rājan | naryā | aviveṣīḥ ||4.19.10||

IAST: yathā-yathā vṛṣṇyāni svagūrtāpāṁsi rājan naryāviveṣīḥ
Griffith: Hath told these deeds of might as thou hast wrought them, great acts, spontaneous, and to man's advantage.
Devanāgarī: यथायथा वृष्ण्यानि स्वगूर्तापांसि राजन्नर्याविवेषीः
pada pāṭha: pra | te | pūrvāṇi | karaṇāni | vipra | ā-vidvān | āha | viduṣe | karāṁsi || yathā-yathā | vr̥ṣṇyāni | sva-gūrtā | apāṁsi | rājan | naryā | aviveṣīḥ ||4.19.10||

IAST: nū ṣṭuta indra nū gṛṇāna iṣaṁ jaritre nadyo na pīpeḥ
Griffith: Now, Indra! lauded, glorified with praises, let powers swell high, like rivers, for the singer.
Devanāgarī: नू ष्टुत इन्द्र नू गृणान इषं जरित्रे नद्यो न पीपेः
pada pāṭha: nu | stutaḥ | indra | nu | gr̥ṇānaḥ | iṣam | jaritre | nadyaḥ | na | pīperiti pīpeḥ || akāri | te | hari-vaḥ | brahma | navyam | dhiyā | syāma | rathyaḥ | sadā-sāḥ ||4.19.11||

IAST: akāri te harivo brahma navyaṁ dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ
Griffith: For thee a new hymn, Lord of Bays! is fashioned. May we, car-borne, through song be victors ever.
Devanāgarī: अकारि ते हरिवो ब्रह्म नव्यं धिया स्याम रथ्यः सदासाः
pada pāṭha: nu | stutaḥ | indra | nu | gr̥ṇānaḥ | iṣam | jaritre | nadyaḥ | na | pīperiti pīpeḥ || akāri | te | hari-vaḥ | brahma | navyam | dhiyā | syāma | rathyaḥ | sadā-sāḥ ||4.19.11||

IAST: ā na indro dūrād ā na āsād abhiṣṭikṛd avase yāsad ugraḥ
Griffith: FROM near or far away may mighty Indra giver of succour, come for our protection
Devanāgarī: आ न इन्द्रो दूरादा न आसादभिष्टिकृदवसे यासदुग्रः
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | indraḥ | dūrāt | ā | naḥ | āsāt | abhiṣṭi-kr̥t | avase | yāsat | ugraḥ || ojiṣṭhebhiḥ | nr̥-patiḥ | vajra-bāhuḥ | sam-ge | samat-su | turvaṇiḥ | pr̥tanyūn ||4.20.1||

IAST: ojiṣṭhebhir nṛpatir vajrabāhuḥ saṁge samatsu turvaṇiḥ pṛtanyūn
Griffith: Lord of men, armed with thunder, with the Strongest, slaying his foes in conflict, in the battles.
Devanāgarī: ओजिष्ठेभिर्नृपतिर्वज्रबाहुः संगे समत्सु तुर्वणिः पृतन्यून्
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | indraḥ | dūrāt | ā | naḥ | āsāt | abhiṣṭi-kr̥t | avase | yāsat | ugraḥ || ojiṣṭhebhiḥ | nr̥-patiḥ | vajra-bāhuḥ | sam-ge | samat-su | turvaṇiḥ | pr̥tanyūn ||4.20.1||

IAST: ā na indro haribhir yātv acchārvācīno 'vase rādhase ca
Griffith: May Indra come to us with Tawny Coursers, inclined to us, to favour and enrich us.
Devanāgarī: आ न इन्द्रो हरिभिर्यात्वच्छार्वाचीनोऽवसे राधसे च
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | indraḥ | hari-bhiḥ | yātu | accha | arvācīnaḥ | avase | rādhase | ca || tiṣṭhāti | vajrī | magha-vā | vi-rapśī | imam | yajñam | anu | naḥ | vāja-sātau ||4.20.2||

IAST: tiṣṭhāti vajrī maghavā virapśīmaṁ yajñam anu no vājasātau
Griffith: May Maghavan, loud-voiced and wielding thunder, stand by us at this sacrifice, in combat.
Devanāgarī: तिष्ठाति वज्री मघवा विरप्शीमं यज्ञमनु नो वाजसातौ
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | indraḥ | hari-bhiḥ | yātu | accha | arvācīnaḥ | avase | rādhase | ca || tiṣṭhāti | vajrī | magha-vā | vi-rapśī | imam | yajñam | anu | naḥ | vāja-sātau ||4.20.2||

IAST: imaṁ yajñaṁ tvam asmākam indra puro dadhat saniṣyasi kratuṁ naḥ
Griffith: Thou, honouring this our sacrifice, O Indra, shalt give us strength and fill us full of courage.
Devanāgarī: इमं यज्ञं त्वमस्माकमिन्द्र पुरो दधत्सनिष्यसि क्रतुं नः
pada pāṭha: imam | yajñam | tvam | asmākam | indra | puraḥ | dadhat | saniṣyasi | kratum | naḥ || śvaghnī-iva | vajrin | sanaye | dhanānām | tvayā | vayam | aryaḥ | ājim | jayema ||4.20.3||

IAST: śvaghnīva vajrin sanaye dhanānāṁ tvayā vayam arya ājiṁ jayema
Griffith: To win the booty, Thunder-armed! like hunters may we with thee subdue in fight our foemen.
Devanāgarī: श्वघ्नीव वज्रिन्सनये धनानां त्वया वयमर्य आजिं जयेम
pada pāṭha: imam | yajñam | tvam | asmākam | indra | puraḥ | dadhat | saniṣyasi | kratum | naḥ || śvaghnī-iva | vajrin | sanaye | dhanānām | tvayā | vayam | aryaḥ | ājim | jayema ||4.20.3||

IAST: uśann u ṣu ṇaḥ sumanā upāke somasya nu suṣutasya svadhāvaḥ
Griffith: Loving us well, benevolent, close beside us, drink, Godlike Indra, of the wellpressed Soma.
Devanāgarī: उशन्नु षु णः सुमना उपाके सोमस्य नु सुषुतस्य स्वधावः
pada pāṭha: uśan | ūm̐ iti | su | naḥ | su-manāḥ | upāke | somasya | nu | su-sutasya | svadhā-vaḥ || pāḥ | indra | prati-bhr̥tasya | madhvaḥ | sam | andhasā | mamadaḥ | pr̥ṣṭhyena ||4.20.4||

IAST: pā indra pratibhṛtasya madhvaḥ sam andhasā mamadaḥ pṛṣṭhyena
Griffith: Drink of the meath we offer, and delight thee with food that cometh from the mountain ridges.
Devanāgarī: पा इन्द्र प्रतिभृतस्य मध्वः समन्धसा ममदः पृष्ठ्येन
pada pāṭha: uśan | ūm̐ iti | su | naḥ | su-manāḥ | upāke | somasya | nu | su-sutasya | svadhā-vaḥ || pāḥ | indra | prati-bhr̥tasya | madhvaḥ | sam | andhasā | mamadaḥ | pr̥ṣṭhyena ||4.20.4||

IAST: vi yo rarapśa ṛṣibhir navebhir vṛkṣo na pakvaḥ sṛṇyo na jetā
Griffith: Him who is sung aloud by recent sages, like a ripe-fruited tree, a scythe-armed victor,-
Devanāgarī: वि यो ररप्श ऋषिभिर्नवेभिर्वृक्षो न पक्वः सृण्यो न जेता
pada pāṭha: vi | yaḥ | rarapśe | r̥ṣi-bhiḥ | navebhiḥ | vr̥kṣaḥ | na | pakvaḥ | sr̥ṇyaḥ | na | jetā || maryaḥ | na | yoṣām | abhi | manyamānaḥ | accha | vivakmi | puru-hūtam | indram ||4.20.5||

IAST: maryo na yoṣām abhi manyamāno 'cchā vivakmi puruhūtam indram
Griffith: I, like a bridegroom thinking of his consort, call hither Indra, him invoked of many;
Devanāgarī: मर्यो न योषामभि मन्यमानोऽच्छा विवक्मि पुरुहूतमिन्द्रम्
pada pāṭha: vi | yaḥ | rarapśe | r̥ṣi-bhiḥ | navebhiḥ | vr̥kṣaḥ | na | pakvaḥ | sr̥ṇyaḥ | na | jetā || maryaḥ | na | yoṣām | abhi | manyamānaḥ | accha | vivakmi | puru-hūtam | indram ||4.20.5||

IAST: girir na yaḥ svatavām̐ ṛṣva indraḥ sanād eva sahase jāta ugraḥ
Griffith: Him who in native strength is like a mountain, the lofty Indra born or old for conquest,
Devanāgarī: गिरिर्न यः स्वतवाँ ऋष्व इन्द्रः सनादेव सहसे जात उग्रः
pada pāṭha: giriḥ | na | yaḥ | sva-tavān | r̥ṣvaḥ | indraḥ | sanāt | eva | sahase | jātaḥ | ugraḥ || ā-dartā | vajram | sthaviram | na | bhīmaḥ | udnā-iva | kośam | vasunā | ni-r̥ṣṭam ||4.20.6||

IAST: ādartā vajraṁ sthaviraṁ na bhīma udneva kośaṁ vasunā nyṛṣṭam
Griffith: Terrific wielder of the ancient thunder. filled full with splendour as a jar with water.
Devanāgarī: आदर्ता वज्रं स्थविरं न भीम उद्नेव कोशं वसुना न्यृष्टम्
pada pāṭha: giriḥ | na | yaḥ | sva-tavān | r̥ṣvaḥ | indraḥ | sanāt | eva | sahase | jātaḥ | ugraḥ || ā-dartā | vajram | sthaviram | na | bhīmaḥ | udnā-iva | kośam | vasunā | ni-r̥ṣṭam ||4.20.6||

IAST: na yasya vartā januṣā nv asti na rādhasa āmarītā maghasya
Griffith: Whom from of old there is not one to hinder, none to curtail the riches of his bounty.
Devanāgarī: न यस्य वर्ता जनुषा न्वस्ति न राधस आमरीता मघस्य
pada pāṭha: na | yasya | vartā | januṣā | nu | asti | na | rādhasaḥ | ā-marītā | maghasya || ut-vavr̥ṣāṇaḥ | taviṣī-vaḥ | ugra | asmabhyam | daddhi | puru-hūta | rāyaḥ ||4.20.7||

IAST: udvāvṛṣāṇas taviṣīva ugrāsmabhyaṁ daddhi puruhūta rāyaḥ
Griffith: Pouring forth freely, O thou Strong and Mighty, vouchsafe us riches, God invoked of many!
Devanāgarī: उद्वावृषाणस्तविषीव उग्रास्मभ्यं दद्धि पुरुहूत रायः
pada pāṭha: na | yasya | vartā | januṣā | nu | asti | na | rādhasaḥ | ā-marītā | maghasya || ut-vavr̥ṣāṇaḥ | taviṣī-vaḥ | ugra | asmabhyam | daddhi | puru-hūta | rāyaḥ ||4.20.7||

IAST: īkṣe rāyaḥ kṣayasya carṣaṇīnām uta vrajam apavartāsi gonām
Griffith: Of wealth and homes of men thou art the ruler, and opener of the stable of the cattle.
Devanāgarī: ईक्षे रायः क्षयस्य चर्षणीनामुत व्रजमपवर्तासि गोनाम्
pada pāṭha: īkṣe | rāyaḥ | kṣayasya | carṣaṇīnām | uta | vrajam | apa-vartā | asi | gonām || śikṣā-naraḥ | sam-itheṣu | prahā-vān | vasvaḥ | rāśim | abhi-netā | asi | bhūrim ||4.20.8||

IAST: śikṣānaraḥ samitheṣu prahāvān vasvo rāśim abhinetāsi bhūrim
Griffith: Helper of men, winner of spoil in combats, thou leadest to an ample heap of riches.
Devanāgarī: शिक्षानरः समिथेषु प्रहावान्वस्वो राशिमभिनेतासि भूरिम्
pada pāṭha: īkṣe | rāyaḥ | kṣayasya | carṣaṇīnām | uta | vrajam | apa-vartā | asi | gonām || śikṣā-naraḥ | sam-itheṣu | prahā-vān | vasvaḥ | rāśim | abhi-netā | asi | bhūrim ||4.20.8||

IAST: kayā tac chṛṇve śacyā śaciṣṭho yayā kṛṇoti muhu kā cid ṛṣvaḥ
Griffith: By what great might is he renowned as strongest, wherewith the Lofty One stirs up wild battles?
Devanāgarī: कया तच्छृण्वे शच्या शचिष्ठो यया कृणोति मुहु का चिदृष्वः
pada pāṭha: kayā | tat | śr̥ṇve | śacyā | śaciṣṭhaḥ | yayā | kr̥ṇoti | muhu | kā | cit | r̥ṣvaḥ || puru | dāśuṣe | vi-cayiṣṭhaḥ | aṁhaḥ | atha | dadhāti | draviṇam | jaritre ||4.20.9||

IAST: puru dāśuṣe vicayiṣṭho aṁho 'thā dadhāti draviṇaṁ jaritre
Griffith: Best soother of the worshipper's great sorrow, he gives possessions to the man who lauds him.
Devanāgarī: पुरु दाशुषे विचयिष्ठो अंहोऽथा दधाति द्रविणं जरित्रे
pada pāṭha: kayā | tat | śr̥ṇve | śacyā | śaciṣṭhaḥ | yayā | kr̥ṇoti | muhu | kā | cit | r̥ṣvaḥ || puru | dāśuṣe | vi-cayiṣṭhaḥ | aṁhaḥ | atha | dadhāti | draviṇam | jaritre ||4.20.9||

IAST: mā no mardhīr ā bharā daddhi tan naḥ pra dāśuṣe dātave bhūri yat te
Griffith: Slay us not; bring, bestow onus the ample gift which thou hast to give to him who offers.
Devanāgarī: मा नो मर्धीरा भरा दद्धि तन्नः प्र दाशुषे दातवे भूरि यत्ते
pada pāṭha: mā | naḥ | mardhīḥ | ā | bhara | daddhi | tat | naḥ | pra | dāśuṣe | dātave | bhūri | yat | te || navye | deṣṇe | śaste | asmin | te | ukthe | pra | bravāma | vayam | indra | stuvantaḥ ||4.20.10||

IAST: navye deṣṇe śaste asmin ta ukthe pra bravāma vayam indra stuvantaḥ
Griffith: At this new gift, with this laud sung before thee, extolling thee, we, Indra, will declare it.
Devanāgarī: नव्ये देष्णे शस्ते अस्मिन्त उक्थे प्र ब्रवाम वयमिन्द्र स्तुवन्तः
pada pāṭha: mā | naḥ | mardhīḥ | ā | bhara | daddhi | tat | naḥ | pra | dāśuṣe | dātave | bhūri | yat | te || navye | deṣṇe | śaste | asmin | te | ukthe | pra | bravāma | vayam | indra | stuvantaḥ ||4.20.10||

IAST: nū ṣṭuta indra nū gṛṇāna iṣaṁ jaritre nadyo na pīpeḥ
Griffith: Now, Indra! lauded, glorified with praises, let power swell high, like rivers, for the singer.
Devanāgarī: नू ष्टुत इन्द्र नू गृणान इषं जरित्रे नद्यो न पीपेः
pada pāṭha: nu | stutaḥ | indra | nu | gr̥ṇānaḥ | iṣam | jaritre | nadyaḥ | na | pīperiti pīpeḥ || akāri | te | hari-vaḥ | brahma | navyam | dhiyā | syāma | rathyaḥ | sadā-sāḥ ||4.20.11||

IAST: akāri te harivo brahma navyaṁ dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ
Griffith: A new hymn, Lord of Bays! for thee is fashioned. May we, car-born, through song be victors ever.
Devanāgarī: अकारि ते हरिवो ब्रह्म नव्यं धिया स्याम रथ्यः सदासाः
pada pāṭha: nu | stutaḥ | indra | nu | gr̥ṇānaḥ | iṣam | jaritre | nadyaḥ | na | pīperiti pīpeḥ || akāri | te | hari-vaḥ | brahma | navyam | dhiyā | syāma | rathyaḥ | sadā-sāḥ ||4.20.11||

IAST: ā yātv indro 'vasa upa na iha stutaḥ sadhamād astu śūraḥ
Griffith: MAY Indra come to us for our protection; here be the Hero, praised, our feast-companion.
Devanāgarī: आ यात्विन्द्रोऽवस उप न इह स्तुतः सधमादस्तु शूरः
pada pāṭha: ā | yātu | indraḥ | avase | upa | naḥ | iha | stutaḥ | sadha-māt | astu | śūraḥ || vavr̥dhānaḥ | taviṣīḥ | yasya | pūrvīḥ | dyauḥ | na | kṣatram | abhi-bhūti | puṣyāt ||4.21.1||

IAST: vāvṛdhānas taviṣīr yasya pūrvīr dyaur na kṣatram abhibhūti puṣyāt
Griffith: May he whose powers are many, waxen mighty, cherish, like Dyaus, his own supreme dominion.
Devanāgarī: वावृधानस्तविषीर्यस्य पूर्वीर्द्यौर्न क्षत्रमभिभूति पुष्यात्
pada pāṭha: ā | yātu | indraḥ | avase | upa | naḥ | iha | stutaḥ | sadha-māt | astu | śūraḥ || vavr̥dhānaḥ | taviṣīḥ | yasya | pūrvīḥ | dyauḥ | na | kṣatram | abhi-bhūti | puṣyāt ||4.21.1||

IAST: tasyed iha stavatha vṛṣṇyāni tuvidyumnasya tuvirādhaso nṝn
Griffith: Here magnify his great heroic exploits, most glorious One, enriching men with bounties,
Devanāgarī: तस्येदिह स्तवथ वृष्ण्यानि तुविद्युम्नस्य तुविराधसो नॄन्
pada pāṭha: tasya | it | iha | stavatha | vr̥ṣṇyāni | tuvi-dyumnasya | tuvi-rādhasaḥ | nr̥̄n || yasya | kratuḥ | vidathyaḥ | na | sam-rāṭ | sahvān | tarutraḥ | abhi | asti | kr̥ṣṭīḥ ||4.21.2||

IAST: yasya kratur vidathyo na samrāṭ sāhvān tarutro abhy asti kṛṣṭīḥ
Griffith: Whose will is like a Sovran in assembly, who rules the people, Conqueror, all-surpassing.
Devanāgarī: यस्य क्रतुर्विदथ्यो न सम्राट् साह्वान्तरुत्रो अभ्यस्ति कृष्टीः
pada pāṭha: tasya | it | iha | stavatha | vr̥ṣṇyāni | tuvi-dyumnasya | tuvi-rādhasaḥ | nr̥̄n || yasya | kratuḥ | vidathyaḥ | na | sam-rāṭ | sahvān | tarutraḥ | abhi | asti | kr̥ṣṭīḥ ||4.21.2||

IAST: ā yātv indro diva ā pṛthivyā makṣū samudrād uta vā purīṣāt
Griffith: Hither let Indra come from earth or heaven, hither with speech from firmament or ocean;
Devanāgarī: आ यात्विन्द्रो दिव आ पृथिव्या मक्षू समुद्रादुत वा पुरीषात्
pada pāṭha: ā | yātu | indraḥ | divaḥ | ā | pr̥thivyāḥ | makṣu | samudrāt | uta | vā | purīṣāt || svaḥ-narāt | avase | naḥ | marutvān | parā-vataḥ | vā | sadanāt | r̥tasya ||4.21.3||

IAST: svarṇarād avase no marutvān parāvato vā sadanād ṛtasya
Griffith: With Maruts, from the realm of light to aid us, or from a distance, from the seat of Order.
Devanāgarī: स्वर्णरादवसे नो मरुत्वान्परावतो वा सदनादृतस्य
pada pāṭha: ā | yātu | indraḥ | divaḥ | ā | pr̥thivyāḥ | makṣu | samudrāt | uta | vā | purīṣāt || svaḥ-narāt | avase | naḥ | marutvān | parā-vataḥ | vā | sadanāt | r̥tasya ||4.21.3||

IAST: sthūrasya rāyo bṛhato ya īśe tam u ṣṭavāma vidatheṣv indram
Griffith: That Indra will we laud in our assemblies, him who is Lord of great and lasting riches,
Devanāgarī: स्थूरस्य रायो बृहतो य ईशे तमु ष्टवाम विदथेष्विन्द्रम्
pada pāṭha: sthūrasya | rāyaḥ | br̥hataḥ | yaḥ | īśe | tam | ūm̐ iti | stavāma | vidatheṣu | indram || yaḥ | vāyunā | jayati | go-matīṣu | pra | dhr̥ṣṇu-yā | nayati | vasyaḥ | accha ||4.21.4||

IAST: yo vāyunā jayati gomatīṣu pra dhṛṣṇuyā nayati vasyo accha
Griffith: Victor with Vayu where the herds are gathered, who leads with boldness on to higher fortune.
Devanāgarī: यो वायुना जयति गोमतीषु प्र धृष्णुया नयति वस्यो अच्छ
pada pāṭha: sthūrasya | rāyaḥ | br̥hataḥ | yaḥ | īśe | tam | ūm̐ iti | stavāma | vidatheṣu | indram || yaḥ | vāyunā | jayati | go-matīṣu | pra | dhr̥ṣṇu-yā | nayati | vasyaḥ | accha ||4.21.4||

IAST: upa yo namo namasi stabhāyann iyarti vācaṁ janayan yajadhyai
Griffith: May the Priest, Lord of many blessings, striving,-who fixing reverence on reverence, giving
Devanāgarī: उप यो नमो नमसि स्तभायन्नियर्ति वाचं जनयन्यजध्यै
pada pāṭha: upa | yaḥ | namaḥ | namasi | stabhāyan | iyarti | vācam | janayan | yajadhyai || r̥ñjasānaḥ | puru-vāraḥ | ukthaiḥ | ā | indram | kr̥ṇvīta | sadaneṣu | hotā ||4.21.5||

IAST: ṛñjasānaḥ puruvāra ukthair endraṁ kṛṇvīta sadaneṣu hotā
Griffith: Vent to his voice, inciteth men to worshipwith lauds bring Indra hither to our dwellings.
Devanāgarī: ऋञ्जसानः पुरुवार उक्थैरेन्द्रं कृण्वीत सदनेषु होता
pada pāṭha: upa | yaḥ | namaḥ | namasi | stabhāyan | iyarti | vācam | janayan | yajadhyai || r̥ñjasānaḥ | puru-vāraḥ | ukthaiḥ | ā | indram | kr̥ṇvīta | sadaneṣu | hotā ||4.21.5||

IAST: dhiṣā yadi dhiṣaṇyantaḥ saraṇyān sadanto adrim auśijasya gohe
Griffith: When sitting pondering in deep devotion in Ausija's abode they ply the press-stone,
Devanāgarī: धिषा यदि धिषण्यन्तः सरण्यान्सदन्तो अद्रिमौशिजस्य गोहे
pada pāṭha: dhiṣā | yadi | dhiṣaṇyantaḥ | saraṇyān | sadantaḥ | adrim | auśijasya | gohe || ā | duroṣāḥ | pāstyasya | hotā | yaḥ | naḥ | mahān | sam-varaṇeṣu | vahniḥ ||4.21.6||

IAST: ā duroṣāḥ pāstyasya hotā yo no mahān saṁvaraṇeṣu vahniḥ
Griffith: May he whose wrath is fierce, the mighty bearer, come as the house-lord's priest within our chambers.
Devanāgarī: आ दुरोषाः पास्त्यस्य होता यो नो महान्संवरणेषु वह्निः
pada pāṭha: dhiṣā | yadi | dhiṣaṇyantaḥ | saraṇyān | sadantaḥ | adrim | auśijasya | gohe || ā | duroṣāḥ | pāstyasya | hotā | yaḥ | naḥ | mahān | sam-varaṇeṣu | vahniḥ ||4.21.6||

IAST: satrā yad īm bhārvarasya vṛṣṇaḥ siṣakti śuṣmaḥ stuvate bharāya
Griffith: Surely the power of Bharvara the mighty for ever helpeth to support the singer;
Devanāgarī: सत्रा यदीं भार्वरस्य वृष्णः सिषक्ति शुष्मः स्तुवते भराय
pada pāṭha: satrā | yat | im | bhārvarasya | vr̥ṣṇaḥ | sisakti | śuṣmaḥ | stuvate | bharāya || guhā | yat | īm | auśijasya | gohe | pra | yat | dhiye | pra | ayase | madāya ||4.21.7||

IAST: guhā yad īm auśijasya gohe pra yad dhiye prāyase madāya
Griffith: That which in Ausija's abode lies hidden, to come forth for delight and for devotion.
Devanāgarī: गुहा यदीमौशिजस्य गोहे प्र यद्धिये प्रायसे मदाय
pada pāṭha: satrā | yat | im | bhārvarasya | vr̥ṣṇaḥ | sisakti | śuṣmaḥ | stuvate | bharāya || guhā | yat | īm | auśijasya | gohe | pra | yat | dhiye | pra | ayase | madāya ||4.21.7||

IAST: vi yad varāṁsi parvatasya vṛṇve payobhir jinve apāṁ javāṁsi
Griffith: When he unbars the spaces of the mountains, and quickens with his floods the water-torrents,
Devanāgarī: वि यद्वरांसि पर्वतस्य वृण्वे पयोभिर्जिन्वे अपां जवांसि
pada pāṭha: vi | yat | varāṁsi | parvatasya | vr̥ṇve | payaḥ-bhiḥ | jinve | apām | javāṁsi || vidat | gaurasya | gavayasya | gohe | yadi | vājāya | su-dhyaḥ | vahanti ||4.21.8||

IAST: vidad gaurasya gavayasya gohe yadī vājāya sudhyo vahanti
Griffith: He finds in lair the buffalo and wild-ox when the wise lead him on to vigorous exploit.
Devanāgarī: विदद्गौरस्य गवयस्य गोहे यदी वाजाय सुध्यो वहन्ति
pada pāṭha: vi | yat | varāṁsi | parvatasya | vr̥ṇve | payaḥ-bhiḥ | jinve | apām | javāṁsi || vidat | gaurasya | gavayasya | gohe | yadi | vājāya | su-dhyaḥ | vahanti ||4.21.8||

IAST: bhadrā te hastā sukṛtota pāṇī prayantārā stuvate rādha indra
Griffith: Auspicious are thy hands, thine arms wellfashioned which proffer bounty, Indra, to thy praiser.
Devanāgarī: भद्रा ते हस्ता सुकृतोत पाणी प्रयन्तारा स्तुवते राध इन्द्र
pada pāṭha: bhadrā | te | hastā | su-kr̥tā | uta | pāṇī iti | pra-yantārā | stuvate | rādhaḥ | indra || kā | te | ni-sattiḥ | kim | ūm̐ iti | no iti | mamatsi | kim | na | ut-ut | ūm̐ iti | harṣase | dātavai | ūm̐ iti ||4.21.9||

IAST: kā te niṣattiḥ kim u no mamatsi kiṁ nod-ud u harṣase dātavā u
Griffith: What sloth is this? Why dost thou not rejoice thee? Why dost thou not delight thyself with giving?
Devanāgarī: का ते निषत्तिः किमु नो ममत्सि किं नोदुदु हर्षसे दातवा उ
pada pāṭha: bhadrā | te | hastā | su-kr̥tā | uta | pāṇī iti | pra-yantārā | stuvate | rādhaḥ | indra || kā | te | ni-sattiḥ | kim | ūm̐ iti | no iti | mamatsi | kim | na | ut-ut | ūm̐ iti | harṣase | dātavai | ūm̐ iti ||4.21.9||

IAST: evā vasva indraḥ satyaḥ samrāḍ ḍhantā vṛtraṁ varivaḥ pūrave kaḥ
Griffith: So Indra is the truthful Lord of treasure. Freedom he gave to man by slaying Vrtra.
Devanāgarī: एवा वस्व इन्द्रः सत्यः सम्राड्ढन्ता वृत्रं वरिवः पूरवे कः
pada pāṭha: eva | vasvaḥ | indraḥ | satyaḥ | sam-rāṭ | hantā | vr̥tram | varivaḥ | pūrave | kariti kaḥ || puru-stuta | kratvā | naḥ | śagdhi | rāyaḥ | bhakṣīya | te | avasaḥ | daivyasya ||4.21.10||

IAST: puruṣṭuta kratvā naḥ śagdhi rāyo bhakṣīya te 'vaso daivyasya
Griffith: Much-lauded! help us with thy power to riches: may I be sharer of thy Godlike favour.
Devanāgarī: पुरुष्टुत क्रत्वा नः शग्धि रायो भक्षीय तेऽवसो दैव्यस्य
pada pāṭha: eva | vasvaḥ | indraḥ | satyaḥ | sam-rāṭ | hantā | vr̥tram | varivaḥ | pūrave | kariti kaḥ || puru-stuta | kratvā | naḥ | śagdhi | rāyaḥ | bhakṣīya | te | avasaḥ | daivyasya ||4.21.10||

IAST: nū ṣṭuta indra nū gṛṇāna iṣaṁ jaritre nadyo na pīpeḥ
Griffith: Now, Indra! lauded, glorified with praises, let power swell high, like rivers, for,the singer.
Devanāgarī: नू ष्टुत इन्द्र नू गृणान इषं जरित्रे नद्यो न पीपेः
pada pāṭha: nu | stutaḥ | indra | nu | gr̥ṇānaḥ | iṣam | jaritre | nadyaḥ | na | pīperiti pīpeḥ || akāri | te | hari-vaḥ | brahma | navyam | dhiyā | syāma | rathyaḥ | sadā-sāḥ ||4.21.11||

IAST: akāri te harivo brahma navyaṁ dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ
Griffith: For thee a new hymn, Lord of Bays! is fashioned. May we, care-borne, through song be victqrs ever.
Devanāgarī: अकारि ते हरिवो ब्रह्म नव्यं धिया स्याम रथ्यः सदासाः
pada pāṭha: nu | stutaḥ | indra | nu | gr̥ṇānaḥ | iṣam | jaritre | nadyaḥ | na | pīperiti pīpeḥ || akāri | te | hari-vaḥ | brahma | navyam | dhiyā | syāma | rathyaḥ | sadā-sāḥ ||4.21.11||

IAST: yan na indro jujuṣe yac ca vaṣṭi tan no mahān karati śuṣmy ā cit
Griffith: THAT gift of ours which Indra loves and welcomes, even that he makes for us, the Great and Strong One.
Devanāgarī: यन्न इन्द्रो जुजुषे यच्च वष्टि तन्नो महान्करति शुष्म्या चित्
pada pāṭha: yat | naḥ | indraḥ | jujuṣe | yat | ca | vaṣṭi | tat | naḥ | mahān | karati | śuṣmī | ā | cit || brahma | stomam | magha-vā | somam | ukthā | yaḥ | aśmānam | śavasā | bibhrat | eti ||4.22.1||

IAST: brahma stomam maghavā somam ukthā yo aśmānaṁ śavasā bibhrad eti
Griffith: He who comes wielding in his might the thunder, Maghavan, gives prayer, praise, and laud, and Soma.
Devanāgarī: ब्रह्म स्तोमं मघवा सोममुक्था यो अश्मानं शवसा बिभ्रदेति
pada pāṭha: yat | naḥ | indraḥ | jujuṣe | yat | ca | vaṣṭi | tat | naḥ | mahān | karati | śuṣmī | ā | cit || brahma | stomam | magha-vā | somam | ukthā | yaḥ | aśmānam | śavasā | bibhrat | eti ||4.22.1||

IAST: vṛṣā vṛṣandhiṁ caturaśrim asyann ugro bāhubhyāṁ nṛtamaḥ śacīvān
Griffith: Bull, hurler of the four-edged rain-producer with both his arms, strong, mighty, most heroic;
Devanāgarī: वृषा वृषन्धिं चतुरश्रिमस्यन्नुग्रो बाहुभ्यां नृतमः शचीवान्
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣā | vr̥ṣandhim | catuḥ-aśrim | asyan | ugraḥ | bāhu-bhyām | nr̥-tamaḥ | śacī-vān || śriye | paruṣṇīm | uṣamāṇaḥ | ūrṇām | yasyāḥ | parvāṇi | sakhyāya | vivye ||4.22.2||

IAST: śriye paruṣṇīm uṣamāṇa ūrṇāṁ yasyāḥ parvāṇi sakhyāya vivye
Griffith: Wearing as wool Parusni for adornment, whose joints for sake of friendship he hath covered.
Devanāgarī: श्रिये परुष्णीमुषमाण ऊर्णां यस्याः पर्वाणि सख्याय विव्ये
pada pāṭha: vr̥ṣā | vr̥ṣandhim | catuḥ-aśrim | asyan | ugraḥ | bāhu-bhyām | nr̥-tamaḥ | śacī-vān || śriye | paruṣṇīm | uṣamāṇaḥ | ūrṇām | yasyāḥ | parvāṇi | sakhyāya | vivye ||4.22.2||

IAST: yo devo devatamo jāyamāno maho vājebhir mahadbhiś ca śuṣmaiḥ
Griffith: God who of all the Gods was born divinest, endowed with ample strength and mighty powers,
Devanāgarī: यो देवो देवतमो जायमानो महो वाजेभिर्महद्भिश्च शुष्मैः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | devaḥ | deva-tamaḥ | jāyamānaḥ | mahaḥ | vājebhiḥ | mahat-bhiḥ | ca | śuṣmaiḥ || dadhānaḥ | vajram | bāhvoḥ | uśantam | dyām | amena | rejayat | pra | bhūma ||4.22.3||

IAST: dadhāno vajram bāhvor uśantaṁ dyām amena rejayat pra bhūma
Griffith: And bearing in his arrns the yearning thunder, with violent rush caused heaven and earth to tremble.
Devanāgarī: दधानो वज्रं बाह्वोरुशन्तं द्याममेन रेजयत्प्र भूम
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | devaḥ | deva-tamaḥ | jāyamānaḥ | mahaḥ | vājebhiḥ | mahat-bhiḥ | ca | śuṣmaiḥ || dadhānaḥ | vajram | bāhvoḥ | uśantam | dyām | amena | rejayat | pra | bhūma ||4.22.3||

IAST: viśvā rodhāṁsi pravataś ca pūrvīr dyaur ṛṣvāj janiman rejata kṣāḥ
Griffith: Before the High God, at his birth, heaven trembled, earth, many floods and all the precipices.
Devanāgarī: विश्वा रोधांसि प्रवतश्च पूर्वीर्द्यौरृष्वाज्जनिमन्रेजत क्षाः
pada pāṭha: viśvā | rodhāṁsi | pra-vataḥ | ca | pūrvīḥ | dyauḥ | r̥ṣvāt | janiman | rejata | kṣāḥ || ā | mātarā | bharati | śuṣmī | ā | goḥ | nr̥-vat | pari-jman | nonuvanta | vātāḥ ||4.22.4||

IAST: ā mātarā bharati śuṣmy ā gor nṛvat parijman nonuvanta vātāḥ
Griffith: The Strong One bringeth nigh the Bull's two Parents: loud sing the winds, like men, in air's mid-region.
Devanāgarī: आ मातरा भरति शुष्म्या गोर्नृवत्परिज्मन्नोनुवन्त वाताः
pada pāṭha: viśvā | rodhāṁsi | pra-vataḥ | ca | pūrvīḥ | dyauḥ | r̥ṣvāt | janiman | rejata | kṣāḥ || ā | mātarā | bharati | śuṣmī | ā | goḥ | nr̥-vat | pari-jman | nonuvanta | vātāḥ ||4.22.4||

IAST: tā tū ta indra mahato mahāni viśveṣv it savaneṣu pravācyā
Griffith: These are thy great deeds, Indra, thine, the Mighty, deeds to be told aloud at all libations,
Devanāgarī: ता तू त इन्द्र महतो महानि विश्वेष्वित्सवनेषु प्रवाच्या
pada pāṭha: tā | tu | te | indra | mahataḥ | mahāni | viśveṣu | it | savaneṣu | pra-vācyā || yat | śūra | dhr̥ṣṇo iti | dhr̥ṣatā | dadhr̥ṣvān | ahim | vajreṇa | śavasā | aviveṣīḥ ||4.22.5||

IAST: yac chūra dhṛṣṇo dhṛṣatā dadhṛṣvān ahiṁ vajreṇa śavasāviveṣīḥ
Griffith: That thou, O Hero, bold and boldly daring, didst with thy bolt, by strength, destroy the Dragon.
Devanāgarī: यच्छूर धृष्णो धृषता दधृष्वानहिं वज्रेण शवसाविवेषीः
pada pāṭha: tā | tu | te | indra | mahataḥ | mahāni | viśveṣu | it | savaneṣu | pra-vācyā || yat | śūra | dhr̥ṣṇo iti | dhr̥ṣatā | dadhr̥ṣvān | ahim | vajreṇa | śavasā | aviveṣīḥ ||4.22.5||

IAST: tā tū te satyā tuvinṛmṇa viśvā pra dhenavaḥ sisrate vṛṣṇa ūdhnaḥ
Griffith: True are all these thy deeds, O Most Heroic. The Milch-kine issued from the streaming udder.
Devanāgarī: ता तू ते सत्या तुविनृम्ण विश्वा प्र धेनवः सिस्रते वृष्ण ऊध्नः
pada pāṭha: tā | tu | te | satyā | tuvi-nr̥mṇa | viśvā | pra | dhenavaḥ | sisrate | vr̥ṣṇaḥ | ūdhnaḥ || adha | ha | tvat | vr̥ṣa-manaḥ | bhiyānāḥ | pra | sindhavaḥ | javasā | cakramanta ||4.22.6||

IAST: adhā ha tvad vṛṣamaṇo bhiyānāḥ pra sindhavo javasā cakramanta
Griffith: In fear of thee, O thou of manly spirit, the rivers swiftly set themselves in motion.
Devanāgarī: अधा ह त्वद्वृषमणो भियानाः प्र सिन्धवो जवसा चक्रमन्त
pada pāṭha: tā | tu | te | satyā | tuvi-nr̥mṇa | viśvā | pra | dhenavaḥ | sisrate | vr̥ṣṇaḥ | ūdhnaḥ || adha | ha | tvat | vr̥ṣa-manaḥ | bhiyānāḥ | pra | sindhavaḥ | javasā | cakramanta ||4.22.6||

IAST: atrāha te harivas tā u devīr avobhir indra stavanta svasāraḥ
Griffith: With joy, O Indra, Lord of Tawny Coursers, the Sisters then, these Goddesses, extolled thee,
Devanāgarī: अत्राह ते हरिवस्ता उ देवीरवोभिरिन्द्र स्तवन्त स्वसारः
pada pāṭha: atra | aha | te | hari-vaḥ | tāḥ | ūm̐ iti | devīḥ | avaḥ-bhiḥ | indra | stavanta | svasāraḥ || yat | sīm | anu | pra | mucaḥ | badbadhānāḥ | dīrghām | anu | pra-sitim | syandayadhyai ||4.22.7||

IAST: yat sīm anu pra muco badbadhānā dīrghām anu prasitiṁ syandayadhyai
Griffith: When thou didst give the prisoned ones their freedom to wander at their will in long succession.
Devanāgarī: यत्सीमनु प्र मुचो बद्बधाना दीर्घामनु प्रसितिं स्यन्दयध्यै
pada pāṭha: atra | aha | te | hari-vaḥ | tāḥ | ūm̐ iti | devīḥ | avaḥ-bhiḥ | indra | stavanta | svasāraḥ || yat | sīm | anu | pra | mucaḥ | badbadhānāḥ | dīrghām | anu | pra-sitim | syandayadhyai ||4.22.7||

IAST: pipīḻe aṁśur madyo na sindhur ā tvā śamī śaśamānasya śaktiḥ
Griffith: Pressed is the gladdening stalk as 'twere a river: so let the rite, the toiler's power, attract thee
Devanāgarī: पिपीळे अंशुर्मद्यो न सिन्धुरा त्वा शमी शशमानस्य शक्तिः
pada pāṭha: pipīḷe | aṁśuḥ | madyaḥ | na | sindhuḥ | ā | tvā | śamī | śaśamānasya | śaktiḥ || asmadryak | śuśucānasya | yamyāḥ | āśuḥ | na | raśmim | tuvi-ojasam | goḥ ||4.22.8||

IAST: asmadryak chuśucānasya yamyā āśur na raśmiṁ tuvyojasaṁ goḥ
Griffith: To us-ward, of the Bright One, as the courser strains his. exceedingly strong leather bridle.
Devanāgarī: अस्मद्र्यक्छुशुचानस्य यम्या आशुर्न रश्मिं तुव्योजसं गोः
pada pāṭha: pipīḷe | aṁśuḥ | madyaḥ | na | sindhuḥ | ā | tvā | śamī | śaśamānasya | śaktiḥ || asmadryak | śuśucānasya | yamyāḥ | āśuḥ | na | raśmim | tuvi-ojasam | goḥ ||4.22.8||

IAST: asme varṣiṣṭhā kṛṇuhi jyeṣṭhā nṛmṇāni satrā sahure sahāṁsi
Griffith: Ever by us perform thy most heroic, thine highest, best victorious deeds, O Victor.
Devanāgarī: अस्मे वर्षिष्ठा कृणुहि ज्येष्ठा नृम्णानि सत्रा सहुरे सहांसि
pada pāṭha: asme iti | varṣiṣṭhā | kr̥ṇuhi | jyeṣṭhā | nr̥mṇāni | satrā | sahure | sahāṁsi || asmabhyam | vr̥trā | su-hanāni | randhi | jahi | vadhaḥ | vanuṣaḥ | martyasya ||4.22.9||

IAST: asmabhyaṁ vṛtrā suhanāni randhi jahi vadhar vanuṣo martyasya
Griffith: For us make Vrtras easy to be conquered: destroy the weapon of our mortal foeman.
Devanāgarī: अस्मभ्यं वृत्रा सुहनानि रन्धि जहि वधर्वनुषो मर्त्यस्य
pada pāṭha: asme iti | varṣiṣṭhā | kr̥ṇuhi | jyeṣṭhā | nr̥mṇāni | satrā | sahure | sahāṁsi || asmabhyam | vr̥trā | su-hanāni | randhi | jahi | vadhaḥ | vanuṣaḥ | martyasya ||4.22.9||

IAST: asmākam it su śṛṇuhi tvam indrāsmabhyaṁ citrām̐ upa māhi vājān
Griffith: Graciously listen to our prayer, O Indra, and strength of varied sort bestow thou on us.
Devanāgarī: अस्माकमित्सु शृणुहि त्वमिन्द्रास्मभ्यं चित्राँ उप माहि वाजान्
pada pāṭha: asmākam | it | su | śr̥ṇuhi | tvam | indra | asmabhyam | citrān | upa | māhi | vājān || asmabhyam | viśvāḥ | iṣaṇaḥ | puram-dhīḥ | asmākam | su | magha-van | bodhi | go-dāḥ ||4.22.10||

IAST: asmabhyaṁ viśvā iṣaṇaḥ puraṁdhīr asmākaṁ su maghavan bodhi godāḥ
Griffith: Send to us all intelligence arid wisdom O Maghavan, be he who gives us cattle.
Devanāgarī: अस्मभ्यं विश्वा इषणः पुरंधीरस्माकं सु मघवन्बोधि गोदाः
pada pāṭha: asmākam | it | su | śr̥ṇuhi | tvam | indra | asmabhyam | citrān | upa | māhi | vājān || asmabhyam | viśvāḥ | iṣaṇaḥ | puram-dhīḥ | asmākam | su | magha-van | bodhi | go-dāḥ ||4.22.10||

IAST: nū ṣṭuta indra nū gṛṇāna iṣaṁ jaritre nadyo na pīpeḥ
Griffith: Now, Indra! lauded, glorified with praises, let wealth swell hiah like rivers to the singer.
Devanāgarī: नू ष्टुत इन्द्र नू गृणान इषं जरित्रे नद्यो न पीपेः
pada pāṭha: nu | stutaḥ | indra | nu | gr̥ṇānaḥ | iṣam | jaritre | nadyaḥ | na | pīperiti pīpeḥ || akāri | te | hari-vaḥ | brahma | navyam | dhiyā | syāma | rathyaḥ | sadā-sāḥ ||4.22.11||

IAST: akāri te harivo brahma navyaṁ dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ
Griffith: For thee a new hymn, Lord of Bays, is fashioned. May we, car-borne, through song be victors ever.
Devanāgarī: अकारि ते हरिवो ब्रह्म नव्यं धिया स्याम रथ्यः सदासाः
pada pāṭha: nu | stutaḥ | indra | nu | gr̥ṇānaḥ | iṣam | jaritre | nadyaḥ | na | pīperiti pīpeḥ || akāri | te | hari-vaḥ | brahma | navyam | dhiyā | syāma | rathyaḥ | sadā-sāḥ ||4.22.11||

IAST: kathā mahām avṛdhat kasya hotur yajñaṁ juṣāṇo abhi somam ūdhaḥ
Griffith: How, what priest's sacrifice hath he made mighty, rejoicing in the Soma and its fountain?
Devanāgarī: कथा महामवृधत्कस्य होतुर्यज्ञं जुषाणो अभि सोममूधः
pada pāṭha: kathā | mahām | avr̥dhat | kasya | hotuḥ | yajñam | juṣāṇaḥ | abhi | somam | ūdhaḥ || piban | uśānaḥ | juṣamāṇaḥ | andhaḥ | vavakṣe | r̥ṣvaḥ | śucate | dhanāya ||4.23.1||

IAST: pibann uśāno juṣamāṇo andho vavakṣa ṛṣvaḥ śucate dhanāya
Griffith: Delighting in juice, eagerly drinking, the Lofty One hath waxed for splendid riches.
Devanāgarī: पिबन्नुशानो जुषमाणो अन्धो ववक्ष ऋष्वः शुचते धनाय
pada pāṭha: kathā | mahām | avr̥dhat | kasya | hotuḥ | yajñam | juṣāṇaḥ | abhi | somam | ūdhaḥ || piban | uśānaḥ | juṣamāṇaḥ | andhaḥ | vavakṣe | r̥ṣvaḥ | śucate | dhanāya ||4.23.1||

IAST: ko asya vīraḥ sadhamādam āpa sam ānaṁśa sumatibhiḥ ko asya
Griffith: What hero hath been made his feast-companion? Who hath been partner in his loving-kindness?
Devanāgarī: को अस्य वीरः सधमादमाप समानंश सुमतिभिः को अस्य
pada pāṭha: kaḥ | asya | vīraḥ | sadha-mādam | āpa | sam | ānaṁśa | sumati-bhiḥ | kaḥ | asya || kat | asya | citram | cikite | kat | ūtī | vr̥dhe | bhuvat | śaśamānasya | yajyoḥ ||4.23.2||

IAST: kad asya citraṁ cikite kad ūtī vṛdhe bhuvac chaśamānasya yajyoḥ
Griffith: What know we of his wondrous acts? How often comes he to aid and speed the pious toiler?
Devanāgarī: कदस्य चित्रं चिकिते कदूती वृधे भुवच्छशमानस्य यज्योः
pada pāṭha: kaḥ | asya | vīraḥ | sadha-mādam | āpa | sam | ānaṁśa | sumati-bhiḥ | kaḥ | asya || kat | asya | citram | cikite | kat | ūtī | vr̥dhe | bhuvat | śaśamānasya | yajyoḥ ||4.23.2||

IAST: kathā śṛṇoti hūyamānam indraḥ kathā śṛṇvann avasām asya veda
Griffith: How heareth Indra offered invocation? How, hearing, marketh he the invoker's wishes?
Devanāgarī: कथा शृणोति हूयमानमिन्द्रः कथा शृण्वन्नवसामस्य वेद
pada pāṭha: kathā | śr̥ṇoti | hūyamānam | indraḥ | kathā | śr̥ṇvan | avasām | asya | veda || kāḥ | asya | pūrvīḥ | upa-mātayaḥ | ha | kathā | enam | āhuḥ | papurim | jaritre ||4.23.3||

IAST: kā asya pūrvīr upamātayo ha kathainam āhuḥ papuriṁ jaritre
Griffith: What are his ancient acts of bounty? Wherefore call they him One who filleth full the singer?
Devanāgarī: का अस्य पूर्वीरुपमातयो ह कथैनमाहुः पपुरिं जरित्रे
pada pāṭha: kathā | śr̥ṇoti | hūyamānam | indraḥ | kathā | śr̥ṇvan | avasām | asya | veda || kāḥ | asya | pūrvīḥ | upa-mātayaḥ | ha | kathā | enam | āhuḥ | papurim | jaritre ||4.23.3||

IAST: kathā sabādhaḥ śaśamāno asya naśad abhi draviṇaṁ dīdhyānaḥ
Griffith: How doth the priest who laboureth, ever longing, win for himself the wealth which he possesseth?
Devanāgarī: कथा सबाधः शशमानो अस्य नशदभि द्रविणं दीध्यानः
pada pāṭha: kathā | sa-bādhaḥ | śaśamānaḥ | asya | naśat | abhi | draviṇam | dīdhyānaḥ || devaḥ | bhuvat | navedāḥ | me | r̥tānām | namaḥ | jagr̥bhvān | abhi | yat | jujoṣat ||4.23.4||

IAST: devo bhuvan navedā ma ṛtānāṁ namo jagṛbhvām̐ abhi yaj jujoṣat
Griffith: May he, the God, mark well my truthful praises, having received the homage which he loveth.
Devanāgarī: देवो भुवन्नवेदा म ऋतानां नमो जगृभ्वाँ अभि यज्जुजोषत्
pada pāṭha: kathā | sa-bādhaḥ | śaśamānaḥ | asya | naśat | abhi | draviṇam | dīdhyānaḥ || devaḥ | bhuvat | navedāḥ | me | r̥tānām | namaḥ | jagr̥bhvān | abhi | yat | jujoṣat ||4.23.4||

IAST: kathā kad asyā uṣaso vyuṣṭau devo martasya sakhyaṁ jujoṣa
Griffith: How, and what bond of friendship with a mortal hath the God chosen as this morn is breaking?
Devanāgarī: कथा कदस्या उषसो व्युष्टौ देवो मर्तस्य सख्यं जुजोष
pada pāṭha: kathā | kat | asyāḥ | uṣasaḥ | vi-uṣṭau | devaḥ | martasya | sakhyam | jujoṣa || kathā | kat | asya | sakhyam | sakhi-bhyaḥ | ye | asmin | kāmam | su-yujam | tatasre ||4.23.5||

IAST: kathā kad asya sakhyaṁ sakhibhyo ye asmin kāmaṁ suyujaṁ tatasre
Griffith: How, and what love hath he for those who love him, who have entwined in him their firm affection?
Devanāgarī: कथा कदस्य सख्यं सखिभ्यो ये अस्मिन्कामं सुयुजं ततस्रे
pada pāṭha: kathā | kat | asyāḥ | uṣasaḥ | vi-uṣṭau | devaḥ | martasya | sakhyam | jujoṣa || kathā | kat | asya | sakhyam | sakhi-bhyaḥ | ye | asmin | kāmam | su-yujam | tatasre ||4.23.5||

IAST: kim ād amatraṁ sakhyaṁ sakhibhyaḥ kadā nu te bhrātram pra bravāma
Griffith: Is then thy friendship with thy friends most mighty? Thy brotherhood with us, -when may we tell it?
Devanāgarī: किमादमत्रं सख्यं सखिभ्यः कदा नु ते भ्रात्रं प्र ब्रवाम
pada pāṭha: kim | āt | amatram | sakhyam | sakhi-bhyaḥ | kadā | nu | te | bhrātram | pra | bravāma || śriye | su-dr̥śaḥ | vapuḥ | asya | sargāḥ | svaḥ | na | citra-tamam | iṣe | ā | goḥ ||4.23.6||

IAST: śriye sudṛśo vapur asya sargāḥ svar ṇa citratamam iṣa ā goḥ
Griffith: The streams of milk move, as most wondrous sunlight, the beauty of the Lovely One for glory.
Devanāgarī: श्रिये सुदृशो वपुरस्य सर्गाः स्वर्ण चित्रतममिष आ गोः
pada pāṭha: kim | āt | amatram | sakhyam | sakhi-bhyaḥ | kadā | nu | te | bhrātram | pra | bravāma || śriye | su-dr̥śaḥ | vapuḥ | asya | sargāḥ | svaḥ | na | citra-tamam | iṣe | ā | goḥ ||4.23.6||

IAST: druhaṁ jighāṁsan dhvarasam anindrāṁ tetikte tigmā tujase anīkā
Griffith: About to stay the Indra-less destructive spirit he sharpens his keen arms to strike her.
Devanāgarī: द्रुहं जिघांसन्ध्वरसमनिन्द्रां तेतिक्ते तिग्मा तुजसे अनीका
pada pāṭha: druham | jighāṁsan | dhvarasam | anindrām | tetikte | tigmā | tujase | anīkā || r̥ṇā | cit | yatra | r̥ṇa-yāḥ | naḥ | ugraḥ | dūre | ajñātāḥ | uṣasaḥ | babādhe ||4.23.7||

IAST: ṛṇā cid yatra ṛṇayā na ugro dūre ajñātā uṣaso babādhe
Griffith: Whereby the Strong, although our debts' exactor, drives in the distant mornings that we know not.
Devanāgarī: ऋणा चिद्यत्र ऋणया न उग्रो दूरे अज्ञाता उषसो बबाधे
pada pāṭha: druham | jighāṁsan | dhvarasam | anindrām | tetikte | tigmā | tujase | anīkā || r̥ṇā | cit | yatra | r̥ṇa-yāḥ | naḥ | ugraḥ | dūre | ajñātāḥ | uṣasaḥ | babādhe ||4.23.7||

IAST: ṛtasya hi śurudhaḥ santi pūrvīr ṛtasya dhītir vṛjināni hanti
Griffith: Eternal Law hath varied food that strengthens; thought of eternal Law, removes transgressions.
Devanāgarī: ऋतस्य हि शुरुधः सन्ति पूर्वीरृतस्य धीतिर्वृजिनानि हन्ति
pada pāṭha: r̥tasya | hi | śurudhaḥ | santi | pūrvīḥ | r̥tasya | dhītiḥ | vr̥jināni | hanti || r̥tasya | ślokaḥ | badhirā | tatarda | karṇā | budhānaḥ | śucamānaḥ | āyoḥ ||4.23.8||

IAST: ṛtasya śloko badhirā tatarda karṇā budhānaḥ śucamāna āyoḥ
Griffith: The praise-hymn of eternal Law, arousing, glowing, hath oped the deaf ears of the living.
Devanāgarī: ऋतस्य श्लोको बधिरा ततर्द कर्णा बुधानः शुचमान आयोः
pada pāṭha: r̥tasya | hi | śurudhaḥ | santi | pūrvīḥ | r̥tasya | dhītiḥ | vr̥jināni | hanti || r̥tasya | ślokaḥ | badhirā | tatarda | karṇā | budhānaḥ | śucamānaḥ | āyoḥ ||4.23.8||

IAST: ṛtasya dṛḻhā dharuṇāni santi purūṇi candrā vapuṣe vapūṁṣi
Griffith: Firm-seated are eternal Law's foundations in its fair form are many splendid beauties.
Devanāgarī: ऋतस्य दृळ्हा धरुणानि सन्ति पुरूणि चन्द्रा वपुषे वपूंषि
pada pāṭha: r̥tasya | dr̥ḷhā | dharuṇāni | santi | purūṇi | candrā | vapuṣe | vapūṁṣi || r̥tena | dīrgham | iṣaṇanta | pr̥kṣaḥ | r̥tena | gāvaḥ | r̥tam | ā | viveśuḥ ||4.23.9||

IAST: ṛtena dīrgham iṣaṇanta pṛkṣa ṛtena gāva ṛtam ā viveśuḥ
Griffith: By holy Law long lasting food they bring us; by holy Law have cows come to our worship.
Devanāgarī: ऋतेन दीर्घमिषणन्त पृक्ष ऋतेन गाव ऋतमा विवेशुः
pada pāṭha: r̥tasya | dr̥ḷhā | dharuṇāni | santi | purūṇi | candrā | vapuṣe | vapūṁṣi || r̥tena | dīrgham | iṣaṇanta | pr̥kṣaḥ | r̥tena | gāvaḥ | r̥tam | ā | viveśuḥ ||4.23.9||

IAST: ṛtaṁ yemāna ṛtam id vanoty ṛtasya śuṣmas turayā u gavyuḥ
Griffith: Fixing eternal Law he, too, upholds it swift moves the might of Law and wins the booty.
Devanāgarī: ऋतं येमान ऋतमिद्वनोत्यृतस्य शुष्मस्तुरया उ गव्युः
pada pāṭha: r̥tam | yemānaḥ | r̥tam | it | vanoti | r̥tasya | śuṣmaḥ | tura-yāḥ | ūm̐ iti | gavyuḥ || r̥tāya | pr̥thvī iti | bahule iti | gabhīre iti | r̥tāya | dhenū iti | parame iti | duhāte iti ||4.23.10||

IAST: ṛtāya pṛthvī bahule gabhīre ṛtāya dhenū parame duhāte
Griffith: To Law belong the vast deep Earth and Heaven: Milch-kine supreme, to Law their milk they render.
Devanāgarī: ऋताय पृथ्वी बहुले गभीरे ऋताय धेनू परमे दुहाते
pada pāṭha: r̥tam | yemānaḥ | r̥tam | it | vanoti | r̥tasya | śuṣmaḥ | tura-yāḥ | ūm̐ iti | gavyuḥ || r̥tāya | pr̥thvī iti | bahule iti | gabhīre iti | r̥tāya | dhenū iti | parame iti | duhāte iti ||4.23.10||

IAST: nū ṣṭuta indra nū gṛṇāna iṣaṁ jaritre nadyo na pīpeḥ
Griffith: Now, Indra! lauded,- glorified with praises, let power swell high like rivers to the singer.
Devanāgarī: नू ष्टुत इन्द्र नू गृणान इषं जरित्रे नद्यो न पीपेः
pada pāṭha: nu | stutaḥ | indra | nu | gr̥ṇānaḥ | iṣam | jaritre | nadyaḥ | na | pīperiti pīpeḥ || akāri | te | hari-vaḥ | brahma | navyam | dhiyā | syāma | rathyaḥ | sadā-sāḥ ||4.23.11||

IAST: akāri te harivo brahma navyaṁ dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ
Griffith: For thee a new hymn, Lord of Bays, is fashioned. May we, car-borne, through song be victors ever.
Devanāgarī: अकारि ते हरिवो ब्रह्म नव्यं धिया स्याम रथ्यः सदासाः
pada pāṭha: nu | stutaḥ | indra | nu | gr̥ṇānaḥ | iṣam | jaritre | nadyaḥ | na | pīperiti pīpeḥ || akāri | te | hari-vaḥ | brahma | navyam | dhiyā | syāma | rathyaḥ | sadā-sāḥ ||4.23.11||

IAST: kā suṣṭutiḥ śavasaḥ sūnum indram arvācīnaṁ rādhasa ā vavartat
Griffith: WHAT worthy praise will bring before us Indra, the Son of Strength, that he may grant us riches;
Devanāgarī: का सुष्टुतिः शवसः सूनुमिन्द्रमर्वाचीनं राधस आ ववर्तत्
pada pāṭha: kā | su-stutiḥ | śavasaḥ | sūnum | indram | arvācīnam | rādhase | ā | vavartat || dadiḥ | hi | vīraḥ | gr̥ṇate | vasūni | saḥ | go-patiḥ | niḥ-sidhām | naḥ | janāsaḥ ||4.24.1||

IAST: dadir hi vīro gṛṇate vasūni sa gopatir niṣṣidhāṁ no janāsaḥ
Griffith: For he the Hero, gives the singer treasures: he is the Lord who sends us gifts, ye people.
Devanāgarī: ददिर्हि वीरो गृणते वसूनि स गोपतिर्निष्षिधां नो जनासः
pada pāṭha: kā | su-stutiḥ | śavasaḥ | sūnum | indram | arvācīnam | rādhase | ā | vavartat || dadiḥ | hi | vīraḥ | gr̥ṇate | vasūni | saḥ | go-patiḥ | niḥ-sidhām | naḥ | janāsaḥ ||4.24.1||

IAST: sa vṛtrahatye havyaḥ sa īḍyaḥ sa suṣṭuta indraḥ satyarādhāḥ
Griffith: To be invoked and hymned in fight with Vrtra, that well-praised Indra gives us real bounties.
Devanāgarī: स वृत्रहत्ये हव्यः स ईड्यः स सुष्टुत इन्द्रः सत्यराधाः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | vr̥tra-hatye | havyaḥ | saḥ | īḍyaḥ | saḥ | su-stutaḥ | indraḥ | satya-rādhāḥ || saḥ | yāman | ā | magha-vā | martyāya | brahmaṇyate | susvaye | varivaḥ | dhāt ||4.24.2||

IAST: sa yāmann ā maghavā martyāya brahmaṇyate suṣvaye varivo dhāt
Griffith: That Maghavan brings comfort in the foray to the religious man who pours libations.
Devanāgarī: स यामन्ना मघवा मर्त्याय ब्रह्मण्यते सुष्वये वरिवो धात्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | vr̥tra-hatye | havyaḥ | saḥ | īḍyaḥ | saḥ | su-stutaḥ | indraḥ | satya-rādhāḥ || saḥ | yāman | ā | magha-vā | martyāya | brahmaṇyate | susvaye | varivaḥ | dhāt ||4.24.2||

IAST: tam in naro vi hvayante samīke ririkvāṁsas tanvaḥ kṛṇvata trām
Griffith: Him, verily, the men invoke in combat; risking their lives they make him their protector,
Devanāgarī: तमिन्नरो वि ह्वयन्ते समीके रिरिक्वांसस्तन्वः कृण्वत त्राम्
pada pāṭha: tam | it | naraḥ | vi | hvayante | sam-īke | ririkvāṁsaḥ | tanvaḥ | kr̥ṇvata | trām || mithaḥ | yat | tyāgam | ubhayāsaḥ | agman | naraḥ | tokasya | tanayasya | sātau ||4.24.3||

IAST: mitho yat tyāgam ubhayāso agman naras tokasya tanayasya sātau
Griffith: When heroes, foe to foe, give up their bodies, fighting, each side, for children and their offspring.
Devanāgarī: मिथो यत्त्यागमुभयासो अग्मन्नरस्तोकस्य तनयस्य सातौ
pada pāṭha: tam | it | naraḥ | vi | hvayante | sam-īke | ririkvāṁsaḥ | tanvaḥ | kr̥ṇvata | trām || mithaḥ | yat | tyāgam | ubhayāsaḥ | agman | naraḥ | tokasya | tanayasya | sātau ||4.24.3||

IAST: kratūyanti kṣitayo yoga ugrāśuṣāṇāso mitho arṇasātau
Griffith: Strong God! the folk at need put forth their vigour, striving together in the whirl of battle.
Devanāgarī: क्रतूयन्ति क्षितयो योग उग्राशुषाणासो मिथो अर्णसातौ
pada pāṭha: kratu-yanti | kṣitayaḥ | yoge | ugra | āśuṣāṇāsaḥ | mithaḥ | arṇa-sātau || sam | yat | viśaḥ | avavr̥tranta | yudhmāḥ | āt | it | neme | indrayante | abhīke ||4.24.4||

IAST: saṁ yad viśo 'vavṛtranta yudhmā ād in nema indrayante abhīke
Griffith: When warrior bands encounter one another some in the grapple quit themselves like Indra.
Devanāgarī: सं यद्विशोऽववृत्रन्त युध्मा आदिन्नेम इन्द्रयन्ते अभीके
pada pāṭha: kratu-yanti | kṣitayaḥ | yoge | ugra | āśuṣāṇāsaḥ | mithaḥ | arṇa-sātau || sam | yat | viśaḥ | avavr̥tranta | yudhmāḥ | āt | it | neme | indrayante | abhīke ||4.24.4||

IAST: ād id dha nema indriyaṁ yajanta ād it paktiḥ puroḻāśaṁ riricyāt
Griffith: Hence many a one worships the might of Indra: hence let the brew succeed the meal-oblation.
Devanāgarī: आदिद्ध नेम इन्द्रियं यजन्त आदित्पक्तिः पुरोळाशं रिरिच्यात्
pada pāṭha: āt | it | ha | neme | indriyam | yajante | āt | it | paktiḥ | puroḷāśam | riricyāt || āt | it | somaḥ | vi | papr̥cyāt | asusvīn | āt | it | jujoṣa | vr̥ṣabham | yajadhyai ||4.24.5||

IAST: ād it somo vi papṛcyād asuṣvīn ād ij jujoṣa vṛṣabhaṁ yajadhyai
Griffith: Hence let the Soma banish those who pour not: even hence I joy to pay the Strong One worship.
Devanāgarī: आदित्सोमो वि पपृच्यादसुष्वीनादिज्जुजोष वृषभं यजध्यै
pada pāṭha: āt | it | ha | neme | indriyam | yajante | āt | it | paktiḥ | puroḷāśam | riricyāt || āt | it | somaḥ | vi | papr̥cyāt | asusvīn | āt | it | jujoṣa | vr̥ṣabham | yajadhyai ||4.24.5||

IAST: kṛṇoty asmai varivo ya itthendrāya somam uśate sunoti
Griffith: Indra gives comfort to the man who truly presses, for him who longs fot it, the Soma,
Devanāgarī: कृणोत्यस्मै वरिवो य इत्थेन्द्राय सोममुशते सुनोति
pada pāṭha: kr̥ṇoti | asmai | varivaḥ | yaḥ | itthā | indrāya | somam | uśate | sunoti || sadhrīcīnena | manasā | avi-venan | tam | it | sakhāyam | kr̥ṇute | samat-su ||4.24.6||

IAST: sadhrīcīnena manasāvivenan tam it sakhāyaṁ kṛṇute samatsu
Griffith: Not disaffected, with devoted spirit this man he takes to be his friend in battles.
Devanāgarī: सध्रीचीनेन मनसाविवेनन्तमित्सखायं कृणुते समत्सु
pada pāṭha: kr̥ṇoti | asmai | varivaḥ | yaḥ | itthā | indrāya | somam | uśate | sunoti || sadhrīcīnena | manasā | avi-venan | tam | it | sakhāyam | kr̥ṇute | samat-su ||4.24.6||

IAST: ya indrāya sunavat somam adya pacāt paktīr uta bhṛjjāti dhānāḥ
Griffith: He who this day for Indra presses Soma, prepares the brew and fries the grains of barley-
Devanāgarī: य इन्द्राय सुनवत्सोममद्य पचात्पक्तीरुत भृज्जाति धानाः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | indrāya | sunavat | somam | adya | pacāt | paktīḥ | uta | bhr̥jjāti | dhānāḥ || prati | manāyoḥ | ucathāni | haryan | tasmin | dadhat | vr̥ṣaṇam | śuṣmam | indraḥ ||4.24.7||

IAST: prati manāyor ucathāni haryan tasmin dadhad vṛṣaṇaṁ śuṣmam indraḥ
Griffith: Loving the hymns of that devoted servant, to him may Indra give heroic vigour.
Devanāgarī: प्रति मनायोरुचथानि हर्यन्तस्मिन्दधद्वृषणं शुष्ममिन्द्रः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | indrāya | sunavat | somam | adya | pacāt | paktīḥ | uta | bhr̥jjāti | dhānāḥ || prati | manāyoḥ | ucathāni | haryan | tasmin | dadhat | vr̥ṣaṇam | śuṣmam | indraḥ ||4.24.7||

IAST: yadā samaryaṁ vy aced ṛghāvā dīrghaṁ yad ājim abhy akhyad aryaḥ
Griffith: When the impetuous chief hath sought the confliet, and the lord looked upon the long-drawn battle,
Devanāgarī: यदा समर्यं व्यचेदृघावा दीर्घं यदाजिमभ्यख्यदर्यः
pada pāṭha: yadā | sa-maryam | vi | acet | r̥ghāvā | dīrgham | yat | ājim | abhi | akhyat | aryaḥ || acikradat | vr̥ṣaṇam | patnī | accha | duroṇe | ā | ni-śitam | somasut-bhiḥ ||4.24.8||

IAST: acikradad vṛṣaṇam patny acchā duroṇa ā niśitaṁ somasudbhiḥ
Griffith: The matron calls to the Strong God whom pressers of Soma have encouraged int the dwelling.
Devanāgarī: अचिक्रदद्वृषणं पत्न्यच्छा दुरोण आ निशितं सोमसुद्भिः
pada pāṭha: yadā | sa-maryam | vi | acet | r̥ghāvā | dīrgham | yat | ājim | abhi | akhyat | aryaḥ || acikradat | vr̥ṣaṇam | patnī | accha | duroṇe | ā | ni-śitam | somasut-bhiḥ ||4.24.8||

IAST: bhūyasā vasnam acarat kanīyo 'vikrīto akāniṣam punar yan
Griffith: He bid a small price for a thing of value: I was content, returning, still unpurchased.
Devanāgarī: भूयसा वस्नमचरत्कनीयोऽविक्रीतो अकानिषं पुनर्यन्
pada pāṭha: bhūyasā | vasnam | acarat | kanīyaḥ | avi-krītaḥ | akāniṣam | punaḥ | yan || saḥ | bhūyasā | kanīyaḥ | na | arirecīt | dīnāḥ | dakṣāḥ | vi | duhanti | pra | vāṇam ||4.24.9||

IAST: sa bhūyasā kanīyo nārirecīd dīnā dakṣā vi duhanti pra vāṇam
Griffith: He heightened not his insufficient offer. Simple and clever, both milk out the udder.
Devanāgarī: स भूयसा कनीयो नारिरेचीद्दीना दक्षा वि दुहन्ति प्र वाणम्
pada pāṭha: bhūyasā | vasnam | acarat | kanīyaḥ | avi-krītaḥ | akāniṣam | punaḥ | yan || saḥ | bhūyasā | kanīyaḥ | na | arirecīt | dīnāḥ | dakṣāḥ | vi | duhanti | pra | vāṇam ||4.24.9||

IAST: ka imaṁ daśabhir mamendraṁ krīṇāti dhenubhiḥ
Griffith: Who for ten milch-kine purchaseth from rne this Indra who is mine?
Devanāgarī: क इमं दशभिर्ममेन्द्रं क्रीणाति धेनुभिः
pada pāṭha: kaḥ | imam | daśa-bhiḥ | mama | indram | krīṇāti | dhenu-bhiḥ || yadā | vr̥trāṇi | jaṅghanat | atha | enam | me | punaḥ | dadat ||4.24.10||

IAST: yadā vṛtrāṇi jaṅghanad athainam me punar dadat
Griffith: When he hath slain the Vrtras let the buyer give him back to me.
Devanāgarī: यदा वृत्राणि जङ्घनदथैनं मे पुनर्ददत्
pada pāṭha: kaḥ | imam | daśa-bhiḥ | mama | indram | krīṇāti | dhenu-bhiḥ || yadā | vr̥trāṇi | jaṅghanat | atha | enam | me | punaḥ | dadat ||4.24.10||

IAST: nū ṣṭuta indra nū gṛṇāna iṣaṁ jaritre nadyo na pīpeḥ
Griffith: Now, Indra! lauded, glorified with praises, let wealth swell high like rivers for the singer.
Devanāgarī: नू ष्टुत इन्द्र नू गृणान इषं जरित्रे नद्यो न पीपेः
pada pāṭha: nu | stutaḥ | indra | nu | gr̥ṇānaḥ | iṣam | jaritre | nadyaḥ | na | pīperiti pīpeḥ || akāri | te | hari-vaḥ | brahma | navyam | dhiyā | syāma | rathyaḥ | sadā-sāḥ ||4.24.11||

IAST: akāri te harivo brahma navyaṁ dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ
Griffith: For thee a new hymn, Lord of Bays, is fashioned. May we, car-borne, through song be victors ever.
Devanāgarī: अकारि ते हरिवो ब्रह्म नव्यं धिया स्याम रथ्यः सदासाः
pada pāṭha: nu | stutaḥ | indra | nu | gr̥ṇānaḥ | iṣam | jaritre | nadyaḥ | na | pīperiti pīpeḥ || akāri | te | hari-vaḥ | brahma | navyam | dhiyā | syāma | rathyaḥ | sadā-sāḥ ||4.24.11||

IAST: ko adya naryo devakāma uśann indrasya sakhyaṁ jujoṣa
Griffith: WHAT friend of man, God-loving, hath delighted, yearning therefor, this day in Indra's friendship?
Devanāgarī: को अद्य नर्यो देवकाम उशन्निन्द्रस्य सख्यं जुजोष
pada pāṭha: kaḥ | adya | naryaḥ | deva-kāmaḥ | uśan | indrasya | sakhyam | jujoṣa || kaḥ | vā | mahe | avase | pāryāya | sam-iddhe | agnau | suta-somaḥ | īṭṭe ||4.25.1||

IAST: ko vā mahe 'vase pāryāya samiddhe agnau sutasoma īṭṭe
Griffith: Who with enkindled flame and flowing Soma laudeth him for his great protecting favour?
Devanāgarī: को वा महेऽवसे पार्याय समिद्धे अग्नौ सुतसोम ईट्टे
pada pāṭha: kaḥ | adya | naryaḥ | deva-kāmaḥ | uśan | indrasya | sakhyam | jujoṣa || kaḥ | vā | mahe | avase | pāryāya | sam-iddhe | agnau | suta-somaḥ | īṭṭe ||4.25.1||

IAST: ko nānāma vacasā somyāya manāyur vā bhavati vasta usrāḥ
Griffith: Who hath with prayer bowed to the Soma-lover? What pious man endues the beams of morning?
Devanāgarī: को नानाम वचसा सोम्याय मनायुर्वा भवति वस्त उस्राः
pada pāṭha: kaḥ | nanāma | vacasā | somyāya | manāyuḥ | vā | bhavati | vaste | usrāḥ || kaḥ | indrasya | yujyam | kaḥ | sakhi-tvam | kaḥ | bhrātram | vaṣṭi | kavaye | kaḥ | ūtī ||4.25.2||

IAST: ka indrasya yujyaṁ kaḥ sakhitvaṁ ko bhrātraṁ vaṣṭi kavaye ka ūtī
Griffith: Who seeks bond, fritridship, brotherhood with Indra? Who hath recourse unto the Sage for succour?
Devanāgarī: क इन्द्रस्य युज्यं कः सखित्वं को भ्रात्रं वष्टि कवये क ऊती
pada pāṭha: kaḥ | nanāma | vacasā | somyāya | manāyuḥ | vā | bhavati | vaste | usrāḥ || kaḥ | indrasya | yujyam | kaḥ | sakhi-tvam | kaḥ | bhrātram | vaṣṭi | kavaye | kaḥ | ūtī ||4.25.2||

IAST: ko devānām avo adyā vṛṇīte ka ādityām̐ aditiṁ jyotir īṭṭe
Griffith: Who claims to-day the Deities' protection, asks Aditi for light, or the Adityas?
Devanāgarī: को देवानामवो अद्या वृणीते क आदित्याँ अदितिं ज्योतिरीट्टे
pada pāṭha: kaḥ | devānām | avaḥ | adya | vr̥ṇīte | kaḥ | ādityān | aditim | jyotiḥ | īṭṭe || kasya | aśvinau | indraḥ | agniḥ | sutasya | aṁśoḥ | pibanti | manasā | avi-venam ||4.25.3||

IAST: kasyāśvināv indro agniḥ sutasyāṁśoḥ pibanti manasāvivenam
Griffith: Of whose pressed stalk of Soma drink the Asvins, Indra, and Agni, well-inclined in spirit?
Devanāgarī: कस्याश्विनाविन्द्रो अग्निः सुतस्यांशोः पिबन्ति मनसाविवेनम्
pada pāṭha: kaḥ | devānām | avaḥ | adya | vr̥ṇīte | kaḥ | ādityān | aditim | jyotiḥ | īṭṭe || kasya | aśvinau | indraḥ | agniḥ | sutasya | aṁśoḥ | pibanti | manasā | avi-venam ||4.25.3||

IAST: tasmā agnir bhārataḥ śarma yaṁsaj jyok paśyāt sūryam uccarantam
Griffith: To him shall Agni Bharata give shelter: long shall he look upon the Sun up-rising,
Devanāgarī: तस्मा अग्निर्भारतः शर्म यंसज्ज्योक्पश्यात्सूर्यमुच्चरन्तम्
pada pāṭha: tasmai | agniḥ | bhārataḥ | śarma | yaṁsat | jyok | paśyāt | sūryam | ut-carantam || yaḥ | indrāya | sunavāma | iti | āha | nare | naryāya | nr̥-tamāya | nr̥ṇām ||4.25.4||

IAST: ya indrāya sunavāmety āha nare naryāya nṛtamāya nṛṇām
Griffith: Who sayeth, Let us press the juice for Indra, man's Friend, the Hero manliest of heroes.
Devanāgarī: य इन्द्राय सुनवामेत्याह नरे नर्याय नृतमाय नृणाम्
pada pāṭha: tasmai | agniḥ | bhārataḥ | śarma | yaṁsat | jyok | paśyāt | sūryam | ut-carantam || yaḥ | indrāya | sunavāma | iti | āha | nare | naryāya | nr̥-tamāya | nr̥ṇām ||4.25.4||

IAST: na taṁ jinanti bahavo na dabhrā urv asmā aditiḥ śarma yaṁsat
Griffith: Him neither few men overcome, nor many to him shall Aditi give spacious shelter.
Devanāgarī: न तं जिनन्ति बहवो न दभ्रा उर्वस्मा अदितिः शर्म यंसत्
pada pāṭha: na | tam | jinanti | bahavaḥ | na | dabhrāḥ | uru | asmai | aditiḥ | śarma | yaṁsat || priyaḥ | su-kr̥t | priyaḥ | indre | manāyuḥ | priyaḥ | supra-avīḥ | priyaḥ | asya | somī ||4.25.5||

IAST: priyaḥ sukṛt priya indre manāyuḥ priyaḥ suprāvīḥ priyo asya somī
Griffith: Dear is the pious, the devout, to Indra dear is the zealous, dear the Soma-bringer.
Devanāgarī: प्रियः सुकृत्प्रिय इन्द्रे मनायुः प्रियः सुप्रावीः प्रियो अस्य सोमी
pada pāṭha: na | tam | jinanti | bahavaḥ | na | dabhrāḥ | uru | asmai | aditiḥ | śarma | yaṁsat || priyaḥ | su-kr̥t | priyaḥ | indre | manāyuḥ | priyaḥ | supra-avīḥ | priyaḥ | asya | somī ||4.25.5||

IAST: suprāvyaḥ prāśuṣāḻ eṣa vīraḥ suṣveḥ paktiṁ kṛṇute kevalendraḥ
Griffith: This Hero curbs the mighty for the zealous: the presser's brew Indra possesses solely:
Devanāgarī: सुप्राव्यः प्राशुषाळेष वीरः सुष्वेः पक्तिं कृणुते केवलेन्द्रः
pada pāṭha: supra-avyaḥ | prāśuṣāṭ | eṣaḥ | vīraḥ | susveḥ | paktim | kr̥ṇute | kevalā | indraḥ || na | asusveḥ | āpiḥ | na | sakhā | na | jāmiḥ | duḥpra-avyaḥ | ava-hantā | it | avācaḥ ||4.25.6||

IAST: nāsuṣver āpir na sakhā na jāmir duṣprāvyo 'vahanted avācaḥ
Griffith: No brother, kin, or friend to him who pours not, destroyer of the dumb who would resist him.
Devanāgarī: नासुष्वेरापिर्न सखा न जामिर्दुष्प्राव्योऽवहन्तेदवाचः
pada pāṭha: supra-avyaḥ | prāśuṣāṭ | eṣaḥ | vīraḥ | susveḥ | paktim | kr̥ṇute | kevalā | indraḥ || na | asusveḥ | āpiḥ | na | sakhā | na | jāmiḥ | duḥpra-avyaḥ | ava-hantā | it | avācaḥ ||4.25.6||

IAST: na revatā paṇinā sakhyam indro 'sunvatā sutapāḥ saṁ gṛṇīte
Griffith: Not with the wealthy churl who pours no Soma doth Indra, Soma-drinker, bind alliance.
Devanāgarī: न रेवता पणिना सख्यमिन्द्रोऽसुन्वता सुतपाः सं गृणीते
pada pāṭha: na | revatā | paṇinā | sakhyam | indraḥ | asunvatā | suta-pāḥ | sam | gr̥ṇīte || ā | asya | vedaḥ | khidati | hanti | nagnam | vi | susvaye | paktaye | kevalaḥ | bhūt ||4.25.7||

IAST: āsya vedaḥ khidati hanti nagnaṁ vi suṣvaye paktaye kevalo bhūt
Griffith: He draws away his wealth and slays him naked, own Friend to him who offers, for oblation.
Devanāgarī: आस्य वेदः खिदति हन्ति नग्नं वि सुष्वये पक्तये केवलो भूत्
pada pāṭha: na | revatā | paṇinā | sakhyam | indraḥ | asunvatā | suta-pāḥ | sam | gr̥ṇīte || ā | asya | vedaḥ | khidati | hanti | nagnam | vi | susvaye | paktaye | kevalaḥ | bhūt ||4.25.7||

IAST: indram pare 'vare madhyamāsa indraṁ yānto 'vasitāsa indram
Griffith: Highest and lowest, men who stand between diem, going, returning, dwelling in contentment,
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रं परेऽवरे मध्यमास इन्द्रं यान्तोऽवसितास इन्द्रम्
pada pāṭha: indram | pare | avare | madhyamāsaḥ | indram | yāntaḥ | ava-sitāsaḥ | indram || indram | kṣiyantaḥ | uta | yudhyamānāḥ | indram | naraḥ | vājayantaḥ | havante ||4.25.8||

IAST: indraṁ kṣiyanta uta yudhyamānā indraṁ naro vājayanto havante
Griffith: Those who show forth their strength when urged to battle-these are the men who call for aid on Indra.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रं क्षियन्त उत युध्यमाना इन्द्रं नरो वाजयन्तो हवन्ते
pada pāṭha: indram | pare | avare | madhyamāsaḥ | indram | yāntaḥ | ava-sitāsaḥ | indram || indram | kṣiyantaḥ | uta | yudhyamānāḥ | indram | naraḥ | vājayantaḥ | havante ||4.25.8||

IAST: aham manur abhavaṁ sūryaś cāhaṁ kakṣīvām̐ ṛṣir asmi vipraḥ
Griffith: I WAS aforetime Manu, I was Surya: I am the sage Kaksivan, holy singer.
Devanāgarī: अहं मनुरभवं सूर्यश्चाहं कक्षीवाँ ऋषिरस्मि विप्रः
pada pāṭha: aham | manuḥ | abhavam | sūryaḥ | ca | aham | kakṣīvān | r̥ṣiḥ | asmi | vipraḥ || aham | kutsam | ārjuneyam | ni | r̥ñje | aham | kaviḥ | uśanā | paśyata | mā ||4.26.1||

IAST: ahaṁ kutsam ārjuneyaṁ ny ṛñje 'haṁ kavir uśanā paśyatā mā
Griffith: Kutsa the son of Arjuni I master. I am the sapient Usana behold me.
Devanāgarī: अहं कुत्समार्जुनेयं न्यृञ्जेऽहं कविरुशना पश्यता मा
pada pāṭha: aham | manuḥ | abhavam | sūryaḥ | ca | aham | kakṣīvān | r̥ṣiḥ | asmi | vipraḥ || aham | kutsam | ārjuneyam | ni | r̥ñje | aham | kaviḥ | uśanā | paśyata | mā ||4.26.1||

IAST: aham bhūmim adadām āryāyāhaṁ vṛṣṭiṁ dāśuṣe martyāya
Griffith: I have bestowed the earth upon the Arya, and rain upon the man who brings oblation.
Devanāgarī: अहं भूमिमददामार्यायाहं वृष्टिं दाशुषे मर्त्याय
pada pāṭha: aham | bhūmim | adadām | āryāya | aham | vr̥ṣṭim | dāśuṣe | martyāya || aham | apaḥ | anayam | vāvaśānāḥ | mama | devāsaḥ | anu | ketam | āyan ||4.26.2||

IAST: aham apo anayaṁ vāvaśānā mama devāso anu ketam āyan
Griffith: I guided forth the loudly-roaring waters, and the Gods moved according to my pleasure.
Devanāgarī: अहमपो अनयं वावशाना मम देवासो अनु केतमायन्
pada pāṭha: aham | bhūmim | adadām | āryāya | aham | vr̥ṣṭim | dāśuṣe | martyāya || aham | apaḥ | anayam | vāvaśānāḥ | mama | devāsaḥ | anu | ketam | āyan ||4.26.2||

IAST: aham puro mandasāno vy airaṁ nava sākaṁ navatīḥ śambarasya
Griffith: In the wild joy of Soma I demolished Sambara's forts, ninety-and-nine, together;
Devanāgarī: अहं पुरो मन्दसानो व्यैरं नव साकं नवतीः शम्बरस्य
pada pāṭha: aham | puraḥ | mandasānaḥ | vi | airam | nava | sākam | navatīḥ | śambarasya || śata-tamam | veśyam | sarva-tātā | divaḥ-dāsam | atithi-gvam | yat | āvam ||4.26.3||

IAST: śatatamaṁ veśyaṁ sarvatātā divodāsam atithigvaṁ yad āvam
Griffith: And, utterly, the hundredth habitation, when helping Divodasa Atithigva.
Devanāgarī: शततमं वेश्यं सर्वताता दिवोदासमतिथिग्वं यदावम्
pada pāṭha: aham | puraḥ | mandasānaḥ | vi | airam | nava | sākam | navatīḥ | śambarasya || śata-tamam | veśyam | sarva-tātā | divaḥ-dāsam | atithi-gvam | yat | āvam ||4.26.3||

IAST: pra su ṣa vibhyo maruto vir astu pra śyenaḥ śyenebhya āśupatvā
Griffith: Before all birds be ranked this Bird, O Maruts; supreme of falcons be this fleet-winged Falcon,
Devanāgarī: प्र सु ष विभ्यो मरुतो विरस्तु प्र श्येनः श्येनेभ्य आशुपत्वा
pada pāṭha: pra | su | saḥ | vi-bhyaḥ | marutaḥ | viḥ | astu | pra | śyenaḥ | śyenebhyaḥ | āśu-patvā || acakrayā | yat | svadhayā | su-parṇaḥ | havyam | bharat | manave | deva-juṣṭam ||4.26.4||

IAST: acakrayā yat svadhayā suparṇo havyam bharan manave devajuṣṭam
Griffith: Because, strong- pinioned, with no car to bear him, he brought to Manu the Godloved oblation.
Devanāgarī: अचक्रया यत्स्वधया सुपर्णो हव्यं भरन्मनवे देवजुष्टम्
pada pāṭha: pra | su | saḥ | vi-bhyaḥ | marutaḥ | viḥ | astu | pra | śyenaḥ | śyenebhyaḥ | āśu-patvā || acakrayā | yat | svadhayā | su-parṇaḥ | havyam | bharat | manave | deva-juṣṭam ||4.26.4||

IAST: bharad yadi vir ato vevijānaḥ pathoruṇā manojavā asarji
Griffith: When the Bird brought it, hence in rapid motion sent on the wide path fleet as thought he hurried.
Devanāgarī: भरद्यदि विरतो वेविजानः पथोरुणा मनोजवा असर्जि
pada pāṭha: bharat | yadi | viḥ | ataḥ | vevijānaḥ | pathā | uruṇā | manaḥ-javāḥ | asarji || tūyam | yayau | madhunā | somyena | uta | śravaḥ | vivide | śyenaḥ | atra ||4.26.5||

IAST: tūyaṁ yayau madhunā somyenota śravo vivide śyeno atra
Griffith: Swift he returned with sweetness of the Soma, and hence the Falcon hath acquired his glory.
Devanāgarī: तूयं ययौ मधुना सोम्येनोत श्रवो विविदे श्येनो अत्र
pada pāṭha: bharat | yadi | viḥ | ataḥ | vevijānaḥ | pathā | uruṇā | manaḥ-javāḥ | asarji || tūyam | yayau | madhunā | somyena | uta | śravaḥ | vivide | śyenaḥ | atra ||4.26.5||

IAST: ṛjīpī śyeno dadamāno aṁśum parāvataḥ śakuno mandram madam
Griffith: Bearing the stalk, the Falcon speeding onward, Bird bringing from afar the draught that gladdens,
Devanāgarī: ऋजीपी श्येनो ददमानो अंशुं परावतः शकुनो मन्द्रं मदम्
pada pāṭha: r̥jīpī | śyenaḥ | dadamānaḥ | aṁśum | parā-vataḥ | śakunaḥ | mandram | madam || somam | bharat | dadr̥hāṇaḥ | deva-vān | divaḥ | amuṣmāt | ut-tarāt | ā-dāya ||4.26.6||

IAST: somam bharad dādṛhāṇo devāvān divo amuṣmād uttarād ādāya
Griffith: Friend of the Gods, brought, grasping fast, the Soma which be bad taken from yon loftiest heaven.
Devanāgarī: सोमं भरद्दादृहाणो देवावान्दिवो अमुष्मादुत्तरादादाय
pada pāṭha: r̥jīpī | śyenaḥ | dadamānaḥ | aṁśum | parā-vataḥ | śakunaḥ | mandram | madam || somam | bharat | dadr̥hāṇaḥ | deva-vān | divaḥ | amuṣmāt | ut-tarāt | ā-dāya ||4.26.6||

IAST: ādāya śyeno abharat somaṁ sahasraṁ savām̐ ayutaṁ ca sākam
Griffith: The Falcon took and brought the Soma, bearing thousand libations with him, yea, ten thousand.
