Devanāgarī: आदाय श्येनो अभरत्सोमं सहस्रं सवाँ अयुतं च साकम्
pada pāṭha: ā-dāya | śyenaḥ | abharat | somam | sahasram | savān | ayutam | ca | sākam || atra | puram-dhiḥ | ajahāt | arātīḥ | made | somasya | mūrāḥ | amūraḥ ||4.26.7||

IAST: atrā puraṁdhir ajahād arātīr made somasya mūrā amūraḥ
Griffith: The Bold One left Malignities behind him, wise, in wild joy of Soma, left the foolish.
Devanāgarī: अत्रा पुरंधिरजहादरातीर्मदे सोमस्य मूरा अमूरः
pada pāṭha: ā-dāya | śyenaḥ | abharat | somam | sahasram | savān | ayutam | ca | sākam || atra | puram-dhiḥ | ajahāt | arātīḥ | made | somasya | mūrāḥ | amūraḥ ||4.26.7||

IAST: garbhe nu sann anv eṣām avedam ahaṁ devānāṁ janimāni viśvā
Griffith: I, As I lay within the womb, considered all generations of these Gods in order.
Devanāgarī: गर्भे नु सन्नन्वेषामवेदमहं देवानां जनिमानि विश्वा
pada pāṭha: garbhe | nu | san | anu | eṣām | avedam | aham | devānām | janimāni | viśvā || śatam | mā | puraḥ | āyasīḥ | arakṣan | adha | śyenaḥ | javasā | niḥ | adīyam ||4.27.1||

IAST: śatam mā pura āyasīr arakṣann adha śyeno javasā nir adīyam
Griffith: A hundred iron fortresses confined me but forth I flew with rapid speed a Falcon.
Devanāgarī: शतं मा पुर आयसीररक्षन्नध श्येनो जवसा निरदीयम्
pada pāṭha: garbhe | nu | san | anu | eṣām | avedam | aham | devānām | janimāni | viśvā || śatam | mā | puraḥ | āyasīḥ | arakṣan | adha | śyenaḥ | javasā | niḥ | adīyam ||4.27.1||

IAST: na ghā sa mām apa joṣaṁ jabhārābhīm āsa tvakṣasā vīryeṇa
Griffith: Not at his own free pleasure did he bear me: he conquered with his strength and manly courage.
Devanāgarī: न घा स मामप जोषं जभाराभीमास त्वक्षसा वीर्येण
pada pāṭha: na | gha | saḥ | mām | apa | joṣam | jabhāra | abhi | īm | āsa | tvakṣasā | vīryeṇa || īrmā | puram-dhiḥ | ajahāt | arātīḥ | uta | vātān | atarat | śūśuvānaḥ ||4.27.2||

IAST: īrmā puraṁdhir ajahād arātīr uta vātām̐ atarac chūśuvānaḥ
Griffith: Straightway the Bold One left the fiends behind him and passed the winds as he grew yet more mighty.
Devanāgarī: ईर्मा पुरंधिरजहादरातीरुत वाताँ अतरच्छूशुवानः
pada pāṭha: na | gha | saḥ | mām | apa | joṣam | jabhāra | abhi | īm | āsa | tvakṣasā | vīryeṇa || īrmā | puram-dhiḥ | ajahāt | arātīḥ | uta | vātān | atarat | śūśuvānaḥ ||4.27.2||

IAST: ava yac chyeno asvanīd adha dyor vi yad yadi vāta ūhuḥ puraṁdhim
Griffith: When with loud cry from heaven down sped the Falcon, thence hasting like the wind he bore the Bold One.
Devanāgarī: अव यच्छ्येनो अस्वनीदध द्योर्वि यद्यदि वात ऊहुः पुरंधिम्
pada pāṭha: ava | yat | śyenaḥ | asvanīt | adha | dyoḥ | vi | yat | yadi | vā | ataḥ | ūhuḥ | puram-dhim || sr̥jat | yat | asmai | ava | ha | kṣipat | jyām | kr̥śānuḥ | astā | manasā | bhuraṇyan ||4.27.3||

IAST: sṛjad yad asmā ava ha kṣipaj jyāṁ kṛśānur astā manasā bhuraṇyan
Griffith: Then, wildly raging in his mind, the archer Krsanu aimed and loosed the string to strike him.
Devanāgarī: सृजद्यदस्मा अव ह क्षिपज्ज्यां कृशानुरस्ता मनसा भुरण्यन्
pada pāṭha: ava | yat | śyenaḥ | asvanīt | adha | dyoḥ | vi | yat | yadi | vā | ataḥ | ūhuḥ | puram-dhim || sr̥jat | yat | asmai | ava | ha | kṣipat | jyām | kr̥śānuḥ | astā | manasā | bhuraṇyan ||4.27.3||

IAST: ṛjipya īm indrāvato na bhujyuṁ śyeno jabhāra bṛhato adhi ṣṇoḥ
Griffith: The Falcon bore him from heaven's lofty summit as the swift car of Indra's Friend bore Bhujyu.
Devanāgarī: ऋजिप्य ईमिन्द्रावतो न भुज्युं श्येनो जभार बृहतो अधि ष्णोः
pada pāṭha: r̥jipyaḥ | īm | indra-vataḥ | na | bhujyum | śyenaḥ | jabhāra | br̥hataḥ | adhi | snoḥ || antariti | patat | patatri | asya | parṇam | adha | yāmani | pra-sitasya | tat | veriti veḥ ||4.27.4||

IAST: antaḥ patat patatry asya parṇam adha yāmani prasitasya tad veḥ
Griffith: Then downward bither fell a flying feather of the Bird hasting forward in his journey.
Devanāgarī: अन्तः पतत्पतत्र्यस्य पर्णमध यामनि प्रसितस्य तद्वेः
pada pāṭha: r̥jipyaḥ | īm | indra-vataḥ | na | bhujyum | śyenaḥ | jabhāra | br̥hataḥ | adhi | snoḥ || antariti | patat | patatri | asya | parṇam | adha | yāmani | pra-sitasya | tat | veriti veḥ ||4.27.4||

IAST: adha śvetaṁ kalaśaṁ gobhir aktam āpipyānam maghavā śukram andhaḥ
Griffith: And now let Maghavan accept the beaker, white, filled with milk, filled with the shining liquid;
Devanāgarī: अध श्वेतं कलशं गोभिरक्तमापिप्यानं मघवा शुक्रमन्धः
pada pāṭha: adha | śvetam | kalaśam | gobhiḥ | aktam | ā-pipyānam | magha-vā | śukram | andhaḥ || adhvaryu-bhiḥ | pra-yatam | madhvaḥ | agram | indraḥ | madāya | prati | dhat | pibadhyai | śūraḥ | madāya | prati | dhat | pibadhyai ||4.27.5||

IAST: adhvaryubhiḥ prayatam madhvo agram indro madāya prati dhat pibadhyai śūro madāya prati dhat pibadhyai
Griffith: The best of sweet meath which the priests have offered: that Indra to his joy may drink, the Hero, that he may take and drink it to his rapture.
Devanāgarī: अध्वर्युभिः प्रयतं मध्वो अग्रमिन्द्रो मदाय प्रति धत्पिबध्यै शूरो मदाय प्रति धत्पिबध्यै
pada pāṭha: adha | śvetam | kalaśam | gobhiḥ | aktam | ā-pipyānam | magha-vā | śukram | andhaḥ || adhvaryu-bhiḥ | pra-yatam | madhvaḥ | agram | indraḥ | madāya | prati | dhat | pibadhyai | śūraḥ | madāya | prati | dhat | pibadhyai ||4.27.5||

IAST: tvā yujā tava tat soma sakhya indro apo manave sasrutas kaḥ
Griffith: ALLIED with thee, in this thy friendship, Soma, Indra for man made waters flow together,
Devanāgarī: त्वा युजा तव तत्सोम सख्य इन्द्रो अपो मनवे सस्रुतस्कः
pada pāṭha: tvā | yujā | tava | tat | soma | sakhye | indraḥ | apaḥ | manave | sa-srutaḥ | kariti kaḥ || ahan | ahim | ariṇāt | sapta | sindhūn | apa | avr̥ṇot | apihitā-iva | khāni ||4.28.1||

IAST: ahann ahim ariṇāt sapta sindhūn apāvṛṇod apihiteva khāni
Griffith: Slew Ahi, and sent forth the Seven Rivers, and opened as it were obstructed fountains.
Devanāgarī: अहन्नहिमरिणात्सप्त सिन्धूनपावृणोदपिहितेव खानि
pada pāṭha: tvā | yujā | tava | tat | soma | sakhye | indraḥ | apaḥ | manave | sa-srutaḥ | kariti kaḥ || ahan | ahim | ariṇāt | sapta | sindhūn | apa | avr̥ṇot | apihitā-iva | khāni ||4.28.1||

IAST: tvā yujā ni khidat sūryasyendraś cakraṁ sahasā sadya indo
Griffith: Indu, with thee for his confederate, Indra swiftly with might pressed down the wheel of Surya.
Devanāgarī: त्वा युजा नि खिदत्सूर्यस्येन्द्रश्चक्रं सहसा सद्य इन्दो
pada pāṭha: tvā | yujā | ni | khidat | sūryasya | indraḥ | cakram | sahasā | sadyaḥ | indo iti || adhi | snunā | br̥hatā | vartamānam | mahaḥ | druhaḥ | apa | viśva-āyu | dhāyi ||4.28.2||

IAST: adhi ṣṇunā bṛhatā vartamānam maho druho apa viśvāyu dhāyi
Griffith: What rolled, all life's support, on heaven's high summit was separated from the great oppressor.
Devanāgarī: अधि ष्णुना बृहता वर्तमानं महो द्रुहो अप विश्वायु धायि
pada pāṭha: tvā | yujā | ni | khidat | sūryasya | indraḥ | cakram | sahasā | sadyaḥ | indo iti || adhi | snunā | br̥hatā | vartamānam | mahaḥ | druhaḥ | apa | viśva-āyu | dhāyi ||4.28.2||

IAST: ahann indro adahad agnir indo purā dasyūn madhyaṁdinād abhīke
Griffith: Indra smote down, Agni consumed, O Indu, the Dasyus ere the noontide in the conflict.
Devanāgarī: अहन्निन्द्रो अदहदग्निरिन्दो पुरा दस्यून्मध्यंदिनादभीके
pada pāṭha: ahan | indraḥ | adahat | agniḥ | indo iti | purā | dasyūn | madhyaṁdināt | abhīke || duḥ-ge | duroṇe | kratvā | na | yātām | puru | sahasrā | śarvā | ni | barhīt ||4.28.3||

IAST: durge duroṇe kratvā na yātām purū sahasrā śarvā ni barhīt
Griffith: Of those who gladly sought a hard-won dwelling he cast down many a thousand with his arrow.
Devanāgarī: दुर्गे दुरोणे क्रत्वा न यातां पुरू सहस्रा शर्वा नि बर्हीत्
pada pāṭha: ahan | indraḥ | adahat | agniḥ | indo iti | purā | dasyūn | madhyaṁdināt | abhīke || duḥ-ge | duroṇe | kratvā | na | yātām | puru | sahasrā | śarvā | ni | barhīt ||4.28.3||

IAST: viśvasmāt sīm adhamām̐ indra dasyūn viśo dāsīr akṛṇor apraśastāḥ
Griffith: Lower than all besides hast thou, O Indra, cast down the Dasyus, abject tribes of Dasas.
Devanāgarī: विश्वस्मात्सीमधमाँ इन्द्र दस्यून्विशो दासीरकृणोरप्रशस्ताः
pada pāṭha: viśvasmāt | sīm | adhamān | indra | dasyūn | viśaḥ | dāsīḥ | akr̥ṇoḥ | apra-śastāḥ || abādhethām | amr̥ṇatam | ni | śatrūn | avindethām | apa-citim | vadhatraiḥ ||4.28.4||

IAST: abādhethām amṛṇataṁ ni śatrūn avindethām apacitiṁ vadhatraiḥ
Griffith: Ye drave away, ye put to death the foemen, and took great vengeance with your murdering weapons.
Devanāgarī: अबाधेथाममृणतं नि शत्रूनविन्देथामपचितिं वधत्रैः
pada pāṭha: viśvasmāt | sīm | adhamān | indra | dasyūn | viśaḥ | dāsīḥ | akr̥ṇoḥ | apra-śastāḥ || abādhethām | amr̥ṇatam | ni | śatrūn | avindethām | apa-citim | vadhatraiḥ ||4.28.4||

IAST: evā satyam maghavānā yuvaṁ tad indraś ca somorvam aśvyaṁ goḥ
Griffith: So, of a truth, Indra and Soma, Heroes, ye burst the stable of the kine and horses,
Devanāgarī: एवा सत्यं मघवाना युवं तदिन्द्रश्च सोमोर्वमश्व्यं गोः
pada pāṭha: eva | satyam | magha-vānā | yuvam | tat | indraḥ | ca | soma | ūrvam | aśvyam | goḥ || ā | adardr̥tam | api-hitāni | aśnā | riricathuḥ | kṣāḥ | cit | tatr̥dānā ||4.28.5||

IAST: ādardṛtam apihitāny aśnā riricathuḥ kṣāś cit tatṛdānā
Griffith: The stable which the bar or stone obstructed; and piercing through set free the habitations.
Devanāgarī: आदर्दृतमपिहितान्यश्ना रिरिचथुः क्षाश्चित्ततृदाना
pada pāṭha: eva | satyam | magha-vānā | yuvam | tat | indraḥ | ca | soma | ūrvam | aśvyam | goḥ || ā | adardr̥tam | api-hitāni | aśnā | riricathuḥ | kṣāḥ | cit | tatr̥dānā ||4.28.5||

IAST: ā naḥ stuta upa vājebhir ūtī indra yāhi haribhir mandasānaḥ
Griffith: COME, lauded, unto us with powers and succours, O Indra, with thy Tawny Steeds; exulting,
Devanāgarī: आ नः स्तुत उप वाजेभिरूती इन्द्र याहि हरिभिर्मन्दसानः
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | stutaḥ | upa | vājebhiḥ | ūtī | indra | yāhi | hari-bhiḥ | mandasānaḥ || tiraḥ | cit | aryaḥ | savanā | purūṇi | āṅgūṣebhiḥ | gr̥ṇānaḥ | satya-rādhāḥ ||4.29.1||

IAST: tiraś cid aryaḥ savanā purūṇy āṅgūṣebhir gṛṇānaḥ satyarādhāḥ
Griffith: Past even the foeman's manifold libations, glorified with our hymns, true Wealth-bestower.
Devanāgarī: तिरश्चिदर्यः सवना पुरूण्याङ्गूषेभिर्गृणानः सत्यराधाः
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | stutaḥ | upa | vājebhiḥ | ūtī | indra | yāhi | hari-bhiḥ | mandasānaḥ || tiraḥ | cit | aryaḥ | savanā | purūṇi | āṅgūṣebhiḥ | gr̥ṇānaḥ | satya-rādhāḥ ||4.29.1||

IAST: ā hi ṣmā yāti naryaś cikitvān hūyamānaḥ sotṛbhir upa yajñam
Griffith: Man's Friend, to this our sacrifice he cometh marking how he is called by Soma-pressers.
Devanāgarī: आ हि ष्मा याति नर्यश्चिकित्वान्हूयमानः सोतृभिरुप यज्ञम्
pada pāṭha: ā | hi | sma | yāti | naryaḥ | cikitvān | hūyamānaḥ | sotr̥-bhiḥ | upa | yajñam || su-aśvaḥ | yaḥ | abhīruḥ | manyamānaḥ | susvāṇebhiḥ | madati | sam | ha | vīraiḥ ||4.29.2||

IAST: svaśvo yo abhīrur manyamānaḥ suṣvāṇebhir madati saṁ ha vīraiḥ
Griffith: Fearless, and conscious that his Steeds are noble, he joyeth with the Soma-pouring heroes.
Devanāgarī: स्वश्वो यो अभीरुर्मन्यमानः सुष्वाणेभिर्मदति सं ह वीरैः
pada pāṭha: ā | hi | sma | yāti | naryaḥ | cikitvān | hūyamānaḥ | sotr̥-bhiḥ | upa | yajñam || su-aśvaḥ | yaḥ | abhīruḥ | manyamānaḥ | susvāṇebhiḥ | madati | sam | ha | vīraiḥ ||4.29.2||

IAST: śrāvayed asya karṇā vājayadhyai juṣṭām anu pra diśam mandayadhyai
Griffith: Make his cars hear, that he may show his vigour and may be joyful in the way he loveth.
Devanāgarī: श्रावयेदस्य कर्णा वाजयध्यै जुष्टामनु प्र दिशं मन्दयध्यै
pada pāṭha: śravaya | it | asya | karṇā | vājayadhyai | juṣṭām | anu | pra | diśam | mandayadhyai || ut-vavr̥ṣāṇaḥ | rādhase | tuviṣmān | karat | naḥ | indraḥ | su-tīrthā | abhayam | ca ||4.29.3||

IAST: udvāvṛṣāṇo rādhase tuviṣmān karan na indraḥ sutīrthābhayaṁ ca
Griffith: May mighty Indra pouring forth in bounty bestow on us good roads and perfect safety;
Devanāgarī: उद्वावृषाणो राधसे तुविष्मान्करन्न इन्द्रः सुतीर्थाभयं च
pada pāṭha: śravaya | it | asya | karṇā | vājayadhyai | juṣṭām | anu | pra | diśam | mandayadhyai || ut-vavr̥ṣāṇaḥ | rādhase | tuviṣmān | karat | naḥ | indraḥ | su-tīrthā | abhayam | ca ||4.29.3||

IAST: acchā yo gantā nādhamānam ūtī itthā vipraṁ havamānaṁ gṛṇantam
Griffith: He who with succour comes to his implorer, the singer here who with his song invites him;
Devanāgarī: अच्छा यो गन्ता नाधमानमूती इत्था विप्रं हवमानं गृणन्तम्
pada pāṭha: accha | yaḥ | gantā | nādhamānam | ūtī | itthā | vipram | havamānam | gr̥ṇantam || upa | tmani | dadhānaḥ | dhuri | āśūn | sahasrāṇi | śatāni | vajra-bāhuḥ ||4.29.4||

IAST: upa tmani dadhāno dhury āśūn sahasrāṇi śatāni vajrabāhuḥ
Griffith: He who himself sets to the pole swift Coursers, he who hath hundreds, thousands, Thunder-wielder.
Devanāgarī: उप त्मनि दधानो धुर्याशून्सहस्राणि शतानि वज्रबाहुः
pada pāṭha: accha | yaḥ | gantā | nādhamānam | ūtī | itthā | vipram | havamānam | gr̥ṇantam || upa | tmani | dadhānaḥ | dhuri | āśūn | sahasrāṇi | śatāni | vajra-bāhuḥ ||4.29.4||

IAST: tvotāso maghavann indra viprā vayaṁ te syāma sūrayo gṛṇantaḥ
Griffith: O Indra Maghavan, by thee protected may we be thine, princes and priests and singers,
Devanāgarī: त्वोतासो मघवन्निन्द्र विप्रा वयं ते स्याम सूरयो गृणन्तः
pada pāṭha: tvā-ūtāsaḥ | magha-van | indra | viprāḥ | vayam | te | syāma | sūrayaḥ | gr̥ṇantaḥ || bhejānāsaḥ | br̥hat-divasya | rāyaḥ | ā-kāyyasya | dāvane | puru-kṣoḥ ||4.29.5||

IAST: bhejānāso bṛhaddivasya rāya ākāyyasya dāvane purukṣoḥ
Griffith: Sharing the riches sent from lofty heaven which yields much food, and all desire its bounty.
Devanāgarī: भेजानासो बृहद्दिवस्य राय आकाय्यस्य दावने पुरुक्षोः
pada pāṭha: tvā-ūtāsaḥ | magha-van | indra | viprāḥ | vayam | te | syāma | sūrayaḥ | gr̥ṇantaḥ || bhejānāsaḥ | br̥hat-divasya | rāyaḥ | ā-kāyyasya | dāvane | puru-kṣoḥ ||4.29.5||

IAST: nakir indra tvad uttaro na jyāyām̐ asti vṛtrahan
Griffith: O INDRA, Vrtra-slayer, none is better, mightier than thou:
Devanāgarī: नकिरिन्द्र त्वदुत्तरो न ज्यायाँ अस्ति वृत्रहन्
pada pāṭha: nakiḥ | indra | tvat | ut-taraḥ | na | jyāyān | asti | vr̥tra-han || nakiḥ | eva | yathā | tvam ||4.30.1||

IAST: nakir evā yathā tvam
Griffith: Verily there is none like thee.
Devanāgarī: नकिरेवा यथा त्वम्
pada pāṭha: nakiḥ | indra | tvat | ut-taraḥ | na | jyāyān | asti | vr̥tra-han || nakiḥ | eva | yathā | tvam ||4.30.1||

IAST: satrā te anu kṛṣṭayo viśvā cakreva vāvṛtuḥ
Griffith: Like chariot-wheels these people all together follow after thee:
Devanāgarī: सत्रा ते अनु कृष्टयो विश्वा चक्रेव वावृतुः
pada pāṭha: satrā | te | anu | kr̥ṣṭayaḥ | viśvā | cakrā-iva | vavr̥tuḥ || satrā | mahān | asi | śrutaḥ ||4.30.2||

IAST: satrā mahām̐ asi śrutaḥ
Griffith: Thou ever art renowned as Great.
Devanāgarī: सत्रा महाँ असि श्रुतः
pada pāṭha: satrā | te | anu | kr̥ṣṭayaḥ | viśvā | cakrā-iva | vavr̥tuḥ || satrā | mahān | asi | śrutaḥ ||4.30.2||

IAST: viśve caned anā tvā devāsa indra yuyudhuḥ
Griffith: Not even all the gathered Gods conquered thee, Indra, in the war,
Devanāgarī: विश्वे चनेदना त्वा देवास इन्द्र युयुधुः
pada pāṭha: viśve | cana | it | anā | tvā | devāsaḥ | indra | yuyudhuḥ || yat | ahā | naktam | ā | atiraḥ ||4.30.3||

IAST: yad ahā naktam ātiraḥ
Griffith: When thou didst lengthen days by night.
Devanāgarī: यदहा नक्तमातिरः
pada pāṭha: viśve | cana | it | anā | tvā | devāsaḥ | indra | yuyudhuḥ || yat | ahā | naktam | ā | atiraḥ ||4.30.3||

IAST: yatrota bādhitebhyaś cakraṁ kutsāya yudhyate
Griffith: When for the sake of those oppressed, and Kutsa as he battled,
Devanāgarī: यत्रोत बाधितेभ्यश्चक्रं कुत्साय युध्यते
pada pāṭha: yatra | uta | bādhitebhyaḥ | cakram | kutsāya | yudhyate || muṣāyaḥ | indra | sūryam ||4.30.4||

IAST: muṣāya indra sūryam
Griffith: Thou stolest away the Sun's car-wheel.
Devanāgarī: मुषाय इन्द्र सूर्यम्
pada pāṭha: yatra | uta | bādhitebhyaḥ | cakram | kutsāya | yudhyate || muṣāyaḥ | indra | sūryam ||4.30.4||

IAST: yatra devām̐ ṛghāyato viśvām̐ ayudhya eka it
Griffith: When, fighting singly, Indra. thou o'ercamest all the furious Gods,
Devanāgarī: यत्र देवाँ ऋघायतो विश्वाँ अयुध्य एक इत्
pada pāṭha: yatra | devān | r̥ghāyataḥ | viśvān | ayudhyaḥ | ekaḥ | it || tvam | indra | vanūn | ahan ||4.30.5||

IAST: tvam indra vanūm̐r ahan
Griffith: thou slewest those who strove with thee.
Devanāgarī: त्वमिन्द्र वनूँरहन्
pada pāṭha: yatra | devān | r̥ghāyataḥ | viśvān | ayudhyaḥ | ekaḥ | it || tvam | indra | vanūn | ahan ||4.30.5||

IAST: yatrota martyāya kam ariṇā indra sūryam
Griffith: When also for a mortal man, Indra, thou speddest forth the Sun,
Devanāgarī: यत्रोत मर्त्याय कमरिणा इन्द्र सूर्यम्
pada pāṭha: yatra | uta | martyāya | kam | ariṇāḥ | indra | sūryam || pra | āvaḥ | śacībhiḥ | etaśam ||4.30.6||

IAST: prāvaḥ śacībhir etaśam
Griffith: And holpest Etasa with might.
Devanāgarī: प्रावः शचीभिरेतशम्
pada pāṭha: yatra | uta | martyāya | kam | ariṇāḥ | indra | sūryam || pra | āvaḥ | śacībhiḥ | etaśam ||4.30.6||

IAST: kim ād utāsi vṛtrahan maghavan manyumattamaḥ
Griffith: What? Vrtra-slayer, art not thou, Maghavan, fiercest in thy wrath?
Devanāgarī: किमादुतासि वृत्रहन्मघवन्मन्युमत्तमः
pada pāṭha: kim | āt | uta | asi | vr̥tra-han | magha-van | manyumat-tamaḥ || atra | aha | dānum | ā | atiraḥ ||4.30.7||

IAST: atrāha dānum ātiraḥ
Griffith: So hast thou quelled the demon too.
Devanāgarī: अत्राह दानुमातिरः
pada pāṭha: kim | āt | uta | asi | vr̥tra-han | magha-van | manyumat-tamaḥ || atra | aha | dānum | ā | atiraḥ ||4.30.7||

IAST: etad ghed uta vīryam indra cakartha pauṁsyam
Griffith: And this heroic deed of might thou, Indra, also hast achieved,
Devanāgarī: एतद्घेदुत वीर्यमिन्द्र चकर्थ पौंस्यम्
pada pāṭha: etat | gha | it | uta | vīryam | indra | cakartha | pauṁsyam || striyam | yat | duḥ-hanāyuvam | vadhīḥ | duhitaram | divaḥ ||4.30.8||

IAST: striyaṁ yad durhaṇāyuvaṁ vadhīr duhitaraṁ divaḥ
Griffith: That thou didst smite to death the Dame, Heaven's Daughter, meditating ill.
Devanāgarī: स्त्रियं यद्दुर्हणायुवं वधीर्दुहितरं दिवः
pada pāṭha: etat | gha | it | uta | vīryam | indra | cakartha | pauṁsyam || striyam | yat | duḥ-hanāyuvam | vadhīḥ | duhitaram | divaḥ ||4.30.8||

IAST: divaś cid ghā duhitaram mahān mahīyamānām
Griffith: Thou, Indra, Mighty One, didst crush Usas, though Daughter of the Sky.
Devanāgarī: दिवश्चिद्घा दुहितरं महान्महीयमानाम्
pada pāṭha: divaḥ | cit | gha | duhitaram | mahān | mahīyamānām || uṣasam | indra | sam | piṇak ||4.30.9||

IAST: uṣāsam indra sam piṇak
Griffith: When lifting up herself in pride.
Devanāgarī: उषासमिन्द्र सं पिणक्
pada pāṭha: divaḥ | cit | gha | duhitaram | mahān | mahīyamānām || uṣasam | indra | sam | piṇak ||4.30.9||

IAST: apoṣā anasaḥ sarat sampiṣṭād aha bibhyuṣī
Griffith: Then from her chariot Usas fled, affrighted, from her ruined car.
Devanāgarī: अपोषा अनसः सरत्सम्पिष्टादह बिभ्युषी
pada pāṭha: apa | uṣāḥ | anasaḥ | sarat | sam-piṣṭāt | aha | bibhyuṣī || ni | yat | sīm | śiśnathat | vr̥ṣā ||4.30.10||

IAST: ni yat sīṁ śiśnathad vṛṣā
Griffith: When the strong God had shattered it.
Devanāgarī: नि यत्सीं शिश्नथद्वृषा
pada pāṭha: apa | uṣāḥ | anasaḥ | sarat | sam-piṣṭāt | aha | bibhyuṣī || ni | yat | sīm | śiśnathat | vr̥ṣā ||4.30.10||

IAST: etad asyā anaḥ śaye susampiṣṭaṁ vipāśy ā
Griffith: So there this car of Usas lay, broken to pieces, in Vipas,
Devanāgarī: एतदस्या अनः शये सुसम्पिष्टं विपाश्या
pada pāṭha: etat | asyāḥ | anaḥ | śaye | su-saṁpiṣṭam | vi-pāśi | ā || sasāra | sīm | parā-vataḥ ||4.30.11||

IAST: sasāra sīm parāvataḥ
Griffith: And she herself fled far away.
Devanāgarī: ससार सीं परावतः
pada pāṭha: etat | asyāḥ | anaḥ | śaye | su-saṁpiṣṭam | vi-pāśi | ā || sasāra | sīm | parā-vataḥ ||4.30.11||

IAST: uta sindhuṁ vibālyaṁ vitasthānām adhi kṣami
Griffith: Thou, Indra, didst. with magic power resist the overflowing stream
Devanāgarī: उत सिन्धुं विबाल्यं वितस्थानामधि क्षमि
pada pāṭha: uta | sindhum | vi-bālyam | vi-tasthānām | adhi | kṣami || pari | sthāḥ | indra | māyayā ||4.30.12||

IAST: pari ṣṭhā indra māyayā
Griffith: Who spread her waters o'er the land.
Devanāgarī: परि ष्ठा इन्द्र मायया
pada pāṭha: uta | sindhum | vi-bālyam | vi-tasthānām | adhi | kṣami || pari | sthāḥ | indra | māyayā ||4.30.12||

IAST: uta śuṣṇasya dhṛṣṇuyā pra mṛkṣo abhi vedanam
Griffith: Valiantly didst thou seize and take the store which Susna had amassed,
Devanāgarī: उत शुष्णस्य धृष्णुया प्र मृक्षो अभि वेदनम्
pada pāṭha: uta | śuṣṇasya | dhr̥ṣṇu-yā | pra | mr̥kṣaḥ | abhi | vedanam || puraḥ | yat | asya | sam-piṇak ||4.30.13||

IAST: puro yad asya sampiṇak
Griffith: When thou didst crush his fortresses.
Devanāgarī: पुरो यदस्य सम्पिणक्
pada pāṭha: uta | śuṣṇasya | dhr̥ṣṇu-yā | pra | mr̥kṣaḥ | abhi | vedanam || puraḥ | yat | asya | sam-piṇak ||4.30.13||

IAST: uta dāsaṁ kaulitaram bṛhataḥ parvatād adhi
Griffith: Thou, Indra, also smotest down Kulitara's son Sambara,
Devanāgarī: उत दासं कौलितरं बृहतः पर्वतादधि
pada pāṭha: uta | dāsam | kauli-taram | br̥hataḥ | parvatāt | adhi || ava | ahan | indra | śambaram ||4.30.14||

IAST: avāhann indra śambaram
Griffith: The Dasa, from the lofty hill.
Devanāgarī: अवाहन्निन्द्र शम्बरम्
pada pāṭha: uta | dāsam | kauli-taram | br̥hataḥ | parvatāt | adhi || ava | ahan | indra | śambaram ||4.30.14||

IAST: uta dāsasya varcinaḥ sahasrāṇi śatāvadhīḥ
Griffith: Of Dasa Varcin's thou didst slay the hundred thousand and the five,
Devanāgarī: उत दासस्य वर्चिनः सहस्राणि शतावधीः
pada pāṭha: uta | dāsasya | varcinaḥ | sahasrāṇi | śatā | avadhīḥ || adhi | pañca | pradhīn-iva ||4.30.15||

IAST: adhi pañca pradhīm̐r iva
Griffith: Crushed like the fellies, of a car.
Devanāgarī: अधि पञ्च प्रधीँरिव
pada pāṭha: uta | dāsasya | varcinaḥ | sahasrāṇi | śatā | avadhīḥ || adhi | pañca | pradhīn-iva ||4.30.15||

IAST: uta tyam putram agruvaḥ parāvṛktaṁ śatakratuḥ
Griffith: So Indra, Lord of Heroes, Powers, caused the unwedded damsel's son,
Devanāgarī: उत त्यं पुत्रमग्रुवः परावृक्तं शतक्रतुः
pada pāṭha: uta | tyam | putram | agruvaḥ | parā-vr̥ktam | śata-kratuḥ || uktheṣu | indraḥ | ā | abhajat ||4.30.16||

IAST: uktheṣv indra ābhajat
Griffith: The castaway, to share the lauds.
Devanāgarī: उक्थेष्विन्द्र आभजत्
pada pāṭha: uta | tyam | putram | agruvaḥ | parā-vr̥ktam | śata-kratuḥ || uktheṣu | indraḥ | ā | abhajat ||4.30.16||

IAST: uta tyā turvaśāyadū asnātārā śacīpatiḥ
Griffith: So sapient Indra, Lord of Might, brought Turvaga and Yadu, those
Devanāgarī: उत त्या तुर्वशायदू अस्नातारा शचीपतिः
pada pāṭha: uta | tyā | turvaśāyadū iti | asnātārā | śacī-patiḥ || indraḥ | vidvān | apārayat ||4.30.17||

IAST: indro vidvām̐ apārayat
Griffith: Who feared the flood, in safel o'er.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रो विद्वाँ अपारयत्
pada pāṭha: uta | tyā | turvaśāyadū iti | asnātārā | śacī-patiḥ || indraḥ | vidvān | apārayat ||4.30.17||

IAST: uta tyā sadya āryā sarayor indra pārataḥ
Griffith: Arpa and Citraratha, both Aryas, thou, Indra, slewest swift,
Devanāgarī: उत त्या सद्य आर्या सरयोरिन्द्र पारतः
pada pāṭha: uta | tyā | sadyaḥ | āryā | sarayoḥ | indra | pārataḥ || arṇācitrarathā | avadhīḥ ||4.30.18||

IAST: arṇācitrarathāvadhīḥ
Griffith: On yonder side of Sarayu,
Devanāgarī: अर्णाचित्ररथावधीः
pada pāṭha: uta | tyā | sadyaḥ | āryā | sarayoḥ | indra | pārataḥ || arṇācitrarathā | avadhīḥ ||4.30.18||

IAST: anu dvā jahitā nayo 'ndhaṁ śroṇaṁ ca vṛtrahan
Griffith: Thou, Vrtra-slayer, didst conduct those two forlorn, the blind, the lame.
Devanāgarī: अनु द्वा जहिता नयोऽन्धं श्रोणं च वृत्रहन्
pada pāṭha: anu | dvā | jahitā | nayaḥ | andham | śroṇam | ca | vr̥tra-han || na | tat | te | sumnam | aṣṭave ||4.30.19||

IAST: na tat te sumnam aṣṭave
Griffith: None may attain this bliss of thine.
Devanāgarī: न तत्ते सुम्नमष्टवे
pada pāṭha: anu | dvā | jahitā | nayaḥ | andham | śroṇam | ca | vr̥tra-han || na | tat | te | sumnam | aṣṭave ||4.30.19||

IAST: śatam aśmanmayīnām purām indro vy āsyat
Griffith: For Divodasa, him who brought oblationt, ndra overthrew
Devanāgarī: शतमश्मन्मयीनां पुरामिन्द्रो व्यास्यत्
pada pāṭha: śatam | aśman-mayīnām | purām | indraḥ | vi | āsyat || divaḥ-dāsāya | dāśuṣe ||4.30.20||

IAST: divodāsāya dāśuṣe
Griffith: A hundred fortresses of stone.
Devanāgarī: दिवोदासाय दाशुषे
pada pāṭha: śatam | aśman-mayīnām | purām | indraḥ | vi | āsyat || divaḥ-dāsāya | dāśuṣe ||4.30.20||

IAST: asvāpayad dabhītaye sahasrā triṁśataṁ hathaiḥ
Griffith: The thirty thousand Disas he with magic power and weapons sent
Devanāgarī: अस्वापयद्दभीतये सहस्रा त्रिंशतं हथैः
pada pāṭha: asvāpayat | dabhītaye | sahasrā | triṁśatam | hathaiḥ || dāsānām | indraḥ | māyayā ||4.30.21||

IAST: dāsānām indro māyayā
Griffith: To slumber, for Dabhiti's sake.
Devanāgarī: दासानामिन्द्रो मायया
pada pāṭha: asvāpayat | dabhītaye | sahasrā | triṁśatam | hathaiḥ || dāsānām | indraḥ | māyayā ||4.30.21||

IAST: sa ghed utāsi vṛtrahan samāna indra gopatiḥ
Griffith: As such, O Vrtra-slayer, thou art general Lord of kine for all,
Devanāgarī: स घेदुतासि वृत्रहन्समान इन्द्र गोपतिः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | gha | it | uta | asi | vr̥tra-han | samānaḥ | indra | go-patiḥ || yaḥ | tā | viśvāni | cicyuṣe ||4.30.22||

IAST: yas tā viśvāni cicyuṣe
Griffith: Thou Shaker of all things that be.
Devanāgarī: यस्ता विश्वानि चिच्युषे
pada pāṭha: saḥ | gha | it | uta | asi | vr̥tra-han | samānaḥ | indra | go-patiḥ || yaḥ | tā | viśvāni | cicyuṣe ||4.30.22||

IAST: uta nūnaṁ yad indriyaṁ kariṣyā indra pauṁsyam
Griffith: Indra, whatever deed of might thou hast this day to execute,
Devanāgarī: उत नूनं यदिन्द्रियं करिष्या इन्द्र पौंस्यम्
pada pāṭha: uta | nūnam | yat | indriyam | kariṣyāḥ | indra | pauṁsyam || adya | nakiḥ | tat | ā | minat ||4.30.23||

IAST: adyā nakiṣ ṭad ā minat
Griffith: None be there now to hinder it.
Devanāgarī: अद्या नकिष्टदा मिनत्
pada pāṭha: uta | nūnam | yat | indriyam | kariṣyāḥ | indra | pauṁsyam || adya | nakiḥ | tat | ā | minat ||4.30.23||

IAST: vāmaṁ-vāmaṁ ta ādure devo dadātv aryamā
Griffith: O Watchful One, may Aryaman the God give thee all goodly things.
Devanāgarī: वामंवामं त आदुरे देवो ददात्वर्यमा
pada pāṭha: vāmam-vāmam | te | ā-dure | devaḥ | dadātu | aryamā || vāmam | pūṣā | vāmam | bhagaḥ | vāmam | devaḥ | karūḷatī ||4.30.24||

IAST: vāmam pūṣā vāmam bhago vāmaṁ devaḥ karūḻatī
Griffith: May Risan, Bhaga, and the God Karulati give all things fair.
Devanāgarī: वामं पूषा वामं भगो वामं देवः करूळती
pada pāṭha: vāmam-vāmam | te | ā-dure | devaḥ | dadātu | aryamā || vāmam | pūṣā | vāmam | bhagaḥ | vāmam | devaḥ | karūḷatī ||4.30.24||

IAST: kayā naś citra ā bhuvad ūtī sadāvṛdhaḥ sakhā
Griffith: WITH what help will he come to us, wonderful, ever-waxing Friend;
Devanāgarī: कया नश्चित्र आ भुवदूती सदावृधः सखा
pada pāṭha: kayā | naḥ | citraḥ | ā | bhuvat | ūtī | sadā-vr̥dhaḥ | sakhā || kayā | śaciṣṭhayā | vr̥tā ||4.31.1||

IAST: kayā śaciṣṭhayā vṛtā
Griffith: With what most mighty company?
Devanāgarī: कया शचिष्ठया वृता
pada pāṭha: kayā | naḥ | citraḥ | ā | bhuvat | ūtī | sadā-vr̥dhaḥ | sakhā || kayā | śaciṣṭhayā | vr̥tā ||4.31.1||

IAST: kas tvā satyo madānām maṁhiṣṭho matsad andhasaḥ
Griffith: What genuine and most liberal draught will spirit thee with juice to burst
Devanāgarī: कस्त्वा सत्यो मदानां मंहिष्ठो मत्सदन्धसः
pada pāṭha: kaḥ | tvā | satyaḥ | madānām | maṁhiṣṭhaḥ | matsat | andhasaḥ || dr̥ḷhā | cit | ā-ruje | vasu ||4.31.2||

IAST: dṛḻhā cid āruje vasu
Griffith: Open e'en strongly-guarded wealth?
Devanāgarī: दृळ्हा चिदारुजे वसु
pada pāṭha: kaḥ | tvā | satyaḥ | madānām | maṁhiṣṭhaḥ | matsat | andhasaḥ || dr̥ḷhā | cit | ā-ruje | vasu ||4.31.2||

IAST: abhī ṣu ṇaḥ sakhīnām avitā jaritṝṇām
Griffith: Do thou who art Protector of us thy friends who praise thee
Devanāgarī: अभी षु णः सखीनामविता जरितॄणाम्
pada pāṭha: abhi | su | naḥ | sakhīnām | avitā | jaritr̥̄ṇām || śatam | bhavāsi | ūti-bhiḥ ||4.31.3||

IAST: śatam bhavāsy ūtibhiḥ
Griffith: With hundred aids approach us.
Devanāgarī: शतं भवास्यूतिभिः
pada pāṭha: abhi | su | naḥ | sakhīnām | avitā | jaritr̥̄ṇām || śatam | bhavāsi | ūti-bhiḥ ||4.31.3||

IAST: abhī na ā vavṛtsva cakraṁ na vṛttam arvataḥ
Griffith: Like as a courser's circling wheel, so turn thee hitherward to us,
Devanāgarī: अभी न आ ववृत्स्व चक्रं न वृत्तमर्वतः
pada pāṭha: abhi | naḥ | ā | vavr̥tsva | cakram | na | vr̥ttam | arvataḥ || niyut-bhiḥ | carṣaṇīnām ||4.31.4||

IAST: niyudbhiś carṣaṇīnām
Griffith: Attracted by the hymns of men.
Devanāgarī: नियुद्भिश्चर्षणीनाम्
pada pāṭha: abhi | naḥ | ā | vavr̥tsva | cakram | na | vr̥ttam | arvataḥ || niyut-bhiḥ | carṣaṇīnām ||4.31.4||

IAST: pravatā hi kratūnām ā hā padeva gacchasi
Griffith: Thou seekest as it were thine own stations with swift descent of powers:
Devanāgarī: प्रवता हि क्रतूनामा हा पदेव गच्छसि
pada pāṭha: pra-vatā | hi | kratūnām | ā | ha | padā-iva | gacchasi || abhakṣi | sūrye | sacā ||4.31.5||

IAST: abhakṣi sūrye sacā
Griffith: I share thee even with the Sun.
Devanāgarī: अभक्षि सूर्ये सचा
pada pāṭha: pra-vatā | hi | kratūnām | ā | ha | padā-iva | gacchasi || abhakṣi | sūrye | sacā ||4.31.5||

IAST: saṁ yat ta indra manyavaḥ saṁ cakrāṇi dadhanvire
Griffith: What time thy courage and his wheels together, Indra, run their course
Devanāgarī: सं यत्त इन्द्र मन्यवः सं चक्राणि दधन्विरे
pada pāṭha: sam | yat | te | indra | manyavaḥ | sam | cakrāṇi | dadhanvire || adha | tve iti | adha | sūrye ||4.31.6||

IAST: adha tve adha sūrye
Griffith: With thee and with the Sun alike,
Devanāgarī: अध त्वे अध सूर्ये
pada pāṭha: sam | yat | te | indra | manyavaḥ | sam | cakrāṇi | dadhanvire || adha | tve iti | adha | sūrye ||4.31.6||

IAST: uta smā hi tvām āhur in maghavānaṁ śacīpate
Griffith: So even, Lord of Power and Might, the people call thee Maghavan,
Devanāgarī: उत स्मा हि त्वामाहुरिन्मघवानं शचीपते
pada pāṭha: uta | sma | hi | tvām | āhuḥ | it | magha-vānam | śacī-pate || dātāram | avi-dīdhayum ||4.31.7||

IAST: dātāram avidīdhayum
Griffith: Giver, who pauses not to think.
Devanāgarī: दातारमविदीधयुम्
pada pāṭha: uta | sma | hi | tvām | āhuḥ | it | magha-vānam | śacī-pate || dātāram | avi-dīdhayum ||4.31.7||

IAST: uta smā sadya it pari śaśamānāya sunvate
Griffith: And verily to him who toils and presses Soma juice for thee
Devanāgarī: उत स्मा सद्य इत्परि शशमानाय सुन्वते
pada pāṭha: uta | sma | sadyaḥ | it | pari | śaśamānāya | sunvate || puru | cit | maṁhase | vasu ||4.31.8||

IAST: purū cin maṁhase vasu
Griffith: Thou quickly givest ample wealth.
Devanāgarī: पुरू चिन्मंहसे वसु
pada pāṭha: uta | sma | sadyaḥ | it | pari | śaśamānāya | sunvate || puru | cit | maṁhase | vasu ||4.31.8||

IAST: nahi ṣmā te śataṁ cana rādho varanta āmuraḥ
Griffith: No, not a hundred hinderers can check thy gracious bounty's flow,
Devanāgarī: नहि ष्मा ते शतं चन राधो वरन्त आमुरः
pada pāṭha: nahi | sma | te | śatam | cana | rādhaḥ | varante | ā-muraḥ || na | cyautnāni | kariṣyataḥ ||4.31.9||

IAST: na cyautnāni kariṣyataḥ
Griffith: Nor thy great deeds when thou wilt act.
Devanāgarī: न च्यौत्नानि करिष्यतः
pada pāṭha: nahi | sma | te | śatam | cana | rādhaḥ | varante | ā-muraḥ || na | cyautnāni | kariṣyataḥ ||4.31.9||

IAST: asmām̐ avantu te śatam asmān sahasram ūtayaḥ
Griffith: May thine assistance keep us safe, thy hundred and thy thousand aids:
Devanāgarī: अस्माँ अवन्तु ते शतमस्मान्सहस्रमूतयः
pada pāṭha: asmān | avantu | te | śatam | asmān | sahasram | ūtayaḥ || asmān | viśvāḥ | abhiṣṭayaḥ ||4.31.10||

IAST: asmān viśvā abhiṣṭayaḥ
Griffith: May all thy favours strengthen us.
Devanāgarī: अस्मान्विश्वा अभिष्टयः
pada pāṭha: asmān | avantu | te | śatam | asmān | sahasram | ūtayaḥ || asmān | viśvāḥ | abhiṣṭayaḥ ||4.31.10||

IAST: asmām̐ ihā vṛṇīṣva sakhyāya svastaye
Griffith: Do thou elect us this place for friendship and prosperity,
Devanāgarī: अस्माँ इहा वृणीष्व सख्याय स्वस्तये
pada pāṭha: asmān | iha | vr̥ṇīṣva | sakhyāya | svastaye || mahaḥ | rāye | divitmate ||4.31.11||

IAST: maho rāye divitmate
Griffith: And great celestial opulence.
Devanāgarī: महो राये दिवित्मते
pada pāṭha: asmān | iha | vr̥ṇīṣva | sakhyāya | svastaye || mahaḥ | rāye | divitmate ||4.31.11||

IAST: asmām̐ aviḍḍhi viśvahendra rāyā parīṇasā
Griffith: Favour us, Indra, evermore with overflowing store of wealth:
Devanāgarī: अस्माँ अविड्ढि विश्वहेन्द्र राया परीणसा
pada pāṭha: asmān | aviḍḍhi | viśvahā | indra | rāyā | parīṇasā || asmān | viśvābhiḥ | ūti-bhiḥ ||4.31.12||

IAST: asmān viśvābhir ūtibhiḥ
Griffith: With all thy succours aid thou us.
Devanāgarī: अस्मान्विश्वाभिरूतिभिः
pada pāṭha: asmān | aviḍḍhi | viśvahā | indra | rāyā | parīṇasā || asmān | viśvābhiḥ | ūti-bhiḥ ||4.31.12||

IAST: asmabhyaṁ tām̐ apā vṛdhi vrajām̐ asteva gomataḥ
Griffith: With new protections, Indra, like an archer, open thou forus
Devanāgarī: अस्मभ्यं ताँ अपा वृधि व्रजाँ अस्तेव गोमतः
pada pāṭha: asmabhyam | tān | apa | vr̥dhi | vrajān | astā-iva | go-mataḥ || navābhiḥ | indra | ūti-bhiḥ ||4.31.13||

IAST: navābhir indrotibhiḥ
Griffith: The stables that are filled with kine.
Devanāgarī: नवाभिरिन्द्रोतिभिः
pada pāṭha: asmabhyam | tān | apa | vr̥dhi | vrajān | astā-iva | go-mataḥ || navābhiḥ | indra | ūti-bhiḥ ||4.31.13||

IAST: asmākaṁ dhṛṣṇuyā ratho dyumām̐ indrānapacyutaḥ
Griffith: Our chariot, Indra, boldly moves endued with splendour, ne'er repulsed,
Devanāgarī: अस्माकं धृष्णुया रथो द्युमाँ इन्द्रानपच्युतः
pada pāṭha: asmākam | dhr̥ṣṇu-yā | rathaḥ | dyu-mān | indra | anapa-cyutaḥ || gavyuḥ | aśva-yuḥ | īyate ||4.31.14||

IAST: gavyur aśvayur īyate
Griffith: Winning for us both kine andsteeds.
Devanāgarī: गव्युरश्वयुरीयते
pada pāṭha: asmākam | dhr̥ṣṇu-yā | rathaḥ | dyu-mān | indra | anapa-cyutaḥ || gavyuḥ | aśva-yuḥ | īyate ||4.31.14||

IAST: asmākam uttamaṁ kṛdhi śravo deveṣu sūrya
Griffith: O Surya, make our fame to be most excellent among the Gods,
Devanāgarī: अस्माकमुत्तमं कृधि श्रवो देवेषु सूर्य
pada pāṭha: asmākam | ut-tamam | kr̥dhi | śravaḥ | deveṣu | sūrya || varṣiṣṭham | dyām-iva | upari ||4.31.15||

IAST: varṣiṣṭhaṁ dyām ivopari
Griffith: Most lofty as the heaven on high.
Devanāgarī: वर्षिष्ठं द्यामिवोपरि
pada pāṭha: asmākam | ut-tamam | kr̥dhi | śravaḥ | deveṣu | sūrya || varṣiṣṭham | dyām-iva | upari ||4.31.15||

IAST: ā tū na indra vṛtrahann asmākam ardham ā gahi
Griffith: O THOU who slewest Vrtra, come, O Indra, hither to our side,
Devanāgarī: आ तू न इन्द्र वृत्रहन्नस्माकमर्धमा गहि
pada pāṭha: ā | tu | naḥ | indra | vr̥tra-han | asmākam | ardham | ā | gahi || mahān | mahībhiḥ | ūti-bhiḥ ||4.32.1||

IAST: mahān mahībhir ūtibhiḥ
Griffith: Mighty One with thy mighty aids.
Devanāgarī: महान्महीभिरूतिभिः
pada pāṭha: ā | tu | naḥ | indra | vr̥tra-han | asmākam | ardham | ā | gahi || mahān | mahībhiḥ | ūti-bhiḥ ||4.32.1||

IAST: bhṛmiś cid ghāsi tūtujir ā citra citriṇīṣv ā
Griffith: Swift and impetuous art thou, wondrous amid the well-dressed folk:
Devanāgarī: भृमिश्चिद्घासि तूतुजिरा चित्र चित्रिणीष्वा
pada pāṭha: bhr̥miḥ | cit | gha | asi | tūtujiḥ | ā | citra | citriṇīṣu | ā || citram | kr̥ṇoṣi | ūtaye ||4.32.2||

IAST: citraṁ kṛṇoṣy ūtaye
Griffith: Thou doest marvels for our help.
Devanāgarī: चित्रं कृणोष्यूतये
pada pāṭha: bhr̥miḥ | cit | gha | asi | tūtujiḥ | ā | citra | citriṇīṣu | ā || citram | kr̥ṇoṣi | ūtaye ||4.32.2||

IAST: dabhrebhiś cic chaśīyāṁsaṁ haṁsi vrādhantam ojasā
Griffith: Even with the weak thou smitest down him who is stronger, with thy strength
Devanāgarī: दभ्रेभिश्चिच्छशीयांसं हंसि व्राधन्तमोजसा
pada pāṭha: dabhrebhiḥ | cit | śaśīyāṁsam | haṁsi | vrādhantam | ojasā || sakhi-bhiḥ | ye | tve iti | sacā ||4.32.3||

IAST: sakhibhir ye tve sacā
Griffith: The mighty, with the Friends thou hast.
Devanāgarī: सखिभिर्ये त्वे सचा
pada pāṭha: dabhrebhiḥ | cit | śaśīyāṁsam | haṁsi | vrādhantam | ojasā || sakhi-bhiḥ | ye | tve iti | sacā ||4.32.3||

IAST: vayam indra tve sacā vayaṁ tvābhi nonumaḥ
Griffith: O Indra, we are close to thee; to thee we sing aloud our songs:
Devanāgarī: वयमिन्द्र त्वे सचा वयं त्वाभि नोनुमः
pada pāṭha: vayam | indra | tve iti | sacā | vayam | tvā | abhi | nonumaḥ || asmān-asmān | it | ut | ava ||4.32.4||

IAST: asmām̐-asmām̐ id ud ava
Griffith: Help hnd defend us, even us.
Devanāgarī: अस्माँअस्माँ इदुदव
pada pāṭha: vayam | indra | tve iti | sacā | vayam | tvā | abhi | nonumaḥ || asmān-asmān | it | ut | ava ||4.32.4||

IAST: sa naś citrābhir adrivo 'navadyābhir ūtibhiḥ
Griffith: As such, O Caster of the Stone, come with thy succours wonderful,
Devanāgarī: स नश्चित्राभिरद्रिवोऽनवद्याभिरूतिभिः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | citrābhiḥ | adri-vaḥ | anavadyābhiḥ | ūti-bhiḥ || anādhr̥ṣṭābhiḥ | ā | gahi ||4.32.5||

IAST: anādhṛṣṭābhir ā gahi
Griffith: Blameless, and irresistible.
Devanāgarī: अनाधृष्टाभिरा गहि
pada pāṭha: saḥ | naḥ | citrābhiḥ | adri-vaḥ | anavadyābhiḥ | ūti-bhiḥ || anādhr̥ṣṭābhiḥ | ā | gahi ||4.32.5||

IAST: bhūyāmo ṣu tvāvataḥ sakhāya indra gomataḥ
Griffith: May we be friends of one like thee, O Indra, with the wealth of kine,
Devanāgarī: भूयामो षु त्वावतः सखाय इन्द्र गोमतः
pada pāṭha: bhūyāmo iti | su | tvā-vataḥ | sakhāyaḥ | indra | go-mataḥ || yujaḥ | vājāya | ghr̥ṣvaye ||4.32.6||

IAST: yujo vājāya ghṛṣvaye
Griffith: Comrades for lively energy.
Devanāgarī: युजो वाजाय घृष्वये
pada pāṭha: bhūyāmo iti | su | tvā-vataḥ | sakhāyaḥ | indra | go-mataḥ || yujaḥ | vājāya | ghr̥ṣvaye ||4.32.6||

IAST: tvaṁ hy eka īśiṣa indra vājasya gomataḥ
Griffith: For thou, O Indra, art alone the Lord of strength that comes from kine
Devanāgarī: त्वं ह्येक ईशिष इन्द्र वाजस्य गोमतः
pada pāṭha: tvam | hi | ekaḥ | īśiṣe | indra | vājasya | go-mataḥ || saḥ | naḥ | yandhi | mahīm | iṣam ||4.32.7||

IAST: sa no yandhi mahīm iṣam
Griffith: So grant thou us abundant food.
Devanāgarī: स नो यन्धि महीमिषम्
pada pāṭha: tvam | hi | ekaḥ | īśiṣe | indra | vājasya | go-mataḥ || saḥ | naḥ | yandhi | mahīm | iṣam ||4.32.7||

IAST: na tvā varante anyathā yad ditsasi stuto magham
Griffith: They turn thee not another way, when, lauded, Lover of the Song,
Devanāgarī: न त्वा वरन्ते अन्यथा यद्दित्ससि स्तुतो मघम्
pada pāṭha: na | tvā | varante | anyathā | yat | ditsasi | stutaḥ | magham || stotr̥-bhyaḥ | indra | girvaṇaḥ ||4.32.8||

IAST: stotṛbhya indra girvaṇaḥ
Griffith: Thou wilt give wealth to those who praise.
Devanāgarī: स्तोतृभ्य इन्द्र गिर्वणः
pada pāṭha: na | tvā | varante | anyathā | yat | ditsasi | stutaḥ | magham || stotr̥-bhyaḥ | indra | girvaṇaḥ ||4.32.8||

IAST: abhi tvā gotamā girānūṣata pra dāvane
Griffith: The Gotamas have sung their song of praise to thee that thou mayst give,
Devanāgarī: अभि त्वा गोतमा गिरानूषत प्र दावने
pada pāṭha: abhi | tvā | gotamāḥ | girā | anūṣata | pra | dāvane || indra | vājāya | ghr̥ṣvaye ||4.32.9||

IAST: indra vājāya ghṛṣvaye
Griffith: Indra, for lively energy.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र वाजाय घृष्वये
pada pāṭha: abhi | tvā | gotamāḥ | girā | anūṣata | pra | dāvane || indra | vājāya | ghr̥ṣvaye ||4.32.9||

IAST: pra te vocāma vīryā yā mandasāna ārujaḥ
Griffith: We will declare thy hero deeds, what Disa forts thou brakest down,
Devanāgarī: प्र ते वोचाम वीर्या या मन्दसान आरुजः
pada pāṭha: pra | te | vocāma | vīryā | yāḥ | mandasānaḥ | ā | arujaḥ || puraḥ | dāsīḥ | abhi-itya ||4.32.10||

IAST: puro dāsīr abhītya
Griffith: Attacking them in rapturous joy.
Devanāgarī: पुरो दासीरभीत्य
pada pāṭha: pra | te | vocāma | vīryā | yāḥ | mandasānaḥ | ā | arujaḥ || puraḥ | dāsīḥ | abhi-itya ||4.32.10||

IAST: tā te gṛṇanti vedhaso yāni cakartha pauṁsyā
Griffith: The sages sing those manly deeds which, Indra, Lover of the Song,
Devanāgarī: ता ते गृणन्ति वेधसो यानि चकर्थ पौंस्या
pada pāṭha: tā | te | gr̥ṇanti | vedhasaḥ | yāni | cakartha | pauṁsyā || suteṣu | indra | girvaṇaḥ ||4.32.11||

IAST: suteṣv indra girvaṇaḥ
Griffith: Thou wrougbtest when the Soma flowed.
Devanāgarī: सुतेष्विन्द्र गिर्वणः
pada pāṭha: tā | te | gr̥ṇanti | vedhasaḥ | yāni | cakartha | pauṁsyā || suteṣu | indra | girvaṇaḥ ||4.32.11||

IAST: avīvṛdhanta gotamā indra tve stomavāhasaḥ
Griffith: Indra, the Gotamas who bring thee praises have grown strong by thee.
Devanāgarī: अवीवृधन्त गोतमा इन्द्र त्वे स्तोमवाहसः
pada pāṭha: avīvr̥dhanta | gotamāḥ | indra | tve iti | stoma-vāhasaḥ || ā | eṣu | dhāḥ | vīra-vat | yaśaḥ ||4.32.12||

IAST: aiṣu dhā vīravad yaśaḥ
Griffith: Give them renown with hero sons.
Devanāgarī: ऐषु धा वीरवद्यशः
pada pāṭha: avīvr̥dhanta | gotamāḥ | indra | tve iti | stoma-vāhasaḥ || ā | eṣu | dhāḥ | vīra-vat | yaśaḥ ||4.32.12||

IAST: yac cid dhi śaśvatām asīndra sādhāraṇas tvam
Griffith: For, Indra, verily thou art the general treasure even of all .
Devanāgarī: यच्चिद्धि शश्वतामसीन्द्र साधारणस्त्वम्
pada pāṭha: yat | cit | hi | śaśvatām | asi | indra | sādhāraṇaḥ | tvam || tam | tvā | vayam | havāmahe ||4.32.13||

IAST: taṁ tvā vayaṁ havāmahe
Griffith: Thee, therefore, do we invocate.
Devanāgarī: तं त्वा वयं हवामहे
pada pāṭha: yat | cit | hi | śaśvatām | asi | indra | sādhāraṇaḥ | tvam || tam | tvā | vayam | havāmahe ||4.32.13||

IAST: arvācīno vaso bhavāsme su matsvāndhasaḥ
Griffith: Excellent Indra, turn to us: glad thee among us with the juice
Devanāgarī: अर्वाचीनो वसो भवास्मे सु मत्स्वान्धसः
pada pāṭha: arvācīnaḥ | vaso iti | bhava | asme iti | su | matsva | andhasaḥ || somānām | indra | soma-pāḥ ||4.32.14||

IAST: somānām indra somapāḥ
Griffith: Of Somas, Soma-drinker thou.
Devanāgarī: सोमानामिन्द्र सोमपाः
pada pāṭha: arvācīnaḥ | vaso iti | bhava | asme iti | su | matsva | andhasaḥ || somānām | indra | soma-pāḥ ||4.32.14||

IAST: asmākaṁ tvā matīnām ā stoma indra yacchatu
Griffith: May praise from us who think Qn thee, O Indra, bring thee near to us.
Devanāgarī: अस्माकं त्वा मतीनामा स्तोम इन्द्र यच्छतु
pada pāṭha: asmākam | tvā | matīnām | ā | stomaḥ | indra | yacchatu || arvāk | ā | vartaya | harī iti ||4.32.15||

IAST: arvāg ā vartayā harī
Griffith: Turn thy two Bay Steeds hitherward.
Devanāgarī: अर्वागा वर्तया हरी
pada pāṭha: asmākam | tvā | matīnām | ā | stomaḥ | indra | yacchatu || arvāk | ā | vartaya | harī iti ||4.32.15||

IAST: puroḻāśaṁ ca no ghaso joṣayāse giraś ca naḥ
Griffith: Eat of our sacrificial cake: rejoice thee in the songs we sing.
Devanāgarī: पुरोळाशं च नो घसो जोषयासे गिरश्च नः
pada pāṭha: puroḷāśam | ca | naḥ | ghasaḥ | joṣayāse | giraḥ | ca | naḥ || vadhūyuḥ-iva | yoṣaṇām ||4.32.16||

IAST: vadhūyur iva yoṣaṇām
Griffith: Even as a lover in his bride.
Devanāgarī: वधूयुरिव योषणाम्
pada pāṭha: puroḷāśam | ca | naḥ | ghasaḥ | joṣayāse | giraḥ | ca | naḥ || vadhūyuḥ-iva | yoṣaṇām ||4.32.16||

IAST: sahasraṁ vyatīnāṁ yuktānām indram īmahe
Griffith: To India for a thousand steeds well-trained and fleet of foot we pray,
Devanāgarī: सहस्रं व्यतीनां युक्तानामिन्द्रमीमहे
pada pāṭha: sahasram | vyatīnām | yuktānām | indram | īmahe || śatam | somasya | khāryaḥ ||4.32.17||

IAST: śataṁ somasya khāryaḥ
Griffith: And hundred jars of Soma juice.
Devanāgarī: शतं सोमस्य खार्यः
pada pāṭha: sahasram | vyatīnām | yuktānām | indram | īmahe || śatam | somasya | khāryaḥ ||4.32.17||

IAST: sahasrā te śatā vayaṁ gavām ā cyāvayāmasi
Griffith: We make a hundred of thy kine, yea, and a thousand, hasten nigh:
Devanāgarī: सहस्रा ते शता वयं गवामा च्यावयामसि
pada pāṭha: sahasrā | te | śatā | vayam | gavām | ā | cyavayāmasi || asma-trā | rādhaḥ | etu | te ||4.32.18||

IAST: asmatrā rādha etu te
Griffith: So let thy bounty come to us.
Devanāgarī: अस्मत्रा राध एतु ते
pada pāṭha: sahasrā | te | śatā | vayam | gavām | ā | cyavayāmasi || asma-trā | rādhaḥ | etu | te ||4.32.18||

IAST: daśa te kalaśānāṁ hiraṇyānām adhīmahi
Griffith: We have obtained, a gift from thee, ten water-ewers wrought of gold:
Devanāgarī: दश ते कलशानां हिरण्यानामधीमहि
pada pāṭha: daśa | te | kalaśānām | hiraṇyānām | adhīmahi || bhūri-dāḥ | asi | vr̥tra-han ||4.32.19||

IAST: bhūridā asi vṛtrahan
Griffith: Thou, Vrtra-slayer, givest much.
Devanāgarī: भूरिदा असि वृत्रहन्
pada pāṭha: daśa | te | kalaśānām | hiraṇyānām | adhīmahi || bhūri-dāḥ | asi | vr̥tra-han ||4.32.19||

IAST: bhūridā bhūri dehi no mā dabhram bhūry ā bhara
Griffith: A bounteous Giver, give us much, bring much and not a trifling gift:
Devanāgarī: भूरिदा भूरि देहि नो मा दभ्रं भूर्या भर
pada pāṭha: bhūri-dāḥ | bhūri | dehi | naḥ | mā | dabhram | bhūri | ā | bhara || bhūri | gha | it | indra | ditsasi ||4.32.20||

IAST: bhūri ghed indra ditsasi
Griffith: Much, Indra, wilt thou fain bestow.
Devanāgarī: भूरि घेदिन्द्र दित्ससि
pada pāṭha: bhūri-dāḥ | bhūri | dehi | naḥ | mā | dabhram | bhūri | ā | bhara || bhūri | gha | it | indra | ditsasi ||4.32.20||

IAST: bhūridā hy asi śrutaḥ purutrā śūra vṛtrahan
Griffith: O Vrtra-slayer, thou art famed in many a place as bountiful
Devanāgarī: भूरिदा ह्यसि श्रुतः पुरुत्रा शूर वृत्रहन्
pada pāṭha: bhūri-dāḥ | hi | asi | śrutaḥ | puru-trā | śūra | vr̥tra-han || ā | naḥ | bhajasva | rādhasi ||4.32.21||

IAST: ā no bhajasva rādhasi
Griffith: Hero, thy bounty let us share.
Devanāgarī: आ नो भजस्व राधसि
pada pāṭha: bhūri-dāḥ | hi | asi | śrutaḥ | puru-trā | śūra | vr̥tra-han || ā | naḥ | bhajasva | rādhasi ||4.32.21||

IAST: pra te babhrū vicakṣaṇa śaṁsāmi goṣaṇo napāt
Griffith: I praise thy pair of Tawny Steeds, wise Son of him who giveth kine
Devanāgarī: प्र ते बभ्रू विचक्षण शंसामि गोषणो नपात्
pada pāṭha: pra | te | babhrū iti | vi-cakṣaṇa | śaṁsāmi | go-sanaḥ | napāt || mā | ābhyām | gāḥ | anu | śiśrathaḥ ||4.32.22||

IAST: mābhyāṁ gā anu śiśrathaḥ
Griffith: Terrify not the cows with these.
Devanāgarī: माभ्यां गा अनु शिश्रथः
pada pāṭha: pra | te | babhrū iti | vi-cakṣaṇa | śaṁsāmi | go-sanaḥ | napāt || mā | ābhyām | gāḥ | anu | śiśrathaḥ ||4.32.22||

IAST: kanīnakeva vidradhe nave drupade arbhake
Griffith: Like two slight images of girls, unrobed, upon a new-wrought post,
Devanāgarī: कनीनकेव विद्रधे नवे द्रुपदे अर्भके
pada pāṭha: kanīnakā-iva | vidradhe | nave | dru-pade | arbhake || babhrū iti | yāmeṣu | śobhete iti ||4.32.23||

IAST: babhrū yāmeṣu śobhete
Griffith: So shine the Bay Steeds in their course.
Devanāgarī: बभ्रू यामेषु शोभेते
pada pāṭha: kanīnakā-iva | vidradhe | nave | dru-pade | arbhake || babhrū iti | yāmeṣu | śobhete iti ||4.32.23||

IAST: aram ma usrayāmṇe 'ram anusrayāmṇe
Griffith: For me the Bays are ready when I start, or start not,
Devanāgarī: अरं म उस्रयाम्णेऽरमनुस्रयाम्णे
pada pāṭha: aram | me | usra-yāmne | aram | anusra-yāmne || babhrū iti | yāmeṣu | asridhā ||4.32.24||

IAST: babhrū yāmeṣv asridhā
Griffith: with the dawn, Innocuous in the ways they take.
Devanāgarī: बभ्रू यामेष्वस्रिधा
pada pāṭha: aram | me | usra-yāmne | aram | anusra-yāmne || babhrū iti | yāmeṣu | asridhā ||4.32.24||

IAST: pra ṛbhubhyo dūtam iva vācam iṣya upastire śvaitarīṁ dhenum īḻe
Griffith: I. I SEND my voice as herald to the Rbhus; I crave the white cow for the overspreading.
Devanāgarī: प्र ऋभुभ्यो दूतमिव वाचमिष्य उपस्तिरे श्वैतरीं धेनुमीळे
pada pāṭha: pra | r̥bhu-bhyaḥ | dūtam-iva | vācam | iṣye | upa-stire | śvaitarīm | dhenum | īḷe || ye | vāta-jūtāḥ | taraṇi-bhiḥ | evaiḥ | pari | dyām | sadyaḥ | apasaḥ | babhūvuḥ ||4.33.1||

IAST: ye vātajūtās taraṇibhir evaiḥ pari dyāṁ sadyo apaso babhūvuḥ
Griffith: Wind-sped, the Skillful Ones in rapid motion have in an instant compassed round the heaven.
Devanāgarī: ये वातजूतास्तरणिभिरेवैः परि द्यां सद्यो अपसो बभूवुः
pada pāṭha: pra | r̥bhu-bhyaḥ | dūtam-iva | vācam | iṣye | upa-stire | śvaitarīm | dhenum | īḷe || ye | vāta-jūtāḥ | taraṇi-bhiḥ | evaiḥ | pari | dyām | sadyaḥ | apasaḥ | babhūvuḥ ||4.33.1||

IAST: yadāram akrann ṛbhavaḥ pitṛbhyām pariviṣṭī veṣaṇā daṁsanābhiḥ
Griffith: What time the Rbus had with care and marvels done proper service to assist their Parents,
Devanāgarī: यदारमक्रन्नृभवः पितृभ्यां परिविष्टी वेषणा दंसनाभिः
pada pāṭha: yadā | aram | akran | r̥bhavaḥ | pitr̥-bhyām | pari-viṣṭī | veṣaṇā | daṁsanābhiḥ || āt | it | devānām | upa | sakhyam | āyan | dhīrāsaḥ | puṣṭim | avahan | manāyai ||4.33.2||

IAST: ād id devānām upa sakhyam āyan dhīrāsaḥ puṣṭim avahan manāyai
Griffith: They won the friendship of the Gods; the Sages carried away the fruit of their devotion.
Devanāgarī: आदिद्देवानामुप सख्यमायन्धीरासः पुष्टिमवहन्मनायै
pada pāṭha: yadā | aram | akran | r̥bhavaḥ | pitr̥-bhyām | pari-viṣṭī | veṣaṇā | daṁsanābhiḥ || āt | it | devānām | upa | sakhyam | āyan | dhīrāsaḥ | puṣṭim | avahan | manāyai ||4.33.2||

IAST: punar ye cakruḥ pitarā yuvānā sanā yūpeva jaraṇā śayānā
Griffith: May they who made their Parents, who were lying like posts that moulder, young again for ever,-
Devanāgarī: पुनर्ये चक्रुः पितरा युवाना सना यूपेव जरणा शयाना
pada pāṭha: punaḥ | ye | cakruḥ | pitarā | yuvānā | sanā | yūpā-iva | jaraṇā | śayānā || te | vājaḥ | vi-bhvā | r̥bhuḥ | indra-vantaḥ | madhu-psarasaḥ | naḥ | avantu | yajñam ||4.33.3||

IAST: te vājo vibhvām̐ ṛbhur indravanto madhupsaraso no 'vantu yajñam
Griffith: May Vaja, Vibhvan, Rbhu, joined with Indra , protect our sacrifice, the Soma-lovers.
Devanāgarī: ते वाजो विभ्वाँ ऋभुरिन्द्रवन्तो मधुप्सरसो नोऽवन्तु यज्ञम्
pada pāṭha: punaḥ | ye | cakruḥ | pitarā | yuvānā | sanā | yūpā-iva | jaraṇā | śayānā || te | vājaḥ | vi-bhvā | r̥bhuḥ | indra-vantaḥ | madhu-psarasaḥ | naḥ | avantu | yajñam ||4.33.3||

IAST: yat saṁvatsam ṛbhavo gām arakṣan yat saṁvatsam ṛbhavo mā apiṁśan
Griffith: As for a year the Rbhus kept the Milch-cow, throughout a year fashioned and formed her body,
Devanāgarī: यत्संवत्समृभवो गामरक्षन्यत्संवत्समृभवो मा अपिंशन्
pada pāṭha: yat | sam-vatsam | r̥bhavaḥ | gām | arakṣan | yat | sam-vatsam | r̥bhavaḥ | māḥ | apiṁśan || yat | sam-vatsam | abharan | bhāsaḥ | asyāḥ | tābhiḥ | śamībhiḥ | amr̥ta-tvam | āśuḥ ||4.33.4||

IAST: yat saṁvatsam abharan bhāso asyās tābhiḥ śamībhir amṛtatvam āśuḥ
Griffith: And through a year's space still sustained her brightness, through these their labours they were made immortal.
Devanāgarī: यत्संवत्समभरन्भासो अस्यास्ताभिः शमीभिरमृतत्वमाशुः
pada pāṭha: yat | sam-vatsam | r̥bhavaḥ | gām | arakṣan | yat | sam-vatsam | r̥bhavaḥ | māḥ | apiṁśan || yat | sam-vatsam | abharan | bhāsaḥ | asyāḥ | tābhiḥ | śamībhiḥ | amr̥ta-tvam | āśuḥ ||4.33.4||

IAST: jyeṣṭha āha camasā dvā kareti kanīyān trīn kṛṇavāmety āha
Griffith: Two beakers let us make,- thus said the eldest. Lct us make three,- this was the younger's sentence.
Devanāgarī: ज्येष्ठ आह चमसा द्वा करेति कनीयान्त्रीन्कृणवामेत्याह
pada pāṭha: jyeṣṭhaḥ | āha | camasā | dvā | kara | iti | kanīyān | trīn | kr̥ṇavāma | iti | āha || kaniṣṭhaḥ | āha | caturaḥ | kara | iti | tvaṣṭā | r̥bhavaḥ | tat | panayat | vacaḥ | vaḥ ||4.33.5||

IAST: kaniṣṭha āha caturas kareti tvaṣṭa ṛbhavas tat panayad vaco vaḥ
Griffith: Four beakers let us make,- thus spoke the youngest. Tvastar approved this rede of yours, O Rbhus.
Devanāgarī: कनिष्ठ आह चतुरस्करेति त्वष्ट ऋभवस्तत्पनयद्वचो वः
pada pāṭha: jyeṣṭhaḥ | āha | camasā | dvā | kara | iti | kanīyān | trīn | kr̥ṇavāma | iti | āha || kaniṣṭhaḥ | āha | caturaḥ | kara | iti | tvaṣṭā | r̥bhavaḥ | tat | panayat | vacaḥ | vaḥ ||4.33.5||

IAST: satyam ūcur nara evā hi cakrur anu svadhām ṛbhavo jagmur etām
Griffith: The men spake truth and even so they acted: this Godlike way of theirs the Rbhus followed.
Devanāgarī: सत्यमूचुर्नर एवा हि चक्रुरनु स्वधामृभवो जग्मुरेताम्
pada pāṭha: satyam | ūcuḥ | naraḥ | eva | hi | cakruḥ | anu | svadhām | r̥bhavaḥ | jagmuḥ | etām || vi-bhrājamānān | camasān | ahā-iva | avenat | tvaṣṭā | caturaḥ | dadr̥śvān ||4.33.6||

IAST: vibhrājamānām̐ś camasām̐ ahevāvenat tvaṣṭā caturo dadṛśvān
Griffith: And Tvastar, when he looked on the four beakers resplendent as the day, was moved with envy.
Devanāgarī: विभ्राजमानाँश्चमसाँ अहेवावेनत्त्वष्टा चतुरो ददृश्वान्
pada pāṭha: satyam | ūcuḥ | naraḥ | eva | hi | cakruḥ | anu | svadhām | r̥bhavaḥ | jagmuḥ | etām || vi-bhrājamānān | camasān | ahā-iva | avenat | tvaṣṭā | caturaḥ | dadr̥śvān ||4.33.6||

IAST: dvādaśa dyūn yad agohyasyātithye raṇann ṛbhavaḥ sasantaḥ
Griffith: When for twelve days the Rbhus joyed reposing as guests of him who never may be hidden,
Devanāgarī: द्वादश द्यून्यदगोह्यस्यातिथ्ये रणन्नृभवः ससन्तः
pada pāṭha: dvādaśa | dyūn | yat | agohyasya | ātithye | raṇan | r̥bhavaḥ | sasantaḥ || su-kṣetrā | akr̥ṇvan | anayanta | sindhūn | dhanva | ā | atiṣṭhan | oṣadhīḥ | nimnam | āpaḥ ||4.33.7||

IAST: sukṣetrākṛṇvann anayanta sindhūn dhanvātiṣṭhann oṣadhīr nimnam āpaḥ
Griffith: lley made fair fertile fields, they brought the rivers. Plants spread o'er deserts, waters filled the hollows.
Devanāgarī: सुक्षेत्राकृण्वन्ननयन्त सिन्धून्धन्वातिष्ठन्नोषधीर्निम्नमापः
pada pāṭha: dvādaśa | dyūn | yat | agohyasya | ātithye | raṇan | r̥bhavaḥ | sasantaḥ || su-kṣetrā | akr̥ṇvan | anayanta | sindhūn | dhanva | ā | atiṣṭhan | oṣadhīḥ | nimnam | āpaḥ ||4.33.7||

IAST: rathaṁ ye cakruḥ suvṛtaṁ nareṣṭhāṁ ye dhenuṁ viśvajuvaṁ viśvarūpām
Griffith: May they who formed the swift car, bearing Heroes, and the Cow omniform and all-impelling,
Devanāgarī: रथं ये चक्रुः सुवृतं नरेष्ठां ये धेनुं विश्वजुवं विश्वरूपाम्
pada pāṭha: ratham | ye | cakruḥ | su-vr̥tam | nare-sthām | ye | dhenum | viśva-juvam | viśva-rūpām || te | ā | takṣantu | r̥bhavaḥ | rayim | naḥ | su-avasaḥ | su-apasaḥ | su-hastāḥ ||4.33.8||

IAST: ta ā takṣantv ṛbhavo rayiṁ naḥ svavasaḥ svapasaḥ suhastāḥ
Griffith: Even may they form wealth for us,-the Rbhus, dexterous-handed, deft in work and gracious.
Devanāgarī: त आ तक्षन्त्वृभवो रयिं नः स्ववसः स्वपसः सुहस्ताः
pada pāṭha: ratham | ye | cakruḥ | su-vr̥tam | nare-sthām | ye | dhenum | viśva-juvam | viśva-rūpām || te | ā | takṣantu | r̥bhavaḥ | rayim | naḥ | su-avasaḥ | su-apasaḥ | su-hastāḥ ||4.33.8||

IAST: apo hy eṣām ajuṣanta devā abhi kratvā manasā dīdhyānāḥ
Griffith: So in their work the Gods had satisfaction, pondering it with thought and mental insight.
Devanāgarī: अपो ह्येषामजुषन्त देवा अभि क्रत्वा मनसा दीध्यानाः
pada pāṭha: apaḥ | hi | eṣām | ajuṣanta | devāḥ | abhi | kratvā | manasā | dīdhyānāḥ || vājaḥ | devānām | abhavat | su-karmā | indrasya | r̥bhukṣāḥ | varuṇasya | vi-bhvā ||4.33.9||

IAST: vājo devānām abhavat sukarmendrasya ṛbhukṣā varuṇasya vibhvā
Griffith: The Gods' expert artificer was Vaja, Indra's Rbhuksan, Varuna's was Vibhvan.
Devanāgarī: वाजो देवानामभवत्सुकर्मेन्द्रस्य ऋभुक्षा वरुणस्य विभ्वा
pada pāṭha: apaḥ | hi | eṣām | ajuṣanta | devāḥ | abhi | kratvā | manasā | dīdhyānāḥ || vājaḥ | devānām | abhavat | su-karmā | indrasya | r̥bhukṣāḥ | varuṇasya | vi-bhvā ||4.33.9||

IAST: ye harī medhayokthā madanta indrāya cakruḥ suyujā ye aśvā
Griffith: They whol made glad with sacrifice and praises, wrought the two Bays, his docile Steeds, for Indra,-
Devanāgarī: ये हरी मेधयोक्था मदन्त इन्द्राय चक्रुः सुयुजा ये अश्वा
pada pāṭha: ye | harī iti | medhayā | ukthā | madantaḥ | indrāya | cakruḥ | su-yujā | ye | aśvā || te | rāyaḥ | poṣam | draviṇāni | asme iti | dhatta | r̥bhavaḥ | kṣema-yantaḥ | na | mitram ||4.33.10||

IAST: te rāyas poṣaṁ draviṇāny asme dhatta ṛbhavaḥ kṣemayanto na mitram
Griffith: Rbhus, as those who wish a friend to prosper, bestow upon us gear and growth of riches.
Devanāgarī: ते रायस्पोषं द्रविणान्यस्मे धत्त ऋभवः क्षेमयन्तो न मित्रम्
pada pāṭha: ye | harī iti | medhayā | ukthā | madantaḥ | indrāya | cakruḥ | su-yujā | ye | aśvā || te | rāyaḥ | poṣam | draviṇāni | asme iti | dhatta | r̥bhavaḥ | kṣema-yantaḥ | na | mitram ||4.33.10||

IAST: idāhnaḥ pītim uta vo madaṁ dhur na ṛte śrāntasya sakhyāya devāḥ
Griffith: This day have they set gladdening drink before you. Not without toil are Gods inclined to friendship.
Devanāgarī: इदाह्नः पीतिमुत वो मदं धुर्न ऋते श्रान्तस्य सख्याय देवाः
pada pāṭha: idā | ahnaḥ | pītim | uta | vaḥ | madam | dhuḥ | na | r̥te | śrāntasya | sakhyāya | devāḥ || te | nūnam | asme iti | r̥bhavaḥ | vasūni | tr̥tīye | asmin | savane | dadhāta ||4.33.11||

IAST: te nūnam asme ṛbhavo vasūni tṛtīye asmin savane dadhāta
Griffith: Therefore do ye who are so great, O Rbhus, vouchsafe us treasures at this third libation.
Devanāgarī: ते नूनमस्मे ऋभवो वसूनि तृतीये अस्मिन्सवने दधात
pada pāṭha: idā | ahnaḥ | pītim | uta | vaḥ | madam | dhuḥ | na | r̥te | śrāntasya | sakhyāya | devāḥ || te | nūnam | asme iti | r̥bhavaḥ | vasūni | tr̥tīye | asmin | savane | dadhāta ||4.33.11||

IAST: ṛbhur vibhvā vāja indro no acchemaṁ yajñaṁ ratnadheyopa yāta
Griffith: To this our sacrifice come Rbhu, Vibhvan, Vaja, and Indra with the gift of riches,
Devanāgarī: ऋभुर्विभ्वा वाज इन्द्रो नो अच्छेमं यज्ञं रत्नधेयोप यात
pada pāṭha: r̥bhuḥ | vi-bhvā | vājaḥ | indraḥ | naḥ | accha | imam | yajñam | ratna-dheyā | upa | yāta || idā | hi | vaḥ | dhiṣaṇā | devī | ahnām | adhāt | pītim | sam | madāḥ | agmata | vaḥ ||4.34.1||

IAST: idā hi vo dhiṣaṇā devy ahnām adhāt pītiṁ sam madā agmatā vaḥ
Griffith: Because this day hath Dhisana the Goddess set drink for you: the gladdening draughts have reached you.
Devanāgarī: इदा हि वो धिषणा देव्यह्नामधात्पीतिं सं मदा अग्मता वः
pada pāṭha: r̥bhuḥ | vi-bhvā | vājaḥ | indraḥ | naḥ | accha | imam | yajñam | ratna-dheyā | upa | yāta || idā | hi | vaḥ | dhiṣaṇā | devī | ahnām | adhāt | pītim | sam | madāḥ | agmata | vaḥ ||4.34.1||

IAST: vidānāso janmano vājaratnā uta ṛtubhir ṛbhavo mādayadhvam
Griffith: Knowing your birth and rich in gathered treasure, Rbhus, rejoice together with the Rtus.
Devanāgarī: विदानासो जन्मनो वाजरत्ना उत ऋतुभिरृभवो मादयध्वम्
pada pāṭha: vidānāsaḥ | janmanaḥ | vāja-ratnāḥ | uta | r̥tu-bhiḥ | r̥bhavaḥ | mādayadhvam || sam | vaḥ | madāḥ | agmata | sam | puram-dhiḥ | su-vīrām | asme iti | rayim | ā | īrayadhvam ||4.34.2||

IAST: saṁ vo madā agmata sam puraṁdhiḥ suvīrām asme rayim erayadhvam
Griffith: The gladdening draughts and wisdom have approached you: send ye us riches with good store of heroes.
Devanāgarī: सं वो मदा अग्मत सं पुरंधिः सुवीरामस्मे रयिमेरयध्वम्
pada pāṭha: vidānāsaḥ | janmanaḥ | vāja-ratnāḥ | uta | r̥tu-bhiḥ | r̥bhavaḥ | mādayadhvam || sam | vaḥ | madāḥ | agmata | sam | puram-dhiḥ | su-vīrām | asme iti | rayim | ā | īrayadhvam ||4.34.2||

IAST: ayaṁ vo yajña ṛbhavo 'kāri yam ā manuṣvat pradivo dadhidhve
Griffith: For you was made this sacrifice, O Rbhus, which ye, like men, won for yourselves aforetime.
Devanāgarī: अयं वो यज्ञ ऋभवोऽकारि यमा मनुष्वत्प्रदिवो दधिध्वे
pada pāṭha: ayam | vaḥ | yajñaḥ | r̥bhavaḥ | akāri | yam | ā | manuṣvat | pra-divaḥ | dadhidhve || pra | vaḥ | accha | jujuṣāṇāsaḥ | asthuḥ | abhūta | viśve | agriyā | uta | vājāḥ ||4.34.3||

IAST: pra vo 'cchā jujuṣāṇāso asthur abhūta viśve agriyota vājāḥ
Griffith: To you come all who find in you their pleasure: ye all were-even the two elder-Vajas.
Devanāgarī: प्र वोऽच्छा जुजुषाणासो अस्थुरभूत विश्वे अग्रियोत वाजाः
pada pāṭha: ayam | vaḥ | yajñaḥ | r̥bhavaḥ | akāri | yam | ā | manuṣvat | pra-divaḥ | dadhidhve || pra | vaḥ | accha | jujuṣāṇāsaḥ | asthuḥ | abhūta | viśve | agriyā | uta | vājāḥ ||4.34.3||

IAST: abhūd u vo vidhate ratnadheyam idā naro dāśuṣe martyāya
Griffith: Now for the mortal worshipper, O Heroes, for him who served you, was the gift of riches.
Devanāgarī: अभूदु वो विधते रत्नधेयमिदा नरो दाशुषे मर्त्याय
pada pāṭha: abhūt | ūm̐ iti | vaḥ | vidhate | ratna-dheyam | idā | naraḥ | dāśuṣe | martyāya || pibata | vājāḥ | r̥bhavaḥ | dade | vaḥ | mahi | tr̥tīyam | savanam | madāya ||4.34.4||

IAST: pibata vājā ṛbhavo dade vo mahi tṛtīyaṁ savanam madāya
Griffith: Drink, Vajas, Rbhus! unto you is offered, to gladden you, the third and great libation.
Devanāgarī: पिबत वाजा ऋभवो ददे वो महि तृतीयं सवनं मदाय
pada pāṭha: abhūt | ūm̐ iti | vaḥ | vidhate | ratna-dheyam | idā | naraḥ | dāśuṣe | martyāya || pibata | vājāḥ | r̥bhavaḥ | dade | vaḥ | mahi | tr̥tīyam | savanam | madāya ||4.34.4||

IAST: ā vājā yātopa na ṛbhukṣā maho naro draviṇaso gṛṇānāḥ
Griffith: Come to us, Heroes, Vajas and Rbhuksans, glorified for the sake of mighty treasure.
Devanāgarī: आ वाजा यातोप न ऋभुक्षा महो नरो द्रविणसो गृणानाः
pada pāṭha: ā | vājāḥ | yāta | upa | naḥ | r̥bhukṣāḥ | mahaḥ | naraḥ | draviṇasaḥ | gr̥ṇānāḥ || ā | vaḥ | pītayaḥ | abhi-pitve | ahnām | imāḥ | astam | navasvaḥ-iva | gman ||4.34.5||

IAST: ā vaḥ pītayo 'bhipitve ahnām imā astaṁ navasva iva gman
Griffith: These draughts approach you as the day is closing, as cows, whose calves are newly-born, their stable.
Devanāgarī: आ वः पीतयोऽभिपित्वे अह्नामिमा अस्तं नवस्व इव ग्मन्
pada pāṭha: ā | vājāḥ | yāta | upa | naḥ | r̥bhukṣāḥ | mahaḥ | naraḥ | draviṇasaḥ | gr̥ṇānāḥ || ā | vaḥ | pītayaḥ | abhi-pitve | ahnām | imāḥ | astam | navasvaḥ-iva | gman ||4.34.5||

IAST: ā napātaḥ śavaso yātanopemaṁ yajñaṁ namasā hūyamānāḥ
Griffith: Come to this sacrifice of ours, ye Children of Strength, invoked with humble adoration.
Devanāgarī: आ नपातः शवसो यातनोपेमं यज्ञं नमसा हूयमानाः
pada pāṭha: ā | napātaḥ | śavasaḥ | yātana | upa | imam | yajñam | namasā | hūyamānāḥ || sa-joṣasaḥ | sūrayaḥ | yasya | ca | stha | madhvaḥ | pāta | ratna-dhāḥ | indra-vantaḥ ||4.34.6||

IAST: sajoṣasaḥ sūrayo yasya ca stha madhvaḥ pāta ratnadhā indravantaḥ
Griffith: Drink of this meath, Wealth-givers, joined with Indra with whom ye are in full accord, ye Princes.
Devanāgarī: सजोषसः सूरयो यस्य च स्थ मध्वः पात रत्नधा इन्द्रवन्तः
pada pāṭha: ā | napātaḥ | śavasaḥ | yātana | upa | imam | yajñam | namasā | hūyamānāḥ || sa-joṣasaḥ | sūrayaḥ | yasya | ca | stha | madhvaḥ | pāta | ratna-dhāḥ | indra-vantaḥ ||4.34.6||

IAST: sajoṣā indra varuṇena somaṁ sajoṣāḥ pāhi girvaṇo marudbhiḥ
Griffith: Close knit with Varuna drink the Soma, Indra; close-knit, ilymn-lover! with the Maruts drink it:
Devanāgarī: सजोषा इन्द्र वरुणेन सोमं सजोषाः पाहि गिर्वणो मरुद्भिः
pada pāṭha: sa-joṣāḥ | indra | varuṇena | somam | sa-joṣāḥ | pāhi | girvaṇaḥ | marut-bhiḥ || agre-pābhiḥ | r̥tu-pābhiḥ | sa-joṣāḥ | gnāḥpatnībhiḥ | ratna-dhābhiḥ | sa-joṣāḥ ||4.34.7||

IAST: agrepābhir ṛtupābhiḥ sajoṣā gnāspatnībhī ratnadhābhiḥ sajoṣāḥ
Griffith: Close-knit with drinkers first, who drink in season; close-knit with heavenly Dames who give us treasures.
Devanāgarī: अग्रेपाभिरृतुपाभिः सजोषा ग्नास्पत्नीभी रत्नधाभिः सजोषाः
pada pāṭha: sa-joṣāḥ | indra | varuṇena | somam | sa-joṣāḥ | pāhi | girvaṇaḥ | marut-bhiḥ || agre-pābhiḥ | r̥tu-pābhiḥ | sa-joṣāḥ | gnāḥpatnībhiḥ | ratna-dhābhiḥ | sa-joṣāḥ ||4.34.7||

IAST: sajoṣasa ādityair mādayadhvaṁ sajoṣasa ṛbhavaḥ parvatebhiḥ
Griffith: Rejoice in full accord with the Adityas, in concord with the Parvatas, O Rbhus;
Devanāgarī: सजोषस आदित्यैर्मादयध्वं सजोषस ऋभवः पर्वतेभिः
pada pāṭha: sa-joṣasaḥ | ādityaiḥ | mādayadhvam | sa-joṣasaḥ | r̥bhavaḥ | parvatebhiḥ || sa-joṣasaḥ | daivyena | savitrā | sa-joṣasaḥ | sindhu-bhiḥ | ratna-dhebhiḥ ||4.34.8||

IAST: sajoṣaso daivyenā savitrā sajoṣasaḥ sindhubhī ratnadhebhiḥ
Griffith: In full accord with Savitar, Divine One; in full accord with floods that pour forth riches.
Devanāgarī: सजोषसो दैव्येना सवित्रा सजोषसः सिन्धुभी रत्नधेभिः
pada pāṭha: sa-joṣasaḥ | ādityaiḥ | mādayadhvam | sa-joṣasaḥ | r̥bhavaḥ | parvatebhiḥ || sa-joṣasaḥ | daivyena | savitrā | sa-joṣasaḥ | sindhu-bhiḥ | ratna-dhebhiḥ ||4.34.8||

IAST: ye aśvinā ye pitarā ya ūtī dhenuṁ tatakṣur ṛbhavo ye aśvā
Griffith: Rbhus, who helped their Parents and the Asvins, who formed the Milch-cow and the pair of horses,
Devanāgarī: ये अश्विना ये पितरा य ऊती धेनुं ततक्षुरृभवो ये अश्वा
pada pāṭha: ye | aśvinā | ye | pitarā | ye | ūtī | dhenum | tatakṣuḥ | r̥bhavaḥ | ye | aśvā || ye | aṁsatrā | ye | r̥dhak | rodasī iti | ye | vi-bhvaḥ | naraḥ | su-apatyāni | cakruḥ ||4.34.9||

IAST: ye aṁsatrā ya ṛdhag rodasī ye vibhvo naraḥ svapatyāni cakruḥ
Griffith: Made armour, set the heaven and earth asunder,-far- reaching Heroes, they have made good offspring.
Devanāgarī: ये अंसत्रा य ऋधग्रोदसी ये विभ्वो नरः स्वपत्यानि चक्रुः
pada pāṭha: ye | aśvinā | ye | pitarā | ye | ūtī | dhenum | tatakṣuḥ | r̥bhavaḥ | ye | aśvā || ye | aṁsatrā | ye | r̥dhak | rodasī iti | ye | vi-bhvaḥ | naraḥ | su-apatyāni | cakruḥ ||4.34.9||

IAST: ye gomantaṁ vājavantaṁ suvīraṁ rayiṁ dhattha vasumantam purukṣum
Griffith: Ye who have wealth in cattle and in booty, in heroes, in rich sustenance and treasure,
Devanāgarī: ये गोमन्तं वाजवन्तं सुवीरं रयिं धत्थ वसुमन्तं पुरुक्षुम्
pada pāṭha: ye | go-mantam | vāja-vantam | su-vīram | rayim | dhattha | vasu-mantam | puru-kṣum || te | agre-pāḥ | r̥bhavaḥ | mandasānāḥ | asme iti | dhatta | ye | ca | rātim | gr̥ṇanti ||4.34.10||

IAST: te agrepā ṛbhavo mandasānā asme dhatta ye ca rātiṁ gṛṇanti
Griffith: Such, O ye Rbhus, first to drink, rejoicing, give unto us and those who laud our present.
Devanāgarī: ते अग्रेपा ऋभवो मन्दसाना अस्मे धत्त ये च रातिं गृणन्ति
pada pāṭha: ye | go-mantam | vāja-vantam | su-vīram | rayim | dhattha | vasu-mantam | puru-kṣum || te | agre-pāḥ | r̥bhavaḥ | mandasānāḥ | asme iti | dhatta | ye | ca | rātim | gr̥ṇanti ||4.34.10||

IAST: nāpābhūta na vo 'tītṛṣāmāniḥśastā ṛbhavo yajñe asmin
Griffith: Ye were not far: we have not left you thirsting, blameless in this our sacrifice, O Rbhus.
Devanāgarī: नापाभूत न वोऽतीतृषामानिःशस्ता ऋभवो यज्ञे अस्मिन्
pada pāṭha: na | apa | abhūta | na | vaḥ | atītr̥ṣāma | aniḥ-śastāḥ | r̥bhavaḥ | yajñe | asmin || sam | indreṇa | madatha | sam | marut-bhiḥ | sam | rāja-bhiḥ | ratna-dheyāya | devāḥ ||4.34.11||

IAST: sam indreṇa madatha sam marudbhiḥ saṁ rājabhī ratnadheyāya devāḥ
Griffith: Rejoice you with the Maruts and with Indra, with the Kings, Gods! that ye may give us riches.
Devanāgarī: समिन्द्रेण मदथ सं मरुद्भिः सं राजभी रत्नधेयाय देवाः
pada pāṭha: na | apa | abhūta | na | vaḥ | atītr̥ṣāma | aniḥ-śastāḥ | r̥bhavaḥ | yajñe | asmin || sam | indreṇa | madatha | sam | marut-bhiḥ | sam | rāja-bhiḥ | ratna-dheyāya | devāḥ ||4.34.11||

IAST: ihopa yāta śavaso napātaḥ saudhanvanā ṛbhavo māpa bhūta
Griffith: Come hither, O ye Sons of Strength, ye Rbhus; stay not afar, ye Children of Sudhanvan.
Devanāgarī: इहोप यात शवसो नपातः सौधन्वना ऋभवो माप भूत
pada pāṭha: iha | upa | yāta | śavasaḥ | napātaḥ | saudhanvanāḥ | r̥bhavaḥ | mā | apa | bhūta || asmin | hi | vaḥ | savane | ratna-dheyam | gamantu | indram | anu | vaḥ | madāsaḥ ||4.35.1||

IAST: asmin hi vaḥ savane ratnadheyaṁ gamantv indram anu vo madāsaḥ
Griffith: At this libation is your gift of treasure. Let gladdening draughts approach you after Indra's.
Devanāgarī: अस्मिन्हि वः सवने रत्नधेयं गमन्त्विन्द्रमनु वो मदासः
pada pāṭha: iha | upa | yāta | śavasaḥ | napātaḥ | saudhanvanāḥ | r̥bhavaḥ | mā | apa | bhūta || asmin | hi | vaḥ | savane | ratna-dheyam | gamantu | indram | anu | vaḥ | madāsaḥ ||4.35.1||

IAST: āgann ṛbhūṇām iha ratnadheyam abhūt somasya suṣutasya pītiḥ
Griffith: Hither is come the Rbhus' gift of riches; here was the drinking of the well-pressed Soma,
Devanāgarī: आगन्नृभूणामिह रत्नधेयमभूत्सोमस्य सुषुतस्य पीतिः
pada pāṭha: ā | agan | r̥bhūṇām | iha | ratna-dheyam | abhūt | somasya | su-sutasya | pītiḥ || su-kr̥tyayā | yat | su-apasyayā | ca | ekam | vi-cakra | camasam | catuḥ-dhā ||4.35.2||

IAST: sukṛtyayā yat svapasyayā cam̐ ekaṁ vicakra camasaṁ caturdhā
Griffith: Since by dexterity and skill as craftsmen ye made the single chalice to be fourfold
Devanāgarī: सुकृत्यया यत्स्वपस्यया चँ एकं विचक्र चमसं चतुर्धा
pada pāṭha: ā | agan | r̥bhūṇām | iha | ratna-dheyam | abhūt | somasya | su-sutasya | pītiḥ || su-kr̥tyayā | yat | su-apasyayā | ca | ekam | vi-cakra | camasam | catuḥ-dhā ||4.35.2||

IAST: vy akṛṇota camasaṁ caturdhā sakhe vi śikṣety abravīta
Griffith: Ye made fourfold the chalice that wag single: ye spake these words and said, O Friend, assist us;
Devanāgarī: व्यकृणोत चमसं चतुर्धा सखे वि शिक्षेत्यब्रवीत
pada pāṭha: vi | akr̥ṇota | camasam | catuḥ-dhā | sakhe | vi | śikṣa | iti | abravīta || atha | aita | vājāḥ | amr̥tasya | panthām | gaṇam | devānām | r̥bhavaḥ | su-hastāḥ ||4.35.3||

IAST: athaita vājā amṛtasya panthāṁ gaṇaṁ devānām ṛbhavaḥ suhastāḥ
Griffith: Then, Vajas! gained the path of life eternal, deft-handed Rbhus, to the Gods' assembly.
Devanāgarī: अथैत वाजा अमृतस्य पन्थां गणं देवानामृभवः सुहस्ताः
pada pāṭha: vi | akr̥ṇota | camasam | catuḥ-dhā | sakhe | vi | śikṣa | iti | abravīta || atha | aita | vājāḥ | amr̥tasya | panthām | gaṇam | devānām | r̥bhavaḥ | su-hastāḥ ||4.35.3||

IAST: kimmayaḥ svic camasa eṣa āsa yaṁ kāvyena caturo vicakra
Griffith: Out of what substance was that chalice fashioned which ye made fourfold by your art and wisdom?
Devanāgarī: किम्मयः स्विच्चमस एष आस यं काव्येन चतुरो विचक्र
pada pāṭha: kim-mayaḥ | svit | camasaḥ | eṣaḥ | āsa | yam | kāvyena | caturaḥ | vi-cakra || atha | sunudhvam | savanam | madāya | pāta | r̥bhavaḥ | madhunaḥ | somyasya ||4.35.4||

IAST: athā sunudhvaṁ savanam madāya pāta ṛbhavo madhunaḥ somyasya
Griffith: Now for the gladdening draught press out the liquor, and drink, O Rbhus, of die meath of Soma.
Devanāgarī: अथा सुनुध्वं सवनं मदाय पात ऋभवो मधुनः सोम्यस्य
pada pāṭha: kim-mayaḥ | svit | camasaḥ | eṣaḥ | āsa | yam | kāvyena | caturaḥ | vi-cakra || atha | sunudhvam | savanam | madāya | pāta | r̥bhavaḥ | madhunaḥ | somyasya ||4.35.4||

IAST: śacyākarta pitarā yuvānā śacyākarta camasaṁ devapānam
Griffith: Ye with your cunning made your Parents youthful; the cup, for Gods to drink, ye formed with cunning;
Devanāgarī: शच्याकर्त पितरा युवाना शच्याकर्त चमसं देवपानम्
pada pāṭha: śacyā | akarta | pitarā | yuvānā | śacyā | akarta | camasam | deva-pānam || śacyā | harī iti | dhanu-tarau | ataṣṭa | indra-vāhau | r̥bhavaḥ | vāja-ratnāḥ ||4.35.5||

IAST: śacyā harī dhanutarāv ataṣṭendravāhāv ṛbhavo vājaratnāḥ
Griffith: With cunning, Rbhus, rich in treasure, fashioned the two swift Tawny Steeds who carry Indra.
Devanāgarī: शच्या हरी धनुतरावतष्टेन्द्रवाहावृभवो वाजरत्नाः
pada pāṭha: śacyā | akarta | pitarā | yuvānā | śacyā | akarta | camasam | deva-pānam || śacyā | harī iti | dhanu-tarau | ataṣṭa | indra-vāhau | r̥bhavaḥ | vāja-ratnāḥ ||4.35.5||

IAST: yo vaḥ sunoty abhipitve ahnāṁ tīvraṁ vājāsaḥ savanam madāya
Griffith: Whoso pours out for you, when days are closing, the sharp libation for your joy, O Vajas,
Devanāgarī: यो वः सुनोत्यभिपित्वे अह्नां तीव्रं वाजासः सवनं मदाय
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | vaḥ | sunoti | abhi-pitve | ahnām | tīvram | vājāsaḥ | savanam | madāya || tasmai | rayim | r̥bhavaḥ | sarva-vīram | ā | takṣata | vr̥ṣaṇaḥ | mandasānāḥ ||4.35.6||

IAST: tasmai rayim ṛbhavaḥ sarvavīram ā takṣata vṛṣaṇo mandasānāḥ
Griffith: For him, O mighty Rbhus, ye, rejoicing, have fashioned wealth with plenteous store of heroes.
Devanāgarī: तस्मै रयिमृभवः सर्ववीरमा तक्षत वृषणो मन्दसानाः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | vaḥ | sunoti | abhi-pitve | ahnām | tīvram | vājāsaḥ | savanam | madāya || tasmai | rayim | r̥bhavaḥ | sarva-vīram | ā | takṣata | vr̥ṣaṇaḥ | mandasānāḥ ||4.35.6||

IAST: prātaḥ sutam apibo haryaśva mādhyaṁdinaṁ savanaṁ kevalaṁ te
Griffith: Lord of Bay Steeds, at dawn thejuice thou drankest: thine, only thine, is the noonday libation.
Devanāgarī: प्रातः सुतमपिबो हर्यश्व माध्यंदिनं सवनं केवलं ते
pada pāṭha: prātariti | sutam | apibaḥ | hari-aśva | mādhyaṁdinam | savanam | kevalam | te || sam | r̥bhu-bhiḥ | pibasva | ratna-dhebhiḥ | sakhīn | yān | indra | cakr̥ṣe | su-kr̥tyā ||4.35.7||

IAST: sam ṛbhubhiḥ pibasva ratnadhebhiḥ sakhīm̐r yām̐ indra cakṛṣe sukṛtyā
Griffith: Now drink thou with the wealth-bestowing Rbhus, whom for their skill thou madest friends, O Indra.
Devanāgarī: समृभुभिः पिबस्व रत्नधेभिः सखीँर्याँ इन्द्र चकृषे सुकृत्या
pada pāṭha: prātariti | sutam | apibaḥ | hari-aśva | mādhyaṁdinam | savanam | kevalam | te || sam | r̥bhu-bhiḥ | pibasva | ratna-dhebhiḥ | sakhīn | yān | indra | cakr̥ṣe | su-kr̥tyā ||4.35.7||

IAST: ye devāso abhavatā sukṛtyā śyenā ived adhi divi niṣeda
Griffith: Ye, whom your artist skill hath raised to Godhead have set you down above in heaven like falcons.
Devanāgarī: ये देवासो अभवता सुकृत्या श्येना इवेदधि दिवि निषेद
pada pāṭha: ye | devāsaḥ | abhavata | su-kr̥tyā | śyenāḥ-iva | it | adhi | divi | ni-seda || te | ratnam | dhāta | śavasaḥ | napātaḥ | saudhanvanāḥ | abhavata | amr̥tāsaḥ ||4.35.8||

IAST: te ratnaṁ dhāta śavaso napātaḥ saudhanvanā abhavatāmṛtāsaḥ
Griffith: So give us riches, Children of Sudhanvan, O Sons of Strength; ye have become immortal.
Devanāgarī: ते रत्नं धात शवसो नपातः सौधन्वना अभवतामृतासः
pada pāṭha: ye | devāsaḥ | abhavata | su-kr̥tyā | śyenāḥ-iva | it | adhi | divi | ni-seda || te | ratnam | dhāta | śavasaḥ | napātaḥ | saudhanvanāḥ | abhavata | amr̥tāsaḥ ||4.35.8||

IAST: yat tṛtīyaṁ savanaṁ ratnadheyam akṛṇudhvaṁ svapasyā suhastāḥ
Griffith: The third libation, that bestoweth treasure, which ye have won by skill, ye dexterous-handed,-
Devanāgarī: यत्तृतीयं सवनं रत्नधेयमकृणुध्वं स्वपस्या सुहस्ताः
pada pāṭha: yat | tr̥tīyam | savanam | ratna-dheyam | akr̥ṇudhvam | su-apasyā | su-hastāḥ || tat | r̥bhavaḥ | pari-siktam | vaḥ | etat | sam | madebhiḥ | indriyebhiḥ | pibadhvam ||4.35.9||

IAST: tad ṛbhavaḥ pariṣiktaṁ va etat sam madebhir indriyebhiḥ pibadhvam
Griffith: This drink hath been effused for you, O Rbhus . drink it with high delight, with joy like Indra's.
Devanāgarī: तदृभवः परिषिक्तं व एतत्सं मदेभिरिन्द्रियेभिः पिबध्वम्
pada pāṭha: yat | tr̥tīyam | savanam | ratna-dheyam | akr̥ṇudhvam | su-apasyā | su-hastāḥ || tat | r̥bhavaḥ | pari-siktam | vaḥ | etat | sam | madebhiḥ | indriyebhiḥ | pibadhvam ||4.35.9||

IAST: anaśvo jāto anabhīśur ukthyo rathas tricakraḥ pari vartate rajaḥ
Griffith: THia car that was not made for horses or for reins, three-wheeled, worthy of lauds, rolls round the firmament.
Devanāgarī: अनश्वो जातो अनभीशुरुक्थ्यो रथस्त्रिचक्रः परि वर्तते रजः
pada pāṭha: anaśvaḥ | jātaḥ | anabhīśuḥ | ukthyaḥ | rathaḥ | tri-cakraḥ | pari | vartate | rajaḥ || mahat | tat | vaḥ | devyasya | pra-vācanam | dyām | r̥bhavaḥ | pr̥thivīm | yat | ca | puṣyatha ||4.36.1||

IAST: mahat tad vo devyasya pravācanaṁ dyām ṛbhavaḥ pṛthivīṁ yac ca puṣyatha
Griffith: That is the great announcement of your Deity, that, O ye Rbhus, ye sustain the earth and heaven.
Devanāgarī: महत्तद्वो देव्यस्य प्रवाचनं द्यामृभवः पृथिवीं यच्च पुष्यथ
pada pāṭha: anaśvaḥ | jātaḥ | anabhīśuḥ | ukthyaḥ | rathaḥ | tri-cakraḥ | pari | vartate | rajaḥ || mahat | tat | vaḥ | devyasya | pra-vācanam | dyām | r̥bhavaḥ | pr̥thivīm | yat | ca | puṣyatha ||4.36.1||

IAST: rathaṁ ye cakruḥ suvṛtaṁ sucetaso 'vihvarantam manasas pari dhyayā
Griffith: Ye Sapient Ones who made the lightly-rolling car out of your mind, by thought, the car that never errs,
Devanāgarī: रथं ये चक्रुः सुवृतं सुचेतसोऽविह्वरन्तं मनसस्परि ध्यया
pada pāṭha: ratham | ye | cakruḥ | su-vr̥tam | su-cetasaḥ | avi-hvarantam | manasaḥ | pari | dhyayā || tān | ūm̐ iti | nu | asya | savanasya | pītaye | ā | vaḥ | vājāḥ | r̥bhavaḥ | vedayāmasi ||4.36.2||

IAST: tām̐ ū nv asya savanasya pītaya ā vo vājā ṛbhavo vedayāmasi
Griffith: You, being such, to drink of this drinkoffering, you, O ye Vajas, and ye Rbhus, we invoke.
Devanāgarī: ताँ ऊ न्वस्य सवनस्य पीतय आ वो वाजा ऋभवो वेदयामसि
pada pāṭha: ratham | ye | cakruḥ | su-vr̥tam | su-cetasaḥ | avi-hvarantam | manasaḥ | pari | dhyayā || tān | ūm̐ iti | nu | asya | savanasya | pītaye | ā | vaḥ | vājāḥ | r̥bhavaḥ | vedayāmasi ||4.36.2||

IAST: tad vo vājā ṛbhavaḥ supravācanaṁ deveṣu vibhvo abhavan mahitvanam
Griffith: O Vajas, Rbhus, reaching far, among the Gods this was your exaltation gloriously declared,
Devanāgarī: तद्वो वाजा ऋभवः सुप्रवाचनं देवेषु विभ्वो अभवन्महित्वनम्
pada pāṭha: tat | vaḥ | vājāḥ | r̥bhavaḥ | su-pravācanam | deveṣu | vi-bhvaḥ | abhavat | mahi-tvanam || jivrī iti | yat | santā | pitarā | sanā-jurā | punaḥ | yuvānā | carathāya | takṣatha ||4.36.3||

IAST: jivrī yat santā pitarā sanājurā punar yuvānā carathāya takṣatha
Griffith: In that your aged Parents, worn with length of days, ye wrought again to youth so that they moved at will.
Devanāgarī: जिव्री यत्सन्ता पितरा सनाजुरा पुनर्युवाना चरथाय तक्षथ
pada pāṭha: tat | vaḥ | vājāḥ | r̥bhavaḥ | su-pravācanam | deveṣu | vi-bhvaḥ | abhavat | mahi-tvanam || jivrī iti | yat | santā | pitarā | sanā-jurā | punaḥ | yuvānā | carathāya | takṣatha ||4.36.3||

IAST: ekaṁ vi cakra camasaṁ caturvayaṁ niś carmaṇo gām ariṇīta dhītibhiḥ
Griffith: The chalice that wag single ye have made fourfold, and by your wisdom brought the Cow forth from the hide.
Devanāgarī: एकं वि चक्र चमसं चतुर्वयं निश्चर्मणो गामरिणीत धीतिभिः
pada pāṭha: ekam | vi | cakra | camasam | catuḥ-vayam | niḥ | carmaṇaḥ | gām | ariṇīta | dhīti-bhiḥ || atha | deveṣu | amr̥ta-tvam | ānaśa | śruṣṭī | vājāḥ | r̥bhavaḥ | tat | vaḥ | ukthyam ||4.36.4||

IAST: athā deveṣv amṛtatvam ānaśa śruṣṭī vājā ṛbhavas tad va ukthyam
Griffith: So quickly, mid the Gods, ye gained immortal life. Vajas and Rbhus, your great work must be extolled.
Devanāgarī: अथा देवेष्वमृतत्वमानश श्रुष्टी वाजा ऋभवस्तद्व उक्थ्यम्
pada pāṭha: ekam | vi | cakra | camasam | catuḥ-vayam | niḥ | carmaṇaḥ | gām | ariṇīta | dhīti-bhiḥ || atha | deveṣu | amr̥ta-tvam | ānaśa | śruṣṭī | vājāḥ | r̥bhavaḥ | tat | vaḥ | ukthyam ||4.36.4||

IAST: ṛbhuto rayiḥ prathamaśravastamo vājaśrutāso yam ajījanan naraḥ
Griffith: Wealth from the Rbhus is most glorious in renown, that which the Heroes, famed for vigour, have produced.
Devanāgarī: ऋभुतो रयिः प्रथमश्रवस्तमो वाजश्रुतासो यमजीजनन्नरः
pada pāṭha: r̥bhutaḥ | rayiḥ | prathamaśravaḥ-tamaḥ | vāja-śrutāsaḥ | yam | ajījanan | naraḥ || vibhva-taṣṭaḥ | vidatheṣu | pra-vācyaḥ | yam | devāsaḥ | avatha | saḥ | vi-carṣaṇiḥ ||4.36.5||

IAST: vibhvataṣṭo vidatheṣu pravācyo yaṁ devāso 'vathā sa vicarṣaṇiḥ
Griffith: In synods must be sung the car which Vibhvan wrought: that which ye favour, Gods! is famed among mankind.
Devanāgarī: विभ्वतष्टो विदथेषु प्रवाच्यो यं देवासोऽवथा स विचर्षणिः
pada pāṭha: r̥bhutaḥ | rayiḥ | prathamaśravaḥ-tamaḥ | vāja-śrutāsaḥ | yam | ajījanan | naraḥ || vibhva-taṣṭaḥ | vidatheṣu | pra-vācyaḥ | yam | devāsaḥ | avatha | saḥ | vi-carṣaṇiḥ ||4.36.5||

IAST: sa vājy arvā sa ṛṣir vacasyayā sa śūro astā pṛtanāsu duṣṭaraḥ
Griffith: Strong is the steed, the man a sage in eloquence, the bowman is a hero hard to beat in fight,
Devanāgarī: स वाज्यर्वा स ऋषिर्वचस्यया स शूरो अस्ता पृतनासु दुष्टरः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | vājī | arvā | saḥ | r̥ṣiḥ | vacasyayā | saḥ | śūraḥ | astā | pr̥tanāsu | dustaraḥ || saḥ | rāyaḥ | poṣam | saḥ | su-vīryam | dadhe | yam | vājaḥ | vi-bhvā | r̥bhavaḥ | yam | āviṣuḥ ||4.36.6||

IAST: sa rāyas poṣaṁ sa suvīryaṁ dadhe yaṁ vājo vibhvām̐ ṛbhavo yam āviṣuḥ
Griffith: Great store of wealth and manly power hath he obtained whom Vaja, Vibhvan, Rbhus have looked kindly on.
Devanāgarī: स रायस्पोषं स सुवीर्यं दधे यं वाजो विभ्वाँ ऋभवो यमाविषुः
pada pāṭha: saḥ | vājī | arvā | saḥ | r̥ṣiḥ | vacasyayā | saḥ | śūraḥ | astā | pr̥tanāsu | dustaraḥ || saḥ | rāyaḥ | poṣam | saḥ | su-vīryam | dadhe | yam | vājaḥ | vi-bhvā | r̥bhavaḥ | yam | āviṣuḥ ||4.36.6||

IAST: śreṣṭhaṁ vaḥ peśo adhi dhāyi darśataṁ stomo vājā ṛbhavas taṁ jujuṣṭana
Griffith: To you hath been assigned the fairest ornament, the hymn of praise: Vajas and Rbhus, joy therein;
Devanāgarī: श्रेष्ठं वः पेशो अधि धायि दर्शतं स्तोमो वाजा ऋभवस्तं जुजुष्टन
pada pāṭha: śreṣṭham | vaḥ | peśaḥ | adhi | dhāyi | darśatam | stomaḥ | vājāḥ | r̥bhavaḥ | tam | jujuṣṭana || dhīrāsaḥ | hi | stha | kavayaḥ | vipaḥ-citaḥ | tān | vaḥ | enā | brahmaṇā | ā | vedayāmasi ||4.36.7||

IAST: dhīrāso hi ṣṭhā kavayo vipaścitas tān va enā brahmaṇā vedayāmasi
Griffith: For ye have lore and wisdom and poetic skill: as such, with this our prayer we call on you to come.
Devanāgarī: धीरासो हि ष्ठा कवयो विपश्चितस्तान्व एना ब्रह्मणा वेदयामसि
pada pāṭha: śreṣṭham | vaḥ | peśaḥ | adhi | dhāyi | darśatam | stomaḥ | vājāḥ | r̥bhavaḥ | tam | jujuṣṭana || dhīrāsaḥ | hi | stha | kavayaḥ | vipaḥ-citaḥ | tān | vaḥ | enā | brahmaṇā | ā | vedayāmasi ||4.36.7||

IAST: yūyam asmabhyaṁ dhiṣaṇābhyas pari vidvāṁso viśvā naryāṇi bhojanā
Griffith: According to the wishes of our hearts may ye, who have full knowledge of all the delights of men,
Devanāgarī: यूयमस्मभ्यं धिषणाभ्यस्परि विद्वांसो विश्वा नर्याणि भोजना
pada pāṭha: yūyam | asmabhyam | dhiṣaṇābhyaḥ | pari | vidvāṁsaḥ | viśvā | naryāṇi | bhojanā || dyu-mantam | vājam | vr̥ṣa-śuṣmam | ut-tamam | ā | naḥ | rayim | r̥bhavaḥ | takṣata | ā | vayaḥ ||4.36.8||

IAST: dyumantaṁ vājaṁ vṛṣaśuṣmam uttamam ā no rayim ṛbhavas takṣatā vayaḥ
Griffith: Fashion for us, O Rbhus, power and splendid wealth, rich in high courage, excellent, and vital strength.
Devanāgarī: द्युमन्तं वाजं वृषशुष्ममुत्तममा नो रयिमृभवस्तक्षता वयः
pada pāṭha: yūyam | asmabhyam | dhiṣaṇābhyaḥ | pari | vidvāṁsaḥ | viśvā | naryāṇi | bhojanā || dyu-mantam | vājam | vr̥ṣa-śuṣmam | ut-tamam | ā | naḥ | rayim | r̥bhavaḥ | takṣata | ā | vayaḥ ||4.36.8||

IAST: iha prajām iha rayiṁ rarāṇā iha śravo vīravat takṣatā naḥ
Griffith: Bestowing on us here riches and offspring, here fashion fame for us befitting heroes.
Devanāgarī: इह प्रजामिह रयिं रराणा इह श्रवो वीरवत्तक्षता नः
pada pāṭha: iha | pra-jām | iha | rayim | rarāṇāḥ | iha | śravaḥ | vīra-vat | takṣata | naḥ || yena | vayam | citayema | ati | anyān | tam | vājam | citram | r̥bhavaḥ | dada | naḥ ||4.36.9||

IAST: yena vayaṁ citayemāty anyān taṁ vājaṁ citram ṛbhavo dadā naḥ
Griffith: Vouchsafe us wealth of splendid sort, O Rbhus, that we may make us more renowned than others.
Devanāgarī: येन वयं चितयेमात्यन्यान्तं वाजं चित्रमृभवो ददा नः
pada pāṭha: iha | pra-jām | iha | rayim | rarāṇāḥ | iha | śravaḥ | vīra-vat | takṣata | naḥ || yena | vayam | citayema | ati | anyān | tam | vājam | citram | r̥bhavaḥ | dada | naḥ ||4.36.9||
