IAST: upa no vājā adhvaram ṛbhukṣā devā yāta pathibhir devayānaiḥ
Griffith: COME to our sacrifice, Vajas, Rbhuksans, Gods, by the paths which Gods are wont to travel,
Devanāgarī: उप नो वाजा अध्वरमृभुक्षा देवा यात पथिभिर्देवयानैः
pada pāṭha: upa | naḥ | vājāḥ | adhvaram | r̥bhukṣāḥ | devāḥ | yāta | pathi-bhiḥ | deva-yānaiḥ || yathā | yajñam | manuṣaḥ | vikṣu | āsu | dadhidhve | raṇvāḥ | su-dineṣu | ahnām ||4.37.1||

IAST: yathā yajñam manuṣo vikṣv āsu dadhidhve raṇvāḥ sudineṣv ahnām
Griffith: As ye, gay Gods, accept in splendid weather the sacrifice among these folk of Manus.
Devanāgarī: यथा यज्ञं मनुषो विक्ष्वासु दधिध्वे रण्वाः सुदिनेष्वह्नाम्
pada pāṭha: upa | naḥ | vājāḥ | adhvaram | r̥bhukṣāḥ | devāḥ | yāta | pathi-bhiḥ | deva-yānaiḥ || yathā | yajñam | manuṣaḥ | vikṣu | āsu | dadhidhve | raṇvāḥ | su-dineṣu | ahnām ||4.37.1||

IAST: te vo hṛde manase santu yajñā juṣṭāso adya ghṛtanirṇijo guḥ
Griffith: May these rites please you in your heart and spirit; may the drops clothed in oil this day approach you.
Devanāgarī: ते वो हृदे मनसे सन्तु यज्ञा जुष्टासो अद्य घृतनिर्णिजो गुः
pada pāṭha: te | vaḥ | hr̥de | manase | santu | yajñāḥ | juṣṭāsaḥ | adya | ghr̥ta-nirnijaḥ | guḥ || pra | vaḥ | sutāsaḥ | harayanta | pūrṇāḥ | kratve | dakṣāya | harṣayanta | pītāḥ ||4.37.2||

IAST: pra vaḥ sutāso harayanta pūrṇāḥ kratve dakṣāya harṣayanta pītāḥ
Griffith: May the abundant juices bear you onward to power and strength, and, when imbibed, delight you.
Devanāgarī: प्र वः सुतासो हरयन्त पूर्णाः क्रत्वे दक्षाय हर्षयन्त पीताः
pada pāṭha: te | vaḥ | hr̥de | manase | santu | yajñāḥ | juṣṭāsaḥ | adya | ghr̥ta-nirnijaḥ | guḥ || pra | vaḥ | sutāsaḥ | harayanta | pūrṇāḥ | kratve | dakṣāya | harṣayanta | pītāḥ ||4.37.2||

IAST: tryudāyaṁ devahitaṁ yathā vaḥ stomo vājā ṛbhukṣaṇo dade vaḥ
Griffith: Your threefold going near is God-appointed, so praise is given you, Vajas and Rbhuksans.
Devanāgarī: त्र्युदायं देवहितं यथा वः स्तोमो वाजा ऋभुक्षणो ददे वः
pada pāṭha: tri-udāyam | deva-hitam | yathā | vaḥ | stomaḥ | vājāḥ | r̥bhukṣaṇaḥ | dade | vaḥ || juhve | manuṣvat | uparāsu | vikṣu | yuṣme iti | sacā | br̥hat-diveṣu | somam ||4.37.3||

IAST: juhve manuṣvad uparāsu vikṣu yuṣme sacā bṛhaddiveṣu somam
Griffith: So, Manus-like, mid younger folk I offer, to you who are aloft in heaven, the Soma.
Devanāgarī: जुह्वे मनुष्वदुपरासु विक्षु युष्मे सचा बृहद्दिवेषु सोमम्
pada pāṭha: tri-udāyam | deva-hitam | yathā | vaḥ | stomaḥ | vājāḥ | r̥bhukṣaṇaḥ | dade | vaḥ || juhve | manuṣvat | uparāsu | vikṣu | yuṣme iti | sacā | br̥hat-diveṣu | somam ||4.37.3||

IAST: pīvoaśvāḥ śucadrathā hi bhūtāyaḥśiprā vājinaḥ suniṣkāḥ
Griffith: Strong, with fair chains of gold and jaws of iron, ye have a splendid car and well-fed horses.
Devanāgarī: पीवोअश्वाः शुचद्रथा हि भूतायःशिप्रा वाजिनः सुनिष्काः
pada pāṭha: pīvaḥ-aśvāḥ | śucat-rathāḥ | hi | bhūta | āyaḥ-śiprāḥ | vājinaḥ | su-niṣkāḥ || indrasya | sūno iti | śavasaḥ | napātaḥ | anu | vaḥ | ceti | agriyam | madāya ||4.37.4||

IAST: indrasya sūno śavaso napāto 'nu vaś cety agriyam madāya
Griffith: Ye Sons of Strength, ye progeny of Indra, to you the best is offered to delight you.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रस्य सूनो शवसो नपातोऽनु वश्चेत्यग्रियं मदाय
pada pāṭha: pīvaḥ-aśvāḥ | śucat-rathāḥ | hi | bhūta | āyaḥ-śiprāḥ | vājinaḥ | su-niṣkāḥ || indrasya | sūno iti | śavasaḥ | napātaḥ | anu | vaḥ | ceti | agriyam | madāya ||4.37.4||

IAST: ṛbhum ṛbhukṣaṇo rayiṁ vāje vājintamaṁ yujam
Griffith: Rbhuksans! him, for handy wealth, the mightiest comrade in the fight,
Devanāgarī: ऋभुमृभुक्षणो रयिं वाजे वाजिन्तमं युजम्
pada pāṭha: r̥bhum | r̥bhukṣaṇaḥ | rayim | vāje | vājin-tamam | yujam || indrasvantam | havāmahe | sadā-sātamam | aśvinam ||4.37.5||

IAST: indrasvantaṁ havāmahe sadāsātamam aśvinam
Griffith: Him, Indra's equal, we invoke, most bounteous ever, rich in steeds.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रस्वन्तं हवामहे सदासातममश्विनम्
pada pāṭha: r̥bhum | r̥bhukṣaṇaḥ | rayim | vāje | vājin-tamam | yujam || indrasvantam | havāmahe | sadā-sātamam | aśvinam ||4.37.5||

IAST: sed ṛbhavo yam avatha yūyam indraś ca martyam
Griffith: The mortal man whom, Rbhus, ye and Indra favour with your help,
Devanāgarī: सेदृभवो यमवथ यूयमिन्द्रश्च मर्त्यम्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | it | r̥bhavaḥ | yam | avatha | yūyam | indraḥ | ca | martyam || saḥ | dhībhiḥ | astu | sanitā | medha-sātā | saḥ | arvatā ||4.37.6||

IAST: sa dhībhir astu sanitā medhasātā so arvatā
Griffith: Must be successful, by his thoughts, at sacrifice and with the steed.
Devanāgarī: स धीभिरस्तु सनिता मेधसाता सो अर्वता
pada pāṭha: saḥ | it | r̥bhavaḥ | yam | avatha | yūyam | indraḥ | ca | martyam || saḥ | dhībhiḥ | astu | sanitā | medha-sātā | saḥ | arvatā ||4.37.6||

IAST: vi no vājā ṛbhukṣaṇaḥ pathaś citana yaṣṭave
Griffith: O Vajas and Rbhuksans, free for us the paths to sacrifice,
Devanāgarī: वि नो वाजा ऋभुक्षणः पथश्चितन यष्टवे
pada pāṭha: vi | naḥ | vājāḥ | r̥bhukṣaṇaḥ | pathaḥ | citana | yaṣṭave || asmabhyam | sūrayaḥ | stutāḥ | viśvāḥ | āśāḥ | tarīṣaṇi ||4.37.7||

IAST: asmabhyaṁ sūrayaḥ stutā viśvā āśās tarīṣaṇi
Griffith: Ye Princes, lauded, that we may press forward to each point of heaven.
Devanāgarī: अस्मभ्यं सूरयः स्तुता विश्वा आशास्तरीषणि
pada pāṭha: vi | naḥ | vājāḥ | r̥bhukṣaṇaḥ | pathaḥ | citana | yaṣṭave || asmabhyam | sūrayaḥ | stutāḥ | viśvāḥ | āśāḥ | tarīṣaṇi ||4.37.7||

IAST: taṁ no vājā ṛbhukṣaṇa indra nāsatyā rayim
Griffith: O Vajas and Rbhuksans, ye Nasatyas, Indra, bless this wealth,
Devanāgarī: तं नो वाजा ऋभुक्षण इन्द्र नासत्या रयिम्
pada pāṭha: tam | naḥ | vājāḥ | r̥bhukṣaṇaḥ | indra | nāsatyā | rayim || sam | aśvam | carṣaṇi-bhyaḥ | ā | puru | śasta | maghattaye ||4.37.8||

IAST: sam aśvaṁ carṣaṇibhya ā puru śasta maghattaye
Griffith: And, before other men's, the steed, that ample riches may be won.
Devanāgarī: समश्वं चर्षणिभ्य आ पुरु शस्त मघत्तये
pada pāṭha: tam | naḥ | vājāḥ | r̥bhukṣaṇaḥ | indra | nāsatyā | rayim || sam | aśvam | carṣaṇi-bhyaḥ | ā | puru | śasta | maghattaye ||4.37.8||

IAST: uto hi vāṁ dātrā santi pūrvā yā pūrubhyas trasadasyur nitośe
Griffith: FROM you two came the gifts in days aforetime which Trasadasyu granted to the Purus.
Devanāgarī: उतो हि वां दात्रा सन्ति पूर्वा या पूरुभ्यस्त्रसदस्युर्नितोशे
pada pāṭha: uto iti | hi | vām | dātrā | santi | pūrvā | yā | pūru-bhyaḥ | trasadasyuḥ | ni-tośe || kṣetra-sām | dadathuḥ | urvarā-sām | ghanam | dasyu-bhyaḥ | abhi-bhūtim | ugram ||4.38.1||

IAST: kṣetrāsāṁ dadathur urvarāsāṁ ghanaṁ dasyubhyo abhibhūtim ugram
Griffith: Ye gave the winner of our fields and plough-lands, and the strong smiter who subdued the Dasytis.
Devanāgarī: क्षेत्रासां ददथुरुर्वरासां घनं दस्युभ्यो अभिभूतिमुग्रम्
pada pāṭha: uto iti | hi | vām | dātrā | santi | pūrvā | yā | pūru-bhyaḥ | trasadasyuḥ | ni-tośe || kṣetra-sām | dadathuḥ | urvarā-sām | ghanam | dasyu-bhyaḥ | abhi-bhūtim | ugram ||4.38.1||

IAST: uta vājinam puruniṣṣidhvānaṁ dadhikrām u dadathur viśvakṛṣṭim
Griffith: And ye gave mighty Dadhikras, the giver of many gifts, who visiteth all people,
Devanāgarī: उत वाजिनं पुरुनिष्षिध्वानं दधिक्रामु ददथुर्विश्वकृष्टिम्
pada pāṭha: uta | vājinam | puruniḥ-sidhvānam | dadhi-krām | ūm̐ iti | dadathuḥ | viśva-kr̥ṣṭim || r̥jipyam | śyenam | pruṣita-psum | āśum | carkr̥tyam | aryaḥ | nr̥-patim | na | śūram ||4.38.2||

IAST: ṛjipyaṁ śyenam pruṣitapsum āśuṁ carkṛtyam aryo nṛpatiṁ na śūram
Griffith: Impetuous hawk, swift and of varied colour, like a brave King whom each true man must honour.
Devanāgarī: ऋजिप्यं श्येनं प्रुषितप्सुमाशुं चर्कृत्यमर्यो नृपतिं न शूरम्
pada pāṭha: uta | vājinam | puruniḥ-sidhvānam | dadhi-krām | ūm̐ iti | dadathuḥ | viśva-kr̥ṣṭim || r̥jipyam | śyenam | pruṣita-psum | āśum | carkr̥tyam | aryaḥ | nr̥-patim | na | śūram ||4.38.2||

IAST: yaṁ sīm anu pravateva dravantaṁ viśvaḥ pūrur madati harṣamāṇaḥ
Griffith: Whom, as 'twere down a precipice, swift rushing, each Puru praises and his heart rejoices,-
Devanāgarī: यं सीमनु प्रवतेव द्रवन्तं विश्वः पूरुर्मदति हर्षमाणः
pada pāṭha: yam | sīm | anu | pravatā-iva | dravantam | viśvaḥ | pūruḥ | madati | harṣamāṇaḥ || paṭ-bhiḥ | gr̥dhyantam | medha-yum | na | śūram | ratha-turam | vātam-iva | dhrajantam ||4.38.3||

IAST: paḍbhir gṛdhyantam medhayuṁ na śūraṁ rathaturaṁ vātam iva dhrajantam
Griffith: Springing forth like a hero fain for battle, whirling the car and flying like the tempest.
Devanāgarī: पड्भिर्गृध्यन्तं मेधयुं न शूरं रथतुरं वातमिव ध्रजन्तम्
pada pāṭha: yam | sīm | anu | pravatā-iva | dravantam | viśvaḥ | pūruḥ | madati | harṣamāṇaḥ || paṭ-bhiḥ | gr̥dhyantam | medha-yum | na | śūram | ratha-turam | vātam-iva | dhrajantam ||4.38.3||

IAST: yaḥ smārundhāno gadhyā samatsu sanutaraś carati goṣu gacchan
Griffith: Who gaineth precious booty in the combats and moveth, winning spoil, among the cattle;
Devanāgarī: यः स्मारुन्धानो गध्या समत्सु सनुतरश्चरति गोषु गच्छन्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | sma | ā-rundhānaḥ | gadhyā | samat-su | sanu-taraḥ | carati | goṣu | gacchan || āviḥ-r̥jīkaḥ | vidathā | ni-cikyat | tiraḥ | aratim | pari | āpaḥ | āyoḥ ||4.38.4||

IAST: āvirṛjīko vidathā nicikyat tiro aratim pary āpa āyoḥ
Griffith: Shown in bright colour, looking on the assemblies, beyond the churl, to worship of the living.
Devanāgarī: आविरृजीको विदथा निचिक्यत्तिरो अरतिं पर्याप आयोः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | sma | ā-rundhānaḥ | gadhyā | samat-su | sanu-taraḥ | carati | goṣu | gacchan || āviḥ-r̥jīkaḥ | vidathā | ni-cikyat | tiraḥ | aratim | pari | āpaḥ | āyoḥ ||4.38.4||

IAST: uta smainaṁ vastramathiṁ na tāyum anu krośanti kṣitayo bhareṣu
Griffith: Loudly the folk cry after him in battles, as 'twere a thief who steals away a garment;
Devanāgarī: उत स्मैनं वस्त्रमथिं न तायुमनु क्रोशन्ति क्षितयो भरेषु
pada pāṭha: uta | sma | enam | vastra-mathim | na | tāyum | anu | krośanti | kṣitayaḥ | bhareṣu || nīcā | ayamānam | jasurim | na | śyenam | śravaḥ | ca | accha | paśu-mat | ca | yūtham ||4.38.5||

IAST: nīcāyamānaṁ jasuriṁ na śyenaṁ śravaś cācchā paśumac ca yūtham
Griffith: Speeding to glory, or a herd of cattle, even as a hungry falcon swooping downward.
Devanāgarī: नीचायमानं जसुरिं न श्येनं श्रवश्चाच्छा पशुमच्च यूथम्
pada pāṭha: uta | sma | enam | vastra-mathim | na | tāyum | anu | krośanti | kṣitayaḥ | bhareṣu || nīcā | ayamānam | jasurim | na | śyenam | śravaḥ | ca | accha | paśu-mat | ca | yūtham ||4.38.5||

IAST: uta smāsu prathamaḥ sariṣyan ni veveti śreṇibhī rathānām
Griffith: And, fain to come forth first amid these armies, this way and that with rows of cars he rushes,
Devanāgarī: उत स्मासु प्रथमः सरिष्यन्नि वेवेति श्रेणिभी रथानाम्
pada pāṭha: uta | sma | āsu | prathamaḥ | sariṣyan | ni | veveti | śreṇi-bhiḥ | rathānām || srajam | kr̥ṇvānaḥ | janyaḥ | na | śubhvā | reṇum | rerihat | kiraṇam | dadaśvān ||4.38.6||

IAST: srajaṁ kṛṇvāno janyo na śubhvā reṇuṁ rerihat kiraṇaṁ dadaśvān
Griffith: Gay like a bridesman, making him a garland, tossing the dust, champing the rein that holds him.
Devanāgarī: स्रजं कृण्वानो जन्यो न शुभ्वा रेणुं रेरिहत्किरणं ददश्वान्
pada pāṭha: uta | sma | āsu | prathamaḥ | sariṣyan | ni | veveti | śreṇi-bhiḥ | rathānām || srajam | kr̥ṇvānaḥ | janyaḥ | na | śubhvā | reṇum | rerihat | kiraṇam | dadaśvān ||4.38.6||

IAST: uta sya vājī sahurir ṛtāvā śuśrūṣamāṇas tanvā samarye
Griffith: And that strong Steed, victorious and faithful, obedient with his body in the combat,
Devanāgarī: उत स्य वाजी सहुरिरृतावा शुश्रूषमाणस्तन्वा समर्ये
pada pāṭha: uta | syaḥ | vājī | sahuriḥ | r̥ta-vā | śuśrūṣamāṇaḥ | tanvā | sa-marye || turam | yatīṣu | turayan | r̥jipyaḥ | adhi | bhruvoḥ | kirate | reṇum | r̥ñjan ||4.38.7||

IAST: turaṁ yatīṣu turayann ṛjipyo 'dhi bhruvoḥ kirate reṇum ṛñjan
Griffith: Speeding straight on amid the swiftly ressing, casts o'er his brows the dust he tosses upward.
Devanāgarī: तुरं यतीषु तुरयन्नृजिप्योऽधि भ्रुवोः किरते रेणुमृञ्जन्
pada pāṭha: uta | syaḥ | vājī | sahuriḥ | r̥ta-vā | śuśrūṣamāṇaḥ | tanvā | sa-marye || turam | yatīṣu | turayan | r̥jipyaḥ | adhi | bhruvoḥ | kirate | reṇum | r̥ñjan ||4.38.7||

IAST: uta smāsya tanyator iva dyor ṛghāyato abhiyujo bhayante
Griffith: And at his thunder, like the roar of heaven, those who attack tremble and are affrighted;
Devanāgarī: उत स्मास्य तन्यतोरिव द्योरृघायतो अभियुजो भयन्ते
pada pāṭha: uta | sma | asya | tanyatoḥ-iva | dyoḥ | r̥ghāyataḥ | abhi-yujaḥ | bhayante || yadā | sahasram | abhi | sīm | ayodhīt | duḥ-vartuḥ | sma | bhavati | bhīmaḥ | r̥ñjan ||4.38.8||

IAST: yadā sahasram abhi ṣīm ayodhīd durvartuḥ smā bhavati bhīma ṛñjan
Griffith: For when he fights against embattled thousands, dread is he in his striving; none may stay him.
Devanāgarī: यदा सहस्रमभि षीमयोधीद्दुर्वर्तुः स्मा भवति भीम ऋञ्जन्
pada pāṭha: uta | sma | asya | tanyatoḥ-iva | dyoḥ | r̥ghāyataḥ | abhi-yujaḥ | bhayante || yadā | sahasram | abhi | sīm | ayodhīt | duḥ-vartuḥ | sma | bhavati | bhīmaḥ | r̥ñjan ||4.38.8||

IAST: uta smāsya panayanti janā jūtiṁ kṛṣṭipro abhibhūtim āśoḥ
Griffith: The people praise the overpowering swiftness of this fleet Steed who giveth men abundance.
Devanāgarī: उत स्मास्य पनयन्ति जना जूतिं कृष्टिप्रो अभिभूतिमाशोः
pada pāṭha: uta | sma | asya | panayanti | janāḥ | jūtim | kr̥ṣṭi-praḥ | abhi-bhūtim | āśoḥ || uta | enam | āhuḥ | sam-ithe | vi-yantaḥ | parā | dadhi-krāḥ | asarat | sahasraiḥ ||4.38.9||

IAST: utainam āhuḥ samithe viyantaḥ parā dadhikrā asarat sahasraiḥ
Griffith: Of him they say when drawing back from battle. Dadhikras hath sped forward with his thousands.
Devanāgarī: उतैनमाहुः समिथे वियन्तः परा दधिक्रा असरत्सहस्रैः
pada pāṭha: uta | sma | asya | panayanti | janāḥ | jūtim | kr̥ṣṭi-praḥ | abhi-bhūtim | āśoḥ || uta | enam | āhuḥ | sam-ithe | vi-yantaḥ | parā | dadhi-krāḥ | asarat | sahasraiḥ ||4.38.9||

IAST: ā dadhikrāḥ śavasā pañca kṛṣṭīḥ sūrya iva jyotiṣāpas tatāna
Griffith: Dadhikras hath o'erspread the Fivefold People with vigour, as the Sun lightens the waters.
Devanāgarī: आ दधिक्राः शवसा पञ्च कृष्टीः सूर्य इव ज्योतिषापस्ततान
pada pāṭha: ā | dadhi-krāḥ | śavasā | pañca | kr̥ṣṭīḥ | sūryaḥ-iva | jyotiṣā | apaḥ | tatāna || sahasra-sāḥ | śata-sāḥ | vājī | arvā | pr̥ṇaktu | madhvā | sam | imā | vacāṁsi ||4.38.10||

IAST: sahasrasāḥ śatasā vājy arvā pṛṇaktu madhvā sam imā vacāṁsi
Griffith: May the strong Steed who winneth bundreds, thousands, requite with sweetness these my words and praises.
Devanāgarī: सहस्रसाः शतसा वाज्यर्वा पृणक्तु मध्वा समिमा वचांसि
pada pāṭha: ā | dadhi-krāḥ | śavasā | pañca | kr̥ṣṭīḥ | sūryaḥ-iva | jyotiṣā | apaḥ | tatāna || sahasra-sāḥ | śata-sāḥ | vājī | arvā | pr̥ṇaktu | madhvā | sam | imā | vacāṁsi ||4.38.10||

IAST: āśuṁ dadhikrāṁ tam u nu ṣṭavāma divas pṛthivyā uta carkirāma
Griffith: Now give we praise to Dadhikras the rapid, and mention in our laud the Earth and Heaven.
Devanāgarī: आशुं दधिक्रां तमु नु ष्टवाम दिवस्पृथिव्या उत चर्किराम
pada pāṭha: āśum | dadhi-krām | tam | ūm̐ iti | nu | stavāma | divaḥ | pr̥thivyāḥ | uta | carkirāma || ucchantīḥ | mām | uṣasaḥ | sūdayantu | ati | viśvāni | duḥ-itāni | parṣan ||4.39.1||

IAST: ucchantīr mām uṣasaḥ sūdayantv ati viśvāni duritāni parṣan
Griffith: May the Dawns flushing move me to exertion, and bear me safely over every trouble.
Devanāgarī: उच्छन्तीर्मामुषसः सूदयन्त्वति विश्वानि दुरितानि पर्षन्
pada pāṭha: āśum | dadhi-krām | tam | ūm̐ iti | nu | stavāma | divaḥ | pr̥thivyāḥ | uta | carkirāma || ucchantīḥ | mām | uṣasaḥ | sūdayantu | ati | viśvāni | duḥ-itāni | parṣan ||4.39.1||

IAST: mahaś carkarmy arvataḥ kratuprā dadhikrāvṇaḥ puruvārasya vṛṣṇaḥ
Griffith: I praise the mighty Steed who fills my spirit, the Stallion Dadhikravan rich in bounties,
Devanāgarī: महश्चर्कर्म्यर्वतः क्रतुप्रा दधिक्राव्णः पुरुवारस्य वृष्णः
pada pāṭha: mahaḥ | carkarmi | arvataḥ | kratu-prāḥ | dadhi-krāvṇaḥ | puru-vārasya | vr̥ṣṇaḥ || yam | pūru-bhyaḥ | dīdi-vāṁsam | na | agnim | dadathuḥ | mitrāvaruṇā | taturim ||4.39.2||

IAST: yam pūrubhyo dīdivāṁsaṁ nāgniṁ dadathur mitrāvaruṇā taturim
Griffith: Whom, swift of foot aind shining bright as Agni, ye, Varuna and Mitra, gave to Purus.
Devanāgarī: यं पूरुभ्यो दीदिवांसं नाग्निं ददथुर्मित्रावरुणा ततुरिम्
pada pāṭha: mahaḥ | carkarmi | arvataḥ | kratu-prāḥ | dadhi-krāvṇaḥ | puru-vārasya | vr̥ṣṇaḥ || yam | pūru-bhyaḥ | dīdi-vāṁsam | na | agnim | dadathuḥ | mitrāvaruṇā | taturim ||4.39.2||

IAST: yo aśvasya dadhikrāvṇo akārīt samiddhe agnā uṣaso vyuṣṭau
Griffith: Him who hath honoured, when the flame is kindled at break of dawn, the Courser Dadhikrivan,
Devanāgarī: यो अश्वस्य दधिक्राव्णो अकारीत्समिद्धे अग्ना उषसो व्युष्टौ
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | aśvasya | dadhi-krāvṇaḥ | akārīt | sam-iddhe | agnau | uṣasaḥ | vi-uṣṭau || anāgasam | tam | aditiḥ | kr̥ṇotu | saḥ | mitreṇa | varuṇena | sa-joṣāḥ ||4.39.3||

IAST: anāgasaṁ tam aditiḥ kṛṇotu sa mitreṇa varuṇenā sajoṣāḥ
Griffith: Him, of one mind with Varuna and Mitra may Aditi make free from all transgression.
Devanāgarī: अनागसं तमदितिः कृणोतु स मित्रेण वरुणेना सजोषाः
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | aśvasya | dadhi-krāvṇaḥ | akārīt | sam-iddhe | agnau | uṣasaḥ | vi-uṣṭau || anāgasam | tam | aditiḥ | kr̥ṇotu | saḥ | mitreṇa | varuṇena | sa-joṣāḥ ||4.39.3||

IAST: dadhikrāvṇa iṣa ūrjo maho yad amanmahi marutāṁ nāma bhadram
Griffith: When we remember mighty Dadhikravan our food and strength, then the blest name of Maruts,
Devanāgarī: दधिक्राव्ण इष ऊर्जो महो यदमन्महि मरुतां नाम भद्रम्
pada pāṭha: dadhi-krāvṇaḥ | iṣaḥ | ūrjaḥ | mahaḥ | yat | amanmahi | marutām | nāma | bhadram || svastaye | varuṇam | mitram | agnim | havāmahe | indram | vajra-bāhum ||4.39.4||

IAST: svastaye varuṇam mitram agniṁ havāmaha indraṁ vajrabāhum
Griffith: Varuna, Mitra, we invoke for welfare, and Agni, and the thunder-wielding Indra.
Devanāgarī: स्वस्तये वरुणं मित्रमग्निं हवामह इन्द्रं वज्रबाहुम्
pada pāṭha: dadhi-krāvṇaḥ | iṣaḥ | ūrjaḥ | mahaḥ | yat | amanmahi | marutām | nāma | bhadram || svastaye | varuṇam | mitram | agnim | havāmahe | indram | vajra-bāhum ||4.39.4||

IAST: indram ived ubhaye vi hvayanta udīrāṇā yajñam upaprayantaḥ
Griffith: Both sides invoke him as they call on Indra when they stir forth and turn to sacrificing.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रमिवेदुभये वि ह्वयन्त उदीराणा यज्ञमुपप्रयन्तः
pada pāṭha: indram-iva | it | ubhaye | vi | hvayante | ut-īrāṇāḥ | yajñam | upa-prayantaḥ || dadhi-krām | ūm̐ iti | sūdanam | martyāya | dadathuḥ | mitrāvaruṇā | naḥ | aśvam ||4.39.5||

IAST: dadhikrām u sūdanam martyāya dadathur mitrāvaruṇā no aśvam
Griffith: To us have Varuna and Mitra granted the Courser Dadhikris, a guide for mortals.
Devanāgarī: दधिक्रामु सूदनं मर्त्याय ददथुर्मित्रावरुणा नो अश्वम्
pada pāṭha: indram-iva | it | ubhaye | vi | hvayante | ut-īrāṇāḥ | yajñam | upa-prayantaḥ || dadhi-krām | ūm̐ iti | sūdanam | martyāya | dadathuḥ | mitrāvaruṇā | naḥ | aśvam ||4.39.5||

IAST: dadhikrāvṇo akāriṣaṁ jiṣṇor aśvasya vājinaḥ
Griffith: So have I glorified with praise strong Dadhikravan, conquering Steed.
Devanāgarī: दधिक्राव्णो अकारिषं जिष्णोरश्वस्य वाजिनः
pada pāṭha: dadhi-krāvṇaḥ | akāriṣam | jiṣṇoḥ | aśvasya | vājinaḥ || surabhi | naḥ | mukhā | karat | pra | naḥ | āyūṁṣi | tāriṣat ||4.39.6||

IAST: surabhi no mukhā karat pra ṇa āyūṁṣi tāriṣat
Griffith: Sweet may he make our mouths; may he prolong the days we have to live.
Devanāgarī: सुरभि नो मुखा करत्प्र ण आयूंषि तारिषत्
pada pāṭha: dadhi-krāvṇaḥ | akāriṣam | jiṣṇoḥ | aśvasya | vājinaḥ || surabhi | naḥ | mukhā | karat | pra | naḥ | āyūṁṣi | tāriṣat ||4.39.6||

IAST: dadhikrāvṇa id u nu carkirāma viśvā in mām uṣasaḥ sūdayantu
Griffith: LET us recite the praise of Dadhikravan: may all the Mornings move me to exertion;
Devanāgarī: दधिक्राव्ण इदु नु चर्किराम विश्वा इन्मामुषसः सूदयन्तु
pada pāṭha: dadhi-krāvṇaḥ | it | ūm̐ iti | nu | cārkirāma | viśvāḥ | it | mām | uṣasaḥ | sūdayantu || apām | agneḥ | uṣasaḥ | sūryasya | br̥haspateḥ | āṅgirasasya | jiṣṇoḥ ||4.40.1||

IAST: apām agner uṣasaḥ sūryasya bṛhaspater āṅgirasasya jiṣṇoḥ
Griffith: Praise of the Lord of Waters, Dawn, and Agni, Brhaspati Son of Angiras, and Surya.
Devanāgarī: अपामग्नेरुषसः सूर्यस्य बृहस्पतेराङ्गिरसस्य जिष्णोः
pada pāṭha: dadhi-krāvṇaḥ | it | ūm̐ iti | nu | cārkirāma | viśvāḥ | it | mām | uṣasaḥ | sūdayantu || apām | agneḥ | uṣasaḥ | sūryasya | br̥haspateḥ | āṅgirasasya | jiṣṇoḥ ||4.40.1||

IAST: satvā bhariṣo gaviṣo duvanyasac chravasyād iṣa uṣasas turaṇyasat
Griffith: Brave, seeking war and booty, dwelling with the good and with the swift, may he hasten the food of Dawn.
Devanāgarī: सत्वा भरिषो गविषो दुवन्यसच्छ्रवस्यादिष उषसस्तुरण्यसत्
pada pāṭha: satvā | bhariṣaḥ | go-iṣaḥ | duvanya-sat | śravasyāt | iṣaḥ | uṣasaḥ | turaṇya-sat || satyaḥ | dravaḥ | dravaraḥ | pataṅgaraḥ | dadhi-krāvā | iṣam | ūrjam | svaḥ | janat ||4.40.2||

IAST: satyo dravo dravaraḥ pataṁgaro dadhikrāveṣam ūrjaṁ svar janat
Griffith: May he the true, the fleet, the lover of the course, the bird-like Dadhikravan, bring food, strength, and light.
Devanāgarī: सत्यो द्रवो द्रवरः पतंगरो दधिक्रावेषमूर्जं स्वर्जनत्
pada pāṭha: satvā | bhariṣaḥ | go-iṣaḥ | duvanya-sat | śravasyāt | iṣaḥ | uṣasaḥ | turaṇya-sat || satyaḥ | dravaḥ | dravaraḥ | pataṅgaraḥ | dadhi-krāvā | iṣam | ūrjam | svaḥ | janat ||4.40.2||

IAST: uta smāsya dravatas turaṇyataḥ parṇaṁ na ver anu vāti pragardhinaḥ
Griffith: His pinion, rapid runner, fans him m his way, as of a bird that hastens onward to its aim,
Devanāgarī: उत स्मास्य द्रवतस्तुरण्यतः पर्णं न वेरनु वाति प्रगर्धिनः
pada pāṭha: uta | sma | asya | dravataḥ | turaṇyataḥ | parṇam | na | veḥ | anu | vāti | pra-gardhinaḥ || śyenasya-iva | dhrajataḥ | aṅkasam | pari | dadhi-krāvṇaḥ | saha | ūrjā | taritrataḥ ||4.40.3||

IAST: śyenasyeva dhrajato aṅkasam pari dadhikrāvṇaḥ sahorjā taritrataḥ
Griffith: And, as it were a falcon's gliding through the air, strikes Dadhikravan's side as he speeds on with might.
Devanāgarī: श्येनस्येव ध्रजतो अङ्कसं परि दधिक्राव्णः सहोर्जा तरित्रतः
pada pāṭha: uta | sma | asya | dravataḥ | turaṇyataḥ | parṇam | na | veḥ | anu | vāti | pra-gardhinaḥ || śyenasya-iva | dhrajataḥ | aṅkasam | pari | dadhi-krāvṇaḥ | saha | ūrjā | taritrataḥ ||4.40.3||

IAST: uta sya vājī kṣipaṇiṁ turaṇyati grīvāyām baddho apikakṣa āsani
Griffith: Bound by the neck and by the flanks and by the mouth, the vigorous Courser lends new swiftness to his speed.
Devanāgarī: उत स्य वाजी क्षिपणिं तुरण्यति ग्रीवायां बद्धो अपिकक्ष आसनि
pada pāṭha: uta | syaḥ | vājī | kṣipaṇim | turaṇyati | grīvāyām | baddhaḥ | api-kakṣe | āsani || kratum | dadhi-krāḥ | anu | sam-tavītvat | pathām | aṅkāṁsi | anu | ā-panīphaṇat ||4.40.4||

IAST: kratuṁ dadhikrā anu saṁtavītvat pathām aṅkāṁsy anv āpanīphaṇat
Griffith: Drawing himself together, as his strength allows, Dadhikras springs along the windings of the paths.
Devanāgarī: क्रतुं दधिक्रा अनु संतवीत्वत्पथामङ्कांस्यन्वापनीफणत्
pada pāṭha: uta | syaḥ | vājī | kṣipaṇim | turaṇyati | grīvāyām | baddhaḥ | api-kakṣe | āsani || kratum | dadhi-krāḥ | anu | sam-tavītvat | pathām | aṅkāṁsi | anu | ā-panīphaṇat ||4.40.4||

IAST: haṁsaḥ śuciṣad vasur antarikṣasad dhotā vediṣad atithir duroṇasat
Griffith: The Hamsa homed in light, the Vasu in mid-air, the priest beside the altar, in the house the guest,
Devanāgarī: हंसः शुचिषद्वसुरन्तरिक्षसद्धोता वेदिषदतिथिर्दुरोणसत्
pada pāṭha: haṁsaḥ | śuci-sat | vasuḥ | antarikṣa-sat | hotā | vedi-sat | atithiḥ | duroṇa-sat || nr̥-sat | vara-sat | r̥ta-sat | vyoma-sat | ap-jāḥ | go-jāḥ | r̥ta-jāḥ | adri-jāḥ | r̥tam ||4.40.5||

IAST: nṛṣad varasad ṛtasad vyomasad abjā gojā ṛtajā adrijā ṛtam
Griffith: Dweller in noblest place, mid men, in truth, in sky, born of flood, kine, truth, mountain, he is holy Law.
Devanāgarī: नृषद्वरसदृतसद्व्योमसदब्जा गोजा ऋतजा अद्रिजा ऋतम्
pada pāṭha: haṁsaḥ | śuci-sat | vasuḥ | antarikṣa-sat | hotā | vedi-sat | atithiḥ | duroṇa-sat || nr̥-sat | vara-sat | r̥ta-sat | vyoma-sat | ap-jāḥ | go-jāḥ | r̥ta-jāḥ | adri-jāḥ | r̥tam ||4.40.5||

IAST: indrā ko vāṁ varuṇā sumnam āpa stomo haviṣmām̐ amṛto na hotā
Griffith: WHAT laud, O Indra-Varuna, with oblation, hath like the Immortal Priest obtained your favour?
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रा को वां वरुणा सुम्नमाप स्तोमो हविष्माँ अमृतो न होता
pada pāṭha: indrā | kaḥ | vām | varuṇā | sumnam | āpa | stomaḥ | haviṣmān | amr̥taḥ | na | hotā || yaḥ | vām | hr̥di | kratu-mān | asmat | uktaḥ | pasparśat | indrāvaruṇā | namasvān ||4.41.1||

IAST: yo vāṁ hṛdi kratumām̐ asmad uktaḥ pasparśad indrāvaruṇā namasvān
Griffith: Hath our effectual laud, addressed with homage, touched you, O Indra-Varuna, in spirit?
Devanāgarī: यो वां हृदि क्रतुमाँ अस्मदुक्तः पस्पर्शदिन्द्रावरुणा नमस्वान्
pada pāṭha: indrā | kaḥ | vām | varuṇā | sumnam | āpa | stomaḥ | haviṣmān | amr̥taḥ | na | hotā || yaḥ | vām | hr̥di | kratu-mān | asmat | uktaḥ | pasparśat | indrāvaruṇā | namasvān ||4.41.1||

IAST: indrā ha yo varuṇā cakra āpī devau martaḥ sakhyāya prayasvān
Griffith: He who with dainty food hath won you, Indra and Varuna, Gods, as his allies to friendship,
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रा ह यो वरुणा चक्र आपी देवौ मर्तः सख्याय प्रयस्वान्
pada pāṭha: indrā | ha | yaḥ | varuṇā | cakre | āpī iti | devau | martaḥ | sakhyāya | prayasvān || saḥ | hanti | vr̥trā | sam-itheṣu | śatrūn | avaḥ-bhiḥ | vā | mahat-bhiḥ | saḥ | pra | śr̥ṇve ||4.41.2||

IAST: sa hanti vṛtrā samitheṣu śatrūn avobhir vā mahadbhiḥ sa pra śṛṇve
Griffith: Jayeth the Vrtras and his foes in battles, and through your mighty favours is made famous.
Devanāgarī: स हन्ति वृत्रा समिथेषु शत्रूनवोभिर्वा महद्भिः स प्र शृण्वे
pada pāṭha: indrā | ha | yaḥ | varuṇā | cakre | āpī iti | devau | martaḥ | sakhyāya | prayasvān || saḥ | hanti | vr̥trā | sam-itheṣu | śatrūn | avaḥ-bhiḥ | vā | mahat-bhiḥ | saḥ | pra | śr̥ṇve ||4.41.2||

IAST: indrā ha ratnaṁ varuṇā dheṣṭhetthā nṛbhyaḥ śaśamānebhyas tā
Griffith: Indra and Varuna are most liberal givers of treasure to the men who toil to serve them,
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रा ह रत्नं वरुणा धेष्ठेत्था नृभ्यः शशमानेभ्यस्ता
pada pāṭha: indrā | ha | ratnam | varuṇā | dheṣṭhā | itthā | nr̥-bhyaḥ | śaśamānebhyaḥ | tā || yadi | sakhāyā | sakhyāya | somaiḥ | sutebhiḥ | su-prayasā | mādayaite iti ||4.41.3||

IAST: yadī sakhāyā sakhyāya somaiḥ sutebhiḥ suprayasā mādayaite
Griffith: When they, as Friends inclined to friendship, honoured with dainty food, delight in flowing Soma.
Devanāgarī: यदी सखाया सख्याय सोमैः सुतेभिः सुप्रयसा मादयैते
pada pāṭha: indrā | ha | ratnam | varuṇā | dheṣṭhā | itthā | nr̥-bhyaḥ | śaśamānebhyaḥ | tā || yadi | sakhāyā | sakhyāya | somaiḥ | sutebhiḥ | su-prayasā | mādayaite iti ||4.41.3||

IAST: indrā yuvaṁ varuṇā didyum asminn ojiṣṭham ugrā ni vadhiṣṭaṁ vajram
Griffith: Indra and Varuna, ye hurl, O Mighty, on him your strongest flashing bolt of thunder
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रा युवं वरुणा दिद्युमस्मिन्नोजिष्ठमुग्रा नि वधिष्टं वज्रम्
pada pāṭha: indrā | yuvam | varuṇā | didyum | asmin | ojiṣṭham | ugrā | ni | vadhiṣṭam | vajram || yaḥ | naḥ | duḥ-evaḥ | vr̥katiḥ | dabhītiḥ | tasmin | mimāthām | abhi-bhūti | ojaḥ ||4.41.4||

IAST: yo no durevo vṛkatir dabhītis tasmin mimāthām abhibhūty ojaḥ
Griffith: Who treats us ill, the robber and oppressor: measure on him your overwhelming vigour.
Devanāgarī: यो नो दुरेवो वृकतिर्दभीतिस्तस्मिन्मिमाथामभिभूत्योजः
pada pāṭha: indrā | yuvam | varuṇā | didyum | asmin | ojiṣṭham | ugrā | ni | vadhiṣṭam | vajram || yaḥ | naḥ | duḥ-evaḥ | vr̥katiḥ | dabhītiḥ | tasmin | mimāthām | abhi-bhūti | ojaḥ ||4.41.4||

IAST: indrā yuvaṁ varuṇā bhūtam asyā dhiyaḥ pretārā vṛṣabheva dhenoḥ
Griffith: O Indra-Varuna, be ye the lovers of this my song, as steers who love the milch-Cow.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रा युवं वरुणा भूतमस्या धियः प्रेतारा वृषभेव धेनोः
pada pāṭha: indrā | yuvam | varuṇā | bhūtam | asyāḥ | dhiyaḥ | pretārā | vr̥ṣabhā-iva | dhenoḥ || sā | naḥ | duhīyat | yavasā-iva | gatvī | sahasra-dhārā | payasā | mahī | gauḥ ||4.41.5||

IAST: sā no duhīyad yavaseva gatvī sahasradhārā payasā mahī gauḥ
Griffith: Milk may it yield us as, gone forth to pasture, the great Cow pouring out her thousand rivers.
Devanāgarī: सा नो दुहीयद्यवसेव गत्वी सहस्रधारा पयसा मही गौः
pada pāṭha: indrā | yuvam | varuṇā | bhūtam | asyāḥ | dhiyaḥ | pretārā | vr̥ṣabhā-iva | dhenoḥ || sā | naḥ | duhīyat | yavasā-iva | gatvī | sahasra-dhārā | payasā | mahī | gauḥ ||4.41.5||

IAST: toke hite tanaya urvarāsu sūro dṛśīke vṛṣaṇaś ca pauṁsye
Griffith: For fertile fields, for worthy sons and grandsons, for the Sun's beauty and for steer-like vigour,
Devanāgarī: तोके हिते तनय उर्वरासु सूरो दृशीके वृषणश्च पौंस्ये
pada pāṭha: toke | hite | tanaye | urvarāsu | sūraḥ | dr̥śīke | vr̥ṣaṇaḥ | ca | pauṁsye || indrā | naḥ | atra | varuṇā | syātām | avaḥ-bhiḥ | dasmā | pari-takmyāyām ||4.41.6||

IAST: indrā no atra varuṇā syātām avobhir dasmā paritakmyāyām
Griffith: May Indra-Varuna with gracious favours work marvels for us in the stress of battle.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रा नो अत्र वरुणा स्यातामवोभिर्दस्मा परितक्म्यायाम्
pada pāṭha: toke | hite | tanaye | urvarāsu | sūraḥ | dr̥śīke | vr̥ṣaṇaḥ | ca | pauṁsye || indrā | naḥ | atra | varuṇā | syātām | avaḥ-bhiḥ | dasmā | pari-takmyāyām ||4.41.6||

IAST: yuvām id dhy avase pūrvyāya pari prabhūtī gaviṣaḥ svāpī
Griffith: For you, as Princes, for your ancient kindness, good comrades of the man who seeks for booty,
Devanāgarī: युवामिद्ध्यवसे पूर्व्याय परि प्रभूती गविषः स्वापी
pada pāṭha: yuvām | it | hi | avase | pūrvyāya | pari | prabhūtī iti pra-bhūtī | go-iṣaḥ | svāpī iti su-āpī || vr̥ṇīmahe | sakhyāya | priyāya | śūrā | maṁhiṣṭhā | pitarā-iva | śaṁbhū iti śam-bhū ||4.41.7||

IAST: vṛṇīmahe sakhyāya priyāya śūrā maṁhiṣṭhā pitareva śambhū
Griffith: We choose to us for the dear bond of friendship, most liberal Heroes bringing bliss like parents.
Devanāgarī: वृणीमहे सख्याय प्रियाय शूरा मंहिष्ठा पितरेव शम्भू
pada pāṭha: yuvām | it | hi | avase | pūrvyāya | pari | prabhūtī iti pra-bhūtī | go-iṣaḥ | svāpī iti su-āpī || vr̥ṇīmahe | sakhyāya | priyāya | śūrā | maṁhiṣṭhā | pitarā-iva | śaṁbhū iti śam-bhū ||4.41.7||

IAST: tā vāṁ dhiyo 'vase vājayantīr ājiṁ na jagmur yuvayūḥ sudānū
Griffith: Showing their strength, these hymns for grace, Free-givers I have gone to you, devoted, as to battle.
Devanāgarī: ता वां धियोऽवसे वाजयन्तीराजिं न जग्मुर्युवयूः सुदानू
pada pāṭha: tāḥ | vām | dhiyaḥ | avase | vāja-yantīḥ | ājim | na | jagmuḥ | yuva-yūḥ | sudānū iti su-dānū || śriye | na | gāvaḥ | upa | somam | asthuḥ | indram | giraḥ | varuṇam | me | manīṣāḥ ||4.41.8||

IAST: śriye na gāva upa somam asthur indraṁ giro varuṇam me manīṣāḥ
Griffith: For glory have they gone, as milk to Soma, to Indra-Varuna my thoughts and praises.
Devanāgarī: श्रिये न गाव उप सोममस्थुरिन्द्रं गिरो वरुणं मे मनीषाः
pada pāṭha: tāḥ | vām | dhiyaḥ | avase | vāja-yantīḥ | ājim | na | jagmuḥ | yuva-yūḥ | sudānū iti su-dānū || śriye | na | gāvaḥ | upa | somam | asthuḥ | indram | giraḥ | varuṇam | me | manīṣāḥ ||4.41.8||

IAST: imā indraṁ varuṇam me manīṣā agmann upa draviṇam icchamānāḥ
Griffith: To Indra and to Varuna, desirous of gaining wealth have these my thoughts proceeded.
Devanāgarī: इमा इन्द्रं वरुणं मे मनीषा अग्मन्नुप द्रविणमिच्छमानाः
pada pāṭha: imāḥ | indram | varuṇam | me | manīṣāḥ | agman | upa | draviṇam | icchamānāḥ || upa | īm | asthuḥ | joṣṭāraḥ-iva | vasvaḥ | raghvīḥ-iva | śravasaḥ | bhikṣamāṇāḥ ||4.41.9||

IAST: upem asthur joṣṭāra iva vasvo raghvīr iva śravaso bhikṣamāṇāḥ
Griffith: They have come nigh to you as treasurelovers, like mares, fleet-footed, eager for the glory.
Devanāgarī: उपेमस्थुर्जोष्टार इव वस्वो रघ्वीरिव श्रवसो भिक्षमाणाः
pada pāṭha: imāḥ | indram | varuṇam | me | manīṣāḥ | agman | upa | draviṇam | icchamānāḥ || upa | īm | asthuḥ | joṣṭāraḥ-iva | vasvaḥ | raghvīḥ-iva | śravasaḥ | bhikṣamāṇāḥ ||4.41.9||

IAST: aśvyasya tmanā rathyasya puṣṭer nityasya rāyaḥ patayaḥ syāma
Griffith: May we ourselves be lords of during riches, of ample sustenance for car and hones.
Devanāgarī: अश्व्यस्य त्मना रथ्यस्य पुष्टेर्नित्यस्य रायः पतयः स्याम
pada pāṭha: aśvyasya | tmanā | rathyasya | puṣṭeḥ | nityasya | rāyaḥ | patayaḥ | syāma || tā | cakrāṇau | ūti-bhiḥ | navyasībhiḥ | asma-trā | rāyaḥ | ni-yutaḥ | sacantām ||4.41.10||

IAST: tā cakrāṇā ūtibhir navyasībhir asmatrā rāyo niyutaḥ sacantām
Griffith: So may the Twain who work with newest succours bring yoked teams hitherward to us and riches.
Devanāgarī: ता चक्राणा ऊतिभिर्नव्यसीभिरस्मत्रा रायो नियुतः सचन्ताम्
pada pāṭha: aśvyasya | tmanā | rathyasya | puṣṭeḥ | nityasya | rāyaḥ | patayaḥ | syāma || tā | cakrāṇau | ūti-bhiḥ | navyasībhiḥ | asma-trā | rāyaḥ | ni-yutaḥ | sacantām ||4.41.10||

IAST: ā no bṛhantā bṛhatībhir ūtī indra yātaṁ varuṇa vājasātau
Griffith: Come with your mighty succours, O ye Mighty; come, Indra-Varuna, to us in battle.
Devanāgarī: आ नो बृहन्ता बृहतीभिरूती इन्द्र यातं वरुण वाजसातौ
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | br̥hantā | br̥hatībhiḥ | ūtī | indra | yātam | varuṇa | vāja-sātau || yat | didyavaḥ | pr̥tanāsu | pra-krīḷān | tasya | vām | syāma | sanitāraḥ | ājeḥ ||4.41.11||

IAST: yad didyavaḥ pṛtanāsu prakrīḻān tasya vāṁ syāma sanitāra ājeḥ
Griffith: What time the flashing arrows play in combat, may we through you be winners in the contest.
Devanāgarī: यद्दिद्यवः पृतनासु प्रक्रीळान्तस्य वां स्याम सनितार आजेः
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | br̥hantā | br̥hatībhiḥ | ūtī | indra | yātam | varuṇa | vāja-sātau || yat | didyavaḥ | pr̥tanāsu | pra-krīḷān | tasya | vām | syāma | sanitāraḥ | ājeḥ ||4.41.11||

IAST: mama dvitā rāṣṭraṁ kṣatriyasya viśvāyor viśve amṛtā yathā naḥ
Griffith: I AM the royal Ruler, mine is empire, as mine who sway all life are all Immortals.
Devanāgarī: मम द्विता राष्ट्रं क्षत्रियस्य विश्वायोर्विश्वे अमृता यथा नः
pada pāṭha: mama | dvitā | rāṣṭram | kṣatriyasya | viśva-āyoḥ | viśve | amr̥tāḥ | yathā | naḥ || kratum | sacante | varuṇasya | devāḥ | rājāmi | kr̥ṣṭeḥ | upamasya | vavreḥ ||4.42.1||

IAST: kratuṁ sacante varuṇasya devā rājāmi kṛṣṭer upamasya vavreḥ
Griffith: Varuna's will the Gods obey and follow. I am the King of men's most lofty cover.
Devanāgarī: क्रतुं सचन्ते वरुणस्य देवा राजामि कृष्टेरुपमस्य वव्रेः
pada pāṭha: mama | dvitā | rāṣṭram | kṣatriyasya | viśva-āyoḥ | viśve | amr̥tāḥ | yathā | naḥ || kratum | sacante | varuṇasya | devāḥ | rājāmi | kr̥ṣṭeḥ | upamasya | vavreḥ ||4.42.1||

IAST: ahaṁ rājā varuṇo mahyaṁ tāny asuryāṇi prathamā dhārayanta
Griffith: I am King Varuna. To me were given these first existinghigh celestial powers.
Devanāgarī: अहं राजा वरुणो मह्यं तान्यसुर्याणि प्रथमा धारयन्त
pada pāṭha: aham | rājā | varuṇaḥ | mahyam | tāni | asuryāṇi | prathamā | dhārayanta || kratum | sacante | varuṇasya | devāḥ | rājāmi | kr̥ṣṭeḥ | upamasya | vavreḥ ||4.42.2||

IAST: kratuṁ sacante varuṇasya devā rājāmi kṛṣṭer upamasya vavreḥ
Griffith: Varuna's will the Gods obey and follow. I am the King of men's most lofty cover.
Devanāgarī: क्रतुं सचन्ते वरुणस्य देवा राजामि कृष्टेरुपमस्य वव्रेः
pada pāṭha: aham | rājā | varuṇaḥ | mahyam | tāni | asuryāṇi | prathamā | dhārayanta || kratum | sacante | varuṇasya | devāḥ | rājāmi | kr̥ṣṭeḥ | upamasya | vavreḥ ||4.42.2||

IAST: aham indro varuṇas te mahitvorvī gabhīre rajasī sumeke
Griffith: I Varuna am Indra: in their greatness, these the two wide deep fairly-fashioned regions,
Devanāgarī: अहमिन्द्रो वरुणस्ते महित्वोर्वी गभीरे रजसी सुमेके
pada pāṭha: aham | indraḥ | varuṇaḥ | te iti | mahi-tvā | urvī iti | gabhīre iti | rajasī iti | sumeke iti su-meke || tvaṣṭā-iva | viśvā | bhuvanāni | vidvān | sam | airayam | rodasī iti | dhārayam | ca ||4.42.3||

IAST: tvaṣṭeva viśvā bhuvanāni vidvān sam airayaṁ rodasī dhārayaṁ ca
Griffith: These the two world-halves have I, even as Tvastar knowing all beings, joined and held together.
Devanāgarī: त्वष्टेव विश्वा भुवनानि विद्वान्समैरयं रोदसी धारयं च
pada pāṭha: aham | indraḥ | varuṇaḥ | te iti | mahi-tvā | urvī iti | gabhīre iti | rajasī iti | sumeke iti su-meke || tvaṣṭā-iva | viśvā | bhuvanāni | vidvān | sam | airayam | rodasī iti | dhārayam | ca ||4.42.3||

IAST: aham apo apinvam ukṣamāṇā dhārayaṁ divaṁ sadana ṛtasya
Griffith: I made to flow the moisture-shedding waters, and set the heaven firm in the scat of Order.
Devanāgarī: अहमपो अपिन्वमुक्षमाणा धारयं दिवं सदन ऋतस्य
pada pāṭha: aham | apaḥ | apinvam | ukṣamāṇāḥ | dharayam | divam | sadane | r̥tasya || r̥tena | putraḥ | aditeḥ | r̥ta-vā | uta | tri-dhātu | prathayat | vi | bhūma ||4.42.4||

IAST: ṛtena putro aditer ṛtāvota tridhātu prathayad vi bhūma
Griffith: By Law the Son of Aditi, Law Observer, hath spread abroad the world in threefold measure.
Devanāgarī: ऋतेन पुत्रो अदितेरृतावोत त्रिधातु प्रथयद्वि भूम
pada pāṭha: aham | apaḥ | apinvam | ukṣamāṇāḥ | dharayam | divam | sadane | r̥tasya || r̥tena | putraḥ | aditeḥ | r̥ta-vā | uta | tri-dhātu | prathayat | vi | bhūma ||4.42.4||

IAST: māṁ naraḥ svaśvā vājayanto māṁ vṛtāḥ samaraṇe havante
Griffith: Heroes with noble horses, fain for battle, selected warriors, call on me in combat.
Devanāgarī: मां नरः स्वश्वा वाजयन्तो मां वृताः समरणे हवन्ते
pada pāṭha: mām | naraḥ | su-aśvāḥ | vājayantaḥ | mām | vr̥tāḥ | sam-araṇe | havante || kr̥ṇomi | ājim | magha-vā | aham | indraḥ | iyarmi | reṇum | abhibhūti-ojāḥ ||4.42.5||

IAST: kṛṇomy ājim maghavāham indra iyarmi reṇum abhibhūtyojāḥ
Griffith: I Indra Maghavan, excite the conflict; I stir the dust, Lord of surpassing vigour.
Devanāgarī: कृणोम्याजिं मघवाहमिन्द्र इयर्मि रेणुमभिभूत्योजाः
pada pāṭha: mām | naraḥ | su-aśvāḥ | vājayantaḥ | mām | vr̥tāḥ | sam-araṇe | havante || kr̥ṇomi | ājim | magha-vā | aham | indraḥ | iyarmi | reṇum | abhibhūti-ojāḥ ||4.42.5||

IAST: ahaṁ tā viśvā cakaraṁ nakir mā daivyaṁ saho varate apratītam
Griffith: All this I did. The Gods' own conquering power never impedeth me whom none opposeth.
Devanāgarī: अहं ता विश्वा चकरं नकिर्मा दैव्यं सहो वरते अप्रतीतम्
pada pāṭha: aham | tā | viśvā | cakaram | nakiḥ | mā | daivyam | sahaḥ | varate | aprati-itam || yat | mā | somāsaḥ | mamadan | yat | ukthā | ubhe iti | bhayete iti | rajasī iti | apāre iti ||4.42.6||

IAST: yan mā somāso mamadan yad ukthobhe bhayete rajasī apāre
Griffith: When lauds and Soma juice have made me joyful, both the unbounded regions are affrighted.
Devanāgarī: यन्मा सोमासो ममदन्यदुक्थोभे भयेते रजसी अपारे
pada pāṭha: aham | tā | viśvā | cakaram | nakiḥ | mā | daivyam | sahaḥ | varate | aprati-itam || yat | mā | somāsaḥ | mamadan | yat | ukthā | ubhe iti | bhayete iti | rajasī iti | apāre iti ||4.42.6||

IAST: viduṣ ṭe viśvā bhuvanāni tasya tā pra bravīṣi varuṇāya vedhaḥ
Griffith: All beings know these deeds of thine thou tellest this unto Varuna, thou great Disposer!
Devanāgarī: विदुष्टे विश्वा भुवनानि तस्य ता प्र ब्रवीषि वरुणाय वेधः
pada pāṭha: viduḥ | te | viśvā | bhuvanāni | tasya | tā | pra | bravīṣi | varuṇāya | vedhaḥ || tvam | vr̥trāṇi | śr̥ṇviṣe | jaghanvān | tvam | vr̥tān | ariṇāḥ | indra | sindhūn ||4.42.7||

IAST: tvaṁ vṛtrāṇi śṛṇviṣe jaghanvān tvaṁ vṛtām̐ ariṇā indra sindhūn
Griffith: Thou art renowned as having slain the Vrtras. Thou madest flow the floods that were obstructed.
Devanāgarī: त्वं वृत्राणि शृण्विषे जघन्वान्त्वं वृताँ अरिणा इन्द्र सिन्धून्
pada pāṭha: viduḥ | te | viśvā | bhuvanāni | tasya | tā | pra | bravīṣi | varuṇāya | vedhaḥ || tvam | vr̥trāṇi | śr̥ṇviṣe | jaghanvān | tvam | vr̥tān | ariṇāḥ | indra | sindhūn ||4.42.7||

IAST: asmākam atra pitaras ta āsan sapta ṛṣayo daurgahe badhyamāne
Griffith: Our fathers then were these, the Seven his, what time the son of Durgaha was captive.
Devanāgarī: अस्माकमत्र पितरस्त आसन्सप्त ऋषयो दौर्गहे बध्यमाने
pada pāṭha: asmākam | atra | pitaraḥ | te | āsan | sapta | r̥ṣayaḥ | dauḥ-gahe | badhyamāne || te | ā | ayajanta | trasadasyum | asyāḥ | indram | na | vr̥tra-turam | ardha-devam ||4.42.8||

IAST: ta āyajanta trasadasyum asyā indraṁ na vṛtraturam ardhadevam
Griffith: For her they gained by sacrifice Trasadasyu, a demi-god, like Indra, conquering foemen.
Devanāgarī: त आयजन्त त्रसदस्युमस्या इन्द्रं न वृत्रतुरमर्धदेवम्
pada pāṭha: asmākam | atra | pitaraḥ | te | āsan | sapta | r̥ṣayaḥ | dauḥ-gahe | badhyamāne || te | ā | ayajanta | trasadasyum | asyāḥ | indram | na | vr̥tra-turam | ardha-devam ||4.42.8||

IAST: purukutsānī hi vām adāśad dhavyebhir indrāvaruṇā namobhiḥ
Griffith: The spouse of Purukutsa gave oblations to you, O Indra-Varuna, with homage.
Devanāgarī: पुरुकुत्सानी हि वामदाशद्धव्येभिरिन्द्रावरुणा नमोभिः
pada pāṭha: puru-kutsānī | hi | vām | adāśat | havyebhiḥ | indrāvaruṇā | namaḥ-bhiḥ || atha | rājānam | trasadasyum | asyāḥ | vr̥tra-hanam | dadathuḥ | ardha-devam ||4.42.9||

IAST: athā rājānaṁ trasadasyum asyā vṛtrahaṇaṁ dadathur ardhadevam
Griffith: Then unto her ye gave King Trasadasyu, the demi-god, the slayer of the foeman.
Devanāgarī: अथा राजानं त्रसदस्युमस्या वृत्रहणं ददथुरर्धदेवम्
pada pāṭha: puru-kutsānī | hi | vām | adāśat | havyebhiḥ | indrāvaruṇā | namaḥ-bhiḥ || atha | rājānam | trasadasyum | asyāḥ | vr̥tra-hanam | dadathuḥ | ardha-devam ||4.42.9||

IAST: rāyā vayaṁ sasavāṁso madema havyena devā yavasena gāvaḥ
Griffith: May we, possessing much, delight in riches, Gods in oblations and the kine in pasture;
Devanāgarī: राया वयं ससवांसो मदेम हव्येन देवा यवसेन गावः
pada pāṭha: rāyā | vayam | sasa-vāṁsaḥ | madema | havyena | devāḥ | yavasena | gāvaḥ || tām | dhenum | indrāvaruṇā | yuvam | naḥ | viśvāhā | dhattam | anapa-sphurantīm ||4.42.10||

IAST: tāṁ dhenum indrāvaruṇā yuvaṁ no viśvāhā dhattam anapasphurantīm
Griffith: And that Milch-cow who ahrinks not from the milking, O Indra-Varuna, give to us daily.
Devanāgarī: तां धेनुमिन्द्रावरुणा युवं नो विश्वाहा धत्तमनपस्फुरन्तीम्
pada pāṭha: rāyā | vayam | sasa-vāṁsaḥ | madema | havyena | devāḥ | yavasena | gāvaḥ || tām | dhenum | indrāvaruṇā | yuvam | naḥ | viśvāhā | dhattam | anapa-sphurantīm ||4.42.10||

IAST: ka u śravat katamo yajñiyānāṁ vandāru devaḥ katamo juṣāte
Griffith: WHO will hear, who of those who merit worship, which of all Gods take pleasure in our homage?
Devanāgarī: क उ श्रवत्कतमो यज्ञियानां वन्दारु देवः कतमो जुषाते
pada pāṭha: kaḥ | ūm̐ iti | śravat | katamaḥ | yajñiyānām | vandāru | devaḥ | katamaḥ | juṣāte || kasya | imām | devīm | amr̥teṣu | preṣṭhām | hr̥di | śreṣāma | su-stutim | su-havyām ||4.43.1||

IAST: kasyemāṁ devīm amṛteṣu preṣṭhāṁ hṛdi śreṣāma suṣṭutiṁ suhavyām
Griffith: On whose heart shall we lay this laud celestial, rich with fair offerings, dearest to Immortals?
Devanāgarī: कस्येमां देवीममृतेषु प्रेष्ठां हृदि श्रेषाम सुष्टुतिं सुहव्याम्
pada pāṭha: kaḥ | ūm̐ iti | śravat | katamaḥ | yajñiyānām | vandāru | devaḥ | katamaḥ | juṣāte || kasya | imām | devīm | amr̥teṣu | preṣṭhām | hr̥di | śreṣāma | su-stutim | su-havyām ||4.43.1||

IAST: ko mṛḻāti katama āgamiṣṭho devānām u katamaḥ śambhaviṣṭhaḥ
Griffith: Who will be gracious? Who will come most uickly of all the Gods? Who will bring liss most largely?
Devanāgarī: को मृळाति कतम आगमिष्ठो देवानामु कतमः शम्भविष्ठः
pada pāṭha: kaḥ | mr̥ḷāti | katamaḥ | ā-gamiṣṭhaḥ | devānām | ūm̐ iti | katamaḥ | śam-bhaviṣṭhaḥ || ratham | kam | āhuḥ | dravat-aśvam | āśum | yam | sūryasya | duhitā | avr̥ṇīta ||4.43.2||

IAST: rathaṁ kam āhur dravadaśvam āśuṁ yaṁ sūryasya duhitāvṛṇīta
Griffith: What car do they call swift with rapid coursers? That which the Daughter of the Sun elected.
Devanāgarī: रथं कमाहुर्द्रवदश्वमाशुं यं सूर्यस्य दुहितावृणीत
pada pāṭha: kaḥ | mr̥ḷāti | katamaḥ | ā-gamiṣṭhaḥ | devānām | ūm̐ iti | katamaḥ | śam-bhaviṣṭhaḥ || ratham | kam | āhuḥ | dravat-aśvam | āśum | yam | sūryasya | duhitā | avr̥ṇīta ||4.43.2||

IAST: makṣū hi ṣmā gacchatha īvato dyūn indro na śaktim paritakmyāyām
Griffith: So many days do ye come swiftly hither, as Indra to give help in stress of battle.
Devanāgarī: मक्षू हि ष्मा गच्छथ ईवतो द्यूनिन्द्रो न शक्तिं परितक्म्यायाम्
pada pāṭha: makṣu | hi | sma | gacchathaḥ | īvataḥ | dyūn | indraḥ | na | śaktim | pari-takmyāyām || divaḥ | ā-jātā | divyā | su-parṇā | kayā | śacīnām | bhavathaḥ | śaciṣṭhā ||4.43.3||

IAST: diva ājātā divyā suparṇā kayā śacīnām bhavathaḥ śaciṣṭhā
Griffith: Descended from the sky, divine, strong-pinioned, by which of all your powers are ye most mighty?
Devanāgarī: दिव आजाता दिव्या सुपर्णा कया शचीनां भवथः शचिष्ठा
pada pāṭha: makṣu | hi | sma | gacchathaḥ | īvataḥ | dyūn | indraḥ | na | śaktim | pari-takmyāyām || divaḥ | ā-jātā | divyā | su-parṇā | kayā | śacīnām | bhavathaḥ | śaciṣṭhā ||4.43.3||

IAST: kā vām bhūd upamātiḥ kayā na āśvinā gamatho hūyamānā
Griffith: What is the prayer that we should bring you, Asvins, whereby ye come to us when invocated?
Devanāgarī: का वां भूदुपमातिः कया न आश्विना गमथो हूयमाना
pada pāṭha: kā | vām | bhūt | upa-mātiḥ | kayā | naḥ | ā | aśvinā | gamathaḥ | hūyamānā || kaḥ | vām | mahaḥ | cit | tyajasaḥ | abhīke | uruṣyatam | mādhvī iti | dasrā | naḥ | ūtī ||4.43.4||

IAST: ko vām mahaś cit tyajaso abhīka uruṣyatam mādhvī dasrā na ūtī
Griffith: Whether of you confronts e'en great betrayal? Lovers of sweetness, Dasras, help and save us.
Devanāgarī: को वां महश्चित्त्यजसो अभीक उरुष्यतं माध्वी दस्रा न ऊती
pada pāṭha: kā | vām | bhūt | upa-mātiḥ | kayā | naḥ | ā | aśvinā | gamathaḥ | hūyamānā || kaḥ | vām | mahaḥ | cit | tyajasaḥ | abhīke | uruṣyatam | mādhvī iti | dasrā | naḥ | ūtī ||4.43.4||

IAST: uru vāṁ rathaḥ pari nakṣati dyām ā yat samudrād abhi vartate vām
Griffith: In the wide space your chariot reacheth heaven, what time it turneth hither from the ocean.
Devanāgarī: उरु वां रथः परि नक्षति द्यामा यत्समुद्रादभि वर्तते वाम्
pada pāṭha: uru | vām | rathaḥ | pari | nakṣati | dyām | ā | yat | samudrāt | abhi | vartate | vām || madhvā | mādhvī iti | madhu | vām | pruṣāyan | yat | sīm | vām | pr̥kṣaḥ | bhurajanta | pakvāḥ ||4.43.5||

IAST: madhvā mādhvī madhu vām pruṣāyan yat sīṁ vām pṛkṣo bhurajanta pakvāḥ
Griffith: Sweets from your sweet shall drop, lovers of sweetness! These have they dressed for you as dainty viands.
Devanāgarī: मध्वा माध्वी मधु वां प्रुषायन्यत्सीं वां पृक्षो भुरजन्त पक्वाः
pada pāṭha: uru | vām | rathaḥ | pari | nakṣati | dyām | ā | yat | samudrāt | abhi | vartate | vām || madhvā | mādhvī iti | madhu | vām | pruṣāyan | yat | sīm | vām | pr̥kṣaḥ | bhurajanta | pakvāḥ ||4.43.5||

IAST: sindhur ha vāṁ rasayā siñcad aśvān ghṛṇā vayo 'ruṣāsaḥ pari gman
Griffith: Let Sindhu with his wave bedew your horses: in fiery glow have the red birds come hither.
Devanāgarī: सिन्धुर्ह वां रसया सिञ्चदश्वान्घृणा वयोऽरुषासः परि ग्मन्
pada pāṭha: sindhuḥ | ha | vām | rasayā | siñcat | aśvān | ghr̥ṇā | vayaḥ | aruṣāsaḥ | pari | gman || tat | ūm̐ iti | su | vām | ajiram | ceti | yānam | yena | patī iti | bhavathaḥ | sūryāyāḥ ||4.43.6||

IAST: tad ū ṣu vām ajiraṁ ceti yānaṁ yena patī bhavathaḥ sūryāyāḥ
Griffith: Observed of all was that your rapid going, whereby ye were the Lords of Siirya's Daughter.
Devanāgarī: तदू षु वामजिरं चेति यानं येन पती भवथः सूर्यायाः
pada pāṭha: sindhuḥ | ha | vām | rasayā | siñcat | aśvān | ghr̥ṇā | vayaḥ | aruṣāsaḥ | pari | gman || tat | ūm̐ iti | su | vām | ajiram | ceti | yānam | yena | patī iti | bhavathaḥ | sūryāyāḥ ||4.43.6||

IAST: iheha yad vāṁ samanā papṛkṣe seyam asme sumatir vājaratnā
Griffith: Whene'er I gratified you here together, your grace was given us, O ye rich in booty.
Devanāgarī: इहेह यद्वां समना पपृक्षे सेयमस्मे सुमतिर्वाजरत्ना
pada pāṭha: iha-iha | yat | vām | samanā | papr̥kṣe | sā | iyam | asme iti | su-matiḥ | vāja-ratnā || uruṣyatam | jaritāram | yuvam | ha | śritaḥ | kāmaḥ | nāsatyā | yuvadrik ||4.43.7||

IAST: uruṣyataṁ jaritāraṁ yuvaṁ ha śritaḥ kāmo nāsatyā yuvadrik
Griffith: Protect, ye Twain, the singer of your praises: to you, Nasatyas, is my wish directed.
Devanāgarī: उरुष्यतं जरितारं युवं ह श्रितः कामो नासत्या युवद्रिक्
pada pāṭha: iha-iha | yat | vām | samanā | papr̥kṣe | sā | iyam | asme iti | su-matiḥ | vāja-ratnā || uruṣyatam | jaritāram | yuvam | ha | śritaḥ | kāmaḥ | nāsatyā | yuvadrik ||4.43.7||

IAST: taṁ vāṁ rathaṁ vayam adyā huvema pṛthujrayam aśvinā saṁgatiṁ goḥ
Griffith: WE will invoke this day your car, farspreading, O Asvins, even the gathering, of the sunlight,-
Devanāgarī: तं वां रथं वयमद्या हुवेम पृथुज्रयमश्विना संगतिं गोः
pada pāṭha: tam | vām | ratham | vayam | adya | huvema | pr̥thu-jrayam | aśvinā | sam-gatim | goḥ || yaḥ | sūryām | vahati | vandhura-yuḥ | girvāhasam | puru-tamam | vasu-yum ||4.44.1||

IAST: yaḥ sūryāṁ vahati vandhurāyur girvāhasam purutamaṁ vasūyum
Griffith: Car praised in hymns, most ample, rich in treasure, fitted with seats, the car that beareth Surya.
Devanāgarī: यः सूर्यां वहति वन्धुरायुर्गिर्वाहसं पुरुतमं वसूयुम्
pada pāṭha: tam | vām | ratham | vayam | adya | huvema | pr̥thu-jrayam | aśvinā | sam-gatim | goḥ || yaḥ | sūryām | vahati | vandhura-yuḥ | girvāhasam | puru-tamam | vasu-yum ||4.44.1||

IAST: yuvaṁ śriyam aśvinā devatā tāṁ divo napātā vanathaḥ śacībhiḥ
Griffith: Asvins, ye gained that glory by your Godhead, ye Sons of Heaven, by your own might and power.
Devanāgarī: युवं श्रियमश्विना देवता तां दिवो नपाता वनथः शचीभिः
pada pāṭha: yuvam | śriyam | aśvinā | devatā | tām | divaḥ | napātā | vanathaḥ | śacībhiḥ || yuvoḥ | vapuḥ | abhi | pr̥kṣaḥ | sacante | vahanti | yat | kakuhāsaḥ | rathe | vām ||4.44.2||

IAST: yuvor vapur abhi pṛkṣaḥ sacante vahanti yat kakuhāso rathe vām
Griffith: Food followeth close upon your bright appearing when stately horses in your chariot draw you.
Devanāgarī: युवोर्वपुरभि पृक्षः सचन्ते वहन्ति यत्ककुहासो रथे वाम्
pada pāṭha: yuvam | śriyam | aśvinā | devatā | tām | divaḥ | napātā | vanathaḥ | śacībhiḥ || yuvoḥ | vapuḥ | abhi | pr̥kṣaḥ | sacante | vahanti | yat | kakuhāsaḥ | rathe | vām ||4.44.2||

IAST: ko vām adyā karate rātahavya ūtaye vā sutapeyāya vārkaiḥ
Griffith: Who bringeth you to-day for help with offered oblation, or with hymns to drink the juices?
Devanāgarī: को वामद्या करते रातहव्य ऊतये वा सुतपेयाय वार्कैः
pada pāṭha: kaḥ | vām | adya | karate | rāta-havyaḥ | ūtaye | vā | suta-peyāya | vā | arkaiḥ || r̥tasya | vā | vanuṣe | pūrvyāya | namaḥ | yemānaḥ | aśvinā | ā | vavartat ||4.44.3||

IAST: ṛtasya vā vanuṣe pūrvyāya namo yemāno aśvinā vavartat
Griffith: Who, for the sacrifice's ancient lover, turneth you hither, Asvins, offering homage?
Devanāgarī: ऋतस्य वा वनुषे पूर्व्याय नमो येमानो अश्विना ववर्तत्
pada pāṭha: kaḥ | vām | adya | karate | rāta-havyaḥ | ūtaye | vā | suta-peyāya | vā | arkaiḥ || r̥tasya | vā | vanuṣe | pūrvyāya | namaḥ | yemānaḥ | aśvinā | ā | vavartat ||4.44.3||

IAST: hiraṇyayena purubhū rathenemaṁ yajñaṁ nāsatyopa yātam
Griffith: Borne on your golden car, ye omnipresent! come to this sacrifice of ours, Nasatyas.
Devanāgarī: हिरण्ययेन पुरुभू रथेनेमं यज्ञं नासत्योप यातम्
pada pāṭha: hiraṇyayena | purubhū iti puru-bhū | rathena | imam | yajñam | nāsatyā | upa | yātam || pibāthaḥ | it | madhunaḥ | somyasya | dadhathaḥ | ratnam | vidhate | janāya ||4.44.4||

IAST: pibātha in madhunaḥ somyasya dadhatho ratnaṁ vidhate janāya
Griffith: Drink of the pleasant liquor of the Soma give riches to the people who adore you.
Devanāgarī: पिबाथ इन्मधुनः सोम्यस्य दधथो रत्नं विधते जनाय
pada pāṭha: hiraṇyayena | purubhū iti puru-bhū | rathena | imam | yajñam | nāsatyā | upa | yātam || pibāthaḥ | it | madhunaḥ | somyasya | dadhathaḥ | ratnam | vidhate | janāya ||4.44.4||

IAST: ā no yātaṁ divo acchā pṛthivyā hiraṇyayena suvṛtā rathena
Griffith: Come hitherward to us from earth, from heaven, borne on your golden chariot rolling lightly.
Devanāgarī: आ नो यातं दिवो अच्छा पृथिव्या हिरण्ययेन सुवृता रथेन
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | yātam | divaḥ | accha | pr̥thivyāḥ | hiraṇyayena | su-vr̥tā | rathena || mā | vām | anye | ni | yaman | deva-yantaḥ | sam | yat | dade | nābhiḥ | pūrvyā | vām ||4.44.5||

IAST: mā vām anye ni yaman devayantaḥ saṁ yad dade nābhiḥ pūrvyā vām
Griffith: Suffer not other worshippers to stay you here are ye bound by earlier bonds of friendship.
Devanāgarī: मा वामन्ये नि यमन्देवयन्तः सं यद्ददे नाभिः पूर्व्या वाम्
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | yātam | divaḥ | accha | pr̥thivyāḥ | hiraṇyayena | su-vr̥tā | rathena || mā | vām | anye | ni | yaman | deva-yantaḥ | sam | yat | dade | nābhiḥ | pūrvyā | vām ||4.44.5||

IAST: nū no rayim puruvīram bṛhantaṁ dasrā mimāthām ubhayeṣv asme
Griffith: Now for us both, mete out, O WonderWorkers, riches exceeding great with store of heroes,
Devanāgarī: नू नो रयिं पुरुवीरं बृहन्तं दस्रा मिमाथामुभयेष्वस्मे
pada pāṭha: nu | naḥ | rayim | puru-vīram | br̥hantam | dasrā | mimāthām | ubhayeṣu | asme iti || naraḥ | yat | vām | aśvinā | stomam | āvan | sadha-stutim | āja-mīḷhāsaḥ | agman ||4.44.6||

IAST: naro yad vām aśvinā stomam āvan sadhastutim ājamīḻhāso agman
Griffith: Because the men have sent you praise, O Asvins, and Ajamilhas come to the laudation.
Devanāgarī: नरो यद्वामश्विना स्तोममावन्सधस्तुतिमाजमीळ्हासो अग्मन्
pada pāṭha: nu | naḥ | rayim | puru-vīram | br̥hantam | dasrā | mimāthām | ubhayeṣu | asme iti || naraḥ | yat | vām | aśvinā | stomam | āvan | sadha-stutim | āja-mīḷhāsaḥ | agman ||4.44.6||

IAST: iheha yad vāṁ samanā papṛkṣe seyam asme sumatir vājaratnā
Griffith: Whene'er I gratified you here together, your grace was given us, O ye rich in booty.
Devanāgarī: इहेह यद्वां समना पपृक्षे सेयमस्मे सुमतिर्वाजरत्ना
pada pāṭha: iha-iha | yat | vām | samanā | papr̥kṣe | sā | iyam | asme iti | su-matiḥ | vāja-ratnā || uruṣyatam | jaritāram | yuvam | ha | śritaḥ | kāmaḥ | nāsatyā | yuvadrik ||4.44.7||

IAST: uruṣyataṁ jaritāraṁ yuvaṁ ha śritaḥ kāmo nāsatyā yuvadrik
Griffith: Protect, ye Twain, the singer of your praises: to you, Nasatyas, is my wish directed.
Devanāgarī: उरुष्यतं जरितारं युवं ह श्रितः कामो नासत्या युवद्रिक्
pada pāṭha: iha-iha | yat | vām | samanā | papr̥kṣe | sā | iyam | asme iti | su-matiḥ | vāja-ratnā || uruṣyatam | jaritāram | yuvam | ha | śritaḥ | kāmaḥ | nāsatyā | yuvadrik ||4.44.7||

IAST: eṣa sya bhānur ud iyarti yujyate rathaḥ parijmā divo asya sānavi
Griffith: YONDER goes up that light: your chariot is yoked that travels round upon the summit of this heaven.
Devanāgarī: एष स्य भानुरुदियर्ति युज्यते रथः परिज्मा दिवो अस्य सानवि
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | syaḥ | bhānuḥ | ut | iyarti | yujyate | rathaḥ | pari-jmā | divaḥ | asya | sānavi || pr̥kṣāsaḥ | asmin | mithunāḥ | adhi | trayaḥ | dr̥tiḥ | turīyaḥ | madhunaḥ | vi | rapśate ||4.45.1||

IAST: pṛkṣāso asmin mithunā adhi trayo dṛtis turīyo madhuno vi rapśate
Griffith: Within this car are stored three kindred shares of food, and a skin filled with meath is rustling as the fourth.
Devanāgarī: पृक्षासो अस्मिन्मिथुना अधि त्रयो दृतिस्तुरीयो मधुनो वि रप्शते
pada pāṭha: eṣaḥ | syaḥ | bhānuḥ | ut | iyarti | yujyate | rathaḥ | pari-jmā | divaḥ | asya | sānavi || pr̥kṣāsaḥ | asmin | mithunāḥ | adhi | trayaḥ | dr̥tiḥ | turīyaḥ | madhunaḥ | vi | rapśate ||4.45.1||

IAST: ud vām pṛkṣāso madhumanta īrate rathā aśvāsa uṣaso vyuṣṭiṣu
Griffith: Forth come your viands rich with store of pleasant meath, and cars and horses at the flushing of the dawn,
Devanāgarī: उद्वां पृक्षासो मधुमन्त ईरते रथा अश्वास उषसो व्युष्टिषु
pada pāṭha: ut | vām | pr̥kṣāsaḥ | madhu-mantaḥ | īrate | rathāḥ | aśvāsaḥ | uṣasaḥ | vi-uṣṭiṣu || apa-ūrṇuvantaḥ | tamaḥ | ā | pari-vr̥tam | svaḥ | na | śukram | tanvantaḥ | ā | rajaḥ ||4.45.2||

IAST: aporṇuvantas tama ā parīvṛtaṁ svar ṇa śukraṁ tanvanta ā rajaḥ
Griffith: Stripping the covering from the surrounded gloom, and spreading through mid-air bright radiance like the Sun.
Devanāgarī: अपोर्णुवन्तस्तम आ परीवृतं स्वर्ण शुक्रं तन्वन्त आ रजः
pada pāṭha: ut | vām | pr̥kṣāsaḥ | madhu-mantaḥ | īrate | rathāḥ | aśvāsaḥ | uṣasaḥ | vi-uṣṭiṣu || apa-ūrṇuvantaḥ | tamaḥ | ā | pari-vr̥tam | svaḥ | na | śukram | tanvantaḥ | ā | rajaḥ ||4.45.2||

IAST: madhvaḥ pibatam madhupebhir āsabhir uta priyam madhune yuñjāthāṁ ratham
Griffith: Drink of the meath with lips accustomed to the draught; harness for the meath's sake the chariot that ye love.
Devanāgarī: मध्वः पिबतं मधुपेभिरासभिरुत प्रियं मधुने युञ्जाथां रथम्
pada pāṭha: madhvaḥ | pibatam | madhu-pebhiḥ | āsa-bhiḥ | uta | priyam | madhune | yuñjāthām | ratham || ā | vartanim | madhunā | jinvathaḥ | pathaḥ | dr̥tim | vahethe iti | madhu-mantam | aśvinā ||4.45.3||

IAST: ā vartanim madhunā jinvathas patho dṛtiṁ vahethe madhumantam aśvinā
Griffith: Refresh the way ye go, refresh the paths with meath: hither, O Asvins, bring the skin that holds the meath.
Devanāgarī: आ वर्तनिं मधुना जिन्वथस्पथो दृतिं वहेथे मधुमन्तमश्विना
pada pāṭha: madhvaḥ | pibatam | madhu-pebhiḥ | āsa-bhiḥ | uta | priyam | madhune | yuñjāthām | ratham || ā | vartanim | madhunā | jinvathaḥ | pathaḥ | dr̥tim | vahethe iti | madhu-mantam | aśvinā ||4.45.3||

IAST: haṁsāso ye vām madhumanto asridho hiraṇyaparṇā uhuva uṣarbudhaḥ
Griffith: The swans ye have are friendly, rich in store of mcath, gold-pinioned, strong to draw, awake at early morn,
Devanāgarī: हंसासो ये वां मधुमन्तो अस्रिधो हिरण्यपर्णा उहुव उषर्बुधः
pada pāṭha: haṁsāsaḥ | ye | vām | madhu-mantaḥ | asridhaḥ | hiraṇya-parṇāḥ | uhuvaḥ | uṣaḥ-budhaḥ || uda-prutaḥ | mandinaḥ | mandi-nispr̥śaḥ | madhvaḥ | na | makṣaḥ | savanāni | gacchathaḥ ||4.45.4||

IAST: udapruto mandino mandinispṛśo madhvo na makṣaḥ savanāni gacchathaḥ
Griffith: Swimming the flood, exultant, fain for draughts that cheer: ye come like flies to our libations of-the meath.
Devanāgarī: उदप्रुतो मन्दिनो मन्दिनिस्पृशो मध्वो न मक्षः सवनानि गच्छथः
pada pāṭha: haṁsāsaḥ | ye | vām | madhu-mantaḥ | asridhaḥ | hiraṇya-parṇāḥ | uhuvaḥ | uṣaḥ-budhaḥ || uda-prutaḥ | mandinaḥ | mandi-nispr̥śaḥ | madhvaḥ | na | makṣaḥ | savanāni | gacchathaḥ ||4.45.4||

IAST: svadhvarāso madhumanto agnaya usrā jarante prati vastor aśvinā
Griffith: Well knowing solemn rites and rich in meath, the fires sing to the morning Asvins at the break of day,
Devanāgarī: स्वध्वरासो मधुमन्तो अग्नय उस्रा जरन्ते प्रति वस्तोरश्विना
pada pāṭha: su-adhcarāsaḥ | madhu-mantaḥ | agnayaḥ | usrā | jarante | prati | vastoḥ | aśvinā || yat | nikta-hastaḥ | taraṇiḥ | vi-cakṣaṇaḥ | somam | susāva | madhu-mantam | adri-bhiḥ ||4.45.5||

IAST: yan niktahastas taraṇir vicakṣaṇaḥ somaṁ suṣāva madhumantam adribhiḥ
Griffith: When with pure hands the prudent energetic priest hath with the stones pressed out the Soma rich in meath.
Devanāgarī: यन्निक्तहस्तस्तरणिर्विचक्षणः सोमं सुषाव मधुमन्तमद्रिभिः
pada pāṭha: su-adhcarāsaḥ | madhu-mantaḥ | agnayaḥ | usrā | jarante | prati | vastoḥ | aśvinā || yat | nikta-hastaḥ | taraṇiḥ | vi-cakṣaṇaḥ | somam | susāva | madhu-mantam | adri-bhiḥ ||4.45.5||

IAST: ākenipāso ahabhir davidhvataḥ svar ṇa śukraṁ tanvanta ā rajaḥ
Griffith: The rays advancing nigh, chasing with day the gloom, spread through the firmament bright radiance like the Sun;
Devanāgarī: आकेनिपासो अहभिर्दविध्वतः स्वर्ण शुक्रं तन्वन्त आ रजः
pada pāṭha: āke-nipāsaḥ | aha-bhiḥ | davidhvataḥ | svaḥ | na | śukram | tanvantaḥ | ā | rajaḥ || sūraḥ | cit | aśvān | yuyujānaḥ | īyate | viśvān | anu | svadhayā | cetathaḥ | pathaḥ ||4.45.6||

IAST: sūraś cid aśvān yuyujāna īyate viśvām̐ anu svadhayā cetathas pathaḥ
Griffith: And the Sun harnessing his horses goeth forth: ye through your Godlike nature let his paths be known.
Devanāgarī: सूरश्चिदश्वान्युयुजान ईयते विश्वाँ अनु स्वधया चेतथस्पथः
pada pāṭha: āke-nipāsaḥ | aha-bhiḥ | davidhvataḥ | svaḥ | na | śukram | tanvantaḥ | ā | rajaḥ || sūraḥ | cit | aśvān | yuyujānaḥ | īyate | viśvān | anu | svadhayā | cetathaḥ | pathaḥ ||4.45.6||

IAST: pra vām avocam aśvinā dhiyaṁdhā rathaḥ svaśvo ajaro yo asti
Griffith: Devout in thought I have declared, O Asvins, your chariot with good steeds, which lasts for ever,
Devanāgarī: प्र वामवोचमश्विना धियंधा रथः स्वश्वो अजरो यो अस्ति
pada pāṭha: pra | vām | avocam | aśvinā | dhiyam-dhāḥ | rathaḥ | su-aśvaḥ | ajaraḥ | yaḥ | asti || yena | sadyaḥ | pari | rajāṁsi | yāthaḥ | haviṣmantam | taraṇim | bhojam | accha ||4.45.7||

IAST: yena sadyaḥ pari rajāṁsi yātho haviṣmantaṁ taraṇim bhojam accha
Griffith: Wherewith ye travel swiftly through the regions to the prompt worshipper who brings oblation.
Devanāgarī: येन सद्यः परि रजांसि याथो हविष्मन्तं तरणिं भोजमच्छ
pada pāṭha: pra | vām | avocam | aśvinā | dhiyam-dhāḥ | rathaḥ | su-aśvaḥ | ajaraḥ | yaḥ | asti || yena | sadyaḥ | pari | rajāṁsi | yāthaḥ | haviṣmantam | taraṇim | bhojam | accha ||4.45.7||

IAST: agram pibā madhūnāṁ sutaṁ vāyo diviṣṭiṣu
Griffith: DRINK the best draught of Soma-juice, O Vayu, at our holy rites:
Devanāgarī: अग्रं पिबा मधूनां सुतं वायो दिविष्टिषु
pada pāṭha: agram | piba | madhūnām | sutam | vayo iti | diviṣṭiṣu || tvam | hi | pūrva-pāḥ | asi ||4.46.1||

IAST: tvaṁ hi pūrvapā asi
Griffith: For thou art he who drinketh first.
Devanāgarī: त्वं हि पूर्वपा असि
pada pāṭha: agram | piba | madhūnām | sutam | vayo iti | diviṣṭiṣu || tvam | hi | pūrva-pāḥ | asi ||4.46.1||

IAST: śatenā no abhiṣṭibhir niyutvām̐ indrasārathiḥ
Griffith: Come, team-drawn, with thy hundred helps, with Indra, seated in the car,
Devanāgarī: शतेना नो अभिष्टिभिर्नियुत्वाँ इन्द्रसारथिः
pada pāṭha: śatena | naḥ | abhiṣṭi-bhiḥ | niyutvān | indra-sārathiḥ || vāyo iti | sutasya | tr̥mpatam ||4.46.2||

IAST: vāyo sutasya tṛmpatam
Griffith: Vaya, and drink your fill of juice.
Devanāgarī: वायो सुतस्य तृम्पतम्
pada pāṭha: śatena | naḥ | abhiṣṭi-bhiḥ | niyutvān | indra-sārathiḥ || vāyo iti | sutasya | tr̥mpatam ||4.46.2||

IAST: ā vāṁ sahasraṁ haraya indravāyū abhi prayaḥ
Griffith: May steeds a thousand bring you both, Indra. and Vayu, hitherward
Devanāgarī: आ वां सहस्रं हरय इन्द्रवायू अभि प्रयः
pada pāṭha: ā | vām | sahasram | harayaḥ | indravāyū iti | abhi | prayaḥ || vahantu | soma-pītaye ||4.46.3||

IAST: vahantu somapītaye
Griffith: To drink the Soma, to the feagt.
Devanāgarī: वहन्तु सोमपीतये
pada pāṭha: ā | vām | sahasram | harayaḥ | indravāyū iti | abhi | prayaḥ || vahantu | soma-pītaye ||4.46.3||

IAST: rathaṁ hiraṇyavandhuram indravāyū svadhvaram
Griffith: For ye, O Indra-Vayu, mount the goldenseated car that aids
Devanāgarī: रथं हिरण्यवन्धुरमिन्द्रवायू स्वध्वरम्
pada pāṭha: ratham | hiraṇya-vandhuram | indravāyū iti | su-adhvaram || ā | hi | sthāthaḥ | divi-spr̥śam ||4.46.4||

IAST: ā hi sthātho divispṛśam
Griffith: The sacrifice, that reaches heaven.
Devanāgarī: आ हि स्थाथो दिविस्पृशम्
pada pāṭha: ratham | hiraṇya-vandhuram | indravāyū iti | su-adhvaram || ā | hi | sthāthaḥ | divi-spr̥śam ||4.46.4||

IAST: rathena pṛthupājasā dāśvāṁsam upa gacchatam
Griffith: On far-refulgent chariot come unto the man who offers gifts:
Devanāgarī: रथेन पृथुपाजसा दाश्वांसमुप गच्छतम्
pada pāṭha: rathena | pr̥thu-pājasā | dāśvāṁsam | upa | gacchatam || indravāyū iti | iha | ā | gatam ||4.46.5||

IAST: indravāyū ihā gatam
Griffith: Come, Indra-Vayu, hitherward.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रवायू इहा गतम्
pada pāṭha: rathena | pr̥thu-pājasā | dāśvāṁsam | upa | gacchatam || indravāyū iti | iha | ā | gatam ||4.46.5||

IAST: indravāyū ayaṁ sutas taṁ devebhiḥ sajoṣasā
Griffith: Here, Indra-Vayu, is the juice: drink it, accordant with the Gods,
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रवायू अयं सुतस्तं देवेभिः सजोषसा
pada pāṭha: indravāyū iti | ayam | sutaḥ | tam | devebhiḥ | sa-joṣasā || pibatam | dāśuṣaḥ | gr̥he ||4.46.6||

IAST: pibataṁ dāśuṣo gṛhe
Griffith: Within the giver's dwelling-place.
Devanāgarī: पिबतं दाशुषो गृहे
pada pāṭha: indravāyū iti | ayam | sutaḥ | tam | devebhiḥ | sa-joṣasā || pibatam | dāśuṣaḥ | gr̥he ||4.46.6||

IAST: iha prayāṇam astu vām indravāyū vimocanam
Griffith: Hither, O Indra-Vayu, be your journey here unyoke your steeds,
Devanāgarī: इह प्रयाणमस्तु वामिन्द्रवायू विमोचनम्
pada pāṭha: iha | pra-yānam | astu | vām | indravāyū iti | vi-mocanam || iha | vām | soma-pītaye ||4.46.7||

IAST: iha vāṁ somapītaye
Griffith: Here for your draught of Soma juice.
Devanāgarī: इह वां सोमपीतये
pada pāṭha: iha | pra-yānam | astu | vām | indravāyū iti | vi-mocanam || iha | vām | soma-pītaye ||4.46.7||

IAST: vāyo śukro ayāmi te madhvo agraṁ diviṣṭiṣu
Griffith: Vayu, the bright is offered thee, best of the meath at holy rites.
Devanāgarī: वायो शुक्रो अयामि ते मध्वो अग्रं दिविष्टिषु
pada pāṭha: vāyo iti | śukraḥ | ayāmi | te | madhvaḥ | agram | diviṣṭiṣu || ā | yāhi | soma-pītaye | spārhaḥ | deva | niyutvatā ||4.47.1||

IAST: ā yāhi somapītaye spārho deva niyutvatā
Griffith: Come thou to drink the Soma juice, God, longed-for, on thy team-drawn car.
Devanāgarī: आ याहि सोमपीतये स्पार्हो देव नियुत्वता
pada pāṭha: vāyo iti | śukraḥ | ayāmi | te | madhvaḥ | agram | diviṣṭiṣu || ā | yāhi | soma-pītaye | spārhaḥ | deva | niyutvatā ||4.47.1||

IAST: indraś ca vāyav eṣāṁ somānām pītim arhathaḥ
Griffith: O Vayu, thou and Indra are meet drinkers of these Soma-draughts,
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रश्च वायवेषां सोमानां पीतिमर्हथः
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | ca | vāyo iti | eṣām | somānām | pītim | arhathaḥ || yuvām | hi | yanti | indavaḥ | nimnam | āpaḥ | na | sadhryak ||4.47.2||

IAST: yuvāṁ hi yantīndavo nimnam āpo na sadhryak
Griffith: For unto you the drops proceed as waters gather to the vale.
Devanāgarī: युवां हि यन्तीन्दवो निम्नमापो न सध्र्यक्
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | ca | vāyo iti | eṣām | somānām | pītim | arhathaḥ || yuvām | hi | yanti | indavaḥ | nimnam | āpaḥ | na | sadhryak ||4.47.2||

IAST: vāyav indraś ca śuṣmiṇā sarathaṁ śavasas patī
Griffith: O Indra-Vayu, mighty Twain, speeding together, Lords of Strength,
Devanāgarī: वायविन्द्रश्च शुष्मिणा सरथं शवसस्पती
pada pāṭha: vāyo iti | indraḥ | ca | śuṣmiṇā | sa-ratham | śavasaḥ | patī iti || niyutvantā | naḥ | ūtaye | ā | yātam | soma-pītaye ||4.47.3||

IAST: niyutvantā na ūtaya ā yātaṁ somapītaye
Griffith: Come to our succour with your team, that ye may drink the Soma juice.
Devanāgarī: नियुत्वन्ता न ऊतय आ यातं सोमपीतये
pada pāṭha: vāyo iti | indraḥ | ca | śuṣmiṇā | sa-ratham | śavasaḥ | patī iti || niyutvantā | naḥ | ūtaye | ā | yātam | soma-pītaye ||4.47.3||

IAST: yā vāṁ santi puruspṛho niyuto dāśuṣe narā
Griffith: The longed-for teams which ye possess, O Heroes, for the worshipper,
Devanāgarī: या वां सन्ति पुरुस्पृहो नियुतो दाशुषे नरा
pada pāṭha: yāḥ | vām | santi | puru-spr̥haḥ | ni-yutaḥ | dāśuṣe | narā || asme iti | tāḥ | yajña-vāhasā | indravāyū iti | ni | yacchatam ||4.47.4||

IAST: asme tā yajñavāhasendravāyū ni yacchatam
Griffith: Turn to us, Indra-Vayu, ye to whom the sacrifice is paid.
Devanāgarī: अस्मे ता यज्ञवाहसेन्द्रवायू नि यच्छतम्
pada pāṭha: yāḥ | vām | santi | puru-spr̥haḥ | ni-yutaḥ | dāśuṣe | narā || asme iti | tāḥ | yajña-vāhasā | indravāyū iti | ni | yacchatam ||4.47.4||

IAST: vihi hotrā avītā vipo na rāyo aryaḥ
Griffith: TASTE offerings never tasted yet, as bards enjoy the foeman's wealth.
Devanāgarī: विहि होत्रा अवीता विपो न रायो अर्यः
pada pāṭha: vihi | hotrā | avītāḥ | vipaḥ | na | rāyaḥ | aryaḥ || vāyo iti | ā | candreṇa | rathena | yāhi | sutasya | pītaye ||4.48.1||

IAST: vāyav ā candreṇa rathena yāhi sutasya pītaye
Griffith: O Vayu, on refulgent car come to the drinking of the juice.
Devanāgarī: वायवा चन्द्रेण रथेन याहि सुतस्य पीतये
pada pāṭha: vihi | hotrā | avītāḥ | vipaḥ | na | rāyaḥ | aryaḥ || vāyo iti | ā | candreṇa | rathena | yāhi | sutasya | pītaye ||4.48.1||

IAST: niryuvāṇo aśastīr niyutvām̐ indrasārathiḥ
Griffith: Removing curses, drawn by teams, with ndra, seated by thy side,
Devanāgarī: निर्युवाणो अशस्तीर्नियुत्वाँ इन्द्रसारथिः
pada pāṭha: niḥ-yuvānaḥ | aśastīḥ | niyutvān | indra-sārathiḥ || vāyo iti | ā | candreṇa | rathena | yāhi | sutasya | pītaye ||4.48.2||

IAST: vāyav ā candreṇa rathena yāhi sutasya pītaye
Griffith: O Vayu, on refulgent car come to the drinking of the juice.
Devanāgarī: वायवा चन्द्रेण रथेन याहि सुतस्य पीतये
pada pāṭha: niḥ-yuvānaḥ | aśastīḥ | niyutvān | indra-sārathiḥ || vāyo iti | ā | candreṇa | rathena | yāhi | sutasya | pītaye ||4.48.2||

IAST: anu kṛṣṇe vasudhitī yemāte viśvapeśasā
Griffith: The two dark treasuries of wealth that wear all beauties wait on thee.
Devanāgarī: अनु कृष्णे वसुधिती येमाते विश्वपेशसा
pada pāṭha: anu | kr̥ṣṇe iti | vasudhitī iti vasu-dhitī | yemāte iti | viśva-peśasā || vāyo iti | ā | candreṇa | rathena | yāhi | sutasya | pītaye ||4.48.3||

IAST: vāyav ā candreṇa rathena yāhi sutasya pītaye
Griffith: O Vayu, on refulgent car come to the drinking of the juice.
Devanāgarī: वायवा चन्द्रेण रथेन याहि सुतस्य पीतये
pada pāṭha: anu | kr̥ṣṇe iti | vasudhitī iti vasu-dhitī | yemāte iti | viśva-peśasā || vāyo iti | ā | candreṇa | rathena | yāhi | sutasya | pītaye ||4.48.3||

IAST: vahantu tvā manoyujo yuktāso navatir nava
Griffith: May nine-and-ninety harnessed steeds who yoke them at thy will bring thee.
Devanāgarī: वहन्तु त्वा मनोयुजो युक्तासो नवतिर्नव
pada pāṭha: vahantu | tvā | manaḥ-yujaḥ | yuktāsaḥ | navatiḥ | nava || vāyo iti | ā | candreṇa | rathena | yāhi | sutasya | pītaye ||4.48.4||

IAST: vāyav ā candreṇa rathena yāhi sutasya pītaye
Griffith: O Vayu, on refulgent car come to the drinking of the juice.
Devanāgarī: वायवा चन्द्रेण रथेन याहि सुतस्य पीतये
pada pāṭha: vahantu | tvā | manaḥ-yujaḥ | yuktāsaḥ | navatiḥ | nava || vāyo iti | ā | candreṇa | rathena | yāhi | sutasya | pītaye ||4.48.4||

IAST: vāyo śataṁ harīṇāṁ yuvasva poṣyāṇām
Griffith: Harness, O Vayu, to thy car a hundred well-fed tawny steeds,
Devanāgarī: वायो शतं हरीणां युवस्व पोष्याणाम्
pada pāṭha: vāyo iti | śatam | harīṇām | yuvasva | poṣyāṇām || uta | vā | te | sahasriṇaḥ | rathaḥ | ā | yātu | pājasā ||4.48.5||

IAST: uta vā te sahasriṇo ratha ā yātu pājasā
Griffith: Yea, or a thousand steeds, and let thy chariot come to us with might.
Devanāgarī: उत वा ते सहस्रिणो रथ आ यातु पाजसा
pada pāṭha: vāyo iti | śatam | harīṇām | yuvasva | poṣyāṇām || uta | vā | te | sahasriṇaḥ | rathaḥ | ā | yātu | pājasā ||4.48.5||

IAST: idaṁ vām āsye haviḥ priyam indrābṛhaspatī
Griffith: DEAR is this offering in your mouth, O Indra and Brhaspati:
Devanāgarī: इदं वामास्ये हविः प्रियमिन्द्राबृहस्पती
pada pāṭha: idam | vām | āsye | haviḥ | priyam | indrābr̥haspatī iti || uktham | madaḥ | ca | śasyate ||4.49.1||

IAST: uktham madaś ca śasyate
Griffith: Famed is the laud, the gladdening draught.
Devanāgarī: उक्थं मदश्च शस्यते
pada pāṭha: idam | vām | āsye | haviḥ | priyam | indrābr̥haspatī iti || uktham | madaḥ | ca | śasyate ||4.49.1||

IAST: ayaṁ vām pari ṣicyate soma indrābṛhaspatī
Griffith: This lovely Soma is effused, O Indra and Brhaspati,
Devanāgarī: अयं वां परि षिच्यते सोम इन्द्राबृहस्पती
pada pāṭha: ayam | vām | pari | sicyate | somaḥ | indrābr̥haspatī iti || cāruḥ | madāya | pītaye ||4.49.2||

IAST: cārur madāya pītaye
Griffith: For you, to drink it and rejoice.
Devanāgarī: चारुर्मदाय पीतये
pada pāṭha: ayam | vām | pari | sicyate | somaḥ | indrābr̥haspatī iti || cāruḥ | madāya | pītaye ||4.49.2||

IAST: ā na indrābṛhaspatī gṛham indraś ca gacchatam
Griffith: As Soma-drinkers to our house come, Indra and Brhaspati
Devanāgarī: आ न इन्द्राबृहस्पती गृहमिन्द्रश्च गच्छतम्
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | indrābr̥haspatī iti | gr̥ham | indraḥ | ca | gacchatam || soma-pā | soma-pītaye ||4.49.3||

IAST: somapā somapītaye
Griffith: and Indra-to drink Soma juice.
Devanāgarī: सोमपा सोमपीतये
pada pāṭha: ā | naḥ | indrābr̥haspatī iti | gr̥ham | indraḥ | ca | gacchatam || soma-pā | soma-pītaye ||4.49.3||

IAST: asme indrābṛhaspatī rayiṁ dhattaṁ śatagvinam
Griffith: Vouchsafe us riches hundredfold, O Indra, and Brhaspati,
Devanāgarī: अस्मे इन्द्राबृहस्पती रयिं धत्तं शतग्विनम्
pada pāṭha: asme iti | indrābr̥haspatī iti | rayim | dhattam | śata-gvinam || aśva-vantam | sahasriṇam ||4.49.4||

IAST: aśvāvantaṁ sahasriṇam
Griffith: With store of horses, thousandfold.
Devanāgarī: अश्वावन्तं सहस्रिणम्
pada pāṭha: asme iti | indrābr̥haspatī iti | rayim | dhattam | śata-gvinam || aśva-vantam | sahasriṇam ||4.49.4||

IAST: indrābṛhaspatī vayaṁ sute gīrbhir havāmahe
Griffith: O Indra. and Brhaspati, we call you when the meath is shed,
Devanāgarī: इन्द्राबृहस्पती वयं सुते गीर्भिर्हवामहे
pada pāṭha: indrābr̥haspatī iti | vayam | sute | gīḥ-bhiḥ | havāmahe || asya | somasya | pītaye ||4.49.5||

IAST: asya somasya pītaye
Griffith: With songs, to drink the Soma juice.
Devanāgarī: अस्य सोमस्य पीतये
pada pāṭha: indrābr̥haspatī iti | vayam | sute | gīḥ-bhiḥ | havāmahe || asya | somasya | pītaye ||4.49.5||

IAST: somam indrābṛhaspatī pibataṁ dāśuṣo gṛhe
Griffith: Drink, Indra and Brhaspati, the Soma in the giver's house:
Devanāgarī: सोममिन्द्राबृहस्पती पिबतं दाशुषो गृहे
pada pāṭha: somam | indrābr̥haspatī iti | pibatam | dāśuṣaḥ | gr̥he || mādayethām | tat-okasā ||4.49.6||

IAST: mādayethāṁ tadokasā
Griffith: Delight yourselves abiding there.
Devanāgarī: मादयेथां तदोकसा
pada pāṭha: somam | indrābr̥haspatī iti | pibatam | dāśuṣaḥ | gr̥he || mādayethām | tat-okasā ||4.49.6||

IAST: yas tastambha sahasā vi jmo antān bṛhaspatis triṣadhastho raveṇa
Griffith: Him who with might hath propped earth's ends, who sitteth in threefold seat, Brhaspati, with thunder,
Devanāgarī: यस्तस्तम्भ सहसा वि ज्मो अन्तान्बृहस्पतिस्त्रिषधस्थो रवेण
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | tastambha | sahasā | vi | jmaḥ | antān | br̥haspatiḥ | tri-sadhasthaḥ | raveṇa || tam | pratnāsaḥ | r̥ṣayaḥ | dīdhyānāḥ | puraḥ | viprāḥ | dadhire | mandra-jihvam ||4.50.1||

IAST: tam pratnāsa ṛṣayo dīdhyānāḥ puro viprā dadhire mandrajihvam
Griffith: Him of the pleasant tongue have ancient sages, deep-thinking, holy singers, set before them.
Devanāgarī: तं प्रत्नास ऋषयो दीध्यानाः पुरो विप्रा दधिरे मन्द्रजिह्वम्
pada pāṭha: yaḥ | tastambha | sahasā | vi | jmaḥ | antān | br̥haspatiḥ | tri-sadhasthaḥ | raveṇa || tam | pratnāsaḥ | r̥ṣayaḥ | dīdhyānāḥ | puraḥ | viprāḥ | dadhire | mandra-jihvam ||4.50.1||

IAST: dhunetayaḥ supraketam madanto bṛhaspate abhi ye nas tatasre
Griffith: Wild in their course, in well-marked wise rejoicing were they, Brhaspati, who pressed around us.
Devanāgarī: धुनेतयः सुप्रकेतं मदन्तो बृहस्पते अभि ये नस्ततस्रे
pada pāṭha: dhuna-itayaḥ | su-praketam | madantaḥ | br̥haspate | abhi | ye | naḥ | tatasre || pr̥ṣantam | sr̥pram | adabdham | ūrvam | br̥haspate | rakṣatāt | asya | yonim ||4.50.2||

IAST: pṛṣantaṁ sṛpram adabdham ūrvam bṛhaspate rakṣatād asya yonim
Griffith: Preserve Brhaspati, the stall uninjured, this company's raining, ever-moving birthplace.
Devanāgarī: पृषन्तं सृप्रमदब्धमूर्वं बृहस्पते रक्षतादस्य योनिम्
pada pāṭha: dhuna-itayaḥ | su-praketam | madantaḥ | br̥haspate | abhi | ye | naḥ | tatasre || pr̥ṣantam | sr̥pram | adabdham | ūrvam | br̥haspate | rakṣatāt | asya | yonim ||4.50.2||

IAST: bṛhaspate yā paramā parāvad ata ā ta ṛtaspṛśo ni ṣeduḥ
Griffith: Brhaspati, from thy remotest distance have they sat down who love the law eternal.
Devanāgarī: बृहस्पते या परमा परावदत आ त ऋतस्पृशो नि षेदुः
pada pāṭha: br̥haspate | yā | paramā | parā-vat | ataḥ | ā | te | r̥ta-spr̥śaḥ | ni | seduḥ || tubhyam | khātāḥ | avatāḥ | adri-dugdhāḥ | madhvaḥ | ścotanti | abhitaḥ | vi-rapśam ||4.50.3||

IAST: tubhyaṁ khātā avatā adridugdhā madhvaḥ ścotanty abhito virapśam
Griffith: For thee were dug wells springing from the mountain, which murmuring round about pour streams of sweetness.
Devanāgarī: तुभ्यं खाता अवता अद्रिदुग्धा मध्वः श्चोतन्त्यभितो विरप्शम्
pada pāṭha: br̥haspate | yā | paramā | parā-vat | ataḥ | ā | te | r̥ta-spr̥śaḥ | ni | seduḥ || tubhyam | khātāḥ | avatāḥ | adri-dugdhāḥ | madhvaḥ | ścotanti | abhitaḥ | vi-rapśam ||4.50.3||

IAST: bṛhaspatiḥ prathamaṁ jāyamāno maho jyotiṣaḥ parame vyoman
Griffith: Brhaspati, when first he had his being from mighty splendour in supremest heaven,
Devanāgarī: बृहस्पतिः प्रथमं जायमानो महो ज्योतिषः परमे व्योमन्
pada pāṭha: br̥haspatiḥ | prathamam | jāyamānaḥ | mahaḥ | jyotiṣaḥ | parame | vi-oman || sapta-āsyaḥ | tuvi-jātaḥ | raveṇa | vi | sapta-raśmiḥ | adhamat | tamāṁsi ||4.50.4||

IAST: saptāsyas tuvijāto raveṇa vi saptaraśmir adhamat tamāṁsi
Griffith: Strong, with his sevenfold mouth, with noise of thunder, with his seven rays, blew and dispersed the darkness.
Devanāgarī: सप्तास्यस्तुविजातो रवेण वि सप्तरश्मिरधमत्तमांसि
pada pāṭha: br̥haspatiḥ | prathamam | jāyamānaḥ | mahaḥ | jyotiṣaḥ | parame | vi-oman || sapta-āsyaḥ | tuvi-jātaḥ | raveṇa | vi | sapta-raśmiḥ | adhamat | tamāṁsi ||4.50.4||

IAST: sa suṣṭubhā sa ṛkvatā gaṇena valaṁ ruroja phaligaṁ raveṇa
Griffith: With the loud-shouting band who sang his praises, with thunder, he destroyed obstructive Vala.
Devanāgarī: स सुष्टुभा स ऋक्वता गणेन वलं रुरोज फलिगं रवेण
pada pāṭha: saḥ | su-stubhā | saḥ | r̥kvatā | gaṇena | valam | ruroja | phali-gam | raveṇa || br̥haspatiḥ | usriyāḥ | havya-sūdaḥ | kanikradat | vāvaśatīḥ | ut | ājat ||4.50.5||

IAST: bṛhaspatir usriyā havyasūdaḥ kanikradad vāvaśatīr ud ājat
Griffith: Brhaspati thundering drave forth the cattle, the lowing cows who make oblations ready.
Devanāgarī: बृहस्पतिरुस्रिया हव्यसूदः कनिक्रदद्वावशतीरुदाजत्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | su-stubhā | saḥ | r̥kvatā | gaṇena | valam | ruroja | phali-gam | raveṇa || br̥haspatiḥ | usriyāḥ | havya-sūdaḥ | kanikradat | vāvaśatīḥ | ut | ājat ||4.50.5||

IAST: evā pitre viśvadevāya vṛṣṇe yajñair vidhema namasā havirbhiḥ
Griffith: Serve we with sacrifices, gifts, and homage even thus the Steer of all the Gods, the Father.
Devanāgarī: एवा पित्रे विश्वदेवाय वृष्णे यज्ञैर्विधेम नमसा हविर्भिः
pada pāṭha: eva | pitre | viśva-devāya | vr̥ṣṇe | yajñaiḥ | vidhema | namasā | haviḥ-bhiḥ || br̥haspate | su-prajāḥ | vīra-vantaḥ | vayam | syāma | patayaḥ | rayīṇām ||4.50.6||

IAST: bṛhaspate suprajā vīravanto vayaṁ syāma patayo rayīṇām
Griffith: Brhaspati, may we be lords of riches, with noble progeny and store of heroes.
Devanāgarī: बृहस्पते सुप्रजा वीरवन्तो वयं स्याम पतयो रयीणाम्
pada pāṭha: eva | pitre | viśva-devāya | vr̥ṣṇe | yajñaiḥ | vidhema | namasā | haviḥ-bhiḥ || br̥haspate | su-prajāḥ | vīra-vantaḥ | vayam | syāma | patayaḥ | rayīṇām ||4.50.6||

IAST: sa id rājā pratijanyāni viśvā śuṣmeṇa tasthāv abhi vīryeṇa
Griffith: Surely that King by power and might heroic hath made him lord of all his foes' posses-ions,
Devanāgarī: स इद्राजा प्रतिजन्यानि विश्वा शुष्मेण तस्थावभि वीर्येण
pada pāṭha: saḥ | it | rājā | prati-janyāni | viśvā | śuṣmeṇa | tasthau | abhi | vīryeṇa || br̥haspatim | yaḥ | su-bhr̥tam | bibharti | valgu-yati | vandate | pūrva-bhājam ||4.50.7||

IAST: bṛhaspatiṁ yaḥ subhṛtam bibharti valgūyati vandate pūrvabhājam
Griffith: Who cherishes Brhaspati well-tended, adorns and worships him as foremost sharer.
Devanāgarī: बृहस्पतिं यः सुभृतं बिभर्ति वल्गूयति वन्दते पूर्वभाजम्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | it | rājā | prati-janyāni | viśvā | śuṣmeṇa | tasthau | abhi | vīryeṇa || br̥haspatim | yaḥ | su-bhr̥tam | bibharti | valgu-yati | vandate | pūrva-bhājam ||4.50.7||

IAST: sa it kṣeti sudhita okasi sve tasmā iḻā pinvate viśvadānīm
Griffith: In his own house he dwells in peace and comfort: to him for ever holy food flows richly.
Devanāgarī: स इत्क्षेति सुधित ओकसि स्वे तस्मा इळा पिन्वते विश्वदानीम्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | it | kṣeti | su-dhitaḥ | okasi | sve | tasmai | iḷā | pinvate | viśva-dānīm || tasmai | viśaḥ | svayam | eva | namante | yasmin | brahmā | rājani | pūrvaḥ | eti ||4.50.8||

IAST: tasmai viśaḥ svayam evā namante yasmin brahmā rājani pūrva eti
Griffith: To him the people with free will pay homage-the King with whom the Brahman hatb precedence.
Devanāgarī: तस्मै विशः स्वयमेवा नमन्ते यस्मिन्ब्रह्मा राजनि पूर्व एति
pada pāṭha: saḥ | it | kṣeti | su-dhitaḥ | okasi | sve | tasmai | iḷā | pinvate | viśva-dānīm || tasmai | viśaḥ | svayam | eva | namante | yasmin | brahmā | rājani | pūrvaḥ | eti ||4.50.8||

IAST: apratīto jayati saṁ dhanāni pratijanyāny uta yā sajanyā
Griffith: He, unopposed, is master of the riches.of his own subjects and of hostile people.
Devanāgarī: अप्रतीतो जयति सं धनानि प्रतिजन्यान्युत या सजन्या
pada pāṭha: aprati-itaḥ | jayati | sam | dhanāni | prati-janyāni | uta | yā | sa-janyā || avasyave | yaḥ | varivaḥ | kr̥ṇoti | brahmaṇe | rājā | tam | avanti | devāḥ ||4.50.9||

IAST: avasyave yo varivaḥ kṛṇoti brahmaṇe rājā tam avanti devāḥ
Griffith: The Gods uphold that King with their protection who helps the Brahman when he seeks his favour.
Devanāgarī: अवस्यवे यो वरिवः कृणोति ब्रह्मणे राजा तमवन्ति देवाः
pada pāṭha: aprati-itaḥ | jayati | sam | dhanāni | prati-janyāni | uta | yā | sa-janyā || avasyave | yaḥ | varivaḥ | kr̥ṇoti | brahmaṇe | rājā | tam | avanti | devāḥ ||4.50.9||

IAST: indraś ca somam pibatam bṛhaspate 'smin yajñe mandasānā vṛṣaṇvasū
Griffith: Indra, Brhaspati, rainers of treasure, rejoicing at this sacrifice drink the Soma.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रश्च सोमं पिबतं बृहस्पतेऽस्मिन्यज्ञे मन्दसाना वृषण्वसू
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | ca | somam | pibatam | br̥haspate | asmin | yajñe | mandasānā | vr̥ṣaṇvasū iti vr̥ṣaṇ-vasū || ā | vām | viśantu | indavaḥ | su-ābhuvaḥ | asme iti | rayim | sarva-vīram | ni | yacchatam ||4.50.10||

IAST: ā vāṁ viśantv indavaḥ svābhuvo 'sme rayiṁ sarvavīraṁ ni yacchatam
Griffith: Let the abundant drops sink deep within you: vouchsafe us riches with full store of heroes.
Devanāgarī: आ वां विशन्त्विन्दवः स्वाभुवोऽस्मे रयिं सर्ववीरं नि यच्छतम्
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | ca | somam | pibatam | br̥haspate | asmin | yajñe | mandasānā | vr̥ṣaṇvasū iti vr̥ṣaṇ-vasū || ā | vām | viśantu | indavaḥ | su-ābhuvaḥ | asme iti | rayim | sarva-vīram | ni | yacchatam ||4.50.10||

IAST: bṛhaspata indra vardhataṁ naḥ sacā sā vāṁ sumatir bhūtv asme
