Griffith: Brhaspati and Indra, make us prosper may this be your benevolence to usward.
Devanāgarī: बृहस्पत इन्द्र वर्धतं नः सचा सा वां सुमतिर्भूत्वस्मे
pada pāṭha: br̥haspate | indra | vardhatam | naḥ | sacā | sā | vām | su-matiḥ | bhūtu | asme iti || aviṣṭam | dhiyaḥ | jigr̥tam | puram-dhīḥ | jajastam | aryaḥ | vanuṣām | arātīḥ ||4.50.11||

IAST: aviṣṭaṁ dhiyo jigṛtam puraṁdhīr jajastam aryo vanuṣām arātīḥ
Griffith: Assist our holy thoughts, wake up our spirit: weaken the hatred of our foe and rivals.
Devanāgarī: अविष्टं धियो जिगृतं पुरंधीर्जजस्तमर्यो वनुषामरातीः
pada pāṭha: br̥haspate | indra | vardhatam | naḥ | sacā | sā | vām | su-matiḥ | bhūtu | asme iti || aviṣṭam | dhiyaḥ | jigr̥tam | puram-dhīḥ | jajastam | aryaḥ | vanuṣām | arātīḥ ||4.50.11||

IAST: idam u tyat purutamam purastāj jyotis tamaso vayunāvad asthāt
Griffith: FORTH from the darkness in the region eastward this most abundant splendid light hatb mounted.
Devanāgarī: इदमु त्यत्पुरुतमं पुरस्ताज्ज्योतिस्तमसो वयुनावदस्थात्
pada pāṭha: idam | ūm̐ iti | tyat | puru-tamam | purastāt | jyotiḥ | tamasaḥ | vayuna-vat | asthāt || nūnam | divaḥ | duhitaraḥ | vi-bhātīḥ | gātum | kr̥ṇavan | uṣasaḥ | janāya ||4.51.1||

IAST: nūnaṁ divo duhitaro vibhātīr gātuṁ kṛṇavann uṣaso janāya
Griffith: Now verily the far-refulgent Mornings, Daughters of Heaven, bring welfare to the people.
Devanāgarī: नूनं दिवो दुहितरो विभातीर्गातुं कृणवन्नुषसो जनाय
pada pāṭha: idam | ūm̐ iti | tyat | puru-tamam | purastāt | jyotiḥ | tamasaḥ | vayuna-vat | asthāt || nūnam | divaḥ | duhitaraḥ | vi-bhātīḥ | gātum | kr̥ṇavan | uṣasaḥ | janāya ||4.51.1||

IAST: asthur u citrā uṣasaḥ purastān mitā iva svaravo 'dhvareṣu
Griffith: The richly-coloured Dawns have mounted eastward, like pillars planted at our sacrifices,
Devanāgarī: अस्थुरु चित्रा उषसः पुरस्तान्मिता इव स्वरवोऽध्वरेषु
pada pāṭha: asthuḥ | ūm̐ iti | citrāḥ | uṣasaḥ | purastāt | mitāḥ-iva | svaravaḥ | adhvareṣu || vi | ūm̐ iti | vrajasya | tamasaḥ | dvārā | ucchantīḥ | avran | śucayaḥ | pāvakāḥ ||4.51.2||

IAST: vy ū vrajasya tamaso dvārocchantīr avrañ chucayaḥ pāvakāḥ
Griffith: And, flushing far, splendid and purifying, unbarred the portals of the fold of darkness.
Devanāgarī: व्यू व्रजस्य तमसो द्वारोच्छन्तीरव्रञ्छुचयः पावकाः
pada pāṭha: asthuḥ | ūm̐ iti | citrāḥ | uṣasaḥ | purastāt | mitāḥ-iva | svaravaḥ | adhvareṣu || vi | ūm̐ iti | vrajasya | tamasaḥ | dvārā | ucchantīḥ | avran | śucayaḥ | pāvakāḥ ||4.51.2||

IAST: ucchantīr adya citayanta bhojān rādhodeyāyoṣaso maghonīḥ
Griffith: Dispelling gloom this day the wealthy Mornings urge liberal givers to present their treasures.
Devanāgarī: उच्छन्तीरद्य चितयन्त भोजान्राधोदेयायोषसो मघोनीः
pada pāṭha: ucchantīḥ | adya | citayanta | bhojān | rādhaḥ-deyāya | uṣasaḥ | maghonīḥ || acitre | antariti | paṇayaḥ | sasantu | abudhyamānāḥ | tamasaḥ | vi-madhye ||4.51.3||

IAST: acitre antaḥ paṇayaḥ sasantv abudhyamānās tamaso vimadhye
Griffith: In the unlightened depth of darkness round them let niggard traffickers sleep unawakened.
Devanāgarī: अचित्रे अन्तः पणयः ससन्त्वबुध्यमानास्तमसो विमध्ये
pada pāṭha: ucchantīḥ | adya | citayanta | bhojān | rādhaḥ-deyāya | uṣasaḥ | maghonīḥ || acitre | antariti | paṇayaḥ | sasantu | abudhyamānāḥ | tamasaḥ | vi-madhye ||4.51.3||

IAST: kuvit sa devīḥ sanayo navo vā yāmo babhūyād uṣaso vo adya
Griffith: O Goddesses, is this your car, I ask you, ancient this day, or is it new, ye Mornings,
Devanāgarī: कुवित्स देवीः सनयो नवो वा यामो बभूयादुषसो वो अद्य
pada pāṭha: kuvit | saḥ | devīḥ | sanayaḥ | navaḥ | vā | yāmaḥ | babhūyāt | uṣasaḥ | vaḥ | adya || yena | nava-gve | aṅgire | daśa-gve | sapta-āsye | revatīḥ | revat | ūṣa ||4.51.4||

IAST: yenā navagve aṅgire daśagve saptāsye revatī revad ūṣa
Griffith: Wherewith, rich Dawns, ye seek with wealth Navagva, Dasagva Angira, the seven-toned singer?
Devanāgarī: येना नवग्वे अङ्गिरे दशग्वे सप्तास्ये रेवती रेवदूष
pada pāṭha: kuvit | saḥ | devīḥ | sanayaḥ | navaḥ | vā | yāmaḥ | babhūyāt | uṣasaḥ | vaḥ | adya || yena | nava-gve | aṅgire | daśa-gve | sapta-āsye | revatīḥ | revat | ūṣa ||4.51.4||

IAST: yūyaṁ hi devīr ṛtayugbhir aśvaiḥ pariprayātha bhuvanāni sadyaḥ
Griffith: With horses harnessed by eternal Order, Goddesses, swiftly round the worlds ye travel,
Devanāgarī: यूयं हि देवीरृतयुग्भिरश्वैः परिप्रयाथ भुवनानि सद्यः
pada pāṭha: yūyam | hi | devīḥ | r̥tayuk-bhiḥ | aśvaiḥ | pari-prayātha | bhuvanāni | sadyaḥ || pra-bodhayantīḥ | uṣasaḥ | sasantam | dvi-pāt | catuḥ-pāt | carathāya | jīvam ||4.51.5||

IAST: prabodhayantīr uṣasaḥ sasantaṁ dvipāc catuṣpāc carathāya jīvam
Griffith: Arousing from their rest, O Dawns, the sleeping, and all that lives, man, bird, and beast, to motion.
Devanāgarī: प्रबोधयन्तीरुषसः ससन्तं द्विपाच्चतुष्पाच्चरथाय जीवम्
pada pāṭha: yūyam | hi | devīḥ | r̥tayuk-bhiḥ | aśvaiḥ | pari-prayātha | bhuvanāni | sadyaḥ || pra-bodhayantīḥ | uṣasaḥ | sasantam | dvi-pāt | catuḥ-pāt | carathāya | jīvam ||4.51.5||

IAST: kva svid āsāṁ katamā purāṇī yayā vidhānā vidadhur ṛbhūṇām
Griffith: Which among these is eldest, and where is she through whom they fixed the Rbhus' regulations?
Devanāgarī: क्व स्विदासां कतमा पुराणी यया विधाना विदधुरृभूणाम्
pada pāṭha: kva | svit | āsām | katamā | purāṇī | yayā | vi-dhānā | vi-dadhuḥ | r̥bhūṇām || śubham | yat | śubhrāḥ | uṣasaḥ | caranti | na | vi | jñāyante | sa-dr̥śīḥ | ajuryāḥ ||4.51.6||

IAST: śubhaṁ yac chubhrā uṣasaś caranti na vi jñāyante sadṛśīr ajuryāḥ
Griffith: What time the splendid Dawns go forth for splendour, they are not known aparto alike, unwasting.
Devanāgarī: शुभं यच्छुभ्रा उषसश्चरन्ति न वि ज्ञायन्ते सदृशीरजुर्याः
pada pāṭha: kva | svit | āsām | katamā | purāṇī | yayā | vi-dhānā | vi-dadhuḥ | r̥bhūṇām || śubham | yat | śubhrāḥ | uṣasaḥ | caranti | na | vi | jñāyante | sa-dr̥śīḥ | ajuryāḥ ||4.51.6||

IAST: tā ghā tā bhadrā uṣasaḥ purāsur abhiṣṭidyumnā ṛtajātasatyāḥ
Griffith: Blest were these Dawns of old, shining with succour, true with the truth that springs from holy Order;
Devanāgarī: ता घा ता भद्रा उषसः पुरासुरभिष्टिद्युम्ना ऋतजातसत्याः
pada pāṭha: tāḥ | gha | tāḥ | bhadrāḥ | uṣasaḥ | purā | āsuḥ | abhiṣṭi-dyumnāḥ | r̥tajāta-satyāḥ || yāsu | ījānaḥ | śaśamānaḥ | ukthaiḥ | stuvan | śaṁsan | draviṇam | sadyaḥ | āpa ||4.51.7||

IAST: yāsv ījānaḥ śaśamāna ukthaiḥ stuvañ chaṁsan draviṇaṁ sadya āpa
Griffith: With whom the toiling worshipper, by praises, hymning and lauding, soon attained to riches.
Devanāgarī: यास्वीजानः शशमान उक्थैः स्तुवञ्छंसन्द्रविणं सद्य आप
pada pāṭha: tāḥ | gha | tāḥ | bhadrāḥ | uṣasaḥ | purā | āsuḥ | abhiṣṭi-dyumnāḥ | r̥tajāta-satyāḥ || yāsu | ījānaḥ | śaśamānaḥ | ukthaiḥ | stuvan | śaṁsan | draviṇam | sadyaḥ | āpa ||4.51.7||

IAST: tā ā caranti samanā purastāt samānataḥ samanā paprathānāḥ
Griffith: Hither from eastward all at once they travel, from one place spreading in the selfsame manner.
Devanāgarī: ता आ चरन्ति समना पुरस्तात्समानतः समना पप्रथानाः
pada pāṭha: tāḥ | ā | caranti | samanā | purastāt | samānataḥ | samanā | paprathānāḥ || r̥tasya | devīḥ | sadasaḥ | budhānāḥ | gavām | na | sargāḥ | uṣasaḥ | jarante ||4.51.8||

IAST: ṛtasya devīḥ sadaso budhānā gavāṁ na sargā uṣaso jarante
Griffith: Awaking, from the seat of holy Order the Godlike Dawns come nigh like troops of cattle.
Devanāgarī: ऋतस्य देवीः सदसो बुधाना गवां न सर्गा उषसो जरन्ते
pada pāṭha: tāḥ | ā | caranti | samanā | purastāt | samānataḥ | samanā | paprathānāḥ || r̥tasya | devīḥ | sadasaḥ | budhānāḥ | gavām | na | sargāḥ | uṣasaḥ | jarante ||4.51.8||

IAST: tā in nv eva samanā samānīr amītavarṇā uṣasaś caranti
Griffith: Thus they go forth with undiminished colours, these Mornings similar, in self-same fashion,
Devanāgarī: ता इन्न्वेव समना समानीरमीतवर्णा उषसश्चरन्ति
pada pāṭha: tāḥ | it | nu | eva | samanā | samānīḥ | amīta-varṇāḥ | uṣasaḥ | caranti || gūhantīḥ | abhvam | asitam | ruśat-bhiḥ | śukrāḥ | tanūbhiḥ | śucayaḥ | rucānāḥ ||4.51.9||

IAST: gūhantīr abhvam asitaṁ ruśadbhiḥ śukrās tanūbhiḥ śucayo rucānāḥ
Griffith: Concealing the gigantic might of darkness with radiant bodies bright and pure and shining.
Devanāgarī: गूहन्तीरभ्वमसितं रुशद्भिः शुक्रास्तनूभिः शुचयो रुचानाः
pada pāṭha: tāḥ | it | nu | eva | samanā | samānīḥ | amīta-varṇāḥ | uṣasaḥ | caranti || gūhantīḥ | abhvam | asitam | ruśat-bhiḥ | śukrāḥ | tanūbhiḥ | śucayaḥ | rucānāḥ ||4.51.9||

IAST: rayiṁ divo duhitaro vibhātīḥ prajāvantaṁ yacchatāsmāsu devīḥ
Griffith: O Goddesses, O Heaven's refulgent Daughters, bestow upon us wealth with store of children.
Devanāgarī: रयिं दिवो दुहितरो विभातीः प्रजावन्तं यच्छतास्मासु देवीः
pada pāṭha: rayim | divaḥ | duhitaraḥ | vi-bhātīḥ | prajā-vantam | yacchata | asmāsu | devīḥ || syonāt | ā | vaḥ | prati-budhyamānāḥ | su-vīryasya | patayaḥ | syāma ||4.51.10||

IAST: syonād ā vaḥ pratibudhyamānāḥ suvīryasya patayaḥ syāma
Griffith: As from our pleasant place of rest ye rouse us may we be masters of heroic vigour.
Devanāgarī: स्योनादा वः प्रतिबुध्यमानाः सुवीर्यस्य पतयः स्याम
pada pāṭha: rayim | divaḥ | duhitaraḥ | vi-bhātīḥ | prajā-vantam | yacchata | asmāsu | devīḥ || syonāt | ā | vaḥ | prati-budhyamānāḥ | su-vīryasya | patayaḥ | syāma ||4.51.10||

IAST: tad vo divo duhitaro vibhātīr upa bruva uṣaso yajñaketuḥ
Griffith: Well-skilled in lore of sacrifice, ye Daughters of Heaven, refulgent Dawns, I thus address you.
Devanāgarī: तद्वो दिवो दुहितरो विभातीरुप ब्रुव उषसो यज्ञकेतुः
pada pāṭha: tat | vaḥ | divaḥ | duhitaraḥ | vi-bhātīḥ | upa | bruve | uṣasaḥ | yajña-ketuḥ || vayam | syāma | yaśasaḥ | janeṣu | tat | dyauḥ | ca | dhattām | pr̥thivī | ca | devī ||4.51.11||

IAST: vayaṁ syāma yaśaso janeṣu tad dyauś ca dhattām pṛthivī ca devī
Griffith: May we be glorious among the people. May Heaven vouchsafe us this, and Earth the Goddess,
Devanāgarī: वयं स्याम यशसो जनेषु तद्द्यौश्च धत्तां पृथिवी च देवी
pada pāṭha: tat | vaḥ | divaḥ | duhitaraḥ | vi-bhātīḥ | upa | bruve | uṣasaḥ | yajña-ketuḥ || vayam | syāma | yaśasaḥ | janeṣu | tat | dyauḥ | ca | dhattām | pr̥thivī | ca | devī ||4.51.11||

IAST: prati ṣyā sūnarī janī vyucchantī pari svasuḥ
Griffith: THIS Lady, giver of delight, after her Sister shining forth
Devanāgarī: प्रति ष्या सूनरी जनी व्युच्छन्ती परि स्वसुः
pada pāṭha: prati | syā | sūnarī | janī | vi-ucchantī | pari | svasuḥ || divaḥ | adarśi | duhitā ||4.52.1||

IAST: divo adarśi duhitā
Griffith: Daughter of Heaven, hath shown herself.
Devanāgarī: दिवो अदर्शि दुहिता
pada pāṭha: prati | syā | sūnarī | janī | vi-ucchantī | pari | svasuḥ || divaḥ | adarśi | duhitā ||4.52.1||

IAST: aśveva citrāruṣī mātā gavām ṛtāvarī
Griffith: Unfailing, Mother of the Kine, in colour like a bright red mare,
Devanāgarī: अश्वेव चित्रारुषी माता गवामृतावरी
pada pāṭha: aśvā-iva | citrā | aruṣī | mātā | gavām | r̥ta-varī || sakhā | abhūt | aśvinoḥ | uṣāḥ ||4.52.2||

IAST: sakhābhūd aśvinor uṣāḥ
Griffith: The Dawn became the Asvins' Friend.
Devanāgarī: सखाभूदश्विनोरुषाः
pada pāṭha: aśvā-iva | citrā | aruṣī | mātā | gavām | r̥ta-varī || sakhā | abhūt | aśvinoḥ | uṣāḥ ||4.52.2||

IAST: uta sakhāsy aśvinor uta mātā gavām asi
Griffith: Yea, and thou art the Asvins' Friend, the Mother of the Kine art thou:
Devanāgarī: उत सखास्यश्विनोरुत माता गवामसि
pada pāṭha: uta | sakhā | asi | aśvinoḥ | uta | mātā | gavām | asi || uta | uṣaḥ | vasvaḥ | īśiṣe ||4.52.3||

IAST: utoṣo vasva īśiṣe
Griffith: O Dawn thou rulest over wealth.
Devanāgarī: उतोषो वस्व ईशिषे
pada pāṭha: uta | sakhā | asi | aśvinoḥ | uta | mātā | gavām | asi || uta | uṣaḥ | vasvaḥ | īśiṣe ||4.52.3||

IAST: yāvayaddveṣasaṁ tvā cikitvit sūnṛtāvari
Griffith: Thinking of thee, O joyous One, as her who driveth hate away,
Devanāgarī: यावयद्द्वेषसं त्वा चिकित्वित्सूनृतावरि
pada pāṭha: yavayat-dveṣasam | tvā | cikitvit | sūnr̥tā-vari || prati | stomaiḥ | abhutsmahi ||4.52.4||

IAST: prati stomair abhutsmahi
Griffith: We woke to meet thee with our lauds.
Devanāgarī: प्रति स्तोमैरभुत्स्महि
pada pāṭha: yavayat-dveṣasam | tvā | cikitvit | sūnr̥tā-vari || prati | stomaiḥ | abhutsmahi ||4.52.4||

IAST: prati bhadrā adṛkṣata gavāṁ sargā na raśmayaḥ
Griffith: Our eyes behold thy blessed rays like troops of cattle loosed to feed.
Devanāgarī: प्रति भद्रा अदृक्षत गवां सर्गा न रश्मयः
pada pāṭha: prati | bhadrāḥ | adr̥kṣata | gavām | sargāḥ | na | raśmayaḥ || ā | uṣāḥ | aprāḥ | uru | jrayaḥ ||4.52.5||

IAST: oṣā aprā uru jrayaḥ
Griffith: Dawn hath filled full the wide expanse.
Devanāgarī: ओषा अप्रा उरु ज्रयः
pada pāṭha: prati | bhadrāḥ | adr̥kṣata | gavām | sargāḥ | na | raśmayaḥ || ā | uṣāḥ | aprāḥ | uru | jrayaḥ ||4.52.5||

IAST: āpapruṣī vibhāvari vy āvar jyotiṣā tamaḥ
Griffith: When thou hast filled it, Fulgent One! thou layest bare the gloom with light.
Devanāgarī: आपप्रुषी विभावरि व्यावर्ज्योतिषा तमः
pada pāṭha: ā-papruṣī | vibhā-vari | vi | āvaḥ | jyotiṣā | tamaḥ || uṣaḥ | anu | svadhām | ava ||4.52.6||

IAST: uṣo anu svadhām ava
Griffith: After thy nature aid us, Dawn.
Devanāgarī: उषो अनु स्वधामव
pada pāṭha: ā-papruṣī | vibhā-vari | vi | āvaḥ | jyotiṣā | tamaḥ || uṣaḥ | anu | svadhām | ava ||4.52.6||

IAST: ā dyāṁ tanoṣi raśmibhir āntarikṣam uru priyam
Griffith: Thou overspreadest heaven with rays, the dear wide region of mid-air.
Devanāgarī: आ द्यां तनोषि रश्मिभिरान्तरिक्षमुरु प्रियम्
pada pāṭha: ā | dyām | tanoṣi | raśmi-bhiḥ | ā | antarikṣam | uru | priyam || uṣaḥ | śukreṇa | śociṣā ||4.52.7||

IAST: uṣaḥ śukreṇa śociṣā
Griffith: With thy bright shining lustre, Dawn.
Devanāgarī: उषः शुक्रेण शोचिषा
pada pāṭha: ā | dyām | tanoṣi | raśmi-bhiḥ | ā | antarikṣam | uru | priyam || uṣaḥ | śukreṇa | śociṣā ||4.52.7||

IAST: tad devasya savitur vāryam mahad vṛṇīmahe asurasya pracetasaḥ
Griffith: OF Savitar the God, the sapient Asura, we crave this great gift which is worthy of our choice,
Devanāgarī: तद्देवस्य सवितुर्वार्यं महद्वृणीमहे असुरस्य प्रचेतसः
pada pāṭha: tat | devasya | savituḥ | vāryam | mahat | vr̥ṇīmahe | asurasya | pra-cetasaḥ || chardiḥ | yena | dāśuṣe | yacchati | tmanā | tat | naḥ | mahān | ut | ayān | devaḥ | aktu-bhiḥ ||4.53.1||

IAST: chardir yena dāśuṣe yacchati tmanā tan no mahām̐ ud ayān devo aktubhiḥ
Griffith: Wherewith he freely grants his worshiper defence. This with his rays the Great God hath vouchsafed to us.
Devanāgarī: छर्दिर्येन दाशुषे यच्छति त्मना तन्नो महाँ उदयान्देवो अक्तुभिः
pada pāṭha: tat | devasya | savituḥ | vāryam | mahat | vr̥ṇīmahe | asurasya | pra-cetasaḥ || chardiḥ | yena | dāśuṣe | yacchati | tmanā | tat | naḥ | mahān | ut | ayān | devaḥ | aktu-bhiḥ ||4.53.1||

IAST: divo dhartā bhuvanasya prajāpatiḥ piśaṅgaṁ drāpim prati muñcate kaviḥ
Griffith: Sustainer of the heaven, Lord of the whole world's life, the Sage, he putteth on his golden-coloured mail.
Devanāgarī: दिवो धर्ता भुवनस्य प्रजापतिः पिशङ्गं द्रापिं प्रति मुञ्चते कविः
pada pāṭha: divaḥ | dhartā | bhuvanasya | prajā-patiḥ | piśaṅgam | drāpim | prati | muñcate | kaviḥ || vi-cakṣaṇaḥ | prathayan | ā-pr̥ṇan | uru | ajījanat | savitā | sumnam | ukthyam ||4.53.2||

IAST: vicakṣaṇaḥ prathayann āpṛṇann urv ajījanat savitā sumnam ukthyam
Griffith: Clear-sighted, spreading far, filling the spacious realm, Savitar hath brought forth bliss that deserveth laud.
Devanāgarī: विचक्षणः प्रथयन्नापृणन्नुर्वजीजनत्सविता सुम्नमुक्थ्यम्
pada pāṭha: divaḥ | dhartā | bhuvanasya | prajā-patiḥ | piśaṅgam | drāpim | prati | muñcate | kaviḥ || vi-cakṣaṇaḥ | prathayan | ā-pr̥ṇan | uru | ajījanat | savitā | sumnam | ukthyam ||4.53.2||

IAST: āprā rajāṁsi divyāni pārthivā ślokaṁ devaḥ kṛṇute svāya dharmaṇe
Griffith: He hath filled full the regions of the heaven and earth: the God for his own strengthening waketh up the hymn.
Devanāgarī: आप्रा रजांसि दिव्यानि पार्थिवा श्लोकं देवः कृणुते स्वाय धर्मणे
pada pāṭha: ā | aprāḥ | rajāṁsi | divyāni | pārthivā | ślokam | devaḥ | kr̥ṇute | svāya | dharmaṇe || pra | bāhū iti | asrāk | savitā | savīmani | ni-veśayan | pra-suvan | aktu-bhiḥ | jagat ||4.53.3||

IAST: pra bāhū asrāk savitā savīmani niveśayan prasuvann aktubhir jagat
Griffith: Savitar hath stretched out his arms to cherish life, producing with his rays and lulling all that moves.
Devanāgarī: प्र बाहू अस्राक्सविता सवीमनि निवेशयन्प्रसुवन्नक्तुभिर्जगत्
pada pāṭha: ā | aprāḥ | rajāṁsi | divyāni | pārthivā | ślokam | devaḥ | kr̥ṇute | svāya | dharmaṇe || pra | bāhū iti | asrāk | savitā | savīmani | ni-veśayan | pra-suvan | aktu-bhiḥ | jagat ||4.53.3||

IAST: adābhyo bhuvanāni pracākaśad vratāni devaḥ savitābhi rakṣate
Griffith: Lighting all living creatures, neer to be deceived, Savitar, God, protects each holy ordinance.
Devanāgarī: अदाभ्यो भुवनानि प्रचाकशद्व्रतानि देवः सविताभि रक्षते
pada pāṭha: adābhyaḥ | bhuvanāni | pra-cākaśat | vratāni | devaḥ | savitā | abhi | rakṣate || pra | asrāk | bāhū iti | bhuvanasya | pra-jābhyaḥ | dhr̥ta-vrataḥ | mahaḥ | ajmasya | rājati ||4.53.4||

IAST: prāsrāg bāhū bhuvanasya prajābhyo dhṛtavrato maho ajmasya rājati
Griffith: He hath stretched out his arms to all the folk of earth, and, with his laws observed, rules his own mighty course.
Devanāgarī: प्रास्राग्बाहू भुवनस्य प्रजाभ्यो धृतव्रतो महो अज्मस्य राजति
pada pāṭha: adābhyaḥ | bhuvanāni | pra-cākaśat | vratāni | devaḥ | savitā | abhi | rakṣate || pra | asrāk | bāhū iti | bhuvanasya | pra-jābhyaḥ | dhr̥ta-vrataḥ | mahaḥ | ajmasya | rājati ||4.53.4||

IAST: trir antarikṣaṁ savitā mahitvanā trī rajāṁsi paribhus trīṇi rocanā
Griffith: Savitar thrice surrounding with his mightiness mid-air, three regions, and the triple sphere of light,
Devanāgarī: त्रिरन्तरिक्षं सविता महित्वना त्री रजांसि परिभुस्त्रीणि रोचना
pada pāṭha: triḥ | antarikṣam | savitā | mahi-tvanā | trī | rajāṁsi | pari-bhūḥ | trīṇi | rocanā || tisraḥ | divaḥ | pr̥thivīḥ | tisraḥ | invati | tri-bhiḥ | vrataiḥ | abhi | naḥ | rakṣati | tmanā ||4.53.5||

IAST: tisro divaḥ pṛthivīs tisra invati tribhir vratair abhi no rakṣati tmanā
Griffith: Sets the three heavens in motion and the threefold earth, and willingly protects us with his triple law.
Devanāgarī: तिस्रो दिवः पृथिवीस्तिस्र इन्वति त्रिभिर्व्रतैरभि नो रक्षति त्मना
pada pāṭha: triḥ | antarikṣam | savitā | mahi-tvanā | trī | rajāṁsi | pari-bhūḥ | trīṇi | rocanā || tisraḥ | divaḥ | pr̥thivīḥ | tisraḥ | invati | tri-bhiḥ | vrataiḥ | abhi | naḥ | rakṣati | tmanā ||4.53.5||

IAST: bṛhatsumnaḥ prasavītā niveśano jagataḥ sthātur ubhayasya yo vaśī
Griffith: Most gracious God, who brings to life and lulls to rest, he who controls the world, what moves not and what moves,
Devanāgarī: बृहत्सुम्नः प्रसवीता निवेशनो जगतः स्थातुरुभयस्य यो वशी
pada pāṭha: br̥hat-sumnaḥ | pra-savitā | ni-veśanaḥ | jagataḥ | sthātuḥ | ubhayasya | yaḥ | vaśī || saḥ | naḥ | devaḥ | savitā | śarma | yacchatu | asme iti | kṣayāya | tri-varūtham | aṁhasaḥ ||4.53.6||

IAST: sa no devaḥ savitā śarma yacchatv asme kṣayāya trivarūtham aṁhasaḥ
Griffith: May he vouchsafe us shelter, -Savitar the God,- for tranquil life, with triple bar against distress.
Devanāgarī: स नो देवः सविता शर्म यच्छत्वस्मे क्षयाय त्रिवरूथमंहसः
pada pāṭha: br̥hat-sumnaḥ | pra-savitā | ni-veśanaḥ | jagataḥ | sthātuḥ | ubhayasya | yaḥ | vaśī || saḥ | naḥ | devaḥ | savitā | śarma | yacchatu | asme iti | kṣayāya | tri-varūtham | aṁhasaḥ ||4.53.6||

IAST: āgan deva ṛtubhir vardhatu kṣayaṁ dadhātu naḥ savitā suprajām iṣam
Griffith: With the year's seasons hath Savitar, God, come nigh: may he prosper our home, give food and noble sons.
Devanāgarī: आगन्देव ऋतुभिर्वर्धतु क्षयं दधातु नः सविता सुप्रजामिषम्
pada pāṭha: ā | agan | devaḥ | r̥tu-bhiḥ | vardhatu | kṣayam | dadhātu | naḥ | savitā | su-prajām | iṣam || saḥ | naḥ | kṣapābhiḥ | aha-bhiḥ | ca | jinvatu | prajā-vantam | rayim | asme iti | sam | invatu ||4.53.7||

IAST: sa naḥ kṣapābhir ahabhiś ca jinvatu prajāvantaṁ rayim asme sam invatu
Griffith: May he invigorate us through the days and nights, and may he send us opulence with progeny.
Devanāgarī: स नः क्षपाभिरहभिश्च जिन्वतु प्रजावन्तं रयिमस्मे समिन्वतु
pada pāṭha: ā | agan | devaḥ | r̥tu-bhiḥ | vardhatu | kṣayam | dadhātu | naḥ | savitā | su-prajām | iṣam || saḥ | naḥ | kṣapābhiḥ | aha-bhiḥ | ca | jinvatu | prajā-vantam | rayim | asme iti | sam | invatu ||4.53.7||

IAST: abhūd devaḥ savitā vandyo nu na idānīm ahna upavācyo nṛbhiḥ
Griffith: Now must we praise and honour Savitar the God: at this time of the day the men must call to him,
Devanāgarī: अभूद्देवः सविता वन्द्यो नु न इदानीमह्न उपवाच्यो नृभिः
pada pāṭha: abhūt | devaḥ | savitā | vandyaḥ | nu | naḥ | idānīm | ahnaḥ | upa-vācyaḥ | nr̥-bhiḥ || vi | yaḥ | ratnā | bhajati | mānavebhyaḥ | śreṣṭham | naḥ | atra | draviṇam | yathā | dadhat ||4.54.1||

IAST: vi yo ratnā bhajati mānavebhyaḥ śreṣṭhaṁ no atra draviṇaṁ yathā dadhat
Griffith: Him who distributes wealth to Manu's progeny, that he may grant us here riches most excellent.
Devanāgarī: वि यो रत्ना भजति मानवेभ्यः श्रेष्ठं नो अत्र द्रविणं यथा दधत्
pada pāṭha: abhūt | devaḥ | savitā | vandyaḥ | nu | naḥ | idānīm | ahnaḥ | upa-vācyaḥ | nr̥-bhiḥ || vi | yaḥ | ratnā | bhajati | mānavebhyaḥ | śreṣṭham | naḥ | atra | draviṇam | yathā | dadhat ||4.54.1||

IAST: devebhyo hi prathamaṁ yajñiyebhyo 'mṛtatvaṁ suvasi bhāgam uttamam
Griffith: For thou at first producest for the holy Gods the noblest of all portions, immor-tality:
Devanāgarī: देवेभ्यो हि प्रथमं यज्ञियेभ्योऽमृतत्वं सुवसि भागमुत्तमम्
pada pāṭha: devebhyaḥ | hi | prathamam | yajñiyebhyaḥ | amr̥ta-tvam | suvasi | bhāgam | ut-tamam || āt | it | dāmānam | savitaḥ | vi | ūrṇuṣe | anūcīnā | jīvitā | mānuṣebhyaḥ ||4.54.2||

IAST: ād id dāmānaṁ savitar vy ūrṇuṣe 'nūcīnā jīvitā mānuṣebhyaḥ
Griffith: Thereafter as a gift to men, O Savitar, thou openest existence, life succeeding life.
Devanāgarī: आदिद्दामानं सवितर्व्यूर्णुषेऽनूचीना जीविता मानुषेभ्यः
pada pāṭha: devebhyaḥ | hi | prathamam | yajñiyebhyaḥ | amr̥ta-tvam | suvasi | bhāgam | ut-tamam || āt | it | dāmānam | savitaḥ | vi | ūrṇuṣe | anūcīnā | jīvitā | mānuṣebhyaḥ ||4.54.2||

IAST: acittī yac cakṛmā daivye jane dīnair dakṣaiḥ prabhūtī pūruṣatvatā
Griffith: If we, men as we are, have sinned against the Gods through want of thought, in weakness, or through insolence,
Devanāgarī: अचित्ती यच्चकृमा दैव्ये जने दीनैर्दक्षैः प्रभूती पूरुषत्वता
pada pāṭha: acittī | yat | cakr̥ma | daivye | jane | dīnaiḥ | dakṣaḥ | pra-bhūtī | puruṣatvatā || deveṣu | ca | savitaḥ | mānuṣeṣu | ca | tvam | naḥ | atra | suvatāt | anāgasaḥ ||4.54.3||

IAST: deveṣu ca savitar mānuṣeṣu ca tvaṁ no atra suvatād anāgasaḥ
Griffith: Absolve us from the guilt and make us free from sin, O Savitar, alike among both Gods and men.
Devanāgarī: देवेषु च सवितर्मानुषेषु च त्वं नो अत्र सुवतादनागसः
pada pāṭha: acittī | yat | cakr̥ma | daivye | jane | dīnaiḥ | dakṣaḥ | pra-bhūtī | puruṣatvatā || deveṣu | ca | savitaḥ | mānuṣeṣu | ca | tvam | naḥ | atra | suvatāt | anāgasaḥ ||4.54.3||

IAST: na pramiye savitur daivyasya tad yathā viśvam bhuvanaṁ dhārayiṣyati
Griffith: None may impede that power of Savitar the God whereby he will maintain the universal world.
Devanāgarī: न प्रमिये सवितुर्दैव्यस्य तद्यथा विश्वं भुवनं धारयिष्यति
pada pāṭha: na | pra-miye | savituḥ | daivyasya | tat | yathā | viśvam | bhuvanam | dhārayiṣyati || yat | pr̥thivyāḥ | variman | ā | su-aṅguriḥ | varṣman | divaḥ | suvati | satyam | asya | tat ||4.54.4||

IAST: yat pṛthivyā varimann ā svaṅgurir varṣman divaḥ suvati satyam asya tat
Griffith: What the fair-fingered God brings forth on earth's expanse or in the heightof heaven, that work of his stands sure.
Devanāgarī: यत्पृथिव्या वरिमन्ना स्वङ्गुरिर्वर्ष्मन्दिवः सुवति सत्यमस्य तत्
pada pāṭha: na | pra-miye | savituḥ | daivyasya | tat | yathā | viśvam | bhuvanam | dhārayiṣyati || yat | pr̥thivyāḥ | variman | ā | su-aṅguriḥ | varṣman | divaḥ | suvati | satyam | asya | tat ||4.54.4||

IAST: indrajyeṣṭhān bṛhadbhyaḥ parvatebhyaḥ kṣayām̐ ebhyaḥ suvasi pastyāvataḥ
Griffith: To lofty hills thou sendest those whom Indra leads, and givest fixed abodes with houses unto these.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रज्येष्ठान्बृहद्भ्यः पर्वतेभ्यः क्षयाँ एभ्यः सुवसि पस्त्यावतः
pada pāṭha: indra-jyeṣṭhān | br̥hat-bhyaḥ | parvatebhyaḥ | kṣayān | ebhyaḥ | suvasi | pastya-vataḥ || yathā-yathā | patayantaḥ | vi-yemire | eva | eva | tasthuḥ | savitariti | savāya | te ||4.54.5||

IAST: yathā-yathā patayanto viyemira evaiva tasthuḥ savitaḥ savāya te
Griffith: However they may fly and draw themselves apart, still, Savitar, they stand obeying thy behest.
Devanāgarī: यथायथा पतयन्तो वियेमिर एवैव तस्थुः सवितः सवाय ते
pada pāṭha: indra-jyeṣṭhān | br̥hat-bhyaḥ | parvatebhyaḥ | kṣayān | ebhyaḥ | suvasi | pastya-vataḥ || yathā-yathā | patayantaḥ | vi-yemire | eva | eva | tasthuḥ | savitariti | savāya | te ||4.54.5||

IAST: ye te trir ahan savitaḥ savāso dive-dive saubhagam āsuvanti
Griffith: May the libations poured to thee thrice daily, day after day, O Savitar, bring us blessing.
Devanāgarī: ये ते त्रिरहन्सवितः सवासो दिवेदिवे सौभगमासुवन्ति
pada pāṭha: ye | te | triḥ | ahan | savitariti | savāsaḥ | dive-dive | saubhagam | ā-suvanti || indraḥ | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | sindhuḥ | at-bhiḥ | ādityaiḥ | naḥ | aditiḥ | śarma | yaṁsat ||4.54.6||

IAST: indro dyāvāpṛthivī sindhur adbhir ādityair no aditiḥ śarma yaṁsat
Griffith: May Indra, Heaven, Earth, Sindhu with the Waters, Aditi with Adityas, give us shelter.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रो द्यावापृथिवी सिन्धुरद्भिरादित्यैर्नो अदितिः शर्म यंसत्
pada pāṭha: ye | te | triḥ | ahan | savitariti | savāsaḥ | dive-dive | saubhagam | ā-suvanti || indraḥ | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | sindhuḥ | at-bhiḥ | ādityaiḥ | naḥ | aditiḥ | śarma | yaṁsat ||4.54.6||

IAST: ko vas trātā vasavaḥ ko varūtā dyāvābhūmī adite trāsīthāṁ naḥ
Griffith: WHO of you, Vasus, saveth? who protecteth? O Heaven and Earth and Aditi, preserve us,
Devanāgarī: को वस्त्राता वसवः को वरूता द्यावाभूमी अदिते त्रासीथां नः
pada pāṭha: kaḥ | vaḥ | trātā | vasavaḥ | kaḥ | varūtā | dyāvābhūmī iti | adite | trāsīthām | naḥ || sahīyasaḥ | varuṇa | mitra | martāt | kaḥ | vaḥ | adhvare | varivaḥ | dhāti | devāḥ ||4.55.1||

IAST: sahīyaso varuṇa mitra martāt ko vo 'dhvare varivo dhāti devāḥ
Griffith: Varuna., Mitra, from the stronger mortal. Gods, which of you at sacrifice giveth comfort?
Devanāgarī: सहीयसो वरुण मित्र मर्तात्को वोऽध्वरे वरिवो धाति देवाः
pada pāṭha: kaḥ | vaḥ | trātā | vasavaḥ | kaḥ | varūtā | dyāvābhūmī iti | adite | trāsīthām | naḥ || sahīyasaḥ | varuṇa | mitra | martāt | kaḥ | vaḥ | adhvare | varivaḥ | dhāti | devāḥ ||4.55.1||

IAST: pra ye dhāmāni pūrvyāṇy arcān vi yad ucchān viyotāro amūrāḥ
Griffith: They who with laud extol the ancient statutes, when they shine forth infallible dividers,
Devanāgarī: प्र ये धामानि पूर्व्याण्यर्चान्वि यदुच्छान्वियोतारो अमूराः
pada pāṭha: pra | ye | dhāmāni | pūrvyāṇi | arcān | vi | yat | ucchān | vi-yotāraḥ | amūrāḥ || vi-dhātāraḥ | vi | te | dadhuḥ | ajasrāḥ | r̥ta-dhītayaḥ | rurucanta | dasmāḥ ||4.55.2||

IAST: vidhātāro vi te dadhur ajasrā ṛtadhītayo rurucanta dasmāḥ
Griffith: Have ordered as perpetual Ordainers, and beamed as holy-thoughted WonderWorkers.
Devanāgarī: विधातारो वि ते दधुरजस्रा ऋतधीतयो रुरुचन्त दस्माः
pada pāṭha: pra | ye | dhāmāni | pūrvyāṇi | arcān | vi | yat | ucchān | vi-yotāraḥ | amūrāḥ || vi-dhātāraḥ | vi | te | dadhuḥ | ajasrāḥ | r̥ta-dhītayaḥ | rurucanta | dasmāḥ ||4.55.2||

IAST: pra pastyām aditiṁ sindhum arkaiḥ svastim īḻe sakhyāya devīm
Griffith: The Housewife Goddess, Aditi, and Sindhu, the Goddess Svasti I implore for friendship:
Devanāgarī: प्र पस्त्यामदितिं सिन्धुमर्कैः स्वस्तिमीळे सख्याय देवीम्
pada pāṭha: pra | pastyām | aditim | sindhum | arkaiḥ | svastim | īḷe | sakhyāya | devīm || ubhe iti | yathā | naḥ | ahanī iti | ni-pātaḥ | uṣasānaktā | karatām | adabdhe iti ||4.55.3||

IAST: ubhe yathā no ahanī nipāta uṣāsānaktā karatām adabdhe
Griffith: And may the unobstructed Night and Morning both, day and night, provide for our protection.
Devanāgarī: उभे यथा नो अहनी निपात उषासानक्ता करतामदब्धे
pada pāṭha: pra | pastyām | aditim | sindhum | arkaiḥ | svastim | īḷe | sakhyāya | devīm || ubhe iti | yathā | naḥ | ahanī iti | ni-pātaḥ | uṣasānaktā | karatām | adabdhe iti ||4.55.3||

IAST: vy aryamā varuṇaś ceti panthām iṣas patiḥ suvitaṁ gātum agniḥ
Griffith: Aryaman, Varuna have disclosed the pathway, Agni as Lord of Strength the road to welfare.
Devanāgarī: व्यर्यमा वरुणश्चेति पन्थामिषस्पतिः सुवितं गातुमग्निः
pada pāṭha: vi | aryamā | varuṇaḥ | ceti | panthām | iṣaḥ | patiḥ | suvitam | gātum | agniḥ || indrāviṣṇū iti | nr̥-vat | ūm̐ iti | su | stavānā | śarma | naḥ | yantam | ama-vat | varūtham ||4.55.4||

IAST: indrāviṣṇū nṛvad u ṣu stavānā śarma no yantam amavad varūtham
Griffith: Lauded in manly mode may Indra-Visnu grant us their powerful defence and shelter.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्राविष्णू नृवदु षु स्तवाना शर्म नो यन्तममवद्वरूथम्
pada pāṭha: vi | aryamā | varuṇaḥ | ceti | panthām | iṣaḥ | patiḥ | suvitam | gātum | agniḥ || indrāviṣṇū iti | nr̥-vat | ūm̐ iti | su | stavānā | śarma | naḥ | yantam | ama-vat | varūtham ||4.55.4||

IAST: ā parvatasya marutām avāṁsi devasya trātur avri bhagasya
Griffith: I have besought the favourof the Maruts, of Parvata, of Bhaga God who rescues.
Devanāgarī: आ पर्वतस्य मरुतामवांसि देवस्य त्रातुरव्रि भगस्य
pada pāṭha: ā | parvatasya | marutām | avāṁsi | devasya | trātuḥ | avri | bhagasya || pāt | patiḥ | janyāt | aṁhasaḥ | naḥ | mitraḥ | mitriyāt | uta | naḥ | uruṣyet ||4.55.5||

IAST: pāt patir janyād aṁhaso no mitro mitriyād uta na uruṣyet
Griffith: From trouble caused by man the Lord preserve us; from woe sent by his friend let Mitra save us.
Devanāgarī: पात्पतिर्जन्यादंहसो नो मित्रो मित्रियादुत न उरुष्येत्
pada pāṭha: ā | parvatasya | marutām | avāṁsi | devasya | trātuḥ | avri | bhagasya || pāt | patiḥ | janyāt | aṁhasaḥ | naḥ | mitraḥ | mitriyāt | uta | naḥ | uruṣyet ||4.55.5||

IAST: nū rodasī ahinā budhnyena stuvīta devī apyebhir iṣṭaiḥ
Griffith: Agree, through these our watery oblations, Goddesses, Heaven and Earth, with Ahibudhnya.
Devanāgarī: नू रोदसी अहिना बुध्न्येन स्तुवीत देवी अप्येभिरिष्टैः
pada pāṭha: nu | rodasī iti | ahinā | budhnyena | stuvīta | devī iti | apyebhiḥ | iṣṭaiḥ || samudram | na | sam-caraṇe | saniṣyavaḥ | gharma-svarasaḥ | nadyaḥ | apa | vran ||4.55.6||

IAST: samudraṁ na saṁcaraṇe saniṣyavo gharmasvaraso nadyo apa vran
Griffith: As if to win the sea, the Gharma-heaters have opened, as they come anear, the rivers.
Devanāgarī: समुद्रं न संचरणे सनिष्यवो घर्मस्वरसो नद्यो अप व्रन्
pada pāṭha: nu | rodasī iti | ahinā | budhnyena | stuvīta | devī iti | apyebhiḥ | iṣṭaiḥ || samudram | na | sam-caraṇe | saniṣyavaḥ | gharma-svarasaḥ | nadyaḥ | apa | vran ||4.55.6||

IAST: devair no devy aditir ni pātu devas trātā trāyatām aprayucchan
Griffith: May Goddess Aditi with Gods defend us, save us the saviour God with care unceasing.
Devanāgarī: देवैर्नो देव्यदितिर्नि पातु देवस्त्राता त्रायतामप्रयुच्छन्
pada pāṭha: devaiḥ | naḥ | devī | aditiḥ | ni | pātu | devaḥ | trātā | trāyatām | apra-yucchan || nahi | mitrasya | varuṇasya | dhāsim | arhāmasi | pra-miyam | sānu | agneḥ ||4.55.7||

IAST: nahi mitrasya varuṇasya dhāsim arhāmasi pramiyaṁ sānv agneḥ
Griffith: We dare not stint the sacred food of Mitra and Varuna upon the back of Agni.
Devanāgarī: नहि मित्रस्य वरुणस्य धासिमर्हामसि प्रमियं सान्वग्नेः
pada pāṭha: devaiḥ | naḥ | devī | aditiḥ | ni | pātu | devaḥ | trātā | trāyatām | apra-yucchan || nahi | mitrasya | varuṇasya | dhāsim | arhāmasi | pra-miyam | sānu | agneḥ ||4.55.7||

IAST: agnir īśe vasavyasyāgnir mahaḥ saubhagasya
Griffith: Agni is Sovran Lord of wealth, Agni of great prosperity:
Devanāgarī: अग्निरीशे वसव्यस्याग्निर्महः सौभगस्य
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | īśe | vasavyasya | agniḥ | mahaḥ | saubhagasya || tāni | asmabhyam | rāsate ||4.55.8||

IAST: tāny asmabhyaṁ rāsate
Griffith: May he bestow these gifts on us.
Devanāgarī: तान्यस्मभ्यं रासते
pada pāṭha: agniḥ | īśe | vasavyasya | agniḥ | mahaḥ | saubhagasya || tāni | asmabhyam | rāsate ||4.55.8||

IAST: uṣo maghony ā vaha sūnṛte vāryā puru
Griffith: Hither to us, rich pleasant Dawn, bring many things to be desired,
Devanāgarī: उषो मघोन्या वह सूनृते वार्या पुरु
pada pāṭha: uṣaḥ | maghoni | ā | vaha | sūnr̥te | vāryā | puru || asmabhyam | vājinī-vati ||4.55.9||

IAST: asmabhyaṁ vājinīvati
Griffith: Thou who hast ample store of wealth.
Devanāgarī: अस्मभ्यं वाजिनीवति
pada pāṭha: uṣaḥ | maghoni | ā | vaha | sūnr̥te | vāryā | puru || asmabhyam | vājinī-vati ||4.55.9||

IAST: tat su naḥ savitā bhago varuṇo mitro aryamā
Griffith: So then may Bhaga, Savitar, Varuna, Mitra, Aryaman,
Devanāgarī: तत्सु नः सविता भगो वरुणो मित्रो अर्यमा
pada pāṭha: tat | su | naḥ | savitā | bhagaḥ | varuṇaḥ | mitraḥ | aryamā || indraḥ | naḥ | rādhasā | ā | gamat ||4.55.10||

IAST: indro no rādhasā gamat
Griffith: Indra, with bounty come to us.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रो नो राधसा गमत्
pada pāṭha: tat | su | naḥ | savitā | bhagaḥ | varuṇaḥ | mitraḥ | aryamā || indraḥ | naḥ | rādhasā | ā | gamat ||4.55.10||

IAST: mahī dyāvāpṛthivī iha jyeṣṭhe rucā bhavatāṁ śucayadbhir arkaiḥ
Griffith: MAY mighty Heaven and Earth, most meet for honour, be present here with light and gleaming splendours;
Devanāgarī: मही द्यावापृथिवी इह ज्येष्ठे रुचा भवतां शुचयद्भिरर्कैः
pada pāṭha: mahī iti | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | iha | jyeṣṭhe iti | rucā | bhavatām | śucayat-bhiḥ | arkaiḥ || yat | sīm | variṣṭhe iti | br̥hatī iti | vi-minvan | ruvat | ha | ukṣā | paprathānebhiḥ | evaiḥ ||4.56.1||

IAST: yat sīṁ variṣṭhe bṛhatī viminvan ruvad dhokṣā paprathānebhir evaiḥ
Griffith: When, fixing them apart, vast, most extensive, the Steer roars loudly in far-reaching courses.
Devanāgarī: यत्सीं वरिष्ठे बृहती विमिन्वन्रुवद्धोक्षा पप्रथानेभिरेवैः
pada pāṭha: mahī iti | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | iha | jyeṣṭhe iti | rucā | bhavatām | śucayat-bhiḥ | arkaiḥ || yat | sīm | variṣṭhe iti | br̥hatī iti | vi-minvan | ruvat | ha | ukṣā | paprathānebhiḥ | evaiḥ ||4.56.1||

IAST: devī devebhir yajate yajatrair aminatī tasthatur ukṣamāṇe
Griffith: The Goddesses with Gods, holy with holy, the Two stand pouring out their rain, exhaustless:
Devanāgarī: देवी देवेभिर्यजते यजत्रैरमिनती तस्थतुरुक्षमाणे
pada pāṭha: devī iti | devebhiḥ | yajate iti | yajatraiḥ | aminatī iti | tasthatuḥ | ukṣamāṇe iti || r̥tavarī ityr̥ta-varī | adruhā | devaputre iti deva-putre | yajñasya | netrī iti | śucayat-bhiḥ | arkaiḥ ||4.56.2||

IAST: ṛtāvarī adruhā devaputre yajñasya netrī śucayadbhir arkaiḥ
Griffith: Faithful and guileless, having Gods for children, leaders of sacrifice with shining splendours.
Devanāgarī: ऋतावरी अद्रुहा देवपुत्रे यज्ञस्य नेत्री शुचयद्भिरर्कैः
pada pāṭha: devī iti | devebhiḥ | yajate iti | yajatraiḥ | aminatī iti | tasthatuḥ | ukṣamāṇe iti || r̥tavarī ityr̥ta-varī | adruhā | devaputre iti deva-putre | yajñasya | netrī iti | śucayat-bhiḥ | arkaiḥ ||4.56.2||

IAST: sa it svapā bhuvaneṣv āsa ya ime dyāvāpṛthivī jajāna
Griffith: Sure in the worlds he was a skilful Craftsman, he who produced these Twain the Earth and Heaven.
Devanāgarī: स इत्स्वपा भुवनेष्वास य इमे द्यावापृथिवी जजान
pada pāṭha: saḥ | it | su-apāḥ | bhuvaneṣu | āsa | yaḥ | ime iti | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | jajāna || urvī iti | gabhīre iti | rajasī iti | sumeke iti su-meke | avaṁśe | dhīraḥ | śacyā | sam | airat ||4.56.3||

IAST: urvī gabhīre rajasī sumeke avaṁśe dhīraḥ śacyā sam airat
Griffith: Wise, with his power he brought both realms, together spacious and deep, wellfashioned, unsupported.
Devanāgarī: उर्वी गभीरे रजसी सुमेके अवंशे धीरः शच्या समैरत्
pada pāṭha: saḥ | it | su-apāḥ | bhuvaneṣu | āsa | yaḥ | ime iti | dyāvāpr̥thivī iti | jajāna || urvī iti | gabhīre iti | rajasī iti | sumeke iti su-meke | avaṁśe | dhīraḥ | śacyā | sam | airat ||4.56.3||

IAST: nū rodasī bṛhadbhir no varūthaiḥ patnīvadbhir iṣayantī sajoṣāḥ
Griffith: O Heaven and Earth, with one accord promoting, with high protection as of Queens, our welfare,
Devanāgarī: नू रोदसी बृहद्भिर्नो वरूथैः पत्नीवद्भिरिषयन्ती सजोषाः
pada pāṭha: nu | rodasī iti | br̥hat-bhiḥ | naḥ | varūthaiḥ | patnīvat-bhiḥ | iṣayantī iti | sa-joṣāḥ || urūcī iti | viśve iti | yājate iti | ni | pātam | dhiyā | syāma | rathyaḥ | sadā-sāḥ ||4.56.4||

IAST: urūcī viśve yajate ni pātaṁ dhiyā syāma rathyaḥ sadāsāḥ
Griffith: Far-reaching, universal, holy, guard us. May we, car-borne, through song be victors ever.
Devanāgarī: उरूची विश्वे यजते नि पातं धिया स्याम रथ्यः सदासाः
pada pāṭha: nu | rodasī iti | br̥hat-bhiḥ | naḥ | varūthaiḥ | patnīvat-bhiḥ | iṣayantī iti | sa-joṣāḥ || urūcī iti | viśve iti | yājate iti | ni | pātam | dhiyā | syāma | rathyaḥ | sadā-sāḥ ||4.56.4||

IAST: pra vām mahi dyavī abhy upastutim bharāmahe
Griffith: To both of you, O Heaven and Earth, we bring our lofty song of praise,
Devanāgarī: प्र वां महि द्यवी अभ्युपस्तुतिं भरामहे
pada pāṭha: pra | vām | mahi | dyavī iti | abhi | upa-stutim | bharāmahe || śucī iti | upa | pra-śastaye ||4.56.5||

IAST: śucī upa praśastaye
Griffith: Pure Ones! to glorify you both.
Devanāgarī: शुची उप प्रशस्तये
pada pāṭha: pra | vām | mahi | dyavī iti | abhi | upa-stutim | bharāmahe || śucī iti | upa | pra-śastaye ||4.56.5||

IAST: punāne tanvā mithaḥ svena dakṣeṇa rājathaḥ
Griffith: Ye sanctify each other's form, by your own proper might ye rule,
Devanāgarī: पुनाने तन्वा मिथः स्वेन दक्षेण राजथः
pada pāṭha: punāne iti | tanvā | mithaḥ | svena | dakṣeṇa | rājathaḥ || ūhyāthe iti | sanāt | r̥tam ||4.56.6||

IAST: ūhyāthe sanād ṛtam
Griffith: And from of old observe the Law.
Devanāgarī: ऊह्याथे सनादृतम्
pada pāṭha: punāne iti | tanvā | mithaḥ | svena | dakṣeṇa | rājathaḥ || ūhyāthe iti | sanāt | r̥tam ||4.56.6||

IAST: mahī mitrasya sādhathas tarantī pipratī ṛtam
Griffith: Furthering and fulfilling, ye, O Mighty, perfect Mitra's Law.
Devanāgarī: मही मित्रस्य साधथस्तरन्ती पिप्रती ऋतम्
pada pāṭha: mahī iti | mitrasya | sādhathaḥ | tarantī iti | pipratī iti | r̥tam || pari | yajñam | ni | sedathuḥ ||4.56.7||

IAST: pari yajñaṁ ni ṣedathuḥ
Griffith: Ye sit around our sacrifice.
Devanāgarī: परि यज्ञं नि षेदथुः
pada pāṭha: mahī iti | mitrasya | sādhathaḥ | tarantī iti | pipratī iti | r̥tam || pari | yajñam | ni | sedathuḥ ||4.56.7||

IAST: kṣetrasya patinā vayaṁ hiteneva jayāmasi
Griffith: WE through the Master of the Field, even as through a friend, obtain
Devanāgarī: क्षेत्रस्य पतिना वयं हितेनेव जयामसि
pada pāṭha: kṣetrasya | patinā | vayam | hitena-iva | jayāmasi || gām | aśvam | poṣayitnu | ā | saḥ | naḥ | mr̥ḷāti | īdr̥śe ||4.57.1||

IAST: gām aśvam poṣayitnv ā sa no mṛḻātīdṛśe
Griffith: What nourisheth our kine and steeds. In such may he be good to us.
Devanāgarī: गामश्वं पोषयित्न्वा स नो मृळातीदृशे
pada pāṭha: kṣetrasya | patinā | vayam | hitena-iva | jayāmasi || gām | aśvam | poṣayitnu | ā | saḥ | naḥ | mr̥ḷāti | īdr̥śe ||4.57.1||

IAST: kṣetrasya pate madhumantam ūrmiṁ dhenur iva payo asmāsu dhukṣva
Griffith: As the cow yieldeth milk, pour for us freely, Lord of the Field, the wave that beareth sweetness,
Devanāgarī: क्षेत्रस्य पते मधुमन्तमूर्मिं धेनुरिव पयो अस्मासु धुक्ष्व
pada pāṭha: kṣetrasya | pate | madhu-mantam | ūrmim | dhenuḥ-iva | payaḥ | asmāsu | dhukṣva || madhu-ścutam | ghr̥tam-iva | su-pūtam | r̥tasya | naḥ | patayaḥ | mr̥ḷayantu ||4.57.2||

IAST: madhuścutaṁ ghṛtam iva supūtam ṛtasya naḥ patayo mṛḻayantu
Griffith: Distilling meath, well-purified like butter, and let the. Lords of holy Law be gracious.
Devanāgarī: मधुश्चुतं घृतमिव सुपूतमृतस्य नः पतयो मृळयन्तु
pada pāṭha: kṣetrasya | pate | madhu-mantam | ūrmim | dhenuḥ-iva | payaḥ | asmāsu | dhukṣva || madhu-ścutam | ghr̥tam-iva | su-pūtam | r̥tasya | naḥ | patayaḥ | mr̥ḷayantu ||4.57.2||

IAST: madhumatīr oṣadhīr dyāva āpo madhuman no bhavatv antarikṣam
Griffith: Sweet be the plants for us. the heavens, the waters, and full of sweets for us be air's mid-region.
Devanāgarī: मधुमतीरोषधीर्द्याव आपो मधुमन्नो भवत्वन्तरिक्षम्
pada pāṭha: madhu-matīḥ | oṣadhīḥ | dyāvaḥ | āpaḥ | madhu-mat | naḥ | bhavatu | antarikṣam || kṣetrasya | patiḥ | madhu-mān | naḥ | astu | ariṣyantaḥ | anu | enam | carema ||4.57.3||

IAST: kṣetrasya patir madhumān no astv ariṣyanto anv enaṁ carema
Griffith: May the Field's Lord for us be full of sweetness, and may we follow after him uninjured.
Devanāgarī: क्षेत्रस्य पतिर्मधुमान्नो अस्त्वरिष्यन्तो अन्वेनं चरेम
pada pāṭha: madhu-matīḥ | oṣadhīḥ | dyāvaḥ | āpaḥ | madhu-mat | naḥ | bhavatu | antarikṣam || kṣetrasya | patiḥ | madhu-mān | naḥ | astu | ariṣyantaḥ | anu | enam | carema ||4.57.3||

IAST: śunaṁ vāhāḥ śunaṁ naraḥ śunaṁ kṛṣatu lāṅgalam
Griffith: Happily work our steers and men, may the plough furrow happily.
Devanāgarī: शुनं वाहाः शुनं नरः शुनं कृषतु लाङ्गलम्
pada pāṭha: śunam | vāhāḥ | śunam | naraḥ | śunam | kr̥ṣatu | lāṅgalam || śunam | varatrāḥ | badhyantām | śunam | aṣṭrām | ut | iṅgaya ||4.57.4||

IAST: śunaṁ varatrā badhyantāṁ śunam aṣṭrām ud iṅgaya
Griffith: Happily be the traces bound; happily may he ply the goad.
Devanāgarī: शुनं वरत्रा बध्यन्तां शुनमष्ट्रामुदिङ्गय
pada pāṭha: śunam | vāhāḥ | śunam | naraḥ | śunam | kr̥ṣatu | lāṅgalam || śunam | varatrāḥ | badhyantām | śunam | aṣṭrām | ut | iṅgaya ||4.57.4||

IAST: śunāsīrāv imāṁ vācaṁ juṣethāṁ yad divi cakrathuḥ payaḥ
Griffith: Suna and Sira, welcome ye this laud, and with the milk which ye have made in heaven
Devanāgarī: शुनासीराविमां वाचं जुषेथां यद्दिवि चक्रथुः पयः
pada pāṭha: śunāsīrau | imām | vācam | juṣethām | yat | divi | cakrathuḥ | payaḥ || tena | imām | upa | siñcatam ||4.57.5||

IAST: tenemām upa siñcatam
Griffith: Bedew ye both this earth of ours.
Devanāgarī: तेनेमामुप सिञ्चतम्
pada pāṭha: śunāsīrau | imām | vācam | juṣethām | yat | divi | cakrathuḥ | payaḥ || tena | imām | upa | siñcatam ||4.57.5||

IAST: arvācī subhage bhava sīte vandāmahe tvā
Griffith: Auspicious Sita, come thou near: we venerate and worship thee
Devanāgarī: अर्वाची सुभगे भव सीते वन्दामहे त्वा
pada pāṭha: arvācī | su-bhage | bhava | sīte | vandāmahe | tvā || yathā | naḥ | su-bhagā | asasi | yathā | naḥ | su-phalā | asasi ||4.57.6||

IAST: yathā naḥ subhagāsasi yathā naḥ suphalāsasi
Griffith: That thou mayst bless and prosper us and bring us fruits abundantly.
Devanāgarī: यथा नः सुभगाससि यथा नः सुफलाससि
pada pāṭha: arvācī | su-bhage | bhava | sīte | vandāmahe | tvā || yathā | naḥ | su-bhagā | asasi | yathā | naḥ | su-phalā | asasi ||4.57.6||

IAST: indraḥ sītāṁ ni gṛhṇātu tām pūṣānu yacchatu
Griffith: May Indra press the furrow down, may Pusan guide its course aright.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्रः सीतां नि गृह्णातु तां पूषानु यच्छतु
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | sītām | ni | gr̥hṇātu | tām | pūṣā | anu | yacchatu || sā | naḥ | payasvatī | duhām | uttarām-uttarām | samām ||4.57.7||

IAST: sā naḥ payasvatī duhām uttarām-uttarāṁ samām
Griffith: May she, as rich in milk, be drained for us through each succeeding year.
Devanāgarī: सा नः पयस्वती दुहामुत्तरामुत्तरां समाम्
pada pāṭha: indraḥ | sītām | ni | gr̥hṇātu | tām | pūṣā | anu | yacchatu || sā | naḥ | payasvatī | duhām | uttarām-uttarām | samām ||4.57.7||

IAST: śunaṁ naḥ phālā vi kṛṣantu bhūmiṁ śunaṁ kīnāśā abhi yantu vāhaiḥ
Griffith: Happily let the shares turn up the ploughland, happily go the ploughers with the oxen.
Devanāgarī: शुनं नः फाला वि कृषन्तु भूमिं शुनं कीनाशा अभि यन्तु वाहैः
pada pāṭha: śunam | naḥ | phālāḥ | vi | kr̥ṣantu | bhūmim | śunam | kīnāśāḥ | abhi | yantu | vāhaiḥ || śunam | parjanyaḥ | madhunā | payaḥ-bhiḥ | śunāsīrā | śunam | asmāsu | dhattam ||4.57.8||

IAST: śunam parjanyo madhunā payobhiḥ śunāsīrā śunam asmāsu dhattam
Griffith: With meath and milk Parjanya make us happy. Grant us prosperity, Suna and Sira.
Devanāgarī: शुनं पर्जन्यो मधुना पयोभिः शुनासीरा शुनमस्मासु धत्तम्
pada pāṭha: śunam | naḥ | phālāḥ | vi | kr̥ṣantu | bhūmim | śunam | kīnāśāḥ | abhi | yantu | vāhaiḥ || śunam | parjanyaḥ | madhunā | payaḥ-bhiḥ | śunāsīrā | śunam | asmāsu | dhattam ||4.57.8||

IAST: samudrād ūrmir madhumām̐ ud ārad upāṁśunā sam amṛtatvam ānaṭ
Griffith: FORTH from the ocean sprang the wave of sweetness: together with the stalk it turned to Amrta,
Devanāgarī: समुद्रादूर्मिर्मधुमाँ उदारदुपांशुना सममृतत्वमानट्
pada pāṭha: samudrāt | ūrmiḥ | madhu-mān | ut | ārat | upa | aṁśunā | sam | amr̥ta-tvam | ānaṭ || ghr̥tasya | nāma | guhyam | yat | asti | jihvā | devānām | amr̥tasya | nābhiḥ ||4.58.1||

IAST: ghṛtasya nāma guhyaṁ yad asti jihvā devānām amṛtasya nābhiḥ
Griffith: That which is holy oil's mysterious title: but the Gods' tongue is truly Amrta's centre.
Devanāgarī: घृतस्य नाम गुह्यं यदस्ति जिह्वा देवानाममृतस्य नाभिः
pada pāṭha: samudrāt | ūrmiḥ | madhu-mān | ut | ārat | upa | aṁśunā | sam | amr̥ta-tvam | ānaṭ || ghr̥tasya | nāma | guhyam | yat | asti | jihvā | devānām | amr̥tasya | nābhiḥ ||4.58.1||

IAST: vayaṁ nāma pra bravāmā ghṛtasyāsmin yajñe dhārayāmā namobhiḥ
Griffith: Let us declare aloud the name of Ghrta, and at this sacrifice hold it up with homage.
Devanāgarī: वयं नाम प्र ब्रवामा घृतस्यास्मिन्यज्ञे धारयामा नमोभिः
pada pāṭha: vayam | nāma | pra | bravāma | ghr̥tasya | asmin | yajñe | dhārayāma | namaḥ-bhiḥ || upa | brahmā | śr̥ṇavat | śasyamānam | catuḥ-śr̥ṅgaḥ | avamīt | gauraḥ | etat ||4.58.2||

IAST: upa brahmā śṛṇavac chasyamānaṁ catuḥśṛṅgo 'vamīd gaura etat
Griffith: So let the Brahman hear the praise we utter. This hath the four-horned Buffalo emitted.
Devanāgarī: उप ब्रह्मा शृणवच्छस्यमानं चतुःशृङ्गोऽवमीद्गौर एतत्
pada pāṭha: vayam | nāma | pra | bravāma | ghr̥tasya | asmin | yajñe | dhārayāma | namaḥ-bhiḥ || upa | brahmā | śr̥ṇavat | śasyamānam | catuḥ-śr̥ṅgaḥ | avamīt | gauraḥ | etat ||4.58.2||

IAST: catvāri śṛṅgā trayo asya pādā dve śīrṣe sapta hastāso asya
Griffith: Four are his horns, three are the feet that bear him; his heads are two, his hands are seven in number.
Devanāgarī: चत्वारि शृङ्गा त्रयो अस्य पादा द्वे शीर्षे सप्त हस्तासो अस्य
pada pāṭha: catvāri | śr̥ṅgā | trayaḥ | asya | pādāḥ | dve iti | śīrṣe iti | sapta | hastāsaḥ | asya || tridhā | baddhaḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | roravīti | mahaḥ | devaḥ | martyān | ā | viveśa ||4.58.3||

IAST: tridhā baddho vṛṣabho roravīti maho devo martyām̐ ā viveśa
Griffith: Bound with a triple bond the Steer roars loudly: the mighty God hath entered in to mortals.
Devanāgarī: त्रिधा बद्धो वृषभो रोरवीति महो देवो मर्त्याँ आ विवेश
pada pāṭha: catvāri | śr̥ṅgā | trayaḥ | asya | pādāḥ | dve iti | śīrṣe iti | sapta | hastāsaḥ | asya || tridhā | baddhaḥ | vr̥ṣabhaḥ | roravīti | mahaḥ | devaḥ | martyān | ā | viveśa ||4.58.3||

IAST: tridhā hitam paṇibhir guhyamānaṁ gavi devāso ghṛtam anv avindan
Griffith: That oil in triple shape the Gods discovered laid down within the Cow, concealed by Panis.
Devanāgarī: त्रिधा हितं पणिभिर्गुह्यमानं गवि देवासो घृतमन्वविन्दन्
pada pāṭha: tridhā | hitam | paṇi-bhiḥ | guhyamānam | gavi | devāsaḥ | ghr̥tam | anu | avindan || indraḥ | ekam | sūryaḥ | ekam | jajāna | venāt | ekam | svadhayā | niḥ | tatakṣuḥ ||4.58.4||

IAST: indra ekaṁ sūrya ekaṁ jajāna venād ekaṁ svadhayā niṣ ṭatakṣuḥ
Griffith: Indra produced one shape, Surya another: by their own power they formed the third from Vena.
Devanāgarī: इन्द्र एकं सूर्य एकं जजान वेनादेकं स्वधया निष्टतक्षुः
pada pāṭha: tridhā | hitam | paṇi-bhiḥ | guhyamānam | gavi | devāsaḥ | ghr̥tam | anu | avindan || indraḥ | ekam | sūryaḥ | ekam | jajāna | venāt | ekam | svadhayā | niḥ | tatakṣuḥ ||4.58.4||

IAST: etā arṣanti hṛdyāt samudrāc chatavrajā ripuṇā nāvacakṣe
Griffith: From inmost reservoir in countless channels flow down these rivers which the foe beholds not.
Devanāgarī: एता अर्षन्ति हृद्यात्समुद्राच्छतव्रजा रिपुणा नावचक्षे
pada pāṭha: etāḥ | arṣanti | hr̥dyāt | samudrāt | śata-vrajāḥ | ripuṇā | na | ava-cakṣe || ghr̥tasya | dhārāḥ | abhi | cākaśīmi | hiraṇyayaḥ | vetasaḥ | madhye | āsām ||4.58.5||

IAST: ghṛtasya dhārā abhi cākaśīmi hiraṇyayo vetaso madhya āsām
Griffith: I look upon the streams of oil descending, and lo! the Golden Reed is there among them.
Devanāgarī: घृतस्य धारा अभि चाकशीमि हिरण्ययो वेतसो मध्य आसाम्
pada pāṭha: etāḥ | arṣanti | hr̥dyāt | samudrāt | śata-vrajāḥ | ripuṇā | na | ava-cakṣe || ghr̥tasya | dhārāḥ | abhi | cākaśīmi | hiraṇyayaḥ | vetasaḥ | madhye | āsām ||4.58.5||

IAST: samyak sravanti sarito na dhenā antar hṛdā manasā pūyamānāḥ
Griffith: Like rivers our libations flow together, cleansing themselves in inmost heart and spirit.
Devanāgarī: सम्यक्स्रवन्ति सरितो न धेना अन्तर्हृदा मनसा पूयमानाः
pada pāṭha: samyak | sravanti | saritaḥ | na | dhenāḥ | antaḥ | hr̥dā | manasā | pūyamānāḥ || ete | arṣanti | ūrmayaḥ | ghr̥tasya | mr̥gāḥ-iva | kṣipaṇoḥ | īṣamāṇāḥ ||4.58.6||

IAST: ete arṣanty ūrmayo ghṛtasya mṛgā iva kṣipaṇor īṣamāṇāḥ
Griffith: The streams of holy oil pour swiftly downward like the wild beasts that fly before the bowman.
Devanāgarī: एते अर्षन्त्यूर्मयो घृतस्य मृगा इव क्षिपणोरीषमाणाः
pada pāṭha: samyak | sravanti | saritaḥ | na | dhenāḥ | antaḥ | hr̥dā | manasā | pūyamānāḥ || ete | arṣanti | ūrmayaḥ | ghr̥tasya | mr̥gāḥ-iva | kṣipaṇoḥ | īṣamāṇāḥ ||4.58.6||

IAST: sindhor iva prādhvane śūghanāso vātapramiyaḥ patayanti yahvāḥ
Griffith: As rushing down the rapids of a river, flow swifter than the wind the vigorous currents,
Devanāgarī: सिन्धोरिव प्राध्वने शूघनासो वातप्रमियः पतयन्ति यह्वाः
pada pāṭha: sindhoḥ-iva | pra-adhvane | śūghanāsaḥ | vāta-pramiyaḥ | patayanti | yahvāḥ || ghr̥tasya | dhārāḥ | aruṣaḥ | na | vājī | kāṣṭhāḥ | bhindan | ūrmi-bhiḥ | pinvamānaḥ ||4.58.7||

IAST: ghṛtasya dhārā aruṣo na vājī kāṣṭhā bhindann ūrmibhiḥ pinvamānaḥ
Griffith: The streams of oil in swelling fluctuation like a red courser bursting through the fences.
Devanāgarī: घृतस्य धारा अरुषो न वाजी काष्ठा भिन्दन्नूर्मिभिः पिन्वमानः
pada pāṭha: sindhoḥ-iva | pra-adhvane | śūghanāsaḥ | vāta-pramiyaḥ | patayanti | yahvāḥ || ghr̥tasya | dhārāḥ | aruṣaḥ | na | vājī | kāṣṭhāḥ | bhindan | ūrmi-bhiḥ | pinvamānaḥ ||4.58.7||

IAST: abhi pravanta samaneva yoṣāḥ kalyāṇyaḥ smayamānāso agnim
Griffith: Like women at a gathering fair to look on and gently smiling, they incline to Agni.
Devanāgarī: अभि प्रवन्त समनेव योषाः कल्याण्यः स्मयमानासो अग्निम्
pada pāṭha: abhi | pravanta | samanā-iva | yoṣāḥ | kalyāṇyaḥ | smayamānāsaḥ | agnim || ghr̥tasya | dhārāḥ | sam-idhaḥ | nasanta | tāḥ | juṣāṇaḥ | haryati | jāta-vedāḥ ||4.58.8||

IAST: ghṛtasya dhārāḥ samidho nasanta tā juṣāṇo haryati jātavedāḥ
Griffith: The streams of holy oil attain the fuel, and Jatavedas joyfully receives them.
Devanāgarī: घृतस्य धाराः समिधो नसन्त ता जुषाणो हर्यति जातवेदाः
pada pāṭha: abhi | pravanta | samanā-iva | yoṣāḥ | kalyāṇyaḥ | smayamānāsaḥ | agnim || ghr̥tasya | dhārāḥ | sam-idhaḥ | nasanta | tāḥ | juṣāṇaḥ | haryati | jāta-vedāḥ ||4.58.8||

IAST: kanyā iva vahatum etavā u añjy añjānā abhi cākaśīmi
Griffith: As maidens dock themselves with gay adornment to join the bridal feast, I now behold them.
Devanāgarī: कन्या इव वहतुमेतवा उ अञ्ज्यञ्जाना अभि चाकशीमि
pada pāṭha: kanyāḥ-iva | vahatum | etavai | ūm̐ iti | añji | añjānāḥ | abhi | cākaśīmi || yatra | somaḥ | sūyate | yatra | yajñaḥ | ghr̥tasya | dhārāḥ | abhi | tat | pavante ||4.58.9||

IAST: yatra somaḥ sūyate yatra yajño ghṛtasya dhārā abhi tat pavante
Griffith: Where Soma flows and sacrifice is ready, thither the streams of holy oil are running.
Devanāgarī: यत्र सोमः सूयते यत्र यज्ञो घृतस्य धारा अभि तत्पवन्ते
pada pāṭha: kanyāḥ-iva | vahatum | etavai | ūm̐ iti | añji | añjānāḥ | abhi | cākaśīmi || yatra | somaḥ | sūyate | yatra | yajñaḥ | ghr̥tasya | dhārāḥ | abhi | tat | pavante ||4.58.9||

IAST: abhy arṣata suṣṭutiṁ gavyam ājim asmāsu bhadrā draviṇāni dhatta
Griffith: Send to our eulogy a herd of cattle bestow upon us excellent possessions.
Devanāgarī: अभ्यर्षत सुष्टुतिं गव्यमाजिमस्मासु भद्रा द्रविणानि धत्त
pada pāṭha: abhi | arṣata | su-stutim | gavyam | ājim | asmāsu | bhadrā | draviṇāni | dhatta || imam | yajñam | nayata | devatā | naḥ | ghr̥tasya | dhārāḥ | madhu-mat | pavante ||4.58.10||

IAST: imaṁ yajñaṁ nayata devatā no ghṛtasya dhārā madhumat pavante
Griffith: Bear to the Gods the sacrifice we offer the streams of oil flow pure and full of sweetness.
Devanāgarī: इमं यज्ञं नयत देवता नो घृतस्य धारा मधुमत्पवन्ते
pada pāṭha: abhi | arṣata | su-stutim | gavyam | ājim | asmāsu | bhadrā | draviṇāni | dhatta || imam | yajñam | nayata | devatā | naḥ | ghr̥tasya | dhārāḥ | madhu-mat | pavante ||4.58.10||

IAST: dhāman te viśvam bhuvanam adhi śritam antaḥ samudre hṛdy antar āyuṣi
Griffith: The universe depends upon thy power and might within the sea, within the heart, within all life.
Devanāgarī: धामन्ते विश्वं भुवनमधि श्रितमन्तः समुद्रे हृद्यन्तरायुषि
pada pāṭha: dhāman | te | viśvam | bhuvanam | adhi | śritam | antariti | samudre | hr̥di | antaḥ | āyuṣi || apām | anīke | sam-ithe | yaḥ | ā-bhr̥taḥ | tam | aśyāma | madhu-mantam | te | ūrmim ||4.58.11||

IAST: apām anīke samithe ya ābhṛtas tam aśyāma madhumantaṁ ta ūrmim
Griffith: May we attain that sweetly-flavoured wave of thine, brought, at its gathering, o'er the surfaceof the floods.
Devanāgarī: अपामनीके समिथे य आभृतस्तमश्याम मधुमन्तं त ऊर्मिम्
pada pāṭha: dhāman | te | viśvam | bhuvanam | adhi | śritam | antariti | samudre | hr̥di | antaḥ | āyuṣi || apām | anīke | sam-ithe | yaḥ | ā-bhr̥taḥ | tam | aśyāma | madhu-mantam | te | ūrmim ||4.58.11||
